It was the best naan by far. You can order to a custom spice level. We went with 4 out of 10. It was perfect for me, but a little too spicy for my wife. The host (I assume the owner) was very pleasent and attentive.

I would give 5 stars but the food was a little slow to come out, and there was a significant delay for the naan. It is very new so some service glitches may be expected. We will definitely be going back.

The people are nice but I made and appoinment for them to install a radio I bought in my 06 Pontiac vibe at 1 and they didn't get to it until 5:30 and I had to and they said it would only take half an hour to put it in and it's almost been an hour and they're still not done they tend to fall behind quite a lot I gave a 3 star not for their quickness but for their politeness
I almost committed suicide at this McDonald's it was so bad, can't believe I am even writing a yelp review on a McDonald's.

I'm in St. Louis at least once or twice a month for work and this place is now on my "GO HERE EVERY TRIP" list.  It is sooo good! 

Portion sizes: The small bowl is usually more than enough food, but I've also gotten the regular size when I was super hungry.  I also like that you can mix your fish scoops. I like to do part salmon, part spicy tuna, with the SPICY poke sauce. 

Toppings:  Good variety, generous servings and also really fresh. I really love that mango is offered too and it is not an extra cost.  This is also where my only gripe comes, in, though:  I wish they'd bring back the fried garlic! It was one of my favorite toppings but when I went last week, the girl working told me they didn't have it anymore and she wasn't sure if it would be coming back :(  Pokedoke, please bring it back! The fried wontons just aren't the same.
Jim the waiter shouldn't make comments about customers where they can hear it, very poor customer service, won't go back again.

Unprofessional with no follow up.  I originally called EBS to fix a leak in my roof and the first visit was very professional and I paid for the service.  After the next rain the roof still leaked and they came again and the problem was still there.  They then missed the next appointment and had none of the measurements from the first appointment when I talked to them on the phone. The repairman called me from a friends cell phone because his was dead.  I have paid but still have a roof leak.
hands down the best pizza in st louis. get the chicago style supreme, you will not be disappointed...

You must be from St. Louis if you are actually impressed by this place in any way.  People think the wait is long because the pizza is so good.  That's not it at all.  Actually, the bar/restaurant has an operations problem.  The kicthen is inadequate to handle the type of pizza (thick crust) they serve.  So, you wait forever.  That's forgivable.  But what isnt?  The fact that the pizza is average at best, probably below average for deep dish.  Go to Chicago, or anywhere they have quality deep dish and you will find much, much better pizza.  In addition to all that, you basically have to serve yourself (i.e. go to the bar every time you need something).  On top of that, the place is a dump.  I'm not talking about a "dive"...I'm talking about a "dump".  They do have games to play while you wait, so I guess that is good.  Anyway, don't believe the hype on this one.  Do it once to mark it off your list and move on. :)

Lol!  Yes, this place is a dive bar, but the pizza is well worth it.  We had decided to dine in and had noticed there were a lot of carry-out orders as we were enjoying our draft beers.  The decor and atmosphere in side is something nothing to brag about and honestly is very run down.  Steps of service....there is one! You place your order , pick up or order and take your dirty plates all to the bar.  No table service at all. Take your pizza to go.

They have seriously got some problem with Management and Employees working for them. It was my nightmare to get out of the apartments. They don't consider sub lease, straight away tells that they have people waiting in line so wouldn't cater sub lease and if i am on notice and GOD forbid something goes wrong, i have to go out of the apartment anyway. What??? I have lived in several parts of the country and rented apartment but they are the worst ones to handle.

Again after 2.5 years living there, they are charging me for paint and marks inside which were of the chairs near to the walls and resurfacing of the laminated kitchen countertops. Igot the house professionally cleaning but cleaning services and still have to pay them 400-450 dollors for the non sense things. Only the legible item was bath tub for which they charge 150$ and everything else was just crap.

I checked with other and everyone asked me why i got it cleaned when they are anyway going to impose the fines. That was my bad because i don't have such thing seen in past. But that's how you learn..anyway.

Maintenance wise they are the laziest team i have seen. To respond to any issue, their SLA is 48 hours and they will come for once and will say that they need to check with supervisor and wouldn't return ever. Once you check with Leasing office, the ticket is resolved already.

Anyway Past it Past but somewhere we are responsible for them to behave in this manner. If i am not happy and want to leave, 10 others are standing in the queue to have it because of Indian community preferring these apartments because of the connectivity and low prices. 

But you always get what you pay for. Entry is easy but exit is a nightmare.

I cannot express the high level of customer service I received from this location. They were very busy and took the time to bring my suit jacket to my hotel. Exceptional! Thanks Rashon!! This is why I'm a loyal customer.

Yolklore challenges assumptions that a counter-service restaurant can't deliver thoughtful, elevated food. I was so impressed with my frittata and my husband raves about the Billy the Kid. All the ingredients were top notch and all dishes were plated beautifully. Delicious. Great kid options available. My son devoured his little dipper pancakes. The restaurant is a bit small, so you may struggle to find a table during busy weekend hours, but the staff is very welcoming and helpful.

DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU MIGHT DIE OF STARVATION !!! I kid you not that my meal took 36 minutes in the drive thru at 9:44 pm on a Wednesday night. Only 3 cars ahead of me. I waited all that time and my order was not difficult double cheeseburger meal No onions, but of course it had onions. So if you want to wait forever for the wrong meal go there but I will never spend another dime there ever again.

A great sandwich shop, its chain-status notwithstanding.  No matter what time of day or night or late-night, I always get great service.  These guys know how to handle the college crowd well.  The price is right and hey, the smells are free!

This was my first time having Soup Dumplings outside of NYC and I was very impressed. It's kind of a hole in the wall, but the food was excellent. I had the Chicken Dumplings and my friend had the pork. She had previously lived in China and said they were very authentic. I would go lunch as it isn't the most filling of food, but I would definitely go back!
Great customer service! I called and was taken care of within the same day. This is probably the easiest time I have had dealing with a service provider. Would definitely recommend.

The service has always been good. The food is ok. I had one  bad experience with an appetizer but that's it. Place is very clean, hostess are great, but I will say it's a bit overpriced. I will be back though.

Terrible.  I hired them to fix my icemaker.  The guy said he had to order a part and that it would be in withing a few days.  I waited 5 days and they never called.  After repeated, repeated, repeated attempts to check on the order, I never heard from them.  They took the service fee - some of which was supposed to go toward the job that they never did.  Crooks.

This place is a great addition to Lafayette Square. Our group tried the fried chicken and cornbread waffle, shrimp and grits, and jambalaya. No one was disappointed. The hush puppies and fries green tomatoes were great, too. Four stars because this place wasn't in the "best I've ever had" category, but would definitely recommend. We'll be back to try the po boys too.

Finally made it here last night after a year of hearing how great it is and we weren't disappointed!  Now as some of the other reviewers have stated, this is a true dive bar, not the cutesy, intentional dive bar, but all out duct taped booths, graffiti covered bathroom, "we ain't doing anything here unless the roof is collapsing" dive bar - which I actually kind of like:)  I didn't have any interactions with the employees other than showing my ID to get in, but the husband never complained when he came back from ordering.  

They are definitely a no nonsense kinda place.  We were told, "Menu's on the table, head up to the bar when you are ready to order."  But luckily we were able to snag a booth right away and didn't have the stress of table stalking and waiting for someone to leave in order to sit down.  We waited about 45 minutes for our pizza, which was fine because it's what we expected going in, so we just chatted with our friends and enjoyed a pitcher of beer while we waited.  

We ended up sharing a medium (12-inch?) Chicago style with peps and mushrooms and I pretty much fell out of the booth when I saw the cheese oozing out - this was my kind of pizza!  Now if you are all about the sauce and toppings I would not recommend this because the bread and cheese are the obvious standouts.  I was a little worried that with all the cheese the crust would be soggy but it was awesomely crisp on the bottom and probably sturdy enough to pick up had I wanted to.  The sauce was deliciously spicy and we guessed might have had sun dried toms in it to give it the deeper hue?  After one slice I was full, after another half slice I was woozy, this pizza is no joke!  

So now I can finally say we have been to Black Thorn and I will happily return the next time a pizza craving or urge to eat a pound of cheese in one sitting strikes.  Thank you for the fun night out!

We came here for lunch and ordered a Caesar side salad and a Small Zen garden salad. They were both absolutely delicious! We also ordered the Puttanesca and the Meat me in St.Louie. Both were amazing. It is a very comfortable atmosphere.  Great craft beer selection and they have happy hour between 3 PM and 6 PM with three dollar cans.

This should be a 2.5 rating. Here is the good, the bad, the ugly and the LDF (low, down foo)

The Good- great Chicago style crust, nice cheese in there.

The Bad- the sauce? Burgundy color with tons and tons of oregano. Makes you gage its so much!

The Ugly- did I mention the massive amassing amount of oregano? That's all it's taste like. Had to wipe it all off to taste anything else on the pizza.

LDF- get rid of that sauce!!! OMG we at foodies and this sauce is bad....just say no.

These sandwiches are MUCH better than Arby's.  I had a Hot Italian beef with hot giardera sp?.  Not as good as truly authentic Chicago style Italian beef, but still  pretty good stuff.  The au jus is very good.

I arrived to a line of about 20 people waiting on cars. No cars were in sight. I am Emerald Club member and there were no cars in the Emerald Club section or any other. I was told they overbooked. After about a 40 minute wait I had a car, unfortunately I had to cancel a meeting and reschedule it for a future date.

In my travels the St. Louis National and the San Antonio National locations seem to be constantly overbooked and the cars are regularly dirty.

For perspective I travel 3 weeks out of the month and almost exclusively use National so I visit a substantial amount of their locations.

The service is excellent and the staff was friendly and helpful. But when I'm getting dropped off by a friend or picked up, where do they park? There doesn't appear to be any parking and I see other customers with the same issue. I've seen people park on the side on the frontage road (which is dangerous, I don't recommend it), or next to the return gate. When I asked an attendant where they could park, they always point to a lot near the front that must be employee parking becuz it's always full. With such a big lot, you'd figure they could find another spot for them to park.

This place is not far from my apartment. So, we frequent here. I've had a variety of options from the menu. The employees are always nice. Prices are reasonable. The seasoning that they use, endearingly called "Lemon Pepper Crack" by locals adds the perfect flavor to both the fish and chicken. Sometimes the fish is a bit too crunchy. The fried chicken wings are the best in my opinion with the fried okra. Heart attack in a styrofoam plate. But, that's why you have to screen your fried foods.  ‍ Also, watch out for the white guy with the backpack that hangs around the place. He's asked me for bus fare every time I've gone there. Yet I never see him leave Grand. One day, I gave him a dollar and he followed me to my car insisting that I search my cup holders for change. He doesn't seem to remember much as the next time I went in, I got the same sob story. He seems to be harmless. But you can't really be too careful these days.

Horrible service. There was no sense of urgency at any time. Brought out one of the worst omelets I have ever had. They put unsanitary ketchup packets on top of the food when they brought it out. There was never a question about if I needed anything. The food was just dropped off without a word. Unless your layover is longer than an hour don't stop here.

This was probably my 8th time to eat here for breakfast in the last 5 weeks due to limited options in the airport. While it is always slow it is usually better than this.
Fantastic pizza and  cold beer!  This is the best Chicago styled pizza in St. Louis!

Sooo... this place is awesome. You order at counter from limited yet exquisite comfort food. Chicken, fried catfish, ribs, roast beef and a special ofnthe day. Great sides for you meat n 3. I had the catfish with some corn bread, special (Adam Wainright) heirloom tomatoes and I got the soup of the day (smoky tomato). Everything was to die for awesome. Sometimes there is a line but it moves fast or you can eat at the bar. Owner is on sight and responsive. Eat Here Now!

My favorite pizza in St. Louis!
Me and the wife have been coming here for years and finally it is getting the notoriety it deserves. Its not "Chicago Style". The sauce has a bit of zip, but the kind that leaves you craving for more. I love the overall vibe of this bar. I know change is coming at Black Thorn, but I can't wait to see what is in store for them!

Tucked in a cozy spot on Watson, Yolklore is the type of restaurant I wouldn't expect in Crestwood. Normally a place like this would be downtown or in Clayton. Curious to find a place like this close by my husband and I was excited to try it out.

The space and decor is like most breakfast places: tight and cozy. The kitchen is open faced and there are coffee mugs, the menu, and a listing of the specials to greet you right at the door. 

I ordered the Bread Pudding French Toast and my husband ordered a basic breakfast plate. The french toast was good, the eggs my husband had were extraordinary and I really liked the direction they took with the potatoes, using whole yukon gold potatoes instead of cubed potatoes. 

I had a smoothie and he had the orange juice. I liked the smoothie but felt it was missing something. 

I noticed the manager touching tables as I ate, checking to see how everyone was enjoying their meal.

I enjoyed eating here, however I felt it was on the pricey side ($28 for two people) for breakfast.

I just had my second visit at this restaurant hoping it would be better than the last time I ate there and unfortunately it wasn't. Maybe a little worse. I only went there because it was the closest to my route heading home. Cornbread = dry; cabbage = too peppery (let folks add their own pepper if they want it instead of the whole batch); yams = not enough flavor; baked chicken = tasted like 3-day old food. I paid a whopping $15.00!  It's hard to find good soul food in Lou that's affordable. I wouldn't mind paying that amount if I enjoyed it, but the meal was totally not worth what I paid.

This place has awesome deep dish style pizza. I was skeptical when I first walked in because it appears to be a dive bar but the food is delicious. There are several bar games to play while you wait for your food. The beer was reasonably priced. If you're a fan of Chicago style pizza Black Thorn is a hidden gem in St. Louis.

I dare you to find a better bakery and cafe!   This is a locally owned establishment that knows how to take care of it's clientele!  The sandwiches are stuffed full of meat and veggies.  The bread is made in house and is so delicious.  The pastries and cookies are fabulous.  You have to try the Blueberry Bread and the Mountain cookie!  You will be back!   The owner, Patrick, is always on hand to make sure everything is perfect and that the service is fast and friendly.

We came in late on a Saturday night. Food was on point and I'm always happy to see Excel soda on the fountain. Nice space! One calzone came out first because the other had a production issue, but the delay wasn't long. Ok, here's the best part of the visit: since we were there right up to the last minute, the crew was beginning pre-close duties and were hustling to get it done. The manager, Tony, very professionally and tactfully told he crew to use care so as not to disturb the dining guests. He was so low key about it, but I heard him and it demonstrated that guest experience matters, even at 10:30 on Saturday night. Thanks, SoS!

I have never been so impressed with a massage in my life. This place is absolutely incredible! The rooms are themed which seems simple but I found it a super thoughtful touch. I had the couples massage and oh my gosh. So amazing. Noise canceling headphones with fabulous soothing music sync with the vibrations in the table and absolutely take you away. I mean cmon- it's insanely genius. The staff was also extremely friendly and professional and just amazing. We had Jackie and Rachel and both my boyfriend and I agreed that this was the best massage we've ever had.  I honestly can't recommend this place enough. I booked it to make up for a couples massage from hell at a different company and I'm almost happy I got tortured for 60 minutes at the other company because it led me to search for and find Sound Stone.  This will be the only place I go for any massages from now on. SO. HAPPY.

We were supposed to wait 45 minutes but it was only a 20 min wait. The service was quick, and the rustic environment was mixed with a sporty vibe. The food was very good, and moderately priced. The pickle chips were really good. Will definitely return.

Delicious calzones, friendly service & great atmosphere. New hot spot in The Grove STL next to UCBC. Wife and I went for Valentine's Day (because I was craving pizza which they don't have hence their name) and have no complaints. And like most restaurants in STL, the craft beer floweth...
Top quality, fresh fish and flavorful ingredients. Generous portion for the price, too!

Brunch for the win! 
An order at the counter style resturant that offers brunch all day, this place serves a smaller menu which clearly ensures top quality and care. The food is delicious! My friend got biscuits and gravy with over-medium eggs and I got a traditional breakfast with scrambled eggs, toast, turkey sausage and two potatoes. 
The potatoes were served in a style I'd never had - small yellow potatoes served whole but crispy and so well seasoned on the outside. Similar to a breakfast baked potato. YUM. 

We also got lattes which are served in to-go cups so that you can take them with you. They have both dairy and soy milk. 

The smaller, intimate atmosphere is clean and well kept, the bathroom is large and offers a changing table, and the staff is very friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants quality breakfast food!

My company recently switched its preferred contract from HERTZ to National to save money. I see where the cost cutting went to. Only two cars available with little to no options, customer service is sub-par. My company saved money but I lost the value. I travel almost every week and if it were up to me....not National.

This is my second experience with a chain cell phone repair facility, and these guys are top notch. Chris is absolutely fantastic! I though the battery needed to be replaced on my Galaxy S6, unfortunately it was not. Chris worked with me on several options, and kept me informed throughout. I was given very reasonable prices and extraordinary quality. These are goto guys for any of my cell phone needs. Thank you!

Honestly, there's not much more I can say that hasn't already been said. I'm giving it 5 stars to help its overall rating.  It's a shame that it is 3 1/2 stars...

Short and sweet: I love it.  It's a great dive.  But not the kind of dive where I'm afraid I'll get stabbed or contract hepatits from a booth.  It feels like a brainy dive.

Awesome pizza.  Great deep dish.

The bar works.  The prices are good.

Parking is not a hassle (at least not that I've experienced).
It's great for large groups.

I really do like this place!  Even if I contracted hepatitis, the great pizza would balance it all out...

This place opened in September and I was presently surprised how friendly the staff was. The atmosphere is trendy yet cozy, and the decor is country sleek. 

I ordered the half pumpkin soup and beet salad with a side or cornbread ($13). The soup was ok - it was garnished with oats and this sweet red sauce. Loved the flavor of the oats and sauce, but wasn't a fan of the soup base. The salad was small but very good. Nice flavor and unique combination of ingredients. My friend ordered the friend chicken with 3 sides: Mac and cheese (just ok), beans (excellent), and cauliflower (yum yum yum!!!). I'd definitely come back next I'm in the STL and order the catfish. Hope this place sticks around for a while

United Van Lines set us up with their local group in our area Hollander International Storage and Moving.  We had an appointment set up to do a virtual tour of our apartment with Kevin.  We had set up the appointment with Maria and had received a confirmation email and text that the appointment was set up.  On the day of the appointment we hadn't heard anything so I called the main line.  I was told that we would receive a call or text with information at the time of our appointment.  We waited until about 10 minutes after the appointment was set to start and called the main line again.  The woman we spoke with told us she didn't have any information about Kevin and that we should give him until half an hour past our appointment time.  Once it was 35 minutes past our scheduled appointment time I called again.  The woman stated that she was unable to see any of our or Kevin's information.  She asked if we were given an email or phone number for Kevin.  I said that we had only been given his name in our confirmation email.  We were told that nothing could be done until Monday as it was the weekend and no one was available at the local office.  We will definitely be using a different moving company that respects our time.
This is the 3rd car I've taken here for tint. Luke was my salesman this time. He was very knowledgeable & helpful. They always do a GREAT tint job & are competitive on price. Customer for life.
The service was great....ask for Lisa. My Pho and the spring rolls were yummy. So glad MK's is in the neighborhood!

This was on my list of places to try in 2018. It was fine, but I expected more than just fine. The drinks were tasty but seemed really tiny. The corn dog appetizer was tasty. Not exactly what I was expecting but good. The entrees were good but seemed pricey for the portion and then discovering they come with no sides. My fault for assuming. But to add a side would definitely take it to too pricey for what it is. Was really surprised the jambalaya didn't even come with any sort of bread.

So I came for lunch buffet around 12:30 pm. The food has not been replenished even after asking for. The tandoori chicken pan had one piece and another guest took it. Staff was more into watching Indian movies than to take care of the buffet line. It is now 12:55 the only items replenished were Naan an a cabbage dish. 
What I ate was good but I don't think the ownership pays attention

Four of us had lunch at the Des Peres location. Loved the patio area, although too cold yet. Excellent, friendly service!  Food - needs some work. French fries are terrible (and I love good fries!)'. Two had the fish sandwich. Two of the three pieces were mushy and inedible. Also, there was far more bun than fish. With a little work in the kitchen, this will be a nice addition to the area

Wow! Great calzone! This place should have a "passport" program - I want to try each one. Meat me in St Louie had creamy moscarpone with the usual pizza stuff: sausage, pepperoni, mozzarella and a meat sauce (on the side of course). When they came out we thought "gee, we could have split one". However none of us stopped eating till they were gone. Waiting for an Apple pie dessert calzone. Employees are all cool and seem happy to be working here: I saw two dancing to the music playing in the background. 

If your on the Southside of St Louis you gotta try this place. About 1/2 mile from SLU. I'll be back.

The best Chicago adjacent pizza!  Can't be true Chicago without Lake Michigan water!!!  I'd love to do a blind tasting of Lou Malnati's and yours.  Bet the reviews would be very very close!  Love the remodel!
The family and I are visiting and decided to stop in for lunch. The staff was nice and the place was clean. The food was ok but a bit over priced for what you get.

Hoo wee! I do love some Black Thorn pizza. Is it a pub/dive inside? Yes. Does it take forever for a carryout? Yes. Is it the best pizza in the city? Yes. I suggest you stop the fucking comparison to authentic whatever style, go inside, sit and relax at the bar with a beer, and talk to the folks around while you wait. It's not some crappy chain, so it takes time. Great robust, spicy sauce, lots of whole milk mozzarella, and fresh toppings. It tastes nothing like Domino's, as someone from Chicago reported. (Probably a Cubs fan, so you know their taste can't be relied upon.)
My God. We arrived at 6:17pm, ordered, and our food didn't show up until 7:36pm...cold.

We purchased the 8 piece fried chicken from the deli at 5:45pm. We assumed the chicken would be fresh since it was dinner time. Wrong!!  It was the smallest pieces of chicken we have ever seen and it was all dried out. One wing was so small that it only had a piece of a bone.  One thigh was dried out and was missing the crispy skin. It was just a piece of almost black dried meat.  We couldn't eat half the chicken it was so bad. Apparently there isn't any quality control in the deli. Very disappointing.

While technically I live in walking distance to this new frozen yogurt spot, it requires me to cross Gravois on foot and then avoid the panhandlers that greet all visitors to Soulard at Midwest Petroleum.  I have a four year old so I put the kiddo in the car and drove 4 blocks. I forgot it was Saturday night and almost changed my mind when travelling all of one block down Russel into the island  I had already been cut off by a golf cart driven by a native and then dealt with all those Honda Accords from the county unloading their passengers in the bike lane in front of McGurks.  When we got to the shop there was no parking so I went off roading in that big elevated lot right next door(I don't know if you are supposed to park there, but we did).

Lots of people outside enjoying their purchases, good sign.  Get inside and it is really nicely done.  Tropical decor of course, a wall of machines and a nice little topping bar area.  8 unique flavors, root beer float, key lime pie, cheesecake, acai berry, cake, that is all I can remember.  We got root beer float and key lime pie.  I added some coconut and then my daughter teed off on the topping bar.  Cherries, sprinkles, chocolate chips, all I could see were mounting ounces to be added to our bill.  I blacked out.  I somehow managed to get our two selections to the weigh station/cash register.  $5.50, what a deal! I immediately came to and we happily ate our dessert outside(which was delicious). 

A happy addition to the island I spend a lot of time on!

I used to visit this place almost every time I visit friends/family in STL.  It's good and is not really any different than STL Bread Co (Panera's), just a local small business (as STL Bread Co once was).  I'll echo the generally bad and slow service comments from other Yelper's.  The manager gave me a disgusted face and retort when I asked if they offered any organic breads, menu items, or even coffee.  

The nice local atmosphere earned the 3 star rating.

The best reason to come to Church's...the biscuits.  I am sure they are covered in some kind of lard type concoction...but man are they delicious...

The chicken is cut differently than you are probably used to (thighs and legs together, etc.) so that might throw you, but it's far better than KFC...and seriously, the rolls...wow.

Yummy bagels, soup, sandwich, coffee, and breakfast place. Very friendly staff. It was pretty similar to panera (bread co) just a bit of a smaller local chain. I'd have to go back several times to figure out all the differences. I think there would be some advantages to not receiving like frozen ingredients from corporate or something.

Not exactly my kind of food, but it would be good to sit and work or meet up with a friend over coffee. Always nice for coffee places to have real food options though.

If your philosoply is the more crap on a pizza the better, then you'll like Black Thorn pizza. And I am not a Chicago style pizza hater, but this stuff has absolutely no balance or finesse. Actually, it in no way resembles any chicago pizza I've ever had. Just loads and loads of gloppy cheese and a heavy, leaden crust that is quite capable of sickening anyone who would dare to eat more than a slice or two.  It just blows my mind that anyone who isn't thoroughly drunk and/or stoned would really like this stuff.

The food here is just... wow. This place is AWESOME. We've already been back within two weeks of trying this place for the first time. We can't get enough of the fried chicken, chicken and biscuits, mashed potatoes, and cole slaw. Everything is always so flavorful, so fresh-tasting, and so delicious. The atmosphere is really bright and welcoming, very open with plenty of seating that doesn't feel crammed together. All of the staff are always lovely. Definitely gonna keep coming back!
Friendly staff and damn good comfort food. I'll eat my greens if it's cooked they way they do. Also the bone marrow gravy, I wish I could drizzle that on everything!

I feel like you have to TRY to screw up orders as bad as they do. Not only that but we had an experience once when I was there with my 2 kids and 2 employees were screaming at each other. They were cussing and finally one left. I got her name and called corporate to complain- never heard back. Next time we went in (we always went before PSR on Wednesdays) that employee was there again. I can't believe she wasn't fired for screaming and cussing in front of kids!
We found the elusive $15/hour fast food workers! The place is so clean and the people are friendly & knowledgeable. The food was great; fresh and quick.

Sometimes what I find confusing about Yelp is that there is no real effort to separate really old reviews from the new ones... And in the case of the Daily Bread, I wonder if that's an important distinction. Many of the reviews about the poor service and dirty tables seem to be from as far back as 2010. I just haven't found that they back up my experience there so far.

I generally go for lunch when it's the most busy. And despite that, the orders are taken fast, they've yet to be messed up and the food is prepared fairly quickly. They have a decently sized outdoor area, which is great -- because honestly I have never wanted to spend much time inside. I've found that it tends to be kind of cold in there and it's often packed to the gills and loud. But the outdoor area is quite nice.

That said, I've liked all of the food I've had. The buffalo chicken melt is OK, but I was really happy with the various vegetarian options and the smoked salmon sandwich. They have some great deli-style sandwiches too. There's just a lot of very different options here, the ingredients are fresh and things are just paired together well. They have a pretty nice soup combo too, which is barely more than the individual sandwiches.

A friend of mine had some of their frosted cookies too -- whoever is decorating them really knows what they're doing. I can't speak of the taste though, as I've not tried one.

They also have four or more unsweetened ice teas at any given point, which is great. You don't see that much.

One of my favorite breakfast spots because it's within walking distance from my home, the food is consistently delicious, the service is excellent, and you never have to worry about waiting longer than 25 minutes for quality food. I have introduced several of my city friends and they all fell in love. It's nice to have a restaurant like this in Crestwood!

This restaurant is right off Watson, but offers other entry ways from side roads. There is also a drive through. 

You order at the counter, they call your name to get your food (like a bread co). Seating is limited so be ok with sharing a big table with strangers. There are two double seat tables and a table for parties that are 3 people or more. 

I've been twice and have enjoyed my food every time. The bacon is ultra thick and crispy, and the gravy is so good, and has a lot of flavor but isn't over salted. The iced coffee is great, and has coffee Ice so you don't get watered down coffee. I have asked for one refill at both visits and have gotten them. 

I have a very "spirited" son and he loves this place. There are crayons, as well as an open kitchen to watch. He also loves peeking in the bakery window and seeing what the back of the house is doing.

I got my hair cut here once.  I actually did like the cut/style even though the salon was a bit dilapidated.  I have called and tried to get back in, but they don't answer their phone.  I have left three messages to call me back.  So frustrating.  I do not even want to go back now. Not professional.

Double check your order because they are new and unorganized.  That said, I like spicy chicken and for fast food, they do it right.  I recommend the spicy fried chicken vs the chicken strips.  I'll be posting review updates over time because like I said, this place is new.  Glad they moved to the area.

My favorite -- the chicken pot pie on Sundays and their herbal iced tea!  Much of the rest of their food is good -- I try to avoid the fried foods as my heart isn't appreciating those these days, but the sweet potatoes, cauliflower (OMG -- yum), and banana pudding are pretty darned good.
Definitely give this place a stop if you enjoy good old comfort food.

Horrible horrible horrible. Never go here. My husband, 2 kids and i went to the drive through because we had gift cards. The ordering was fine. Then we were in line for over 30 minutes and stuck because there were cars in front and behind of us. Also there is a concrete barrier on either side of you. So while we were waiting, we saw food finally getting handed to the people in front of us. I saw what my son had ordered and even commented to my husband that i bet that was my son's food. It was a tall truck so we could see what the people in the cab were doing. We saw them go through the food. They went through everything then handed everything back through the window. I saw the worker set the food down on the counter. Finally that customer got their food. When it was our turn,  we drove up to the window and the worker handed us that same food. The same food that had been sitting there for the past 10 minutes and that was in another person's car and other people's hands had gone through. I said i knew it was old food and i saw what he had done.....so he yelled and huffed at me. Needless to say....i drove off. I will not ever go back there. Disgusting!!!!!!

This place caught me totally off guard! Suffice it to say the surroundings do not come anywhere close to representing the quality of the pizza. If you like deep dish and cheese you need to visit this place, but go early!

Amazing calzones.  Our kids ordered plain - one cheese and one pepperoni.  My husband and I actually preferred the simple ones over our more creative ones (can't remember the exact names).  Portions are huge - we stopped before heading back to Chicago and nibbled on our leftovers on the drive home.  Kids didn't ask once to stop for anything - they had their delicious leftovers.

Do NOT choose this moving company. They 'sound' good but they do NOT follow up when they break things regardless of what they say in the quote interview.

NEVER will use them again! They broke 2 expensive items and then refused to fix them or cover the damage after even the driver said it was their fault. TERRIBLE  company!!!!!
HUGE calzones. Amazing salads. Lots of beer options. Plenty of seating. On street parking. Friendly staff. Had the Five-O calzone and it was great. The sauce was sweet and delish!

I suggest calling 45 minutes ahead if you want to order pizza. It takes a bit of a wait to get your pizza because it's more of a pub than a pizza joint.

However, the pizza is worth it. The Chicago style is enormous. I can't finish more than one slice. The sauce (according to a Vegan friend) is Vegan in nature. But I don't really care about that: this is good stuff. I suggest the hand-tossed style of pizza. I think it's more enjoyable than a slice of Chicago indulgence, since it's more comfortable to carry around in your stomach when you go into the game room for a round of shuffle board.

Absolutely pathetic drive through times. I live near by and every single time I'm in their drive through I wait no less than 15 minutes and have spent 30 minutes+ more than once. Once you're in their drive through, you're trapped and can't leave due to their barriers.  Do not go here unless you have a lot of time and want to waste it.
Loved this place!!! The food was fresh and flavorful. I loved the falafel salad with goat cheese. The ciabatta and bisquits were house made and so delicious.
Foods good but, there is not seating and it's very loud. They ran out of ciabatta buns.

Often times we go to particular places for one thing or the other, and I don't know about you....but customer service is EVERYTHING.  I understand you want to know about...IS THE FOOD GOOD BRUH...is it worth my drive....and TRUST ME when I get to that....you'll gas up and get there.  

As I was saying....CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EVERYTHING.  I scheduled a business meeting there at lunch not having been to this establishment and many people I know hadn't been to this place to give a heads-up so allow me to tell you....THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS NOTHING SHORT OF 5 STAR at LUNCH!   Both hosts were recent graduates of h.s., one on his way to SEMO.   They were well versed on the menu, the specials, the lay out, and you knew from the moment they opened their mouths to the moment you sat down after them having carried your tray, and retrieved your beverage of choice...THEY WERE HIRED TO SERVE YOU, and that they did with excellence and pride in what they did.   

I know....where is this place....and why haven't I heard about it.....well had it not been for my travel through the 170 corridor, and then catching a super late at night (early a.m.) advertisement I wouldn't have known about this SOUL FOOD GEM!  I know...there are a few spots that BOAST, but this isn't one that does, but once you GO, EAT, and ENJOY it will easily become your FAVORITE.   I didn't visit the restroom areas, but if it was anything like the front of house (clean as the dept of health....white glove military clean...) and the dining area.....I'd believe you if you said you could eat off the toilet seat it was that clean.  NOW ON TO THE FOOD:

The had some very tempting choices, and almost exhaustive (The WIDOWMAKER, SHRIMP PO'BOY and the TRIPLE  DECKER CLUB) were amongst the heavy hitters as far as sales go.   I personally wanted a good crispy tripe sandwich, but the manager (who hadn't tried it...) said I'd order from the table first if I were you.  Which was her way of encouraging me to order from the steam table that offered liver and onions, smother pork chops, fried chicken, smothered fried chicken, meatloaf as entrees, then followed by sides such as green beans, sweet potatoes, mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, cabbage, black eyed peas, and few other mentionables.   The WAY BACK WEDNESDAY special was an entree with two sides and I cautiously proceeded ahead.   I had the meatloaf, cabbage, and mac n cheese there were accompanied by cornbread muffin. 

MEATLOAF was more than enough, and I'd guess it was 5-6oz of a thick slice wonderfully tasty monolithic masterpiece of juicy, well seasoned beef with some green peppers, onions throughout.  It has house made tasty gravy over it that didn't over-power it, but complimented it.  I actually and eventually ended up mixing it ( the meatloaf and gravy with my mac n cheese).  Now I must tell you this meat loaf didn't have the traditional layer of baked on ketchup or tomato paste to top it....and honestly it didn't need it at all.  

MAC N CHEESE - This is look a mix of grandmas home made mac n cheese that was made by CHESTER CHEETAH.  Let me explain:  most home made macs have that baked crust that sometimes...often times....has areas of burns that we just chalk it up to the mac game, and it's still edible.  Other times home made macs are so cheesy that they are soupy and you'd have to bake them in a crematory before you get a crust.  This mac n cheese was a mix of golden yellow and orange deliciousness.  I'd err on the side of caution of one of the BEST if not THE BEST SOUL FOOD MACS in our area  ( I do have a favorite MAC...and it's from of all places a BBQ joint in the loop....UNTOUCHABLE) ...it paired well with my meatloaf and gravy for sure. 

FRIED CABBAGE:  Just like my grandmama or my momma, or I make....straight from the south.   It wasn't terribly overcooked but tender and flavorful.   A hint of salt, pepper, garlic...( I believe it even had some cayenne pepper flakes that gave it a nice kick) and possible in a light chicken stock broth.  Had I not been on this diet I would've had to take the corn bread (sweet I might add) and mix it up in my cabbage,unbuckle my belt, kick off my shoes....and call it a done deal!  

 My only negatives are be cognizant of your clientele with music volume.....you may want to turn it down 1-2 notches so they can enjoy your food, the establishment, and one another without having to talk over or louder than the background music, and  I wanted to speak to the owner (as well as my constituent did too) to simply behold the owner of this gem.  TRUST I WILL BE BACK, and will tell others of the wonderful experience we had.  We don't have a place like this in St. Charles County and if you're looking for, or considering a second location...I'd highly encourage you to head WEST ON 70, so we can bless you! Until then....I make it back I have a date with a CRISPY FRIED TRIPE SANDWICH.  

GOD BLESS YOU ALL, and thank you for your memorable service/experience.

Man..... This ice cream was soooooo good! Milkshakes are MASSIVE. Literally two people can split it and you might still have some left over. Customer service was just okay. my sister waited an hour for her milkshake that they forgot about.
 
They started on it, 10 minutes later we look up and they were fraternizing again instead of making her milkshake that she been waiting for OVER an hour over for. 

We also ordered food. The beyond wings and pizza were BOMB. Pizza was a slight replica of imo's, no lie!!!! Fries were just regular crinkle cut fries. Definitely will be back.
I have been 3 times - all 3 times the ahi tuna was still semi-frozen. Staff is friendly and topping are generic. Overall, food is good, but I wouldn't go specifically for the  tuna.

This place reminds me of Lucille's bbq in ca, but with a More authentic feel. You're greeted as you walk in and order at the front right away. You go to your table then your food is brought to you. It's very flavorful and each meal has its distinct taste. There is also a few beers on tap as well as many canned drinks. I haven't had much southern food, but this was great and the atmosphere was right. Thank you for a great experience.
'Cool atmosphere, relaxing and casual but with style. Creative menu selections made with quality ingredients. Good food! Friendly staff! And they have a drive thru! What!

I've been trying to get over here since it opened and today was my first chance. I was going to grab something to go and was pleasantly surprised to see a drive thru option. 

I ordered the Nest Egg and 1 Big Dipper (to give into my sweet tooth). The staff member was very friendly and it only took about 5 minutes or so to get my order. I was impressed with how quick the service was. 

When I got home I couldn't wait to dive in. The pancake was well cooked and fluffy. The Nest Egg was the star. Don't be afraid of the lemon and onion on top. I used the Nest like a bowl and mixed the egg with all of the delicious toppings. Wow. Whoever created this dish is a culinary mastermind. Every element complimented the next and I cannot wait to go back. The top of the crust was a little burnt for my liking but the rest of it was flaky and delicious. And the smashed potatoes had a little bit of spice to them and the portion amount was perfect.
For fast food you can't beat the taste and quality. At this Popeyes the staff was exceptionally courteous and welcoming.  Too bad we were just visiting from out of town.

Great service, disappointing food. 
My husband and I ate here recently on a layover due to the great priority pass deal and while the deal was great - the food wasn't quite so. 
We ordered the meat lovers pizza, the toasted ravioli, and the side salad. 
The toasted ravioli was okay - my husband didn't much enjoy it but I didn't mind it too much. I did like the marinara that came with it for dipping. 
The salad was unremarkable - a standard salad. 
The pizza was...not good. The cheese was...I don't even know how to describe it. It was like a goopy chewy mess. I liked the meat on the pizza and the pizza sauce, but ugh the cheese. If you can order it w/out the cheese maybe you should. The crust of the pizza was a thin crust whatever. Maybe a little on the crispy side but honestly not too noteworthy good or bad.

Very tasty, balanced meals. We ordered the classic and Mary BEAR and enjoyed it immensely. Small space and communal seating...we enjoyed it as it gave us the feel of eating in someone's kitchen! The decor is absolutely adorable and aesthetically pleasing.

G i'm only getting two stars because I've been there in the past and the food has been good. I ordered do you pick to roast a turkey and cranberry flatbread with the autumn harvest squash soup... I don't know what happened to their thinly sliced roasted chicken breasts that were in all of their dishes?  This flatbread was full of inedible goop (I saw one cranberry) and the rest was white??  And the chicken was chunked with some very chewy - gross - pieces...and I would be lying if I said there were more than 4 pitiful "chunks" of chicken in it.  Soup tasted ok, but more of a purée than a bisque.  I won't be ordering any of that again.  At least not at this store.  I would give this meal 1 star...ick.

Love a Black Thorn spicy Chicago SOB ... Seriously delicious. Do call ahead because it takes an hour and 15 minutes... eat your pizza there because it is now smoke free (thank you ban!!!!) Tasty pizza, pinball, cold beer and great bathroom reading!

This is absolutely, positively, hands down the best pizza in St Louis. I'd put it up against any place in the country, and I'm a Chicagoan. And before you judge... No, I'm not a touristy, "I went to Uno's and Giordanos and Gino's East so I know Chicago pizza" idiot... I've tried it all. Pequods, Stefanos, Lou Mals, Oven Grinder, those hidden gems in the burbs. I've lived there for 30 years and have tried hundreds of pizzas and this "Chicago style" at Black Thorn is as good as any I've ever had. 

We had a "supreme", pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, onion and green pepper. Chicago style. 

I don't know what kind of magic they do to this pizza in the 50-60 minutes it takes to prep and cook, but it is absolutely worth it. 

There are some complaints about how long the pizzas take.  Before you shoot your f*cking mouth off, go watch what they're doing... They're pulling dough, rolling it, tossing it, prepping it in the pan, loading it with all the delicious stuff you asked for and baking it. And I think they broil the top quickly at the end to give it a nice crisp top, and a great flavor.  Sit down, relax, have a beer and wait. It was worth it. 

The bar looks like it hasn't been touched since the 70s, which is awesome. I think if I had to gripe, I'd ask that they add a few seats... They seem sparse. 

Decent juke box, awesome atmosphere, small neighborhood joint. The Chicago Style here is among the best pizza I've ever had, whether you want to debate whether it's truly Chicago style or not. There's just no denying it's stellar.
Fast, delicious, friendly staff, clean, nice atmosphere, generous portions and a number of options for a reasonable price.

I have never been to such a slow drive thru, and that's comparing to other S&S's!! It's literally at least a 20 minute wait just to order and that's at 10pm. Although I have gone to their take-out counter and waited just as long for cold food and a melted shake. Not sure why this location can't pull it off like others. It's really disappointing because it's right by my house.

I went to Clarkson Eyecare in the CWE the other day to get my first eye exam in close to 10 years - and to get my very first pair of glasses! I can speak most highly to their customer service. One of the Opticians, named Rita, took such amazing care of me and was so incredibly kind and patient. Good customer service goes such a long way and I am very grateful that she practically held my hand through the whole process and was so genuinely nice. I came away with a great new pair of glasses. The store is very nice and the process was all very seamless. Thank you to the entire staff for such an easy experience and to Dr. Sherman for all of the exams.

After reading the reviews on yelp I decided not to go along with this company. When they contacted me after giving a quote and when I mentioned the yelp reviews, the agent Todd Smith, got angry and abusive. If this is how they plan to get my business I can only imagine what their service is going to be like.

We went on a gorgeous Thursday evening at around 6. It is seat yourself and order at the bar. The bartender was so super friendly and approachable. When we were unsure about what beers to order, he offer to let us sample. Barkeep was an A+ man, but it was self serve; so overall, service was a B.

We ordered a pitcher of ESB Schlafly, small garlic bread, and a ten inch, two topping Chicago deep dish pizza with sausage and mushroom. The garlic bread was underwhelming. It hadn't been baked enough so the cheese on top of the garlic bread was lukewarm and not stretchy. You also couldn't taste the garlic and it was quite salty. I liked the crunchy bits on the edges, but there wasn't that much. It was reminiscent of the cheese bread from Papa John's. Also, it was 10 inches, aka huge.

The pizza. (Disclaimer we were quite full on beer and bread when we starting eating the pizza.) The crust was drier and flaky and quite thick. When the pizza first came out, the bottom crust was nice and crusty. However, the longer the pizza sat, more and more oil seeped through the crust, leaving it quite dense. The sauce was good and balanced. The sausages were really large and very spiced, which made it the prima dona of the pizza. The mushrooms were nice. Overall, we were disappointed about the deep dish that we heard so much about.

Atmosphere wise: it was chill. It is a great place for a group of friends to go out and unwind together. It was relatively quiet (it was a Thursday night though), so it makes for a chill night out.

Fantastic fresh approach to breakfast! Best quality of ingredients, a lovely staff, inviting dining room. 
I had the Nest Egg that has so many amazing flavors married together in this little bundle. The potatoes are perfectly seaosned and roasted, great accompaniment to the Nest Egg.
Def will be back ;)
#bestbirthdaybreakfast
Absolutely the best. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and my favorite thing in the world. I love going as often as possible!

I think it's important to prepare yourself for what Black Thorn are selling. This is not quality pizza to my mind, more like really tasty "junk food" pizza. The deep dish is ridiculously filling, most people will struggle to finish two slices so you get a lot of value for your money. The sauce is great and if you love cheese, you will not be disappointed.

Looking for a fun bar to hang out and eat something greasy and tasty then Black Thorn is the place. If you are looking for something more traditional Italian or more upmarket, it's not going to fit the bill.

We had a delayed flight for 4 hours so we decided to eat here. Their pizza was really good and their lasagna was really good as well. The service was kind of slow, but then again, there was only one waiter and it was packed. The space is kind of tight as well. We would probably eat here again if we were ever back in the area.

Service:5 
Drinks:5
Atmosphere:4
Food:4 (small sample size)

Everything was pretty amazing.  Danny was our server and he gets mucho kudos.  We had two cocktails, both awesome.  First time having a Sazerac served in this way, and the wise blood was super unique and sooo tasty.  We sat on the patio and I know, tis the season, but the mosquitoes we out in full force.  We got two small plates, the octopus (5) and the heirloom salad (3).  Octopus was cooked perfectly, with tons of natural flavor complimented by the seasonings & peppers. & the texture was absolutely perfect.  The peppers can speak for themselves as always, but oh so tasty, in a perfect compliment to the tentacles.  The heirloom salad, however, left a few things to be desired.  There was almost no pork belly, and the tomatoes were slightly under flavored. I'll just leave it at room for improvement, hopefully it was a one off.  Other than that, we will be back to experience more and more, as we are crazy excited about all the intriguing menu changes!!!

My family and I had such a great experience at L'Acadiane. Every dish we had (hush puppies, catfish, ribs, steak, waffles & chicken, beignets) was delicious. The server was professional, and the manager stopped by to make sure all was well. We felt so welcome, plus the space is beautiful: very cozy yet sophisticated. I'm super jealous of the gorgeous map on the bar wall. I want it. Speaking of the bar, they also have really nice cocktails. Can't wait to go back.

My friends and I first stopped in at Keetons a year or so ago when we were looking for a sports bar to watch Blues playoff games. Keetons on Manchester had recently opened, and we figured it would be the perfect spot for is to park our bandwagon and enjoy the game and some brews. Full disclosure, we started going to Keetons ironically, but damned if their charming wait staff, cheap beer, and tasty didn't keep us coming back again and again and again to where it's no longer ironic, it's just a friendly neighborhood sports bar we all just legitimately enjoy.

Lots of TVs and projectors. A lotto scratcher machine my buddy lost a lot of money on (he kept letting it ride!). Juke box. Kareoke. And even a tiny little patio out back. Keetons has it all.

I have been searching for a great burger I got the Big Burger & fries with bacon ate every bite. While we were there we met Larry and visited with him, another great score. We will be back the drive would be worth it!

I forgot to take a picture because it was so good so here is a copied photo of what I ordered

https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wDvCRZaBD8oTeUs6ml0IyA?select=lv9vN0Qgwjcxfo83mn0w7w&utm_source=ishare&utm_content=photo&utm_campaign=psb_sq

Cool bar.  Solid pizza.

Really?  Chicago-style?  I'd like to think this as Pizza Hut pan pizza on steroids, with loads of extra cheese and toppings.

Either way it's pretty delicious, but it's not something to trek down for.  It's definitely a cool spot to hang out after kickball or flag football and Tower Grove Park, though.
Pleasantly surprised to find such good food in an airport. Perfect portion sizes, specially made Italian dressing and sauces. Very quick service. Prices are quite reasonable for airport food.

Dang! another car rental review. 

Booked a mid-size car so I can get access to the executive emerald aisle. The car selection wasn't great but I was able to get an SUV. checkout process was a breeze. The car ran very well, and did not give me any issues. The return process was a bit convoluted, and I did have to wait a bit as the staff were not very fast. 

Location of this place is weird, google maps had trouble finding it, and I had to circle the airport twice to get here.

Great casual atmosphere, attentive staff, excellent faire. I had the fried Korean BBQ ribs, sweet and sour turnip greens, and corn bread. The corn bread was so-so, but the greens and ribs were 'slap your granny' good. I highly recommend.

OMG! This pizza is amazingly delicious. I read the reviews and it seems the Chicago style is the people's fave, so that's what I went with. I was skeptical because most Chicago style pizzas aren't fully cooked and gummy in the center. Not this one! This pizza was fire! Perfectly cooked all the way through. Premium ingredients. Loaded. I ordered the 10" with pepperoni, sausage, bacon, mushrooms, garlic, jalapeños, onion and bell pepper. I could only eat one slice. I am full. I am satisfied. And, I will be back.
This is hands down the best deep dish pizza in St. Louis. If you don't like dive bars, get it to go.

I've now been to PokeDoke three times, at various times of day. Initially they were working out some kinks (ran out of fish, 15 min wait for rice) but I have had an excellent meal there every time! I feel like even the small is plenty filling. You get two scoops of fish for the small, which isn't a ton but is enough. You can chose whatever toppings you want, which is awesome! The flavors are great, they are pretty efficient, and the people working there are very nice and friendly. Great addition to the CWE dining scene! Get out of that shake shack line and try Poke Doke instead!

Great spot! Delicious and fresh food. I'm looking forward to going back. The drive thru is a great bonus for a Mom like me on the go but looking for non fast food options. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff!

Same experience every time I go there. Food's totally fine. Terrible wait times and people who aren't as friendly as they should be, especially considering the extended wait times....Decent food saves this rating

We gave it a shot on a random Tuesday night, the service was good and friendly. The smoothie was delicious, in fact I'd probably just go back for one. 
 
The food overall was... meh. It was fresh and the quality was good, however the flavor was lacking. It seemed to be missing that symphony of flavor that I enjoy about Thai food.
The business presents a clean, fresh appearance offering several delightful flavors with a huge variety of favorite toppings. You could make any number of combinations you want. Great place!
great food!  took hubby for his birthday and he loved it!  great meal and wonderful customer service!

One of my favorite pizza places in St. Louis for several reasons:

The Pizza! It's thick and cheesy and just really damn delicious. I will agree the sauce is a little weird, but I can get over that with all the cheesy goodness.

The atmosphere. I love a good dive bar, with a decent beer selection in addition to cheap drinks. The wait for a table and food is REALLY long, so don't expect to go there if you are in a hurry. Luckily they have games scattered through the bar, so you can occupy your time.

Other than that, a must go to in St. Louis, even if you are a snobby Chicago-style pizza eater.

Lastly, the last time we were there a group sitting next to us overheard a conversation we were having regarding a company one of them worked for. She bought us a pitcher to thank us for our kind words. These are my kinda people!

This food truck is a real Hawaiian Grill, unlike other local restaurants that are 0% Hawaiian with similar names. I made sure I got my work done early so I'd have the extra time to drive from work to the BJC location, and it was worth it! I got the Loco Moco, a Poke bowl/platter, Spam Musubi, and a lumpia roll. It was competing against my memory the hawaiian grills from my home town of Las Vegas and it did not disappoint one bit. I honestly think it was all the best I have had.

I plan to go there every week and I hope that one day it becomes a full fledged restaurant. It's my mission to try everything on the menu.

Side note, next time I try kimchi fried rice which most of the Korean places I have been to don't even have! Buzz's has a very complementary mix of cuisines.

Sadly this place is unimpressive. I came here craving oatmeal. So I ordered oatmeal and sausage. The oatmeal can in s dry block. It had yogurt and berries on top. It dry and unpleasant. The sausage was very good. It taste fresh. I can only give this place 3 stars because it wasn't impressive.  I'm open to giving it another try on day. Maybe oatmeal isn't their thing...

I went here for a happy hour tonight. The service ROCKED!! I had a chicken sandwich which could have been really good but it had a ton of pepper. It almost seemed as if they spilled the pepper on it. I should have ordered the steak sandwich. It not only looked great but everyone was bragging about how great it was. There was about 30 in our group and I never asked for a new beer or anything. Nicki was OUTSTANDING!! I look forward to going back and having a steak sandwich. I would rate this higher but I just can't with all the pepper. I WILL  be back!

I hit up this great new Thai/Vietnamese/Amer-asian joint for lunch.  Clean, simple menu - just a handful of choices, so you'd hope they're all top notch.  The server was prompt and attentive, and the restaurant itself is casual, clean and comfortable - nothing fancy.  It doesn't need to be - the food is the star here.

I had the egg rolls (veggie), fried rice (you get to choose your own protein and veggies from lists of each), and a Thai iced tea.  Everything was exactly what I had in mind.  The egg rolls give Bo Fung a run for their money (no, really!); the rice dish was generously-portioned, and perfectly seasoned; the Thai tea was just the right blend of strong, bitter tea and creamy sweetness... just the thing to cut the spiciness I requested in the rice dish.

The chef (and I'm guessing owner) came out as I was finishing up and greeted me, checked up... always a nice touch, especially in a new place.  I told him what I'm telling you here - everything was great, and I can't wait to go back and try his Pho and Pad!

Wow! After a long time, we had good Indian food in St. Louis! Everything we ordered was awesome - and our spread included both North Indian and South Indian dishes. Truly authentic Indian food! A must go!! And great service also.
Been there twice screwed up order both times. Should I try for " Third time a charm" ?  NOT !!!!! HATE THAT CHICKEN AT POPEYES

I didn't think to much of the property on first drive up impression. And I had my doubts about even staying here. But once inside I was greeted at the front desk with a great smile and positive attitude from the desk manager. This is an older property, but they have modernized it with furnishings and bath fixtures.

I hadn't been to Yolklore since summer 2016 when they opened. I went on a weekday morning and ordered The Nest Egg (Biscuit crust, 2 Buttonwood Eggs, Bacon Bits, Cheddar, Pickled Red Onion, Preserved Lemon) and a hot tea just as I had done previously. I still find the community seating situation here a little uncomfortable and intrusive.  My breakfast can best be described as a hot mess. The biscuit crust was heavy, the eggs were cold like they had been precooked and sitting out for a long time, the pickled onion just tasted like raw onion, and I don't think the preserved lemon was even present.  The place was filthy. The hot tea was cold. Never again.

We were supposed to wait 45 minutes but it was only a 20 min wait. The service was quick, and the rustic environment was mixed with a sporty vibe. The food was very good, and moderately priced. The pickle chips were really good. Will definitely return. 

Edit: returned several times since. The service is relatively slow, even when there aren't many people here. Seems like something has changed. Definitely not on the A game with speed.

Outstanding pizza pie.  Best Chicago style in all of St louis even better then pizza I've had in chicago. Their pizza sauce is amazing, unique and full of flavor, always ordering extra sauce on my pie. The perfect amount of toppings.  And plenty of delicious cheeze. An all around great pizza at great price.
Nice place with good home made pies & cookies with great coffee.  Good selection of hot breakfast sandwiches too.

We recently moved our salon to a new location and needed several updates made to our website. Timmermann Group was very responsive to our needs and made me feel like our business was a priority. They met with me about the changes I needed to make, and even offered some additional ideas I didn't even think about.  Plus, they kept me up to date with the status of the updates.  If you are looking for a web design company in St Louis I would highly recommend TG!

cute little breakfast joint. And great customer service, super friendly staff. Our first time in the St. Louis area and he did a good explaining the menu and being welcoming. 
Breakfast sandwich was pretty good. Pork sausage was delicious, however biscuit was a little dry for my liking. I'm from SC so I know a good biscuit. And nobody does biscuits like a true southerner, unfortunately. 
Fresh squeezed orange juice was perfect, sweet and tart, real orange juice and not too much pulp. 
And the coffee was good. 
And the man working the counter brought us out a slice of Gooey Butter Cake, we'd never had that or even heard of it..it's really sweet but great with a cup of coffee. And it was on the house, so that was cool! We are very happy with our experience here, thank you Yolklore

Incredibly unprofessional shop. Reserved gear a couple weeks before a trip to STL, got a call 4 days before arrival that they didn't have enough gear because of other divers going out the same weekend. Well duh, that's why we reserve gear, so you don't give it to others! The crazy part is that the reservation was for weights, the one thing you never run out of, it's the easiest thing to have buckets full of, our shop has never run out of weights in the 15 years I've been teaching. I even tried with their other store and they said nope, they were out too, kinda suspicious but whatever. Definitely a place to avoid if that's how they treat new customers.

This place is great.  The food was excellent from the fried egg to the homemade pastries.  They even serve Whistle orange soda.  It made me feel like a kid again.  I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants some good food at a good price

This is one of the best informal and relaxing restaurants in STL. Staff great.  Food outstanding.

Just back again.  New menu.  Even better
Great spot in CWE, friendly staff, fresh seafood and an upbeat and hip atmosphere. Such a treat. Can't wait to go back!!!

I was skeptical. I was wrong. This place has a brilliant formula, and they follow it religiously. All the ingredients lined up that you could possibly want. The system allows you to play creative master, but the curating makes it all work. Whoever buys their ingredients cares deeply about freshness. 

I felt good after eating here. It was healthy, flavorful, and ultra tasty.
I am not familiar with onion in Mac Salad,  teriyaki needs to be truly grilled.  Not the worst I've had but....

When I got back from teaching in China back in '07, there was one thing I wanted more than anything else: soup dumplings. And it was the one thing I couldn't find on sale in any of the local Chinese places. These are the soup dumplings I was looking for.
I recommend the Chicago style pizza. I ordered it with sausage and pepperoni and it was so good. They must put cheese in the crust. The pizza is super heavy and takes at least 45 minutes to make.

Dump! Without a doubt the FILTHIEST restaurant I've ever stepped into.  Slow night, but every table was still dirty.  Instead of cleaning they wanted to seat us at the ONLY table that was clean.  They did not want to clean any tables. I found out why when I passed by the kitchen: they had HUGE PILES of dirty dishes piles up in the back.  The cooking station was filthy.  We couldn't get out of there fast enough.

Omg I came here one night after going out and the food and drinks were great. I came back today to make sure it was as good as I thought and it is!  LOVE the circle 7 chicken wrap and the cherry whiskey smash

I tried this place again for the second time and it was consistently disappointing. I don't expect much from an airport pasta restaurant, but this one was just not that good.
I ordered the baked mostaciolli and the pasta itself was okay, but the sauce was super salty and the cheese appeared microwaved onto it. There was no hint of browning it. Also the meatball tasted like meatloaf. It had a lot of bread filler in it.
I also started with a salad which was mostly wilted iceberg and a few leaves of dark greens.
I can say the service wasn't bad, but the food is meh, the tables are cramped, and I didn't really enjoy my meal.

This place is great, but I wanted to leave a review specifically for the bakery/ cookies. I just ordered DB's fantastic cookies for a third event - this time they were custom-made - and you would be hard-pressed to find a better dessert/ favor (/place card, as I did on Thanksgiving!) for a party. 

Firstly, the cookies are the best sugar cookies in town - cakey, not too sweet, and real-tasting. As a bonus, they are also gorgeous to look at - the details the bakers pay attention to are unreal. As you can see in my photo, they drew little flowers on the tea hat, using metallic icing to accent, and finished them with the birthday girl's name! They will box them, or even individually wrap them in cello bags with a nice raffia ribbon (if you are planning to use them for place cards or favors). I find the cookies (especially the individually-bagged ones) to be reasonably priced. I bought some today to enjoy and give as Valentines, and I am about to order more for a baby shower. We are glad for DB to be a part of all of our family celebrations to come!
Love been a member of Emerald Club, so convenient and easy to pick up and drop of car rentals.

Awesome Chicago-Style pizza... what more do you need? It looks like a bit of a dive, and I've only done carry out orders, but I love the place. I can order a pizza right before I leave work, head to Black Thorn, sit down and have a beer while I wait and the pizza is usually ready by the time I finish my beer. Then I go home and enjoy. 

The sauce is quite strong, kind of heavy on the black pepper, but its really good with sausage and pepperoni. And that thick chewy crust and lots of mozzarella cheese, you just can't go wrong. One day I might try a thin crust or hand tossed, but I'll have to get tired of the deep-dish first!
This is the slowest Steak N Shake I have ever been to. One night the drive thru took 25 minutes.

This review I'm posting is the same exact feelings I have for their other location. Both locations did a wonderful job.  Awesome service, great and compassionate staff. They made me feel very comfortable and relaxed and everything went fast, but they were very thorough. I had a phenomenal experience.

I've been twice, and it's been a great experience each time. Fresh, unique atmosphere. The guy at the counter was also really excited about the menu, which is always a good sign, and had helpful suggestions for what to try!

Incredible restaurant with great food and better service. One of best fast casual places in town. Now have been to all 3 stores and all same quality and great service. Have met owners at each location and always fun and great to customers. Seriously a great place.

Francesca is awesome!  She was so accommodating in meeting me at a nearby hospital, while I was at a doctors appointment (talk about flexibility) to pick up my new GT bike, tune it, and dropped it off for me at work, in time for my ride.  She responded quickly to my emails, and offered great suggestions, not just an order taker.  I ask for handle bars trimmed, seat post trimmed, and disc break installed.  Great results!

Time is $, and quality time is even more important for my family.  She offers both with a great business model!  I'll be calling her again to do a drive by tune up!

Wings were great. Juicy,  flavorful,  and piping hot. . Service was fast and friendly.
Pasta was good, not great. Table near us had a salad that looked good.
Decent prices. Significantly better than most airport food.

Great breakfast spot in a somewhat unexpected location. The frittata is one of the best I've ever had. I only wish there was a little more seating, as it can get cramped and crowded sometimes. Also not a fan of the mirrors by the back seating - who wants to watch themselves eat? The food is delicious though. Get takeout or go through the drive-through.

SLOW. Declining food quality. The last two times I have ordered it has taken at least an hour to get my sandwich. The last time I ordered, after 50 minutes the driver called me and said he was at our office. 15 minutes later he still wasn't there. When he did arrive, there was confusion with the order. 

Two orders ago - my chips were stale. This last order, there was one small piece of bacon on the club Lulu and the turkey had an odd taste. 

After two years of ordering almost weekly, I am moving on. The speed and quality of the food have declined significantly and there are now better options available.

We had the turkey leg which was enormous and perfectly cooked. The sides were exemplary especially the sweet potatoes. The marshmallow really made it seem more like a dessert than a side.
We had really attentive and friendly wait staff and enjoyed our night out.
I'll definitely be back!

Expect a long wait, period. These monster pizzas are made to order with limited oven space. 
Plan to arrive before you are ravenous. Come in to place your order and sit down to have a drink or 2 while you wait an hour or two. Let the anticipation build your hunger... or call ahead if you don't want to wait. 

Establishment has been remodeled throughout, to include a nice patio set up. We almost left thinking we walked into the wrong place!
What hasn't changed: the service and the food. The toppings were 2 fingers deep and cooked to perfection. There was no muddling of flavors and the crust was flaky-crisp. 

Bring friends, these pies are made to feed the masses. We were a party of 4 adults and took home half a pizza.

There is a service model here and patrons are generally aware of how it works, without having to ask or be told. Don't expect to be fawned over, it's just not that kind of environment. The service is friendly however, and the set up is efficient.

[Edit: The 5th star was almost granted here. I was at a 4.5 and rounded down. I might bump it up when I eat the other half for breakfast. I just hafta see how it re-heats!]

It's been said before but I'll mention it again:  this is not a pizza joint.  It is a bar that just so happens to also make pizza.  I have little sympathy for anyone complaining about wait times, table service, or ID checks.

Ok with that out of the way, let's move on and review this place as it is.  Is it a dive bar? Check.  Is the pizza awesome?  Yes.    Are you from Chicago and/or usually order Pizza Hut?  Then this "deep dish" is probably not what you're looking for.

Oh, and this ain't gourmet pizza, either.  It's not Pi, it's not wood-oven, you can't get goat cheese.  Sorry.

Sometimes you just have an experience with a place worth repeating.  And Blackthorn provides that.  A hearty (and delicious), unpretentious pie, great to share with friends over beer.  It's a neighborhood joint that kind of has a vibe of "you don't like it?  Too bad."  And I respect that.  Thankfully, for me, they do exactly what I would expect of a place like this.

If the food want good this would have been just a one star.  Service is slow, the kitchen is ungodly slow and this is in an airport.  

On top of it, bartender dropped my girlfriends food and didn't even say anything to us about it. Until it showed up 10 minutes after mine.   

My recommendation is to only order beers here and save the food order for somewhere else that cares.

I work 3rd shift and get off at 2am and there is very few places that are 24hrs. Twice in two nights i was denied a burger. They said the grills are down then i asked for milkshake they said milkshake machine is down. Then on a 3rd occasion i was served food but after i didn't get a response in drive thru i drove around and they were all outside smoking.  Im done with this place. People don't wanna work apparently at this time of night. They shouldn't be open 24hrs to waste people's time.

Seriously not good. The cheese garlic sticks were layered in garlic, an actual disgusting amount of garlic. The crust on the pizza is tough, very very tough, and the sauce is more of a salsa than a Italian tomato sauce. You an try it, but honestly Pi has a much much better deep dish pizza, or check out The Good Pie.

Came here with some friends for Sunday night karaoke. It was awesome! Great stage, great music selection, and the DJ keeps things moving without any dead air. 

The venue itself is pretty cool, and everything was clean. Pool tables and darts upstairs, and the stage and bar on the ground level. They had a special drink at the bar that was delicious!  The food was also really good.

Damn you, Highway 44 and the rock that kicked up and cracked my windshield!
