No complaints with my Glass Doctor experience. I called and spoke with who I think was the owner. He assessed the problem (a crack has to be the size of a quarter or smaller to repair and mine most certainly was not, so it was a replacement). They gave me an appointment for the following day.

Glass Doctor comes to you, which is awesome. The driver came to my work and called me when he was 15 minutes away. I came out and met him when he arrived, went back in until he was finished (about 20 mins) and he called me to come out and inspect the final product when he was done.

A plus is that, god forbid, your windshield gets cracked again within one year, they will replace it for free - all that you have to pay is the labor fee. Chips and leakage are free repairs for the life of the windshield.
Good service, provide good cars and prompt resolution to any issues
different flavors than the other frozen yogurt places in the stl.....toppings could be a little bit larger....more choices.....

TL:DR: Healthy, fresh, and quick. Tasty if you get combinations right. Best combos will have something savory, sweet, and crunchy.

This place is amazing. Everyone is extremely friendly and the fish is super fresh for the Midwest. Make sure you keep your expectations in check though, we are landlocked by quite a distance.

You also get unlimited toppings with avacado and Kim chi being extra. I've had poke quite a bit on the coasts and have found that the best combinations tend to have a mix of something crunchy (chips or fried onion), something savory (spicy poke sauce, Kim chi), and something sweet (Thai sweet chili sauce, mango, or pineapple). My go to combo is white rice w/chips, ahi tuna, crab salad, seaweed salad, mango, green onion, fried onion, sweet Thai chili sauce, spicy mayo, sesame seeds, and togorashi seasoning.

If you can, I've found sharing a large bowl between two ppl is plenty of food, as long as you both can agree on toppings this is def the way to go and much cheaper than getting two bowls.

Seating in the resteraunt is ample and it's always very clean and well lit. It's hard to beat a healthy, fresh, and quick resteraunt in cwe. People will naturally compare to.blk mrkt eats, both are delicious, but pokedoke bowls are def better than blk mrkt bowls. But there sushi-rittos are different and delicious as well. I believe they can both coexist, in that one day I'll be feeling sushi-rittos and another I'll be feeling  poke and can pick and choose which I'm feeling that day and not be conflicted.

With all the photos circulating on Facebook of extreme milkshakes in other major cities it's so much fun to have a destination like this in St. Louis! The chocoholic was as insane as it sounds stuffed with an ice cream sandwich, cupcake, brownie, and donuts on the straw! Definitely a place to take Instagram worthy foodie pictures!

Loved making my appointment online, staff was super friendly and upbeat even though it was almost closing time on a Friday. Conveniently will get your prescriptions on site and avoid another trip. The EMTs were very nice and professional and the nurse practitioner was great as well.

I love using National and I use them very frequently. My recent experience at the location of St. Louis airport left a lot to be desired.  Upon check in the computer systems were down, the Emerald Club lots were empty so I was advised to walk around a general lots a pointed in a direction.  The vehicle was fine however not cleaned well, there was sticky stuff stuck on the console and steering wheel.  Upon my return 27 days later the computer system was down again.  I have utilized this location several times in the last 4 years for business travel, the last 2 times were this year 2016 and the computer systems are aweful, the customer service reps would rather chat with each other than assist the customer, and the cars are not cleaned adequately.

Every kind of delicious!  I ordered several sides and they were all amazing....  beets perfectly spiced, carrots seasoned with a tasty pesto, and the leek soup so full of flavor and satisfying I had to order a second cup.  Even the decor is delightful.  Highly recommended!

I went here on Friday night pretty close to when they were closing. They greeted us happily and we ordered our food. The waitress Mia, was very friendly and helpful. She explained everything to us and I settled on Pad Thai. We also ordered crab rangoon as an appetizer. The crab rangoon was crispy and had a ton of crab/cream cheese in it. When I received the Pad Thai it was beautiful. It was a light color and the vegetables that I ordered on it just popped. The chicken breast was cooked perfectly and complimented it so well. Everything was fresh. Seriously. Everything. The chicken and noodles had just been made and the vegetables, mint AND cilantro (thanks Mia) looked like they had just been picked. One of my friends had shrimp teriyaki and the shrimp were large. MK came out and introduced himself and told us that there was no rush for us to leave. Which was very kind. He talked a little about Saturday nights there and how they were going to add to the menu - and if we had any suggestions (I sincerely think he wants to know.). I gave them 4 stars because I think they should have a bigger menu. When we left he said goodbye to us each by name. Classy. I'll definitely be back.

Crestwood lacked exceptional breakfast options. 

Enter: Yolklore. 

Everything I've had is delicious. "Billy The Kid" is the breakfast sandwich of my life. 

The juice is fresh, the coffee is fresh, the ingredients are local. What else would the eager breakfast goer want? 

Oh, you want treats, pastries, cream puffs? Yolklore has those too. These Yolklore treats are 5 star situations. 

All the employees are super nice. They are professionals on the griddle. 

Pro tip: seating is limited. Seating more than 4 people together can be a challenge. If that's the case, hit up the drive through with your huge order and meet your large group friends at your favorite park, or make the group hang a more intimate situation and come to Yolklore a few times with a friend or two.
Carry out was quick and painless, had the regular poke that was quite filling! Great addition to the cwe.

I was unaware of this place's existence. Now, it's going to be a problem. Seriously, it is a trendy little clean, bright, fresh, breakfast joint hidden rudely in a strip mall! Confusing. 

I'm pushing 7 months pregnant, as of the time I write this, and I am going back for those pancakes- big dippers. You sometimes go out and get pancakes and they are kind of flat and rubbery... Almost as if they have been pre made and heated up, or microwaved. And, thus, remind me to only eat pancakes that we make at home. I was craving pancakes so I ordered the big dippers. I was initially skeptical about the concept that you get 6 pancakes that you tear up and dip in syrup. But, now that's the only way I want to eat pancakes- these stay fluffy and delicious and only need a tiny bit of syrup dipped on the edge. These are NOT those gross French toast sticks you get at the grocery store freezer aisle; they make it all right in front of you. 

They even have a drive through!!! Also, a created problem for me now, 

Husband got slinger on a sandwich and said it was delicious! 

But, seriously, there was a four year old sitting a few seats away from me (it's a big shared long table in the middle of the room) who got the kid's version of what I got (the Little Dippers) and proudly exclaimed, "These pancakes are really good!!!". Aren't four year olds the experts on pancakes? 

Also, I was fascinated by the idea that they have an old-school coffee "club" where you rent a mug on the wall with your name on it and come in and get coffee in your very own reserved mug.

Also, also, this joint makes custom cakes- gooey butter cake, cheesecake, cookie cakes, and.....wedding cakes!? (Yes, wedding cakes.) 

Go have breakfast here. Get pancakes. You need pancakes. Who doesn't need pancakes? Ok, maybe people who have issues with gluten, but everyone else.

We visited for the first time last week - great food, love that they locally source the ingredients! Wonderful decor and really like the European vibe with long tables shared with folks - will definitely go back again.
Great looking building walking distance from SLU. The best sanwiches ever! They slap on the lettuce, and are always down to dish our more. The bread is cut super thick and oh so tasty.
Just terrible. The Spaghetti Carbonara took forever to make and arrived as a bland pile in a bowl. Will not be back.

I'm very conflicted about this place.  The food was mostly excellent.  The service was mostly atrocious.  
When we arrived, the server took our order, but did not write anything down (this will come back later), and brought out our drinks.  The appetizer was correct, and was delicious; we asked for some water. Then the table next to us received their entrees, and we were told ours would be next... The table next to us finished their entire meal before we had a server come to us to let us know our order was coming.  Still no water, so we asked again.  
Eventually, the main course comes, and mine is not correct.  I had ordered the BBQ Beck Burger with onions and french fries.  I received a Beck Burger (no BBQ sauce), a pickle (no onions) and chips (no fries).  The server plopped down our food and left without saying a word.  I was hungry so started eating my burger.  The server comes back about 5 minutes later, and asked if I was supposed to have sauerkraut.  I said no, but it was supposed to have BBQ sauce, I should have had fries, and we were still waiting on water.  We received a look from the server that we were being jerks, and she said, "well, that's basically the same (referencing the chips), but I'll get you some fries".  She brings some BBQ sauce, fries, and water (finally!).
The burger was even better with the sauce.  The fries were dry and stale.
After we had finished our meal, the server came back and asked if I was finished, I said yes, and asked for the check.  The plates were removed, and the server left.  10 minutes later, the server returns, and asks if we would like anything else.  I again ask for the check.  Another while later, and the check finally arrives.
If it hadn't been for the horrible service, I would have given this place 5 stars.  But on that same note, if the food hadn't been so good, it would have only gotten 1 star.
So, if you don't mind waiting forever for food, it's really good.  Just be warned, the servers aren't too friendly.  It will be a long while before I will go again.
I have good customer service from S . county location and the work they do was not bad either, getting more things installed soon at s.county.

not sure if i was there on a /really/ bad night, but from my experience, this place doesn't hold a candle to pi (or even onesto).  the crust--perhaps the most important component on a deep dish pizza--lacked any distinctive flavor at all, and the limited amount of veggies were completely overwhelmed by the sauce.  i'm not saying the pizza was horrible; it's just that it didn't leave me wanting more.

There are 2 things I try at every new restaurant, salad & chili.  Salad I check for fresh greens & chili I check for ground beef and spice.  This sports bar takes food seriously.  The salad was served with dressing on the side.  The chili was made with cubed beef, not ground beef.  It's spicy but not overwhelming the flavor with too much heat.  I will come back to explore more of the menu before I give the fifth star.
Dumplings are pricey for their size and quality.  You can go to the large Asian grocery store next door and get frozen dumplings that are comparable.

The smile perfecter. Dr. Harris is extremely knowledgable and involved with every service. I've been a patient for years and I hate I've gone to other dentist in the past; Dr. Harris has had to go-over and correct the work of former dentist. I am always happy with her work although I dread coming to sit in a dentist chair; at least I'm sitting in comfort and assured it'll all be done properly here.

I have been wanting to try soup dumplings after seeing them on so many food network shows.   So when I saw this opened up in STL I couldn't wait to try it.
I went in at the end of lunch rush....The place is very minimalist...and they serve soup dumplings...5 different kinds...but only soup dumplings.    I ordered 1 order of pork variety...not sure if I should get a second.  They come 6 to an order...except I believe the seafood has 8.  I was starving and they came out with a clear broth soup to start.   It was really light and delicious.   And would serve as a receptical for the soup that would eventually leak out of my dumpling...you want to slurp up every bit.    The  dumplings were small but amazing.   I could eat them all day every day.   I decided not to get a second order...but I've been craving them ever since.   I do wish there was something else to go with them...maybe a seaweed salad or spring rolls.   No alcohol, only bottled soda and water.     Still....good effin dumplings!
Been there 3 times in a week. Looking forward to try everything on the menu and start over! Breakfast is now my favorite meal.

Minimal wait on a Thursday at 1pm. Everything looked fresh. Keep things simple and don't overload the bowl with sauce and you can taste each individual ingredient you add. Kind of feels like a subway for poke. Crafting my bowl was done in about a minute. Nice if you're in a hurry. Street parking is a little difficult to find since it's in the central west end, which is my only gripe, but certainly worth it for a fast and unique lunch or dinner option.

I was looking for a lunch spot near the Boeing plant on a work trip and Yelp came up with Ol' Henry.  Man, am I glad it did!  I came in thinking I'd just try some things since I wasn't that hungry and wound up rolling out of there after polishing off the one meat lunch special.  I had the ribs, green beans, and mac and cheese.  The ribs were great, and a huge portion for a lunch special.  The green beans were the best I've ever had, which is a weird thing to say about green beans, but completely true.  I don't know what they made those things with, but I'd say, if your kids won't eat their vegetables, just bring them here and change their minds.  Everyone working there was super friendly and helpful, probably the best service I had my entire trip.  If I come back here for work, you can be sure I'll be back to Ol' Henry for lunch.

Famished all day, I was on a mission to find a new place to eat, but something fairly close to home. I felt adventurous, but NOT that adventurous to go too far.

After living in the Tower Grove area for nearly 2 years, I finally decided to give Black Thorn a shot. All I've heard were good things minus the long wait people usually endure when coming here.

Jason and I got here around 7:30. To our surprise there was not a line nor was it insanely busy like we had anticipated. Another thing we had not anticipated was the set up of the place.

You have to place your order at the bar, get your own drinks from the bar, and pay all before you receive your pizza if you aren't going to keep an open tab. It basically has the same concept as a Bread Co. or Qdoba. Once you order, they'll bring you your pizza out.

We ordered a 12 inch Chicago style sausage and pepperoni pizza and a bowl of caesar salad to hold us over until the pizza came out. Little did we know that we were going to wait 30 minutes to receive the salad, then an additional 30 minutes after that for our pizza. As mentioned before, it was not busy. It had a few patrons, but not enough to cause the wait like we had to.

8:30pm. Pizza is out. We're ready and holy hot damn, am I excited! The pizza lived up to the hype I had hoped for. The time spent waiting was well worth every bite I ate. I think the only downside is the wait time. I don't know how long it takes to cook the pizzas. I'd assume awhile considering how thick the crusts are, but still, could they not have told us?

As far as the attitude of the bartender, I have to agree with Aimee K. The girl looked like she had a blank stare on her face, and she didn't seem too pleasant to talk to. I asked her when our salad was going to come out, and her reply was, "when we get to it." I went back to my seat and continued to wait without questioning. I didn't want anything to happen to our beloved deep dish pizza!

Anyway, aside from that, I like Black Thorn. The rustic looking 1980s dive bar setting who outlived its hay day truly adds character to this place. It has darts, hurling, and a juke box. You can't go wrong, especially in this hipster neighborhood.

Come check it out and you'll see what I mean.

This is an excellent addition to their other locations. This location is huge. I have not been to their downtown location, but I would guess it is three times the size of their Clayton location. There is ample seating both at community tables and smaller tables. 

The food was excellent as always, and the portion size is very generous. One calzone is certainly enough to share between multiple people! Although they still have some kinks to work out with meal timing, the service overall was fantastic. I had a misunderstanding with my order and one of the cooks came out personally to address it, which I really appreciated.

I'm so glad this restaurant came to the Grove, it fits right in and will certainly be successful. Stop in when you get the chance.

The Island is great. I am genuinely shocked that more St. Louisans do not frequent this place. Why go wait in line at Trops and be forced to sit there and finish your drink, when you could stop in The Island and take a nice frozen drink (I prefer the Arnold Palmer) with you for a stroll around Soulard? Their frozen yogurt is top notch, too. Their employees are always friendly and helpful. I think big things may be on the horizon for this joint.

Great food and atmosphere, especially for fast casual.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to the table.  Ceasar salad and beets with green salad were both great.  Family had four different calzones-all trendy and delicious.  Not your grandfathers calzone place!  Good beer and soda selection.  Wine list is shorter, but their suggestion for wine for a calzone was spot one.  Thanks!!

Amazing. Grew up here, and went to this location mane times. It has been a little while since I've been back , but very few people across the country know about Lion's Choice, and it's delicious. The seasoning, roast beef, toasted hot dog, and crushed ice are stand outs. This place is a huge St.louis perk.

Takeout service: I've ordered takeout of the Chicago deep dish pizza on a number of occasions. Each time has been on point with timing estimates - the usual 45 minutes.

Interiors - as the other reviews will tell you, this location is under renovation. I applaud that, as it appears it needed a facelift, and they're achieving that.

Chicago Deep Dish - the closest to true deep dish I've had, outside of Chicago. I always order the pizza with sausage; call it reminiscing my college days in Chicago! The cheese and crust are just what you should expect form a good deep dish pizza. Their sauce, although a rich blend of spices, is all their own, and "distinct" as Black Thorn's Dave has stated in some of these reviews.

In short, give this neighborhood spot a shot!

Of course, here is the obligatory zero star statement!!!

Deserves zero stars...

So after being a member of the emerald club for around 20 years or more, with the past couple of years being an executive level member, I had to make changes in my drop off plans for my rental car.

What does tha mean? It means that I have to pay triple the rate I had for a one week rental. That means going from just under $300 for one week to almost $1,000.00 just to drop it off 200 miles away from the pickup location.

Well, talk about a ripoff!!  Yeah, I did have to change the reservation, but I didn't really expect to get screwed like this. Talk about butt hurt!!!

Well National, you just lost a longtime loyal customer.

Good riddance...

I love this little all you can eat Indian restaurant!  Delicious food, small restaurant but the staff is very friendly and nice.  The food is delicious and is hot.  The staff continued to make sure the food was in good supply.  I can't wait to go back.

After visiting several furniture stores in the area I was pleasantly surprised with the options and prices at Slumberland. The staff was very helpful & not pushy. I left the store with a new mattress & was very happy with how easy the process was!

As a Californian, I love my fro yo, and I miss Yogurtland more than I can express, but The Island hits the spot well enough.  Many of the flavors don't quite reach what they proclaim to be, tasting instead like nondescriptly sweet frozen stuff, but that's what the sample cups are for, and the flavors rotate frequently.  

The toppings selection is pretty nifty, including a range of crushed candy bars, fruits, cereals, cookies, cookie dough bites, brownie bites, and more.  But who am I kidding?  Half the time, I get fro yo as an excuse to load up on cookie dough bites anyway, so The Island pretty much had me sold on that.

I've never tried the boozy slushies, though, because I live so close to Trops.
So I recently found out they were charging me for cleaning cloths but they're apparently free. Does anyone else pay for cleaning cloths at this location?

This is the half order of brisket nachos. Half. Order. It's a ton of food. Also pictured is the Smokehouse burger. This is our first visit here. Great place to come to see a game as there are numerous TVs and friendly wait staff as well. Charles was our server and he made a couple of great recommendations. We also tried the Honey Fiery Shrimp as an appetizer. Some at our table liked it better than others. I prefer to taste the shrimp and this could have been any protein fried and drowned in sauce. Tasty?  Yes. Shrimp?  Not really. 
We will be back. And ask for Charles.

Awesome fast casual breakfast place. All the meals are about $9, and they give you a lot of food. Much more interesting and higher quality than standard diner fare. Great cookies and baked sweets too.

We came here because of some of the great reviews of this place. The pizza was good but there was some kind of spice in the marinara sauce, I think, that ruined it for both of us. It might have been oregano or something else. I think this is a good place to try once and check it out but I doubt we will ever repeat it...I will go with 3 stars, taking into consideration the cleanliness of the place as well...
From Chicago and read the great reviews about this place, tastes like it was ordered from Dominos. I eat alot and I denied leftovers. The Ceasar Salad was good.
Great local business! Same day service and very friendly installers who know a lot about glass.
A coworker took me here for lunch. Super friendly atmosphere. Huge fan of the veggie sandwich and the seasonal salad. Definitely recommend for lunch.
Always a treat for the kids and us. Very reasonable. Big selection of frozen yogurt and toppings.

I love all of the Bailey's restaurants so was very excited to see the new concept in the old space. The decor is absolutely beautiful. It felt warm and inviting but also very modern and fun. We started our meal with the crab cake and the corn dogs. I was a bit surprised to see a crab cake appetizer with only one crab cake. I think it would have been better to have two smaller crab cakes to make it easier to share (it is an appetizer). However, the flavor of it was very good. The corn dogs were also good, but the portion size felt very off to me. It was served with five corn dogs, but they were almost the size of my palm. This required us to use a knife to eat them, so then the breading was falling off, making it somewhat strange to eat. I would have liked to see this served differently. For our meals, we both ordered the jambalaya. I enjoyed the sausage and tiny shrimp in the dish and felt it added some much needed texture. I found myself seeking those bites out and stopping when they were gone. I was surprised at the dish it was served in. It essentially came out in a boat instead of a bowl, which I felt was an odd choice. Our server, while a nice person, was not very helpful in terms of recommending items on the menu. For a new restaurant, I wanted to hear the house recommendations or customer favorites so far. They also went missing for about thirty minutes after we were served our main dishes and we had to flag someone down to get our check. I really wanted to love this restaurant but it fell a little short of my expectations. The food was good, but not as good as I was expecting for the price, and service was inconsistent. I will probably give it another shot since I love the Bailey's restaurants and think the New Orleans inspired cuisine is something our city needs, but am not in a hurry to return.

The restaurant was very clean the staff very polite and helpful. I ordered the fried chicken and it was one of the best chicken I have ever had. The fries were crispy and perfectly seasoned. The mac and cheese was very creamy and the corn bread was outstanding. I will definitely be a regular.

Great atmosphere and cool artwork waiting on our food but looks very promising! This store is on the corner inside the grove shopping area. Plenty of seating and honestly don't have much to say only doing it because yelp is telling me to write more. I could write more after eating but anyway there customizable options with a creative menu
The food always comes out fresh but expect to wait in the drive-thru for at least 20+ minutes.  Steak 'N Shakes have always been notorious for long drive-thru lines but this is a little excessive.

I was expecting to be wowed but just wasn't. I ordered the chicken tenders with mac-n-cheese and cornbread. The chicken and mac-n-cheese were okay.  Cornbread was very good. My husband ordered a burger. The char on his burger made it taste like charcoal. Sauce on it was very good though.

The service was excellent. People were extremely friendly. Plenty of seating and a relaxed atmosphere.

Darn it! I was really hoping that this would be our new convenient neighborhood takeout spot. The premise sounded so good and I LOVE bubble tea. Unfortunately, the Pad Thai and Stir Fry were just mediocre and I didn't love the sweet sauce that came alongside it. And the bubble tea was super sugary and out of a carton. Very disappointed - this neighborhood needs something like this, but (at least for me) MK's misses the mark.

I come to this Mcdonald's because it's closest to where I live and I always have an awful experience. Today, it took over 15 minutes to get my food after ordering at the drive thru. Then, when they finally brought out the food, it was completely the wrong order. They then brought out the "correct" order, which was still the wrong thing. By that time, I was sick of waiting and knew that the chances of getting the right order were slim to none. This is the worst McDonald's I've ever been to. It's embarrassing that no matter when I come, they are never able to prepare the right order.
They need to bring back the scale. The prices of the different size cups are not worth it.

Too much cheese in my opinion, but I've learned to order light cheese and extra sauce. The sauce itself I could literally eat with a spoon...so good. I really wish pineapple was a topping option!   It does take a while to get it, roughly an hour or so, but there's lots to do while you wait. Fun bar atmosphere with way better than average bar pizza!

I can't see anyone complaining about this joint but there are apparently some jackasses that work there. I got lucky and went on a night where the staff was just unhappy to be working a shit job. I can accept that. It's the same any crappy bar you go to at 9pm on a weeknight. Those folks are going to have to clean up vomit later and they know it.

Upon arrival it is in fact a dirty dive. There are only a couple people working. You seat yourself and order at the bar. It will take a minute for your order to be taken and your draft to be poured. No one is going to come check on you. It's loud. People are going in and out smoking constantly. But it's a bar, you get what you asked for when you walked through the door.

Still trying to figure out why the pizza sauce is brown and spicy but I like it, and none of that provel BS thank you very much! Is it the best in STL? No way, Pi is much better and yet that's not saying much. STL pizza 2 out of 10. Chicago 9 out of 10.
The dough itself is perfect then stuffed with goodness of your choice. The variety of sauces on the side are brilliant! Making every taste bud happy.

OMG! Hubby treated me to a couples stone massage for my birthday. The massages were excellent and perfect. Special attention was paid on my knees and neck. The vibration tables were an amazing experience. Sound Stone is becoming part of our dating life.

The best Chicago style pizza I have ever had. That's right, you heard me Chicagoans: the best. The pepper sauce is outstanding, the crust is delicious, and the atmosphere is a blast. It does take about 45 minutes to get a pie, but if you go either early (before 7) or late (I think they're still cooking after 10) it's not too bad.

If I could have packed the Black Thorn up and took it with when we moved to Minneapolis, I would have.

I had high hopes for this place but coming from a southern family I've been spoiled. The chicken tenders were dry, the mac & cheese was good, the herb beef was excellent, the cauliflower side was good, the green bean casserole was OK, and the cornbread was just OK. Positive: extremely fast service!

Again the company paid for us to move with United - much happier with the service. Though in Austin initally 2 guys moved everything that took 3 or 4 guys - unitl a couple more came late. 

Pretty much no damage or excessive mess. 

In LA - more movers helped. 

I would use them again.

Compared with another mover, it was butter. 

One regret is that I gave the tip to the driver in Austin and asked him to give the rest to the guy who did most of the moving. Give the tip directly to them - I wish I had because I don't like wondering.

Got a delicious bowl today! Small, salmon and spicy tuna. Portion is quite big! The bubble tea wasn't the most amazing thing ever, but I'll come back for the bowls. Quite a line for takeout, be prepared to wait.

I had 30 minutes prior to my flight boarding. I thought, well, here's a bar where I can see when they line us up like cattle to board. I thought, I'll have a couple beers while I wait. Two draft beers cost me 23.98 plus tax and tip. That's over $15 a pint. Ridiculous.

This company is a complete mess. DO NOT USE THEM! 
It's going to take a month to receive our stuff and they still haven't told us what time they'll be delivering. At least let us know approx. what time so that I can take PTO from work??!!?!? We moved from San Diego to Portland not San Diego to New York. It shouldn't take like 10 years to get our stuff! 
It's really inconvenient having absolutely nothing at our new place. We can't sit, cook or lay down anywhere. 
When we emailed and called our rep in the San Diego office, she completely ignored us because she knows they messed up. 
At least keep apologizing because isn't that your job? She tried to blame us for having stuff under 3500 pounds?! Seriously?! We had to buy a new bed bc we couldnt sleep on the floor! We're wasting money on buying stuff we already have! 
If you hate your job that much, then go find something else instead of being completely useless! Oh yeah, the corp office will make you talk to the rep so they're pretty useless too. 
From reading other reviews, I'm really afraid our stuff is going to either get lost or damaged. I don't understand why/how this company is still in business when they have so many negative reviews. Im also going to report this company to BBB! I am rolling my eyes as I'm typing because this company is annoying and they don't care about anything other than making money.

Excited to have new Circle 7 located in Lucky Ds neck of the woods.  Little different layout from the Ballwin location but very nice decor with the wood walls and TVs all over the place good spot to watch your favorite team.  Tried the barbecue nachos pretty good and also had the classic burger & fries all good.  Will definitely come back & try something else on the menu.

United Van Lines made my move absolutely painless. Donna McGee is absolutely wonderful: I expressed to her that I needed to move ASAP from the Midwest to the west coast, and she set up an appointment for me to get a quote for the next day! The next day she called me expressing she found movers that could come just 4 days later. She would call me every other day with updates. The actual movers at pick up were punctual and quick but careful with my things. They were friendly and answered all of my questions. After pick up Donna would give me updates about every other day regarding the status of my delivery, which took just a week. The delivery workers were also wonderful and amicable. The quote for this company was also much more reasonable than other quotes I had received from other companies (who were much harder to communicate with). I thought moving would be an awful experience but they made this an absolutely stress free experience. Thank you!

Finally made it here!  Super friendly staff. I went for a late dinner with a friend.  We waited in line to order our meal. The person in front of us was having trouble deciding what to get and the cashier took her time to give the guy recommendations. We ordered a large salad strawberry salad and duke calzone to share.  I love that they brought out the salad already plated before the calzone.  I don't usually expect that at a place where you order at the counter.  The salad was pretty good.  Maybe a little too much dressing but I love that they aren't stingy on the nuts and cheese.  The duke calzone was very good and flavorful.  We didn't even need the sauce for dipping.  They also brought an extra plate without me asking (I hate when food comes out and you have to ask for a plate and wait there with the food sitting in front of you).  They are also really good about clearing away the used dishes on our table so they don't stack up. The wait for food was pretty quick and we paid a total of $22 before tip for a yummy dinner.  When we left I think every staff member that was in the dining room said goodbye with a genuine smile on their face.
DELICIOUS pizza!! Loved the video games and the huge bathroom. Will be back for sure.

I was dying to try this place but ended up with take out only due to time constraints. I pray they operate a massive recycling center in the back because no free water (bottles only), combined with styrofoam everything, nearly guarantees them a spot in trash hell. Dumplings are very good but small and somewhat pricey - just 6 set me back $8. I've been told they are labor intensive to make but this seems extreme. There's no way i could bring my teens here and get them full for under $100. Again didn't stay to eat but seemed clean.

I made my first visit to The Daily Bread Bakery & Café today.  They were not busy at all however there was no one at either register to take an order.  I waited at one of the registers for about 5 minutes (way to long in my opinion) for someone to at least acknowledge that I was standing there and that they would be with me in a moment.  Didn't happen.  I finally leaned over to speak with several of the people working behind the registers (I could see) so I knew they also saw me.  I ask if I was in the right area to place an order.  The girl yelled over to two other ladies that were filling the drink machine and said......Hey, you have a customer here.  I apologized to the cashier once she was taking my order.  That I didn't mean to cause a problem just wasn't sure where to place my order since it was my first visit.  She said NOTHING!

I placed an order for the albacore tuna sandwich.  I saw on the menu board that it came with chips and fruit.  When they called my number I was given a bag with only a sandwich.  I ask if  the chips and fruit came with my sandwich and the server that handed me the sandwich rolled his eyes and looked at the lady that had yelled for the cashiers.  She said, yeah you can help yourself to the chips and a banana or apple.  I know I would have walked out of there without the sides (if you will) if it would have been left up to the server.

I took the sandwich (sides) back to work.  I was very disappointed with the tuna.  Not much tuna, lettuce and tomato on a large bun . What seem to be a very strong garlic taste was evident and I was unable to finish the sandwich.  I offered the remaining half to a co-worker who didn't care for it either.

I will not be going back.  Too many other places to visit!

We originally saw this establishment on "Show me St Louis". Please come with a sweet tooth!  There was so much Ice Cream that I could not finish it all.  Very friendly and professional staff. I definitely recommend this place on a hot day!

After 9 years of National Car Rentals, National car employee Jenay employee number E579NO told me to Take A Walk.  As a very active Emerald Club member, my last rental I was charged for a toll of only $4.00 due to not my EZ pass not working, but rather the toll booth not doing its job to pick up the toll.  Ms. Jenay who is a supt. with National was totally not into customer care, but rather just reading me over and over National will not do anything about it, and just take your car rental business somewhere else.   We normally pay $100-150 per day on our one way rental cars.   I feel she was not flexible, and would just rather see the company just loose a very good customer over just $4..  Sorry.   We are through with National Car, just hope that headquarters in St. Louis, MO picks up on this.

I was in town and our hotel was right next to this Popeyes. I have a love/hate relationship with Popeyes because when it's good, it's great. But lately most locations in Chicagoland have burned me.

I must say this is one of the best Popeye locations I've been to in a while. Better than the one I went to in New Orleans. Employees were friendly, chicken was piping hot and delicious. I must've caught them on a good day because I'd easily go back there whenever I'm back in town.
This place is amazing. Delicious slushy drinks in a huge space. Great people watching while dulling your senses on unanticipatedly boozy, sweet, icy treats. Didn't try the GSF. I shall return.
Great food!  Great little tavern atmosphere!  It's refreshing to find something in the Midwest that puts quality ahead of quantity.

We love Sauce on the Side it's our go to restaurant in St. Louis for 'pizza' (they only serve calzones). The food is so good we don't even order traditional pizza anymore! We were happy to see a location was opening in The Grove which is very convenient for us. We called in our order which was taken promptly over the phone by a very friendly girl. My husband went to pick it up 20 minutes later and the restaurant was pretty busy. He was frustrated that there wasn't a designated pick up area since there was a long line at the register and the bar area was full as well. He waited in line to pick up our food which was ready for us and delicious! We had the Five-O and the Roasty Toasty with added feta. Just need a designated area for pick up to make it more efficient.

8pm in the evening, only the 20 items or less lane is open, I have 3 items and get stuck behind the guy with 300 items in his basket. I know, it wasn't his fault, it was the only line open. Wake up Schnucks, you were two hours from closing, keep a few lanes open. Bad management decision. That's okay though, Dierbergs is closer and I get to see my 16 year old the nights he is working. Bye Schmucks.

I got the turkey leg with squash and cornbread as the two sides. Interest pricing here...the entrees are an amazing deal (the turkey leg is like half the size of my arm and only $10! So awesome!) while the sides are like the biggest rip off ever. $3 for a fistful of squash?! And another $2 bucks if I want cornbread?! A lot of people have been talking about the cornbread but I'll just set it straight. Unless you like dry, stale, under seasoned, not very tasty cornbread DONT GET IT. To put it in perspective, I like Boston market cornbread better. Yeah that's right, you can get better cornbread at Boston market. it's not worth it. 

So with a great deal on entrees and terrible deal on sides it ends up being about decent meal for ~$16-17 bucks. 

I was pretty turned off by the cornbread but overall it was a good meal. Turkey leg for $10 is great. easily could eat that for two meals and be very happy

Doesn't even deserve one star. I am 0.2 miles from this restaurant and it has been 30+ minutes since I ordered my sandwiches and they still haven't arrived. I would walk and get them myself if I wasn't playing in a volleyball tournament and can't leave.

Planning on moving? Take my recommendation and DO NOT hire United Van Lines to move you. By far the worst company me & my wife have ever experienced in our entire lives. Our overall move experience was a COMPLETE NIGHTMARE. From start to finish our relocation was extremely poorly handled by United Van Lines. Being guaranteed during our quote that if we signed with United Van Lines they would have our belongings loaded and arrived at our new location by 8-1-17. After numerous interactions with the moving coordinator and being lied to about the status of our property, our belongings weren't delivered until 8-11-17 and 8-14-17 due to additional loads being added and our stuff being split into two separate trucks without our approval. I drove from MN to AZ and incurred multiple moving expenses due to the lies about when the truck was leaving MN with our property. Given these multiple delays we notified United Van Lines we would not be at our new house to receive the first truck due to a family wedding we were in. United Van Lines then wanted us to pay additional money to have it stored overnight for all of their mistakes & incompetence. In a new city where we know nobody we made arrangements to fly someone down to AZ to be present while the first truck was unloaded while we flew back to MN. Obviously even more unnecessary costs incurred because of United Van Lines . United Van Lines is responsible for numerous damaged items as well as 9 lost boxes that are irreplaceable. This kind of service is absolutely ridiculous especially coming from the largest moving company in the entire country. To add the cherry on top our claims process has been equally miserable as the move itself. We submitted our claim on 9-26-17 and did not receive the claim check until 2-17-18 to replace all of the property that was damaged & lost by United Van Lines. The claims coordinator for United Van Lines never kept us in the loop as to our claims status, we always had to initiate the conversation and even then were lied to about its status as they continually told us a new date to expect reimbursement. United Van Lines should be embarrassed with their customer service during our move as this process is inexcusable and no doubt the worst service we've ever experienced. I will NEVER recommend this company to anyone looking for a successful & easy move. Rest assured my letter to the Betterbusinessbureau will say this exact same thing about United Van Lines. If only one person reads this and decides NOT to hire United Van Lines then I have done my job and I've saved them from a total nightmare experience that's easily avoidable.

Service was fantastic and food was great. I only ran in for a quick bite while traveling and was surprised by the quality of the food. Darren was our waiter and was outstanding while offering helpful suggestions such as adding the meatball to the pasta (completely worth it) and our sodas never went empty.

I like The Haven. It isn't 5-star food, but it's good bar food, and their burgers are pretty darn good. Their fries aren't bad, though I've learned to order them well done, as sometimes they can be a bit on the rawer side for my liking. The wings are good too. My boyfriend likes the BBQ, I like the hot. They're crispy, either way, which is great, and the BBQ type are loaded with sauce. If you aren't a super saucy fan, do like I do, and ask for it on the lighter side. 

Ranch dressing is good as well. Seems homemade, and isn't super thick and filling like some I've had. It's great on one of their salads, which I've had good experiences with. Onion petals are good, albeit filling and a bit greasy, although I think that's the point of onion petals, is it not? Burgers are excellent, and huge, and taste homemade. I get mine with provel and bacon, and I'm in food heaven.

The television situation there is always a bit of a challenge for me. I don't care for football whatsoever (I'm a total baseball girl, who bleeds red), but football seems to be the sports programming of choice at The Haven. I don't understand that, because it's usually not Rams games, but teams of other states that they have on the televisions there, even when the Cardinals are playing a game that day, at the same time, but ... whatever. To be fair, whenever I've asked the waitresses at The Haven to turn at least one television to the baseball game, the waitresses have done so without hesitation, so I can't complain much, but it would be nice to have the Cards game on all of the time, whenever one is playing, without having to ask.

The waitresses are all nice, and they get to know regulars like me pretty quickly (I live up the street, so I stop by quite often). Arrici (excuse my spelling if I am spelling it wrong) is my fav waitress at The Haven, and is always super helpful, and a real gem. The Haven is lucky to have her. She always takes good care of me whenever I visit. 

Drink prices are on the cheap side, which is nice, and they aren't stingy with the amount they give in regard to food or liquor. I'd like to see more choices offered on draft, such as Bud Select instead of the darker Schlafly Ale they offer on tap, but maybe this will happen in time.

Overall it's a good place to go to get a bar type meal, a cold beer, and watch a sports game. No smoke, no fuss, just a good neighborhood feel.

I tried to get a quote from United Van Lines.  Our situation is unique because our household items are being stored with Serv Pro. Our items were in storage and there was a fire in the unit above us. After 9 long months everything been cleaned repacked and is now ready to move to our new home.  Our move is from Poway CA to Las Vegas NV. We have had a professional moving company go out and look at our inventory, we have approximately 11,000 pounds.  This is our 30th move so I am confident the numbers are close. (my husband was in the military)  United can't be bothered to give us a quote because they want to look at everything.  I was told my call was suspicious due to the fact that they cannot look at our household items.  My goal was to get a quote based on 11,000 pounds because I do not believe it is reasonable to ask another company to disrupt their business to unpack our items again.  I will NEVER use or recommend United Van Lines
The steak was good.  My wine was ok.  Our service was a bit slow at the get go but picked up.  It's very strange to see Baileys Chocolate Bar reimagined but the atmosphere was nice!

Very courteous staff at the return station. I have an Emerald club member and I liked the selection that was provided to me. The cars were clean. Getting in and out was easy and fast.
So far no issues whenever I've had to use them.

I rent from National a lot and generally have good experiences at most locations. However, this was not the case at STL. When I got in the car, the fuel gauge was slightly below full - not a big deal. On the way back, depsite being in a hurry, I stopped to refuel the car. When the rental receipt was emailed to me, I noticed an extra refueling charge had been tacked on, which is really irritating considering I returned the car with more gas than when I got it. Luckily corporate customer service was able to resolve the issue and refund the charge, but this location seems to have some questionable business practices.

We've been here for lunch a few times. We like the modern rustic decor (similar to the Fixer Upper home renovation TV show, Joanna Gaines' style) with wood floors, pastel colors and open space. We're always received with a warm and hearty welcome and an introduction to the menu and daily specials when we arrive. After making our order at the counter we're free to sit anywhere in the large open room. 

My favorite item here is the fried chicken. We've only had the non-spicy option but not the spicy. Always crunchy and well seasoned, I like that its moist without being oily, even the white meat is tender. In my opinion, the seasoning on the chicken skin plays a key role in my decision of whether I like it. Every bite of Rick's Famous Fried Chicken is crispy and bursting with soulful flavor. 

We've also had the cornmeal fried catfish. Crisp crust on the outside yet flaky, soft and mild flavored on the inside. Served in several smaller 1-2 bite-sized pieces with a dipping sauce. Great entree, second only to the fried chicken or if you'd like a lighter offering. 

We've had a variety of the sides. The are a few staples and some others that rotate. I always like the honey sweet, and savory cornbread. We've liked the mashed sweet potatoes, sweet and savory, and always topped with a little nutty crunch for a  contrast in texture. The Mac and cheese is also a reliable side, creamy and delicious. 
Grace's meat and three is a great addition to Saint Louis' food scene. Comforting soul food that always hits the spot and satisfies the craving.

I recently moved here from Orange County,  California, where I ate poke 4+ times a week. This is the first poke place I have found in St. Louis.  

Pros: 
-Reasonable price 
-lots of topping choices, incl seaweed salad which is usually extra $$
-fish tastes a lot fresher than all other raw fish I've had at sushi places in STL 
-super friendly staff, people approached my table twice to ask how I liked things, and cleared my tray for me. 

Cons:
-reeeeally small poke portions. Scooper was the size of a tablespoon and my server underfilled it on 2/4 of my scoops. For a large you are paying $12 for about 3 oz of fish, if that. 
-No soy sauce or sriracha, a staple at every other poke place I've ever been to. 
-they only have forks, no chopsticks?!? I guess that one is petty, but... it's like having only forks at a sushi place... 

Overall, this satisfied my longing for raw fish which is all I can hope for in the Midwest I suppose. I'll be back, just not 4 times a week

Very good food. The house made sausage might be the best I've ever had, and the thick slab bacon is phenomenal. I was never a fan of eggs over easy until I ate here, you've changed me and I thank you for that.

I am a long time very satisfied customer of National, but my very recent experience at St. Louis airport was disappointing. Every car we checked before choosing one in Emerald Aisle wreaked of cigarette smoke. When we pointed it out to the attendant on the way out of the lot, her reply was that "they all smell like that."  Otherwise, the car was reliable and in good condition.

***This National Car Rental (at the St. Louis airport) is similar to other National Car Rental locations in terms of reasonable rates and decent vehicle selection in the Executive Aisle; there were a few issues though--maybe it is how the cars are not covered, but they were not clean (lots of water spots) and the first car I picked up (Nissan Altima) had a check engine light on (they were very helpful with getting me a new car and it was quick); satellite radio is a nice feature when you are driving a lot or are in a new area, but even though the Chevrolet Malibu had it, the service was not active, which was a shame (it would have been a nice bonus)***

I am not sure what the parking situation is, but there is not much space at this small rental agency; getting in and getting out can be a little difficult because entrances and exits are quite congested.
My mom, daughter and I stumbled across this place and we loved it!! Everything was great!! Great sandwiches, soups and salads.  Homemade breads and desserts!! We will be back!
Ate the $6.99 breakfast buffet. Food wasn't bad, but food was cold. They microwaved it to warm it up. Probably won't be back.

Always a clean and well stocked store. Sometimes prices are higher than other places but it's close and convenient. Deli service is very good. We've come to know the servers there and they are generally helpful and friendly. 

The store is quick to respond to any complaints or errors. We've been shopping here for 10+ years and it's just fine. 

I tend to not use the self checkout if can help it. 

Good grocery store with helpful staff and ok prices.  I'll continue coming here.

I have been receiving exceptional eye care services from Dr. Fontana for over 30 years.  In recent years I have been assessed by Dr. Jeffrey Kempf and found him to be most knowledgeable, extremely thorough and exhibiting a high degree of professionalism and courtesy.  I walk away learning something new.  Office staff are always welcoming and helpful.

What can I say.... it is just plain creepy! The elevators can fit one large person and one carry on bag, run by gerbals. Not a nice area, very dated hotel, and my roon had a toilet installed by someone really high and confused cause it was installed on an angle! Shame on corporate to house people with me especially who stays in this chain each week! All I can say, is please stay somewhere, anywhere else!
Wow the salmon filet sandwich is incredible!!! Have been trying all the different sandwiches & love everyone, but never had a salmon goat cheese sandwich like this I one.   5 stars

I have loved Lions Choice for decades but the service at this location has gone down hill quickly over the last year.  If you want pay for food you don't get in your bag in the drive thru and if you enjoy watery drink because the drink machine isn't maintained appropriately - this is your place!  I would avoid this location!

Fantastic!!! I've been craving a poke bowl since I got back from Hawaii. This place definitely deserves all 5 stars. Very fresh. It was delicious. Will definitely be back. I had a medium bowl with ahi tuna, spicy salmon, and shrimp. Only con- service seemed a bit rushed...
We tried the pancakes, biscuits and gravy and chili and they were all delicious. The staff was super friendly and the place was very clean.  We will be back when we are in St. Louis.

I'm ashamed that I live so close and waited so long to try Grace (first time was appx 8 months after opening...and now I've been back multiple times because anytime I'm hungry it's the only place I want to go). 

You cannot go wrong with this menu, it's all mouthwatering! Fried green tomatoes are the best I've ever had, and I also really love the livers. I need to get back and try all the items I haven't had the pleasure of eating yet. The staff are always sweet and happy which helps makes it my first choice when I'm choosing the restaurant for friends, meetings, etc. Thank you for being a part of the neighborhood, Grace!
If you want to wait in the drive through for 30+ minutes for some nuggets and ff because that's all you're craving at midnight then this is your place! Yes. 30+ minutes.

Horrible! The right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing! I had a tour and Kristina gave me ALL incorrect , faulty information. I called the next day spoke to Kristy who wasn't even sympathetic and did not even apologize ! She just stated "idk why Kristina gave you incorrect information" wow! Do not move here, If you want an apartment of competence!

Worst/ slowest location ever!! I am a teacher and have a very short lunch break. I ordered my sandwich in advance to be delivered during my lunch. They were over 30 min. Late and when I called to tell the manager, he became very combative and rude. I worked at JJs while being college for over 3 years and I know how the place works. This store is rude and the manager Is very Rude.

All I have to say is this place is great.  Great FOOD, SERVICE and ATMOSPHERE.  I had the pasta primavera.  Just what I was looking for!  Joe my server was awesome!  Great comunications skills, service and has such an uplifting personality.  Manager had great things to say about her employees and she even helped incoming customers with seating and menus!  Looks like she has a great crew!  

Thanks for your service and look forward to coming back when at this location.

First time eating here since they opened. I will say the staff was friendly and punctual although it was not very busy when I ate. As I was leaving there were a few people who left as tables needed to be cleared. As for the food. The house salad was blah and the greens seemed mushy and not crisp and fresh. The baked mostaccioli was delicious on the other hand! Wish there was some bread served with it but I probably didn't need it anyway. Look forward to trying it again.

I have never been able to eat a huge amount of food, but this is the most filling meal in the world. The deep dish pizza is fantastic and comes with anything you want on it. It takes about an hour (could be longer if there are lots of people), so grab some friends and a pitcher or two. Play darts, deer hunter, shuffle board or tell stories in a circle. You can call ahead for carry-out if you want. 



Chalk writing on the walls and old booths, the atmosphere is comfortable and inviting. It's a great place.

YECH!!   Side salad ($3.50) looked like they got it out of a dumpster.  Watery "bolognese" sauce had no detectable signs of meat.  Meatball ($3) was saw-dust tasting.  Service was good but that is all.  No Italian was harmed (or would walk near this joint) in the preparation of this food.

This place has the best fried chicken in America. We were visiting from Chicago, stopped here for dinner before we headed back up North, and we are literally thinking about going back sooner than originally planned just because we're dying for more of this place's fried chicken.

Been renting from National in St. Louis (2-3 times a month), next to airport.  Shuttle running from airport seem to be plenty, I haven't had to wait more than 3-5 minutes for a shuttle. Car selection is not great, most of the times I had a choice of either van or big pickup truck, great if I needed to shuttle people around but that wasn't the case for me.  I had to go inside and talk to someone at the counter once, not very helpful. Overall staff at the St. Louis location are not friendly, perhaps if management ready this they can provide a little more training to staff?

Wouldn't eat there ever again, staff and manager are incompeten, slow and slower and can't get an order right if their life counted on it and then to mess up a wrong order with another wrong order, well need I say more...ZERO STARS IS WHAT THEY DESERVE!!!
First time to try. Flavors were excellent. We had the pork and pork/crab. To be honest I was looking for a larger dumpling but they were delicious.  Very nice people working here.

So darn overrated .So greasy and chicken is fatty and gristle .I gave it many chances.And the biscuits use to be so good ,now suck.And all so pricey.Nothing good but greasy fries which you get a handful.Ill take KFC..

I sAw this place on Yelp. It was well recommended. My wife and I went there but opted for takeout. Not much of an ear in place but the pizza and the Cajun fries were both Excellent. We were very happy we found this place.

Ooooh, girl. No. 

You know when you go shopping with a friend, and they try on an ill-fitting/ugly shirt, and they think it's OMGSOCUTE, and you just don't have the heart to tell them that it's just not working for them? You just want to shake them and tell them they could do SO much better, but instead you smile and tell them that they look GREAT?

Actually, I'm not that friend at all (I'm brutally honest; don't ask for my opinion unless you REALLY want it), but for the sake of this review, let's pretend that I am. 

The Island Frozen Yogurt is the equivalent of that ugly shirt that your friend is in LOVE with.

And honey, I'll let you in on a little secret: you could do SO much better. 

Don't get me wrong, The Island is cute. It's an adorable tropical-themed froyo shop in the heart of Soulard, and if you want to stay in the city, it's one of your only options. 

Let me take a moment to NOT be a food snob and say that The Island isn't THAT awful. They have a pretty decent variety of flavors (even though vanilla was one of the only ones I could choke down, and YES, I sampled every flavor...#fatty). The service was fantastic (the guy working the day I visited? I want to squeeze him into my pocket and take him home with me). And the price was reasonable. 

But back to the froyo itself. It had a weird consistency. Almost icy. It's such a far cry from the sweet, rich, velvety, DELICIOUS froyo that Yogurtland (or Red Mango, or Orange Leaf) serves. Remember the self-serve vanilla frozen yogurt that you gobbled down at Old Country Buffet as a kid (just me? Ooookay)? Or the frozen yogurt at Sweet Tomatoes? The frozen yogurt at The Island is like that. And hey, if you're into that, do yo thang. I won't hate. You go, Glen Coco! 

But...can I tell you something? You know, just between me and you? Promise you won't get mad? Okay.

That shirt? Looks like shit on you.

We had beer cheese pretzel burger, fiery honey chicken, blackened chicken and firecracker chicken.  Everything was delicious, the only negative comment from all of us was the longer wait to get the food and one persons fries were a little on the cool side by the time they arrived.  I have to rave about the fiery honey chicken, I would have given 5 stars for mine. We would definitely come back.  You will wait on a weekend night and since we were not there at a prime time and had a decent wait for food I would guess that during prime time the wait would increase.

Horrible customer service. Called to get an estimate and told the representative that I am sorry, but I need to change the starting address and ending address. He was immediately irritated and rude. When he said he would be sending an estimator to the location within a week, I said that that might not work since I wouldn't be at that location then, so could we please speak again in a month or so. He became extremely rude and had a bad attitude, snapping at me and saying why didn't I say that from the beginning. I don't see why there is any need to be spoken to like this. I understand my situation was complicated, but I was doing everything that I could to be accomodating...why do you think the appropriate response is snapping at me?

I ended up saying that I would talk at a later date, and decided not to use the company. I called back later asking if they would please remove my contact information as I would not be using them. The representative (a different one) asked why, and I told him that the representative before was unwilling to be flexible and extremely rude to me. He then told me that I "should have known" that the estimator would go to the location within a week, and that he was sorry the representative was rude, but they're the top leader in the industry so if I choose not to I'm the one who will suffer! 

I would encourage NO ONE to use this company as I can't imagine how they would be if you actually start working with them to move your stuff. Just horrible. Save yourself the aggravation.

Went to Maul last year and had poke for the first time and loved it. On a trip to St Louis with my wife we came across this place and was not disappointed one bit. A variety of choices to chose from good prices very good customer service. Will definitely go back.
Didn't realize it took 1 hour to make and delivery a sandwich that was 10 minutes away. Jimmy johns should be sued for using a slogan like Freaky Fast because that absolutely false advertising
My carpets look great again and all the pet stains are gone. Thanks Ricky and Travis! Hope you can come back next time they need to be cleaned.

Went into the store and left me be, which is fine as I don't like salespeople constantly watching/following my every move.  A very smooth talker, almost like a politician though.  Very chatty about other stuff, to the point where making a purchase takes significantly longer than it should have.  When asking to get it delivered, he was late by a couple of hours, even though a rough time was set days ahead of time.  The first time my bed was delivered it was the wrong bed so he had to go back to the store to get the one I purchased.  A mistake that could have been easily corrected had he checked/confirmed before he left the store.  Then, when he was moving the be into my apartment, broke a light cover when he bumped the bed into it.  Said he was going to buy me a new one and call me to schedule a time within a week to bring back the light cover to me but he never did.  I don't exactly know how much I can trust him anymore.  In summary, the bed is good but the service could have been better.

My first time ever trying soup dumplings, but I loved them. The lady at the counter was helpful, showing me the best way to eat them without making a mess. I'll be back, and I'll bring friends next time.

Could be the worst McDonalds that I have ever been to, service wise.  I waited in drive thru for over 5 minutes and didn't move.   Went inside because there were only two people in line.   No one was taking orders.  An employee said the counter girl was in the bathroom.   There were several people just standing around.   One person said she couldn't help us because she hadn't clocked in yet.  When I got to order i chose a #3, but still had to wait for fries.   I asked for my burger and drink so I could leave.   The staff couldn't understand me leaving without my fries.  I will never return to this McDonalds

Second visit in two weeks. Really good food. Last time had prime rib special. Cones sliced so a bit different but really good. This time fried chicken and meatloaf sandwich for husband. Again both really good. Would be a good place for large family very open seating.

I filmed a TV pilot in St. Louis in June of 2013. My crew and I got a great deal on a group deal at this hotel. 

The Pros:
Spacious rooms and comfortable beds.
Wonderful staff - They were efficient and kind with every request. They threw in one of their conference rooms with our deal and it became our production office. 
Location - Not far from downtown and in a quiet area.

Cons:
Air conditioning unit was so so. It either worked and was loud or did not work and we roasted.
The layout is kind of cumbersome. It is a long walk from the entrance to the main elevators. 
The decor is straight out of the 70's and sometimes the hotel has a musty smell.

Overall, it was a comfortable place to rest my tired bones for a week. The staff is really the main selling point. Because I travel for work,  I find myself really relying on hotel staff much more then I do when I'm traveling for leisure.

Between the food, the service, and the quickness, you really can't have a bad experience here.
They will change recipes around to meet the needs of the customer. 
Matt, the manager, came from the original Circle 7 on Clayton, and is doing a great job!

Attention all St. Louis Bread Co. Lovers!!!

Take one trip to The Daily Bread and you will leave Bread Co. behind forever. I love, love, love this place!

Some of My Favorites....

- All Soups
- Buffalo Chicken Flat Bread **** (The real star)
- Cookies
- Banana Bread
- Breakfast Croissant
- Barbeque Chicken Pizza
- Seasonal Salads

They all allow you to pre-order for holidays. This is a great place to get all of your Thanksgiving pies and breads or your Christmas cookies. Also a great place to get catering platters for showers, weddings, parties etc.

WOW!  From Chicago, wasn't expecting much...but, wow!  Place is a bit of a dive, but don't let that stop you.  

We got the hand tossed and that sauce is awesome! Will be going back when in St. Louis!

We took our family of 4 to eat here & found the seating situation inside to be tremendously unaccommodating for families w/ small children. Specifically children that are in high chairs. It was cramped. Although the giant family style table in the middle looks cool, the bar height seating isn't ideal for a kid in a hair chair OR a toddler really. I like that there is an option to go through a drive through but I've never found food to travel as well as it tastes fresh. Unfortunately, because of that, I'll likely not go often. The food that we had was good though.

I had a few issues with this practice. 
First of all, my eyes were dilated without warning or being told of the side effects which included me not being able to see or drive for the rest of the day. If you had other plans, forget about it don't even count on your vision to help you pick out a fresh pair of specks. 
The eye glasses are extremely over priced- go ahead and add another one to two hundred  bucks to a pair of glasses compared to other places. Oh, they had a promotion going on which was 60% off a pair of frames, but if you had a vision plan, then you can only use one or the other which doesn't save you much. Also, part of the vision exam is extra, but you aren't told about it until after that service. Now, I have had a lifetime of eye care, but my total never came close to 500. This time, my total was over 800 and thankfully with my insurance I had to pay only 204 but still, holy cow! Where do they come up with these extra charges since the frames I bought were less than what my insurance plan was willing to pay. So basically the 800 was my check up and lenses.
 I also eft without a follow up appointment and the staff seemed a bit scatterbrained. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

Grant Toms provided great service on our first treatment of the year.  Aptive provides great service knocking down the wasp nests and treating the inside when needed.  We've been really happy with them.  No ants is a really good thing at our house.

I began my lease in August 2013.  Yes, rent is a bit higher than some of the surrounding apartments but the property makes up for it in service and amenities.  The maintenance staff is super-quick.  With all the snow we've been getting, they pre-treat the area and the parking lot is cleared. (I noticed other apartment lots were not cleaned). I'm really sensitive to the noise of others, but you can hear thru the walls.  My experience with the leasing office has been minimal, but they seem friendly enough.

Black Thorn Pub gets 4 stars for strong effort in Chicago-Style pizza making! 

- This place is super dive-y, but that adds an odd sense of legitimacy to the pizza even before tasting it. The atmosphere makes you feel like you've found a hidden gem.
- There are like 2-3 people that work there at any given time, so I imagine if you're trying to order a pizza in their busy time, it would be a nightmare if you were really hungry at the time of ordering. (*** I recommend ordering ahead, before you're starving, and picking it up!!! ***)

- When I went to pick up my pizza, I could see evidence of home-made crust (i.e. some sort of mixing contraption and a lot of flour!). This is a win for SURE.

- As another reviewer (Courtney J.) astutely wrote, "[their] Chicago style stuffed crust pizza is more of an homage to Chicago style deep dish than a textbook replica." I couldn't agree more, and I couldn't have said it better myself. The pizza is kind of like an Italian-flavored quesadilla with raised edges, melty cheese, tomato sauce, and extra toppings on covering it. 

- Note: the deep dish pizza does not re-heat very well. Even using the best stovetop method (if you don't know about stovetop reheating of pizza, you're missing out, go check it out on youtube immediately!), you'll never achieve the same level of meltiness as when the pizza was first made.

Pretty authentic Chinese soup dumpling I've ever had in stl. Though this place is brand new, the dumpling has wom when in private kitchen. I know they will keep the high quality food cause the private kitchen always does！The taste is really good but having limited stuff to choice. Be patient if you go there as all dumpling were handmade to ensure the best mouthfeel when you have it. A little bit overprice but you need to try this! We had a pork n crab, 2 pork and that were enough for two with total of $30.

I came here while on a business trip based on their Yelp reviews. Ordered the beer cheese burger and it was beyond bad. Luckily the staff was very nice and the atmosphere was good. Probably a good spot to just drink.

Not super impressed. The food was okay, expensive for what you got and lacked some flavor. There was milk instead of half n half for the coffee, though I should have just asked. The fruit looked like it was cut a day or two ago (and why does it have parsley? That's a weird garnish for fruit).

Upsides:
Very quick, not an overwhelming menu to try and choose from and has a drive thru.

Downsides:
Overpriced, food is lacking and can be hard to find a seat (tho the intention is a quick breakfast).

I should've read the reviews before placing my order! How is the 5 star review from 2013 the first review we can see when there are other reviews from 2016??!!! So here's the hip hop version of my horrible experience with this place. It's Sunday evening around 7:30, I am starving and want something fast, I think of the "freaky-fast' commercials i hear on the radio and immediately decided that i wanted a sandwich from Jimmy Johns. Bad idea! First, I ordered online, thinking that I was ordering from the store right up the street (Pine St). There is no estimated delivery time annotated so i just thought that it was because the sandwich would arrive so fast. At the end of the order, i see that the sandwich is coming from the Laclede store which is about 2 miles away and thought it was still cool. 15 minutes later, i called the store to confirm my order since i didn't receive an email. The person on the phone told me the driver left with my sand which 20 minutes ago, i knew this was a lie because i had only ordered the sandwich about 15 minutes ago. So....an hour later i had enough and called to cancel the order! about 10 minutes after i called to cancel, the driver calls me saying he has my sandwich. Still starving :-(

If you're looking for the best pilates class in St. Louis, this place is hard to beat! My first time to Club Pilates and the instructor was incredibly patient and had such a positive enthusiastic energy, it made the class go by so quick! Also, I definitely walked out taller and was already feeling it in my muscles - it was a great workout! The studio is bright, extremely clean and the equipment is in top notch shape. The class was professional, at the same time the instructor took time with each person to make sure your form and technique was right. Definitely a great community of people who attend as well, very welcoming. I absolutely recommend Club Pilates and I can't wait for the next class!!

Blackthorn is a great pub. It's got a dive-like charm to it. Shuffleboard table, variety of seating, graffitied bathrooms, drinks are reasonable, the pizza is baller. If you're going on a busy night, might want to call ahead with your pizza order. On a Friday night ours took more than an hour to cook.

Although many would prefer pizza, I like Ben Wyatt have an obsession with calzones. Whether it's the ricotta or the ability to dip as much sauce as I want, either way they're amazing. When I saw a calzone restaurant was coming to the Grove I was so excited. Being new to STL I didn't realize there was two locations already in the area! Although I love calzones, part of the thing you learn to live with, is the two ends being mostly just dough, very few places manage to pack a calzone fully. Sauce on the side has achieved this feat. Every single bite was packed with meat and cheesy goodness and it was amazing. I got the Meat me in St Louie, which was sausage, pepperoni and a ricotta-marscapone blend and it was amazing! Exactly what you'd want in a classic calzone. My boyfriend got the which came first and added chorizo. It comes with chicken and egg inside and a verde salsa to dip and it was also amazing. I love how sauce on the side has many classic options then a huge variety of unique options also! They also had a great beer collection. I was very excited to find my all time favorite, Stone Brewing IPA on tap!

They were recommended by my corporate for our out of state move and they did an amazing job. We used them for moving only and moving vehicles - not packing and unpacking due to cost. Service was excellent . I was given updates on the timelines of everything. The workers were very careful with the furniture and responsive to requests to move things to where I wanted it. We have carpet and they took precautions not to drag or dirty the carpet.
I would definitely work with them again

Continuously ** HORRIBLE SERVICE** They say its a training store, then some needs to train the trainers. Made a simple order no special request and still... could not get it right... 9:45 AM Sunday Morning... If at all possible GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

Fast, casual brunch that's delicious! Yolklore is a small venue located in Crestwood. You will place your order when you walk in and then pick up your food at the window. The drip coffee and water is self serve. 

I really enjoyed my meal here! I ordered the mushroom frittata with potatoes. It's seasoned well and the goat cheese and arugala are the perfect toppers for the most delicious flavor combo. My friends ordered the big supper, biscuits and gravy, and the nest egg. No complaints here! Everything was delicious and perfectly cooked from the sausage to the eggs. 

Since it was noon on a Wednesday there weren't many people but I'm sure it gets busy during the brunch/breakfast hours during the weekend! The service is friendly and they even give you samples of their gooey butter cake!!! NOMZ. Highly recommend!

I'm normally a big fan of Dierbergs because I feel like they provide a middle ground for those of us who want a wide-range of higher quality products without spending our Whole Paycheck. The employees are also normally friendly. The Tesson Ferry location is basically a Schnucks wearing a Dierbergs mask. We only come here when time constraints demand it. 

The selection is limited. The layout of the store makes zero sense and is very different from most of the other locations in town. If you ask an employee for help, they're often rude. I can't tell you the number of times an employee has asked if I need help if I so much as look confused in other Dierbergs. Here, you're treated like an imposition.
