I am not joking when I say that one of the top three reasons that I will not live so far south that this is my store is because of how important a quality, convenient grocery shopping experience is to me. This store cannot possibly provide that.

5 star for their meats

3.5 star for their sides

Chicken: Wow the chef is from Southern so I definitely was expecting something like that. and it delivered. Chicken was great, juicy, crispy, flavored to perfection.

Turkey leg: Wow, I wanted to go pirate style and grab it and chow down. Great smoked flavor and skin, awesome taste in the actual turkey meat as well. Unfortunately I had to eat this with a fork and knife.

BBQ Pulled Pork / burnt ends (Wednesday Special): Solid, but not the best. Some burnt end parts were delicious, fatty, smokey, and soft. Some were very tough and couldn't eat. 

Sides: Personally, didn't like the sides that much. 

My favorite was definitely the mac n cheese. The other ones I got to try weren't that good, collared greens, green bean casserole and cornbread. (very dry and lacking flavor)

I am usually a huge fan of bread and when I found this place in the Tower Grove area, I fell in love! My boyfriend I went here for the first time. I got a Meet Me in St Louie and he got The Duke. Now I'm a usual slow eater but this time I managed to finish before my boyfriend even got a chance to since he's a normal fast eater. I absolutely recommend anyone who's in St Louis is to try their famous calzones and how they even make them! Check them out on YouTube and plus they deliver which is even better! if you haven't gone, you're missing out!!

With all the hype about this place, so I went there and give it a shot.  Once I walked in, there's no one to greet you.  One guy standing at the counter in the back.  Behind him is a hand writing menu on a poster.  $8 for pork, $9 for beef, etc.   No credit card accepted if your bill less than $25.  Once you gave your order and paid.  You get to find yourself a table.  Wow.  So is this self service?  Does it mean I don't have give tips?   Wrong!  I asked the guy where's my water?  He said no free water.  Either you buy bottle water or soda from us.  Wow!
Does he know it's the law to give free water?  Anyway... The lady from the kitchen bought out our dumplings.  Opened the bamboo cover and found six tiny pieces of dumplings.  $8 for six tiny pieces?  Talk about inflation!  There's a mandatory size for dumplings even supermarkets has bigger pieces in the frozen department.
Uncomfortable seat, no music, you can hear everyone's conversations.  One entrance door.  If a new customer comes in, the wind draft will blow everything off your table.  Zero service.  I just left a few bucks on the table and call it a day.
So stop the bitching and tell us how's the dumplings?  My honest answer to you is that you can find this in any dim sum place, and cheaper with service and free water.

I honestly haven't had many chances to come by here, but I was able to stop by once since I was in the area.  I really liked the vibe of this place - so welcoming, kind of like a St. Lous Bread Co (Panera), but soo much better!  I came here with two friends and despite it being so crowded, we were served very quickly! The workers were really friendly and didn't mind me taking ages to decide what I wanted to get.

I finally managed to pick the chestnut chicken salad sandwich.  The sandwich was cool, refreshing and delicious.  I'm not the biggest fan of chicken salad, but considering I would definitely come back and order this really tells you how yummy this sandwich was.  I can't remember what my friends ordered (one a soup, the other a sandwich), but they were both very happy.  I did manage to steal a little of one friend's mountain cookie.  And, boy oh boy, I wish I had gotten my own.  They are absolutely incredible.  It has a little bit of everything - oatmeal, raisins, chocolate chips, walnuts, and coconut.  I didn't think so many different ingredients would go together, but it's perfectly balanced.

Had two cars tinted  at the  soco location and couldn't be happier with the work.  On the second car we had taken to another tint shop and regretted it.  50 bucks cheaper ended up spending almost double.  Came back to custom sounds to have them do it.  They were friendly and courteous.  Had a  issue they took  care of it with a smile not like another place on big bend.  The shop on big bend gave an attitude with the poor craftsmanship.  Will be back next year when we get our new car.  Our Prius looks great...almost like it came out of factory tinted.  No missing tint. No miss cuts with the exacto knife.  Will refer any time anyone asks where we got the tint done.

Thanks customers sound.  Keep up the good work.

Amazing calazone's...well they were. We visited June 23rd @ the grove location. 
 
Upon arriving we were not greeted by the young blonde!  While my party was reviewing the menu, I inquired about their rewards card in which threw her into a tizzy...she just got a card and told me nothing about it.  Useless!  

Calazone's were filled with less ingredients than in my many previous visits and just was okay. It was more dough and cheese!  

My mother in law mentioned the ice tea was very weak and brought to the blonde's attention in which you guessed it "didn't care" most would have said key me make another batch but not her, she could of cared less!  

I sent a message on fb with no reply, not sure who is reading their messages but I hope it is not the owners since they do not reply... not planing on returning!

We contracted with United Van Lines for a move from Boston, MA to Las Vegas, NV. The team in Boston was impeccable: courteous, professional, fast, efficient and very attentive to every single item. We were unbelievably happy with the care they took with our items. We tipped well, bought them breakfast and couldn't stop thanking them.

Cut to a week later, where the San Diego-based Mayflower crew takes over, and it's a whole different story. They are an hour and a half late, claiming they got lost ON THE STREET WE LIVE ON with a GPS. Dozens of crushed and upside down boxes, including those marked fragile. Boxes completely ripped open or shredded down the side. A large tear in our leather couch, and a forged slip that claims it was already there. And a dresser that is so broken they had to leave it shrink wrapped for fear it would collapse.

What's worse is that they were beyond rude. Every time I noticed something broken, they immediately said "Not our fault. Came out of the warehouse like that." One, what warehouse? It should have stayed on the truck! Two, act like an adult and take responsibility. 

Even after all that, I tipped them, because while I thought they showed little respect or care, I know they did some heavy lifting. They did not say thank you or seem appreciative in any way.

If you contract with United Van Lines be very careful of the team you get and request they be the same at both homes if possible. Ask what they will do with your stuff in between. And United Van Lines, if you're reading, you should not allow unprofessional and uncaring people to be a part of your network.

Friendly, clean and welcoming breakfast/lunch place. Simple interior design style works well in this space. Menu has some interesting options and I tried the baked oatmeal with a side of smashed potatoes. It was surprisingly delicious.  Coffee is fresh and local.  They are earth friendly serving food on items that will easily decompose.  Plenty of parking and even a drive through! I think if you have time, it's best to park (ample free parking) and stroll in to enjoy the atmosphere. Wonderful little hole in the wall that's somewhat a secret. Don't tell anyone, tell everyone! See you there.

This place is disorganized, inefficient, and manipulative. I had an appointment in March  2014 - the ophthalmologist recommended a specific brand of contact lenses for me - when I received my bill it far exceeded what I've paid in the past and was far more than their website advertises. Worse yet - I still have not received my lenses and it's the end of August. It took 3 phone calls to their office for them to find a paper note in my chart stating my order had been placed on hold. Unbelievable.

Love, love, love this place!!!! So love Sophies! Did I mention I love it? Where to begin? Should I start about the amazing cocktails speciality made by St. Louis own Cocktail Maestro, Venue Manager Jeremy Pevnick? These are not your run of the  mill weak cocktails, but infusion of great spirits together with a perfect mixer! They are only unique to Sophies. How about talking about the man himself, Jeremy? The very well dressed and well educated in the art of all things spirits will greet you warmly and make you feel right at home! Maybe I will mention the happy hour. Yes, the happy hour! From 4-7pm,  you get classic cocktails, popular brews and wines at very budget friendly prices. Your wallet will smile at you! Have I talked about the atmosphere yet? Well that's a must! The decor is elegant, classy, but chill. Its a great place to wind down and relax with friends. The patio area gives a great view of Grand Central! Beautiful cosmopolitan and spacious seating. There is artwork leading up to the doors,  that make you feel like  you are entering a swank studio. If you want to do more than sip on those fantastic cocktails, there are games you can play that bring back memories of Yahoo with friends! Now it's above the theater, so you do have to keep voices down where there is a production. But Sophies is so relaxing, that it won't be hard to do! Go by and meet Jeremy! You won't regret it! See why I love Sophies so much!

I use National all the time but today in St. Louis I waited at least 15 min for the shuttle, others were there before me and all waiting could not get on. I called to let them know and could not reach a person no matter what menu option I tried. Need faster shuttles, and definitely a way to reach the St. Louis airport rental location. Oh, and the rap music on the shuttle was a bonus

We asked for a double when we reserved the room. When we checked in we were told they did not have any doubles available and the hotel was sold out. We had to settle for a single. They did offer a roll-a-way but that's not the same. The elevators are old, small and slow. The room itself was decent and clean with a comfortable bed. The staff was friendly as well so that helped.
Very standard breakfast.  On the plus side - the check in option made it very easy to get in and the food was served lightening fast.

Really fresh food, the place was clean and the staff was incredibly nice. I think the portions are a good size for the price. Of the two places serving Poke in the CWE/Midtown/Cortex area I think this one takes the cake!

I had the spicy tuna with white rice and it was great to see the tuna mixed with sauce and cucumbers in front of me. Number of yummy toppings! 

I will for sure be heading back

I want to write a review for the lovely lady at the very front of the counter at The Pasta House next to gate E6.

We had just 20 minutes during our layover at STL, and we asked her which items on the menu would be served the quickest.  She said that the spaghetti and pasta options would be ready in 12 minutes (what an exact quote).  During the wait she brought us iced water in to-go cups so that we would be ready to run to our boarding gate as soon as our meal was ready.  Rather than simply calling our names back to the counter, she actually brought the food (complete with extra utensils and paper napkins) out to the waiting area.  She (I wish I got her name) deserves super props for the extra care and attention given to transient guests.

We were so surprised by the above and beyond service that it was the pasta taste that much better!
One of the much nicer and family-friendly restaurant/bars in the area. A nice place to meet with friends and/or catch your favorite sports game. The food has been great every time.

Had been wanting to try this place for a while based on the star rating and the pictures on Postmates. Can you guess which pic is mine and which is the one they advertise with? The bowl was so disappointing and didn't look a thing like what they advertise. Not to mention the price of the bowl for what I got. Portions where much smaller and the salmon had a strange taste to it. It was drenched in soy sauce so much so that I had to pour some out to make it edible. Green bubble tea tastes chalky. After reading more reviews I hope I don't get sick tonight. I won't try a second time.

I've rented here twice; it's the only National location in STL, and my work has a contract with them so we get better rates.

I love National, in general, but this location is not a good example of what I normally expect from them.  Service is severely lacking!  I could not get help as I was picking up the car or dropping it off...and they don't allow cars on the lot, so local renters are forced to walk on Natural Bridge to get picked up.

The savings AND the Emerald Aisle do not outweigh the hassle for local renters and the poor customer service.  I will not rent from this location again.

Order through Skip the Dishes (which we shall refer to as STD from here on our) and decided to upcharge my side the French Onion Soup. The "restaurant" confirmed the order and after waiting an hour for the food I discovered that my sandwich had no soup included (which $1.50 extra was already paid) and instead there were mashed potatoes and gravy (please note that this is a normal side)...so in essence, this place stole $1.50 and never mentioned anything about it. We called STD and let them know about the situation and said that we wanted the soup delivered as ordered. The Hell...I mean Haven, confirmed the order again...only to then say they didn't have French Onion Soup. After arguing with STD for over an hour, the "restaurant" graciousiously (***please note the sarcasm) offered to refund the sandwich through "skip credits"...more annoying conversation and we got the order refunded. Please note that this was not the only issue - the other order was a hamburger and the bottom bun was disgusting as it was soaked in pickle juice and under-cooked and the steak sandwich (the one that was supposed to come with the soup) said on the menu that it was served on garlic bread - let it be known that there was not one bit of garlic anywhere to be found on that bread. Please spend your well-earned money and time somewhere else and don't ruin your dinner/evening dealing with this so-called business.

I would zero stars if it was possible. You cannot get into this place to rent a vehicle unless you are coming on a shuttle from the airport. They claim to have a parking lot if you want to call it that, way out in front of the place. It holds about 4 cars in this "parking lot". When I walked up to ask the woman how to get in, she was very rude and said this is the airport location meaning you can only rent a car coming from the airport. The whole thing was ridiculous, but they were extremely rude on top of it.

Hands down Best comfort food in St. Louis! Rick Lewis and his friendly & attentive staff go above & beyond to make sure every detail of the dining experience is top notch. The medium rare roast beef with mushroom gravy & crispy leeks if off the chain delicious! I have been 4 times & am amazed by the perfect execution of everything I have tried!
One of my favorite places to go for pizza. Their sauce is amazing, kind of spicy, it really makes the pizza.

My husband and I just relocated and my company provided me with household moving service, which is how I ended up with this company.  Based on this experience I will never use "professional" movers again.
-They charged my company ~$18,000 to move my 2 person household.  (No I didn't accidentally add a zero)
-Charged $200 to box my tv into it's original packing, and then when the sub-contractors that packed my house came, they made us crate the tv.  
-Household items were 2 days late on delivery, after we made a special trip to our new state to meet the truck.  Were told that we would be compensated $200 each day they were late (we weren't).
-The subcontractors delivering the household items stacked as many boxes as possible in the garage, rather than in the house locations indicated on the boxes, since the garage was easier to get to.
-Many broken, scratched, and MISSING items.  In one example we received half of the contents of one dresser drawer, but not the others.  Still waiting for the claim to be reviewed on the household items.
-They moved 2 cars as part of the move.  They had the cars for a month.  Delayed delivery twice, no showed once, and eventually delivered the cars.  Both cars are antiques, and were covered in black, greasy handprints.  As a result of being inside a carrier at high temps the older of the cars sustained significant damage.  Claim denied because there was no evidence of denting, or rubbing in the areas of paint/fiberglass cracking.
-To compare, I shipped a 3rd vehicle through a different carrier.  United charged $1800 per car and took 1 month to deliver (NY to FL).  The other carrier charged $600 and delivered in 3 days.

THIS IS WHAT $35 GETS YOU FOR BREAKFAST? Cannot believe the hype on this place. 

AMBIENCE - Loud-loud-loud, 90% community seating filled with moms with babies drinking coffee and yammering at high pitch. Very awkward since they took up nearly all the spaces but the kitchen itself wasn't busy so we had to stand around for 10 minutes before being able to sit, all the while wondering why we'd bothered to come here since we couldn't actually "have" a conversation here, given the noise. 

FOOD - 
Mushroom Frittata -- small, tough and barely warm (on the upside, the tomato jam and goat cheese on top were wonderful) 
Potatoes -- nothing special, served barely roasted and barely warm 
Classic Breakfast w Sausage, Biscuits & Gravy -- we make better sausage at home, barely warm; biscuits were tough and cold; gravy had zero flavor, didn't mind that it was a puny portion, not even enough for the two biscuits 
Brownie -- complimentary, foisted upon us by manager/owner who (to his credit) noticed that we were less than enthusiastic 
Bacon -- we'd heard it was good, someone across the table offered us theirs, it was fine 

COFFEE - excellent

We had an excellent experience using Reynolds Transfer of Madison Wisconsin. We moved from Milwaukee Wisconsin to Northern California 4/2018. All aspects of our move went perfectly. Our driver Shayne Duesing of Schroeder Moving Systems  ( a United Van Lines agent)was fantastic he coordinated the packing and unloading of our belongings. He kept in frequent contact with us during the move and actually delivered our load a day earlier than quoted. We would highly recommend him as a driver. We were extremely happy with our move.

Our son also used Reynolds Transfer for his move to the same location, however his belongings were shipped in a container on a freight truck, not on a United Van Lines moving truck. His items which he had packed and labeled were then crated by Reynolds and many of the boxes were  crushed and damaged during the move.They were not told their items would be handled differently than our move when they scheduled their move. I would recommend insisting your belongings are not shipped via container as this method was not acceptable.The United representative that uncrated his belongings on delivery commented that they had not been handled properly.
It is as delicious as everyone says it is! Yeah, it's a dive, but it has a certain charm about it. Bring some quarters and play shuffleboard, pacman, or air hockey while you wait!
These people are rude and slow. I've called to complain to the manager who could care less. Burn or piss on your money, but for god's sake, don't eat here...

Wow. Because there was a "$60 order" ahead of me, there was nobody to take orders at the drive through. I had to go to the window and ask what was going on and was met with a snippy manager talking about the $60 order ahead of me and "what would I like?" in a patronizing tone with no apologies for the 20 min I just waited. Try harder. Pathetic.
Really enjoyed the Calzone, a lot of options. Good atmosphere.  Please open one in St Charles.

The food was delicious but what was even better was the service.  I had all four of my kids with me who had no idea what they wanted.  The girl that was taking our order was super friendly and patient.  We had a big order that had a lot of customizing to it and it was perfect.  So many times you encounter people that see a big order as an inconvenience to them and they are rude and get it all wrong because they just don't care to try.  This was the exact opposite.  I don't even live in St Louis anymore but when passing through I could see myself going out of the way just to go here!

Hands down the best massage I've ever had! For someone who suffers from major stress and anxiety, my body is constantly tense and it was obvious after getting a massage. My massage therapist, Ditto, concentrated on my neck and upper back and still managed to fit in the rest of my body, making it the ultimate massage experience. I left with a relieved body and I haven't had a headache in a few weeks now. Recommended for anyone with stress, anxiety, back pain and who suffers from headaches. I'll definitely be back, hopefully at least once every few months.

A Great dive bar!!! With amazing pizza! Come on and galaga video game, shuffle board and air hockey,and pinball what else do we need oh yeah a full bar! Please take note... If we could bring descent wine into your bar u would get 5 stars.... U could make $ on corkage... ??? Please???? Your wine is tragic!!! Say yes to the wine!!!

I ordered and pre-paid for a two week car rental from National Car Rental via Priceline.com.

 I arrived to pick up my car and no one was at the counter for several minutes.  Finally, someone came out to help. She asked me how I would be paying. I told her credit card and handed her my card.  She would not accept it because it was a debit/credit card. I explained that I had pre- paid for the rental and she said, "Oh well, they (Priceline) know our rules."  I told her I would check with Priceline because I had driven 1/2 hour to get there and paid for the car in advance.

While at the counter, I called Priceline, attempting to rectify the situation.  The agent left me at the counter, went to the back room to grab her ugly pink purse, and left the building (while I stood at the unattended counter). WTH? Really? She never came back. 

In the end I went to Enterprise in Ladue. They helped me with a more expensive rental and after a 1/2 hour on the phone with Priceline speaking with scripted individuals who were clearly not speaking English as a first language, Priceline refunded my money, minus a $20 surcharge. 

Moral of the story, if you value your time and work on ethics and principles, don't go to this National for a car and don't do it through Priceline.
Go through the drive through if you don't want to wait 45 minutes for a burger. Staff is decent but short. My order is usually right and they are convenient. Always use the drive through though.

We stayed for an overnight and while the hotel was clean and had just been updated, we were supposed to have a queen bed and we didn't.  Also there was a dirty towel on the back of the bathroom door and the bottom sheet was inside out which made me a little worried. We were put on the side of the hotel facing the interstate which didn't make much sense seeing as how there were only a few rooms that were booked. Even after we came back after dinner there was only 12 cars in the parking lot. The a/c was SO LOUD that every time it would turn on I'd wake up although it did drown out the interstate noise.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I called this company to get an estimate and see if they could help with my move and the sales associate would not give me a quote nor speak with me until I assured him the weight of my items. He was aggressive in his tone and hung up on me. I, myself, work in customer service and am an extremely cheerful person. This was a terrible experience. Never calling again.
Excellent food, but more seating would be nice.  The smashed potatoes were amazing, and my biscuit was crispy and light both!  I would definitely go back, as the food was very good.

I have hade several long-distance moves in the past, having used Allied, American and Bekins, and THIS was by far the worst experience yet. There is absolutely no communication between agent and driver once your goods are picked up. I had to do most if not all of the communication with the driver. I was promised delivery on a certain day and after two days of mechanical failure (which is understandable) and deception on the parts of both agent and driver ....oh, and cancellation of all of my appointments for two days....I finally received my goods. If I hadn't told the driver just before he arrived in my town that I lived in a gated condo community which would not accommodate an 18 wheeler my delivery would have been delayed even more. This information should have been conveyed to the driver long beforehand. I give this carrier one star.....well, because I'm a nice guy. The rest of you....beware....use Allied.

Don't let anyone talk you into the thin pizza!

Go for Chicago-style/deep dish. It'll take a while (45-60 minutes most nights). Relax. Drink. Drink some more. Play shuffleboard. Repeat. Relax. Drink. Play pinball or was it Ms. Pacman? Repeat. Eat. Eat some more.

Easygoing crowd, easygoing staff.
Avoid this place at all times! It's always slow, things are always broke down-- jus awful.
I had the slinger and all the flavors felt off.  Just not impressed... this is one of those trendy places that puts metro food on their menu but doesn't do it right.

We had meatballs and cantelloni and both were awful. The meat looked processed the sauce was essentially Ragu but with less flavor. Very sub par. The guy that served us was not friendly at all. I would never eat here again.

Ok, I really wanted to like a neighborhood ethnic restaurant, and after reading the reviews I was excited. BUT..who is reviewing this place? Relatives?  From the second  we walked in, I wasn't feeling warm and fuzzy. The place smelled like Clorox and dirt. There was a drill gun sitting out on the bandstand. Not good signs, but still had hope for the food. As I was sitting down (butt still not on the chair), waitress asks me what I would like for an app.  OK.  Ordered the spring rolls. Mind you, I've had spring rolls from Mai Lee, Webster Garden, etc., so I know a decent spring roll. Their's was not.  Shrimp was pretty much absent, or if it was shrimp, they weren't whole. 

Ok, still hoping for a turnaround. I ordered the Spicy Steak, gf ordered fried rice. I tried her fried rice, and I've had better from Chinese takeout, but still edible. But my dish? NOT edible. The meat was like jerky. A couple pieces I had a hard time sticking my fork into it. Rice was not fresh. 

Maybe they were having a bad day. Everyone has one right?  Yes, but as the restaurant should then try to make amends, right?  

After our meal, I told the waitress "Can I just say a few suggestions?"  Well, I wasn't expecting anything free, but maybe a sorry or something. Nope, she just said, "oh" and took our check. 

We then waited 10 minutes for our change and we were 1 of 2 tables there. 

This is Stl. You have to have your game face on when you open. Yes, there are growing pains, but if your missing 2 legs, football might not be the sport for you. 

Effort goes a long way with subpar food,  and when you lack effort and good food, hmmmm, hope the lease isn't long. 

All the people who gave this place a good review, go to Mai Lee or Webster Garden and be truly gratified.

If you are wanting actual frozen yogurt, I recommend not going here. Please. Try Tutti Frutti, FroYo or Orange Leaf. If you are wanting something like ice cream but not really and frozen yogurt that really isn't, be my guest ;)

After passing this establishment daily and eagerly awaiting the opening, my girlfriend and I were finally able to grab lunch there this weekend. They did not disappoint. 

We both got chicken (mine was hot), as well as mac n' cheese, crispy potatoes and greens. The chicken was cooked perfectly, with both white and dark meat obtaining a perfectly crispy skin while maintaining internal juiciness. The mac 'n cheese was also delicious with the crispy topping adding texture to balance the creaminess, and who doesn't love Gouda? I only had one potato, but they were very crispy on the outside with a tender interior. The greens were my favorite, I'll go back just for those. The sweet and sour take was well done, and good greens are hard to find. 

The interior itself is rather warm and inviting and fits well with the upscale southern fare. The employees were all extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and you can tell they have a passion about the food they serve as well as the establishment they work in. 

There are several other menu items I can't wait to go back and try.

This is the best sandwich shop in town by far!
 Great food. Nice people.. Priced properly. I would recondmmend it to my friends and family. Good thing I don't live next door. I'd be a pig!

Definitely smaller then other National Car Rental... I walked out to the shuttle, thankfully the shuttle came after few minutes, the bus was full... the bus pulled up and I was the last to get out and unfortunately by the time I got out, vehicle selection was minimal... either a F150, Minivan or sedan... then I found a Hyundai SUV, got in and found that the seats where manual... after getting myself situated, they brought another SUV, so I got out and took that one.

Returning the car was simple... just dropped off the car and went to the bus and in few minutes, I got my receipt via email.  Overall, not bad experience.

Awesome spot , especially if you like to "choose your own adventure." I'm picky about what I can order since I try not to eat a lot of carbs, so rather than ask to "hold the rice, etc. , I can simply choose exactly what I want (as a salad for example.) For those that would rather just let the menu speak for itself, there's plenty of options there also.

St. Louis is always little slow on food trends, but I was super excited to hear poke was finally starting to arrive!

This place has been on my radar even before it opened, thank you social media. My spouse and I checked out PokeDoke for dinner one night. Parking was pretty difficult to find, but it's to be expected as this restaurant is located in CWE.

I was having trouble figuring out which of the three sizes to choose. Small, regular, or large. I decided to go with the small which came with two scoops of protein. I had two scoops of the salmon with a base of white rice. I went with the medium poke sauce, but I think I'm going to go with the spicy next time. Toppings: mango, seaweed salad, masago, green onion, friend onion, and wasabi, all topped with a drizzle of wasabi mayo.

I'm not sure I can say it's the best poke I've ever had in my life, but it sure was tasty. The salmon was pretty good, I liked the poke sauce that was used. The toppings went really well with the meat and the rice. I really just see poke as a deconstructed sushi roll, which I already love. I was really surprised as to how full I was at the end of the meal. Though I chose the smallest size, I was pretty stuffed. If I had chosen the regular size, I would've been very uncomfortable.

I thought prices were fair. A small bowl is $10, while a sushi burrito from Blk Mkt Eats was $9 or $10. Not a big difference.
I had the pull pork sandwich with potato salad and they were both delicious! The buns for the sandwich was so good I've never tasted a bun like that.

My son and his wife took us to this place.  New experience for us and we really liked it.    The staff were very friendly, patient, and helpful with us picking everything out for the first time.  There were generous amount of sushi, rice, and all the fixings.  Interesting variety of sauces added great flavors to the bowl.  All in all, a great value for the money.  $10-12 per bowl.
Service and customer orientation of team is on high level. However, I received multiple times a car that has not been cleaned properly.  The Executive Emerald selection needs to be improved...
Food was okay.  Their only salad dressing had little flavor, and their spicy chicken sandwich was deep fried and dry.  However, the sevice was exceptional.
Accepts priority pass for take-out. I ordered the penne roma with two extra meatballs. It took around 10 minutes to prepare. Pasta was good but the meatballs were excellent. Would come back again.

The Island is the best place for frozen yogurt in St Louis. It has a charismatic atmosphere and the frozen yogurt is absolutely delicious. While similar to Froyo, The Island is a much better alternative. Asking customers what flavors to keep in the rotation, and having them vote between new products is one way they keep their ear to the ground. The latest vote is between frozen Greek yogurt and frozen custard. Also, take your dog for a trip there, they have cold healthy treats ready for your best friend. Lastly, and this is awesome, they started serving adult frozen slushies. Head over there and enjoy!

Due to the paper thin outside walls, and proximity to the highway, if you love the sounds of nascar zooming around inside your room this is the place for you! If you don't avoid it like the fucking plague because when you ask for an inside facing room they will lie and tell you the hotel is full. Uh, it is a Tues. night and no one is here. 

I will never stay in another hotel owned by IHG again.

Love this place!

Good variety of flavors and super nice employees, what more can you ask for?

Notable flavors are banana, chocolate milkshake, and fruit loops.  The first 2 are delicious mixed together and fruit loops is just an awesome flavor, very unique!

I want to try some of their other flavors (rootbeer, island colada, and marshmallow) but unfortunately it's like a 30 minute drive for me so I only really go here when I am in the area.  Definitely a solid choice for frozen yogurt when a craving hits!
We had a small group go up here during March madness and we all had a great time. Service was awesome, plenty of TVs, and the food specials were good too. Great sports bar!

The staff is wonderful, kind and accommodating!   We were road-weary and far from home.  Our reservation was given away at a nearby hotel, on a busy saturday night.  Brett was the night front desk manager, and quickly and efficiently saved the night.  To top it off, we were given breakfast vouchers. We are certainly grateful!  Thanks Brett, God bless you, and thanks Holiday Inn!

Loved the food. Felt kind of like a slightly more upscale Bread Co. Absolutely, insanely crowded at 11:45 AM on a Friday. Tables were scarce; chairs were more scarce. Do not understand not having four chairs at four-tops, especially when they get this crowded every day. 

Bread was excellent, as was the seasonal garlic beef sandwich - but the toasted bread was so hard it scraped up the top of my mouth. Chicken and wild rice was good, but crazy salty. I love salt. I put salt on salt. And this was salty even for me. Again, I like Bread Co.'s better. Salted Caramel Mocha was a hit. Loved.  

I liked it. I'd go back.

Best deep dish around, hands down.  

Treat yourself to a great little place and amazing pizza.  A small warning, plan on waiting 45 minutes to an hour for a pizza.  However, with the beers they have on tap and the fun atmosphere, you'll be fine.

I give this Steak n Shake another chance about every six months or so, because it's much closer to my house than is the one on Chippewa near Kingshighway.  I mean, I figure at some point, someone will have to wake up and drag this location up at least to the fairly low average Steak n Shake standard of service -- but so far this hasn't happened.

They *look* busy, but nevertheless everything takes a lot longer than at locations doing about the same amount of business.

It doesn't matter if I sit at the counter, or at a table, or go through the drive-through or even if I call ahead with an order and then wait before going down there: I'm going to be cooling my heels for about 25-35 minutes waiting for them to produce food.  If I go inside at all, this means that I'm in there for long enough to smell like a steakburger until I wash my hair.

I was skeptical about Chicago-style pizza outside of the Windy City, but I was pleasantly surprised by the pizza here! It was amazing! I love the friendly, neighborhood atmosphere. People just came through after work to chill and hang out. You would never expect this place would serve up the best pizza in STL so give them a try!

Sports Authority is good for what it offers. It offers a wide variety of sports equipment at decent prices. This staff are not overly knowledgeable, and can be annoying at times, but they stayed out of my way for the most part and let me find what I was looking for, a new pair of shoes. They had a modest sale going on and the pair of shoes i ended up with was $5 off and there was a Yelp coupon offering $10 off a $50 or more purchase. Glad I checked in or I would have missed that offer. 

All in all, they are A-OK. They don't offer over the top service and a knowledgeable staff, but if that is what I was looking for I would have gone elsewhere.
Poor quality food. Margarita was one of the worst. Mediocre beer. Ill equipped bar. Typical overpriced airport venue. But worse than average food quality.

Worst service ever by Sharon at St Louis airport. She was more interested in her hot chocolate than working.  She has no customer service skills at all.   National though must take blame also for no drive away before 7am.  I questioned why and it's for my safety, COMPLETE BULLSHIT.
Drive thru, coffee club , artisan style, homemade deliciousness! Pleasantly surprised at every turn.

Seating in this place is super wack. It's extremely loud like a cafeteria and very crowded. Sandwiches and treats are good so if it's worth the noise then perfect for you. Parking lot is full of crazy kirkwood drivers rounding blind corners doing 30 mph. I'm sure it's the same ones that fail to understand the concept of a 4 way stop sign.

Yes yes yes!! I live in Arizona which has seen an abundance of poke restaurants make their way to the Phoenix area and I would put PokeDoke up against any of them (yes I know it's the desert but nearly all get their fish flown in daily and have figured the formula out thanks to that large oceanside state to our left). Portions were generous (for those saying the scoops are small, they're using a standard scoop that any poke restaurant uses). Food was fresh. Toppings were abundant. Prices were reasonable. Service was super friendly. I will absolutely be making this place a regular stop when visiting family in the CWE. Keep up the great work!

Awesome customer service. Dropped off car for repairs after a deer hit my car. They coordinated with Enterprise to have a car there when I dropped off. Kept me in the loop with daily text updates regarding the progress of my repair. Hope I never have to have any repairs done again, but if so will be happy to come to this body shop again!
Just like dumplings in Taiwan; so delicious.  We drove 45 min just to come here.  Polite and quick service.

I think there really is something here for everyone. I didn't enjoy my first meal here, the second was better... I tried something different and third time was the charm I found my perfect calzone! Seriously different experience and a new favorite of mine!
SOLID!!!  We returned the car, found out my flight was delayed 5 hours, and they were kind enough to rent it back to me (even though they were sold out) for the low price of $246 for 1 day.

Food was great! Service was less attentive as it began to fill up during prime dinner time. Highly recommend the shrimp and grits. The chicken and waffles looked amazing across the table as my daughter devoured it. 

Skip the beignets though. They were way too dense and lacked flavor.

One star is too many. Spent 25 minutes later in drive thru and finally gave up. Five other cars behind me pulled off ahead for f me. Spent at least 10 minutes at the ordering speaker. Hong horn, tried to get attention. Called on the phone and put on hold before I could say a word. Called back and yelled at a manager that wanted me to drive back there and buy me lunch. A terrible experience. Service has been a problem there for a while but this went beyond ridiculous. One star is too good a review. Stay away!

Ahhh...the Black Thorn Pub.  What can I say that's not already been said by 48 other Yelpers?

I've been to Black Thorn Pub several times and I can honestly say that their pizza is the best deep-dish/Chicago style pizza in St. Louis.  While I am fan of pizzas with all sorts of toppings, the essence of simplicity is not overlooked at Black Thorn Pub.  You're not going to get a deep-dish white pizza with buffalo mozzarella, basil, grilled chicken, spinach, toasted pine nuts, olive oil, and a drizzle of aged balsamic vinegar at Black Thorn Pub (okay...umm, actually that sounds pretty good!).  You'll get the pizza with toppings we all grew up with - sausage, mushroom, pepperoni, onions, green peppers - you know, the stuff we used to eat when went to birthday parties when we were kids!...the stuff that makes an all-around good pizza.  Frankly, anyone can take toppings, slap'em on a crust, add sauce, and call it pizza.  Black Thorn Pub achieves a harmonious balance with good toppings (albeit, simple toppings), good sauce (nice an'zesty, with a little tart to it), great mozzarella, and good crust.  That balance makes for a fantastic pizza.  

Like most growing boys, I could probably put down most of a medium pizza from the Hut, Dom's, or the Caesar.  This is highly unlikely at Black Thorn Pub - I mean, next to near impossible.  Two slices of their goodness is all I need to send me into a food coma.  After a particularly intense workout last night (the shirt-soaking kind), we thought it best to relax and unwind with pizza from Black Thorn Pub.  I mean, is there a better way?  We ordered a pie with sausage, mushrooms, and garlic, and it was awesome.  This was the second time we ordered that combination and we loved it.  In fact, I've got a leftover slice for lunch today!

I think we can all agree that Black Thorn Pub - at least the "Pub" aspect of it - either borders on, or just is, a dive.  But don't be distracted by that.  It's got a great neighborhood feel to it.  It is literally the "bar on the corner" that you could meet a friend for a beer, bring the team back after a gratuitous win, or take that special someone out for a great dining experience.  I've done all three, and have had a great time each time.  I would hope that Christine F. would go back there and give Black Thorn Pub a second chance despite her first experience (see, below).  I do agree, no one deserves to be treated that way, but we're not perfect, right?  I've worked in restaurants and bars, too, and no matter what, the customer's concern is what is most important.  Dude should not have treated her that way, let alone talked to her like that - that's clearly bullshit treatment.  But give the guy a second chance, hell...give Black Thorn Pub a second chance - if the shoe was on the other foot, I'm sure they'd want that second chance to impress her.  In the words of Gordon Gekko, "What, no one believes in comebacks anymore?"

Man. I really liked this place the first time, but the 2nd time just seemed like an all around mistake. What have I concluded? Eat here when you are starving to death and it will taste 150 times better than if you were only hungry for a proper portion sized meal.

I ordered a pepperoni pizza 10 inch for take out last night. $13.50 isn't bad for the depth and size of the pizza. It may only contain 4 slices, but those 4 slices are comparable to a Domino's 8 slice pizza.

I ordered around 8:30pm and still had an hour wait even though when I went in they weren't that busy. Seems to be the case every time. Never slammed, but always the long wait. This is typical of Black Thorn I guess.

When we got home to eat our pizza, it seemed overly spicy with seasoning. Cheese seemed to be more on one side of the pizza than the other and not evenly distributed. After eating a single slice it just seemed to settle than digest in our systems. When Jason and I laid down in the bed we both agreed that we would never get that pizza again. Then the passing thought occurred, we still have to eat left overs.

Left overs were a lot better than the first initial piece we had. It tasted fresher. Does that seem weird? Probably. Still I think that was our final visit. It good pizza when you're starving, but I wouldn't advise going if you are only a little hungry.
Great service, great food.  Cabbage and smoked turkey leg were both really good.  Short drive from airport area hotels make this a great spot to pick up food on the way to check in.

My wife and I heard about this place through the grapevine and made a point to try it. This review is a little late, but well deserved. 

To be quite honest our experience at first was a bit jarring , but that's just because we'd never been to a breakfast/brunch place quite like it before. 

You order food from a counter and then try to find a place to sit. We're far from antisocial, but not big fans of community seating, so we jumped at the chance to sit at a dirty two top table as another couple was leaving. As we were taking our seats someone came right over wiped down the table for us (thank you!).

They were slammed so we were surprised to receive our food after waiting for what seemed like no more than 5 minutes. IT. WAS. INCREDIBLE. I had the Slinger Sandwich and my wife had the Mushroom Frittata. She described it as being "the perfect blend between creamy and woodsy"... the only two words I can use to describe the slinger sandwich are "More Please".  Both meals came with a side of small potatoes. Not hash browns, not grits, whole potatoes. They too were nearly too good to be true. 

I hope these guys continue to be as successful as they seemed that one Sunday morning few months ago. I also hope they can open more locations, maybe with a little more seating. Great job Yolklore!

Mary and her team are amazing!!! First and foremost, grab some brunch here whenever possible!  But I really want to share our most amazing experience ordering our wedding cake!  Mary made everything so easy and fun for us and our cake was both stunning and delicious!  Thanks so much!

Shocking I know, but yet another pizza review that highlights my love for the thick crust. As my friend Julie says "The thicker the better!" This South City gem delivers fully with their deep dish awesomeness. 

I need to warn you about a few things: 

1. The pizza does not come out quick here. I mean with crust this thick it takes a while to cook.

2. This is a dive bar, so be ready for down to earth gritty.

The pub is actually not very large, so I tend to get takeout. Again plan ahead, because it can often take over and hour to get your pie. Trust me the wait is well worth it.

The toppings here are top notch. Nothing fancy, but all the basics I love and plenty of them. What I love most is they are not shy with their cheese. mmmmm cheese!!! Loads and loads of yummy mozzarella makes this a high calorie masterpiece.

My girlfriend and I tried black thorn's pizza after hearing about the legendary deep dish pizza that was worth waiting for.  The crust and cheese were absolutely amazing... second to none.  The sauce was a different story.  I tend to over-season my pizza with oregano other type seasonings, and this sauce just ruined the pizza.  Maybe we got a bad batch... or maybe whoever seasons it overdid it a bit.  But i've been trying to wash the peppery flavor out of my mouth for the last hour. This pizza would be some of the best every if they stuck to a conventional pizza sauce.
First time to try. Flavors were excellent. We had the pork and pork/crab. To be honest I was looking for a larger dumpling but they were delicious.  Very nice people working here.
I booked a couple of appointments after I strained my back. I got the 30 minute focused relief massage. Sue was excellent. I would definitely go again.
I won't ever need to try another Calzone Restaurant again. For the size of this thing, it's well worth the price! I had the Carmen after tax was only $11

Since the two of us had to utilize a $50 Groupon, we had a feast last night with plenty left over.   The stand outs were:  Lobster Tikka Masala, Lamb Korma, Daal Soup and Keema Naan.  Service was friendly and attentive.  I can hardly wait to return.

Have now visited this establishment 3x over the past 2 months, and I must say I am incredibly impressed and why this is now one of my favorite restaurants. First is the exceptional food.  My personal favorite is the turkey leg, but others in my group have loved the fried chicken, ribs, turkey meatloaf special, and bologna.  Sides are all solid - cauliflower, Mac & cheese are two favs. Second is the passionate and friendly people who work there and want you to enjoy your meal. Owner / chef Rick gets a ton of credit for creating the right culture!  Third is the setting.  Warm and friendly with plenty of seating. Fourth is the prices which are reasonable.  Fifth is the fact they are constantly experimenting. Whether it be a few new dishes in 2018, to adding a catering menu.

This is a must visit place for those who live in or visit stl.

We stopped in on a rainy Thursday afternoon. The place was packed and I can understand why! The food is amazing. We tried the catfish, the turkey leg, and hot chicken. They were all delicious. The grits are the best grits I've ever tasted. Everyone that works here was friendly and helpful. We loved Grace Meat + Three and will be back.
I love this new sweet shoppe in my neighborhood. The ice cream treats are delectable and like none I've had before! The staff is very friendly.

This had to be one of my favorite things I have EVER ATE IN MY LIFE! the Figgy Piggy is like a party is happening with all the flavors going on.
I asked for no onions and they put them on anyway might I say thank you for messing up my order because this was the most perfect mess up  that has ever happened to one of my special orders.
 I NEVER give 5 stars but this was well deserving, the art on the walls is bright and whimsical.
Thank you for creating the most awesome food ever.
Props to the chef!

Two stars because the service is nice, friendly and fast. But the food!!! What a disappointment... Good fried chicken, although nothing to write home about, but fairly disappointing sides. I had the collard greens and they were actually gritty. Like sand between my teeth! And the fried green tomatoes (one of my all-time Southern favorites) were also a waste of 6$ (small slices, mostly end pieces, batter slipping off). The only side I enjoyed quite a bit was the mashed sweet potatoes with marshmallows - delicious. 
Overall, though, it was a pretty negative experience. We won't be returning for a while, unless we hear that the kitchen has stepped it up.

I didn't eat here, because the service was so bad. I asked the guy working there do we seat ourselves?  His response was go ahead everybody else does. I sat down and started looking at a menu that was in a rack on the counter. He and another waitress just kept passing by scowling at me. After 5 minutes I just got up and left. You're better off going some place else. I would give this place 5 negative stars if I could.

I've heard about this place and have never been in my 22 years living in STL. I highly recommend it as a great lunch spot during a break, a place for the family or even a date night. 5 stars in my book. And the food is delish. Try the Duke and the Toasty Roasty calzone, you won't be sorry. I'll definitely be back.

This McDonald's is notorious for getting orders wrong. Not to mention it is on of the slowest McDonald's I have ever been to. On top of it they charge you for extra sauce for nuggets and never ever give it to you without you having to ask for it after you get your food and then explain to them yes I did pay for it already. All in all the cooks can't read, the employees are rude, and the owners just don't seem to give a damn.

I keep trying to have a decent meal there but just can't. It may be this time because I was alone.  I got the feeling that they would be more attentive to a full table. The lady who sat me was very nice, but the one who took my order was not happy.  I ordered the cod sandwich with (homemade?) chips. Not alot of chips and cold/oily. Not alot of cod much to my dismay.  Everyone has told me about how big the cod sandwich was. I saw the sandwiches at a neighboring table and they where twice the size of mine. Instead of "The Haven " they may call this place the "Haves and Have Nots".  The lady finally brought my check and stood waiting for payment and tip.  She probably sensed that I was not in love with the place. I wouldn't have stiffed her on the tip, but she didn't deserve the 20% tip I gave her. The cod sandwich and chips with drink cost me $16. Not a great value. I will not be back.

If I could rate higher I would. I would consider myself a regular and every visit has been fantastic. My latest visit today was amazing. Edward, Nina, and LP gave impeccable service. I was extremely impressed by them. They were very friendly, knowledgeable about the product, and made you feel welcome. I would recommend this place to anyone. We brave the CWE traffic and parking just to come here.
Best place for poke in STL and they just got a loyalty program too. The owners are so nice and friendly

10 out of 10. It was my first time eating at a poke restaurant and I was nothing less than satisfied! I had no idea what to get but the staff was super friendly and helpful. The food and service was fast, friendly and delicious to say the least. It has definitely became on of my new favorite places to eat. If you like sushi or anything cuisine like that you will love this place! 

The fish and meat I got tasted fresh and it was really filling! (Coming from someone who can put down quite a bit) I found that it was affordable and I have no complaints whatsoever. 

Next time I'm in CWE I will be stopping by Poke Doke.
I found this restaurant just riding by and I was glad I found it. The seasoning they add is delicious. I had the fish.  I'm going back to try the burger and the chicken.

Awful extremely salty food.  I order the same thing at every McDonald's I ever go to and for some reason the artisan chicken sandwich was extremely salty.  I asked called (which I almost never do with fast food joints), and spoke to a snippy female 'manager' and was told to stuff either bring the sandwich back - which I had fed to my dogs by this time.  No refund, no replacement.  The manager gave me 'corporate's' number to call.  I did and spoke to Dot.  After a lot of back and forth with Dot, who had said she was the owner, and then said she wasn't.  She claimed the manager was right, I said fine, keep the money I'll just write an online review.  Then she put me on hold to consult with the 'owner' and came back and offered me a refund if I could give her the precise time I could go back to the store.  I couldn't. So she offered coupons.  I said fine as long as they covered the artisan grilled chicken sandwich which is all I order from McDonald's.  Watch this space.  I will delete the review if I receive a satisfactory resolution.

It seems that some people that came here do not appreciate how difficult soup dumplings are to make and how rare they are to find. This place is exactly what is means to be: quick, quality, really good soup dumplings.

nothing special about this national.  they are a little ways from the airport so give yourself plenty of time when you are dropping off.  not a lot of selection so i picked my car when we were driving in on the shuttle.  since i have to i will be back.

Can't believe I'm going to give the Black Thorn Pub a bad rating but after last night I'm never going there again.  I'm not a regular but I was in last year and the deep dish pizza (it's not really Chicago style) was pretty good.  Gooey crust in the middle but I can overlook that.  Wanted to try the pan and thin crust so my friend and I order a 12" of each.  Her pan pizza had about a 1" crust and 2 ounces of topping.  The crust on both was bland and tasted like yesterday's leftovers. The thin crust was as thick as a normal pizza's crust and I wondered why they called it thin crust. The toppings were decent.  However, the sauce on both was hot, hot, hot.  I don't mind zingy but jalapeno hot shouldn't be used as a pizza sauce. Maybe they accidentally put too much red pepper in but it was enough to make me look for another place. The Schlafly seasonal was very good and saved my night. I don't know what happened-new manager-new owner-new pizza maker?

Best ribs in St. Louis, and plenty of delicious sides to go with it. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Healthier options are available too. This is soon to be a staple of The Grove. Go check them out, you won't be disappointed.
Took an appointment for a visit in my home in Watertown, MA to get an estimate. Nobody showed up. When I called, they said I called them 2 days ago to cancel... Pure lie. Total waste of time.

havent tried their thin.

the pan tossed is solid. good amount of sauce. good use of oregano.

the deep dish is very good. the best you'll find in stl. its not quite Lou Mal's but if that is your chicago pref then you'll be satisfied. giordano folks stay away...your obsession with too much cheese will not be met here.

Another mediocre bar in The Loo.
Ordered: 
Burger, medium rare. Received well done.
Chicken sandwich without buffalo sauce. Received with buffalo sauce AND jalpino's (!)
Grilled chicken was OK though.
Maybe our waitress couldn't hear us over the very loud speakers blasting football.
Would I go back? Nope.
Absolutely terrible. Had the house salad, spent two days laid up sick as a dog.  Wait staff is slow and unfriendly and rude.

This is everything you want in a Pizza place. My wife and I brought my daughter to have a bit of fun and eat some pizza. This was a fun Sat night out, no stress and some pinball, drinks and oh yeah that Pizza. If you cant wait the full hour for it order the cheese bread in the meantime. As far as Pizza shops go this is the one you want to be at on a Sat. night. Or Maybe Thursday night would be best for you, that way my line is shorter! Keep it up!

The daughter and I really liked our early lunch, or I guess a brunch since it's all really breakfast dishes.  It's a simple concept, basically fast casual for big breakfast entrees.  I wanted to try a bunch of stuff, so we ordered three entrees knowing some would be taken home.

My favorite was the Nest Egg.  It's a big ole crispy biscuit crust that has two sous vide eggs inside that mixed with the large bacon bits and cheddar for savory explosion.  Pickled red onion on top with preserved lemon bits gave a great contrast that rounded it out.  I'd say you have to try this.

The Mary B.E.A.R. was darn good too.  It's a sandwich made of a ciabatta bun, with brie, boiled egg, arugula, apple butter, and pickled red onion.  It had a light, but satisfying flavor, that left you fresh.

Pancake rollup was my least favorite.  It was an okay dish - 2 scrambled eggs, turkey chorizo, cheddar, pickled jalapeno, salsa all rolled up in a pancake (burrito style), with a lime cheese drizzle across it.  The lime cheese was a tart contrast to the rest of it, but too tart for me.  Turkey chorizo was decent, but could have had a stronger flavor.  The pancake also seemed to lake flavor.  I would have liked more butter flavor in it.  Really, it could have used some syrup.  But it didn't come with any, and I didn't see any in the place.  Oh well. Two really good choices and one okay choice.
Convenient location, nice staff but I think the common areas need to be upgraded. It's a good hotel for the price I got from Priceline.

Got in there at 745. Wait for 15 minute to order (5 people ahead of me) and 823 the order is ready. Staff is loud to each other and yell back and forth for communication and I heard they call each other bixch. eyeroll to customer.  No table is clean. The star is for the food, better than the McDonald in kingshighway and Jefferson .

Such a great place - amazing menu, great atmosphere, and wonderful people. I will definitely come back next time I'm in St Louis. Also glad we got to meet Angelique on her first day! She was fantastic!

this a cool spot, come down to the market about once a month, and this just happened to be recently opened  A little different as the bar and food are seperate, but didnt matter, it was worth it.  great southern food, rib tips, catfish......... the cat fish tasted like it was just caught.  now lets get on to the green beans, i know weird right, best green beans ive had since my gg passed away!  the bar is super cool, built in 1910 as a library.  the bartender Stephanie was awesome and very helpful.  highly recommend this place, ill be coming back.

If i could give a MINUS score I would.  I use National Rental Car VERY often.  During my last visit to St. Louis, they issued me a car with NO GAS!  I ran out of Gas on my way to the office!  UNACCEPTABLE. I called and was put on hold, transferred multiple times, and no one would call me back to handle my complaint. The Customer Relations department on Facebook promised a call back and despite multiple request, they have NEVER called or Owned up to the issue.  VERY VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED!  I will be posting monthly on my Facebook until i hear from National.

A lot of the flavors tasted alike, such as the vanilla and the belgian waffle. I ended up having the pink cupcake (which was tasty) and something chocolate. The server was fine, nothing exceptional with the yogurts, toppings or the service. The prices were great, I'll give them that. Did enjoy sitting outside to eat with my friends and listening to the music from next door, though.

Plan to wait even on a week night, at least 90 minutes. Food is amazing. However, we didn't get the food we ordered, service was lacking and it took along time to get our food. It is super loud and difficult to have a conversation.

Before I made an appointment with this eye care center, I asked if they carried my eye insurance company and they confirmed that they did. As a result, I set up an appointment with them right away. 

The service was great, as I was services right away and the eye exam was quick yet thorough. After my eye exam was completed and I was fit for contacts, the same associate I confirmed my insurance with, notified me that she did not carry my insurance. Wow, I was blown away as that was the sole reason for me coming to this specific location.

I ended up paying $110 dollars in total (72 for exam and $40 for fitting). I called another eye are center and all of that would have cost me $10. To say the least, I am disappointed in their lack of accurate info provided to a customer. This ALL could have been avoided if the associate properly did her job and checked my insurance through my policy number in the first place. 

After expressing that I didn't want to come back for a SECOND fitting, she was a bit frustrated with me and stated that she was trying to make sure I'm not wasting my money. Overall, I had a bad experience with Clarkson.

I love the Daily Bread.  The service there is super.  They really try to help you work through their menu, which is massive and a bit overwhelming if you don't know exactly what you want.  I like how they work their window and they trust you to pick your own chips.  I like the trust they put into their customers.  But most of all, their bakery items are the best!  I had a friend introduce me to their iced cookies.  Normally, I don't like these types of cookies.  Too sweet and usually not very soft.  Different story here.  Amazing!  I buy them now as gifts too, as they often have specialty cookies for seasons, events, etc.  I just bought some pumpkin cookies for friends, and one for myself.  I wanted to run back in and get another.  The only disappointing sandwich I've had is their salmon.  It had a strong fish smell and the fish itself was pieced together to make the sandwich.
Great coffee, and even better pizza.  Their salads could feed a family.  The service is very friendly, and they are always happy to help.

First time here and was surprised with the food. Although the overall taste is great, still not used to that thick of a mixed taste in my mouth. However still loved the spicy tuna and the sauce with the brown rice. Also highly recommend the avocado. Would consider coming again but will always wonder about freshness of food.

Ordered the "famous" house salad and it wasn't even dried after they washed the lettuce, therefore, none of the dressing (I'm assuming they used dressing) could stick to the lettuce.  Very bland; and I haven't had a salad in two weeks, so even a crappy salad would have made me happy, but this one had to be returned.  Then I ordered the pasta con broccoli.  The pasta was more of a soup than anything else.  It's like the chef has never seen pasta before and had no idea how much sauce is supposed to be on the plate; absolutely baffling.  Beer wasn't bad, but they're not a "free house" so they only sell one brand.  I gave two stars because the pasta wasn't too bad and the service was good.  I've attached a picture of how much pasta sauce was left over after I was done eating...crazy, right?
Not only Dr. Karen Harris, but her entire team are exceptional. Friendly, knowledgable, and amazing bedside manner. I could not recommend highly enough!
Very nice place. Super friendly staff.  Great happy hour specials.  They are going to give the local Three Kings a run for their money.

I was really wanting to like this place when we walked in. I was in the area trying different local breweries and this was our last stop. When you walk in the minimalistic decor is very cute and understated. There are also a plethora of games that you can opt to play while enjoying a few brews. 

Unfortunately, I think they are still trying to figure out the beer part. We asked for a flight so we could try a few different options. But they do not have this. As a regular beer drinker I found this strange that a relatively hip brewery doesn't offer flights? For sure a miss. They did let me try a few different options before settling on the raspberry beer at their suggestion. It was just okay. Nothing special but it was the best of the 3 that I tried so I landed on that. Their IPA beer didn't seem like an IPA at all so if you are in the market for that I would go elsewhere. 

Their outdoor area is cute and very homey and we hung out there for awhile while playing games. Long story short this place is great for groups and meet ups. But not so great on the beer.

Great breakfast.  I had the spinach fritatta and my wife the biscuits and gravy.  I was impressed with the new potato that was grilled.  I didn't expect that much flavor from it.  My daughter wouldn't let me try the pancake bites so I assume they where good

This place is phenomenal. I don't consider myself a huge southern food fan (don't hate me), but if all southern food was this flavorful, I'd reconsider! I've had the fried chicken, which is good. But, where they really shine is their absolutely amazing sides! I've had the braised green beans, which are so much better than they even sound. They are super flavorful with tomatoes, onions, and some type of meat in a really wonderful broth (that I drink when the beans are gone). I got their mac and cheese hesitantly because it's very rare for mac and cheese to impress me, but this does! It has such great consistency and flavor and I loved the well-seasoned crust. My favorite side might just be the leek and mushroom soup, which is super creamy and they must marinate or braise the mushrooms because those are also bursting with flavor. I want to try more sides, but I'm always way too full when I get a main course too, so my plan is to just order 4 sides as my meal on my next trip. I got the fried bologna sandwich today and my, oh my was it yummy- juicy, great complex flavor, with a perfectly cooked egg. Try it next time you go. Grace Meat and Three has done everything right here, including the vibe, space, décor, and especially the food!
First time in and  all i can say is YUMMMMMMYYYY!!!! Cooked to perfection and fresh!!! I will return! Think i just found my new favorite spot!!! The window seat is EVERYTHING!

Super tasty ice cream and mammoth shakes! We had the New Yorker, with strawberry cheesecake, and it was definitely enough for two people. Service was nice, and the ladies at the counter were helpful. It took us about 5 minutes to get our shake with one other person in line. Parking is plentiful. Only complaints I have are that we had a hard time finding a place to sit because tables were not clean, and the noise level was pretty high. Otherwise, a pretty cool stop. 

Update: after going back a couple more times, the hype has died down. Yeah, this is cool, but there are better places
The repair they made did not fix the problem. Worst experience ever. Called Sears and received the correct diagnosis. Had to buy a new machine in the end.
This pub is right down the road from where i live. This is a must try facility. I promise the wait is worth it! Cheap beer, great music, great games, and by far the best homemade pizza around!!

Disclaimer: The decanter at the front door is not cucumber infused vodka. 

When I first entered The Island, my eyes immediately went to the large dispenser containing clear refreshing liquid with thinly sliced cucumbers floating inside.  I jokingly asked, "is that cucumber infused vodka?".  The jovial cashier, gave a hearty laugh and informed me it was "just water". I have to admit I was disappointed, but once I sampled and filled my bowl with Froyo I was whisked away to a tropical "island". 

Those big chain Froyo shops have nothing on The Island, in fact The Island has them beat with flavor, toppings and customer service. I'm a purest,  I like my yogurt plain like my flavored vodka. I like to experience their true flavors to the fullest. 

My "island" experience included; Madagascar Vanilla, Root Beer Float and Cheesecake. The Root Beer Float was as if you truly were having one, except it was all yogurt and no soda. If you crumbled up some graham crackers with the cheesecake, you'd think you were eating the real thing. However, the Madagascar Vanilla was my favorite, it had true vanilla flavoring. Even as a child my favorite ice cream was vanilla, I guess old habits are hard to break. 

I also grabbed some Banana FroYo to go, we had a neighbors birthday to celebrate when I got home from this UYE.  I forgot to mention this was a UYE sponsored by Miss Soulard herself, Mandie M.. If it were not for her, I would have never discovered this delightful yogurt shop.  By the way, the banana went great with a chocolate cake.

I've been here a couple of times. I really want to like the place - they have a lot going for them. The outdoor space and overall design are top notch. The problem I find with it is the pricing structure of the beers. They have a lot of low abv, sessionable beers, yet sell them at a relatively high price point. I would gladly pay top dollar for a really great, complex beer, even if it's low abv. Unfortunately the price is not right. Both times I've closed my tap I've been blown away at how high it was, not sure if I'll be back.

Very good!  The catfish and sweet tea were spot on.  It's been a while sine I had good southern food.  I had the spicy catfish and I like spicy but it was a little over the top for me.  We were warned by the lady taking our order, but it sure was delicious just the same.  I'd order it again with the spicy liquid on the side.  My wife ordered the fried chicken that way, which was excellent.  I will definitely be going back.  Spent the morning at the arch.
15 minutes later... still don't have my food.  Only one car ahead of me when I pulled in the drive thru.  And to boot - the lady at the window is just as pleasant as could be... Not!
Best food ever! Really cool bar place for all ages. Expect a wait though. All the burgers, the frisco melt, and the dirty fries are the best!!

Stopped in after a Billikens game. Narrow menu- 1st time but will not be the last. Reco the Figgy Piggy. Figs, caramelized onion, bacon and creamy ricotta. Kinda sweet but with the cheese a very nice combo.YUM! Their dough is really good. Crusty on the outside with a slightly chewy inside. Mate had the puttanesca. Salty olives and capers, chicken, cheese. Also good but more classic tastes. Also tried the beet salad. Citrusy dressing on arugula. Actually really tasty with jicama(?) Fat pecans and little bits od orange. Very tasty and had i not been so bowled over by the Figgy Piggy the salsd would be the star of the review. Cant wait for another Bills game so we can come back to try orher versions. Almost forgot. Staff was super friendly.

Holy moly was that good!!!  Did not expect much, given it's airport food, but we got the house salad, a couple beers (Pumpkin seasonal being the standout favorite) and a custom dish of chicken parm over spaghetti with meat sauce.  Odd that they don't have it on the menu.  We had to order it off the sandwich menu and substitute with Al, our bartender.  The chicken was fresh and yummy, the spaghetti was perfectly cooked and THAT SAUCE!!!  It must have butter in it or something equally addictive. Definitely on our short list the next time we are here!!!

It is a Holiday Inn so I didn't expect the Taj Mahal. Great value. It felt like a boutique hotel. The front end staff were professional and baked chocolate chip cookies for all the guests. They called me in my room to see if I needed anything. Great place to stay.
Not sure if they are understaffed or what, but the drive-thu is pretty slow.  Not sure if they are understaffed or what, but the drive-thu is pretty slow.

Mark was super helpful in finding the perfect option of a futon for my office/guest bedroom. He was very friendly and not pushy at all. 

The delivery guys were also very nice, but took out a huge branch of my neighbors tree as they were backing down the street to deliver my furniture. They did push the branch out of the street (after I requested they not leave it in the middle of the street). However this left this large branch splayed over my neighbors front steps and the sidewalk. 

I called and spoke with Thomas Grogan (warehouse manager) and told him what was going on. I also sent pictures. He said he would leave early and come out and remove it. He did come out and broke down the branch and put it in his truck. He even knocked on my neighbor's door to apologize. I'm so thankful that this was taken care of and I think Thomas went way above and beyond! Kudos!!

OMG this is one of the best finds I've ever stumbled on in St Louis! From the smoky tomato bisque and the fresh succotash to the pan fried chicken.....this place is the BOMB!!!! Oh, and to top it off it was one of the most affordable meals I found as well!! Sooooo goooooooddddd!!!!!!!!!!

Went here with my dinner group last week. I should note that I am the one with the Southern roots, who knew what a 'meat and three' is, and recommended it. I was not impressed.
First off, I do not understand why we're standing in line to order, and being served on institutional-style metal trays. It adds nothing to the charm of the place, and it is certainly not 'southern' in any sense. 
The food was uniformly mediocre. I had ribs, which were kind of dry and VERY salty, mashed potatoes, which were reminiscent of what they serve at KFC, summer squash with a sunflower seed pesto--the highlight of the meal--and cornbread. I am so tired of places serving cold, obviously hours-old cornbread. If Red Lobster can get fresh hot cheese biscuits on your plate every five or ten minutes, why can't other places serve hot fresh cornbread? It is really only good fresh and hot; it is nothing but a disappointment otherwise. 
Two of my friends had catfish, which looked pretty much like nuggets, served (for some reason) on a piece of cold white bread. My other friend had the special Korean ribs, which he shared out to the rest of us, apparently not that impressed with them. They all had greens, which they said were 'alright.' 
Fortunately, the place is not expensive, so we didn't waste a lot of money. But I absolutely fail to understand the hype surrounding this hugely mediocre eatery. Can't see myself going back.

Completely a rip off.....bait and switch. Their online quote was $64....but when I got to counter, it became $250. Real jerks.
It is clear they are part of Enterprise rent a car. 

Try Hertz. Much better experience.

POST REVIEW:
Dear Customer Care....
Here's a better idea since i will NEVER rent from Enterprise or National again (and I rent once a week as a Hertz Gold member)....
Since your Executives are in St. Louis (less than 10 miles away), try the experience yourself as a blind shopper. It is not my job to do your job for you. This way, you can "enjoy this pleasant experience" personally like the rest of us.

Look at your ratings- they are accurate. Embarrassing, especially since his is so close to your global HQ.
Good food for being in the Airport, loved the selections of beers.

I lived at at Fieldpointe for about a year and a half.  It was okay.  I will list positives and negatives about the staff/location/apartments in the bottom of the review.  My biggest gripe about the company is that if you do not sign a renewal contract (i was planning on moving but did not have a location when my contract was up) you pay an additional $200 dollars ON TOP OF MARKET PRICE FOR RENT.  This is not anywhere in the contract but is in the "welcome booklet" and gets glossed over in the paperwork section, so don't let them rush you through it.  It is not even initialed to indicate you have read it.  This could very well be legal but it is definitely shady.  However it is easy to get your security deposit back as long as you do what is indicated on the move out instructions.

Pros:
-rent is relatively cheap as long as you get some sort of deal for x amount of months
-Windows block lots of sound
-quiet area
-close to 270

Cons:
-depending on where you live in the complex there can be a lot of kids playing in the parking lot.  there is no apartment complex playground so you have to be vigilant not to squish one.
-buildings have lots of charm but the insides don't.  make sure you get a tour of the apartment you'd be renting. Not just the model
-If you need two things repaired don't bother submitting it on one repair request or two separate ones on the same day.  only one will get done.
-Not a very fun or lively area (hence its quiet, it is a double edged sword)
