We stopped in to check out the new breakfast hot spot in the Lou. When we showed up I had a feeling it was going to be good, there was a line out the door and to me that's a good sign. We walked into a fun atmosphere, ordered and sat down. When it came out it looked so good, the second I took a bite out of the biscuits and gravy I knew I was in for a treat. Best biscuit and gravy I have ever had. Every single thing my wife and I ordered was beyond amazing and not only that it was all fresh. Everything they have is locally grown and sourced. NO frozen food here. If your looking for a great place to start your day this is it, if you don't live close its worth the drive. We will be back!!!

Rented car for 9 days for vacation, needed to pick up car 6 hours early and was no problem. Went to emerald isle and could not find what I wanted and they allowed me to pick any full size car that was on the lot. Very helpful in getting the best car for the trip. Will definitely rent again.
Five piece chicken tenders only two were good size The other three are pretty scrawny

I just worked here not too long ago. About a month ago. This place sucks so bad!! Theres one manager who hated me, I could tell. She always had some issues going on in her life and took it out on us. Especially me. She is the most rude woman to ever enter that place. She would always emotionally push me away. She always pointed fingers at me everytime something went wrong. She was always throwing fits. One time it was 7pm and these customers had TOGO orders. They didnt get their food for almost an hour. There was about 3 people waiting. They tipped me and blamed her. That made me happy because I can't stand that stupid woman. Shes evil. She knows who I am and I hope she sees this. Bad management, unhappy employees.

I hadn't been to The Black Thorn Pub in over ten years. No specific reason just geography. I will say someone cleaned it up a little bit. It's not quite as dusty and dingy as my last visit. They used to have a stuffed Noid (The Domino's Pizza mascot) as decoration and I clearly remember him being caked in cobwebs and dust. My Dad and I were having dinner and he chose Black Thorn. We ordered a large House Salad (An Italian style salad, served with homemade vinaigrette) and a 14" Chicago Style Pizza with Pepperoni and Hamburger. We were prepared for a wait because we both remember waiting over an hour for food here in the past but I must say the service was speedy tonight. Their beer selection is really great and they have $2 pints of PBR if you have simple taste. The salad was fresh with ample amounts of cheese and a nice bite from the vinaigrette. I'm a fan of thin and light St. Louis style pizza but I have to say this cheesy deep dish concoction really made me sorry I hadn't been here in ten years. Their sauce is hearty and slightly spicy. I can't even fathom how many pounds of cheese they used on this one pizza or how many calories are in one slice of it. By the way I was only able to eat one full slice plus another one inch slice. This is a true South City gem. I'll be back and I won't wait another ten years.

Buying a mattress long distance ( for my son at SLU) is rather difficult, especially if you need it delivered.
 The very nice and very helpful people at Preferred Mattress made it all go smoothly.
They advised me honestly about mattress quality, were concerned that we be happy with what was chosen, and arranged delivery.
 My son now has a very comfortable bed, and he is indeed happy!

From my experience ( and I assure you I spoke to other mattress people in St. Louis also....who were NOT So helpful) , I can recommend this firm highly.
Always amazing.  I am a vegetarian and they always cater to my pain in the butt needs.  Thanks Haven!!

When did this place get such a good selection of oraganic and vegetarian/vegan fair???

I just moved home and was...well, not so much missing my Shaw's with it's hordes of BU freshman buying frozen pizzas, but was desperately missing the fairly decent vegetarian/organic section I had grown so accustomed to over the past few years.  I ran an errand for my parents and was shocked.  I was thrilled to be able to get my soy pommegranite chip ice cream and my toffuti (that I used to have to drive to Brentwood and get at Whole Foods)  Finally, somewhere in South County helping a vegetarian girl with a lactose problem out.  

And in case you are interested, they still have the same sick collection of teeny bopper magazines they had when I was thirteen.  Good to know the Andrew Keegans and Jonathon Taylor Thomases of today still have a home at Dierbergs.

This is by far the best deep dish pizza I've had in Saint Louis.  Their sauce is a bit spicy, which makes Black Thorn incomparable to other deep dish.  My friend and I will pick up Black Thorn a couple times a month and the pizza will feed both of us and leave enough for another complete meal, totally justifying the $20 price tag.  

We always do carry out because the atmosphere leaves something to be desired--it is the epitome of a dive bar.  It usually takes about 45 minutes to cook the pizza, so we always call ahead.  The staff is friendly and efficient--we have never had to wait for service and our pizza is always been piping hot and ready to go right when we get there. 

Bottom Line: Go for the pizza, not the atmosphere.
Outstanding breakfast place, when you're tired of the traditional breakfast stuff. If you're in a hurry, check out the drive-thru. They also do cakes.
Great ice cream.  it was a busy place tonight.

Grace Meat + Three might be my new favorite spot in St. Louis. 

It's a nod to southern flavors and traditions right in the heart of STL. If you're a fan of chicken, turkey, or really anything with a good bit of spice, this is the place for you. Definitely start with the Deviled Eggs. The blend is perfect, and the presentation is adorable. For mains, the chicken (hot is REALLY hot) and the turkey leg are our personal favorites. You really can't go wrong with the sides either. The mac and cheese is a particular favorite, as are the collard greens.  

While not a traditional meat and three in the sense that there is no cafeteria line, there are nods to the concept in the flat pricing of the sides and the cafeteria-inspired serving trays which were a cute touch.
Fantastic beer and service!!!! Great gluten free options as well.. we definitely plan on coming back!

I'm giving 3 stars for the very friendly and helpful team that works here. Kudos to their patience with these big crowds.
Since this place is brand new, expect long wait times, very long wait times. I would say the food is okay. I kind of think it's the ugly brother of KFC. Their chicken strips were just okay nothing special and the Cajun spices are very spicy! The $5 box for lunch or dinner is a good deal. not sure if I'd come back being the chicken at KFC is better still.
Yummy deep dish.  Comfortable hang out.  Takes a while to make a deep dish pizza, so relax!
My kind of place! Dive bar with great Chicago-style pizza. Time flies playing shuffleboard, video games and sharing pitchers with friends.
Rallys is decent for fast food. I had a stomach ache afterwards, but hey that comes with fast food. Service was quick and efficient.
This is one the nicest studios that I have seen around St. Louis. Everyone is friendly and very helpful. All of the instructors are super helpful and all bring something different to the table.

All I can say is YUM! I have wanted to try the pizza for years and finally got around to Blackthorn Pub last week and we loved it! Ordered Sausage Onion Bacon Chicago style and we ate it for 2 days afterwards :)  so good and cheesy. Bartender was very nice, and due to it being very early on a weeknight there were just a few regulars so it wasn't too smoky yet...In my top 5 pizza favs in STL without a doubt!

Got a chance eat here today. We split the crunchy and pipping hot fried green tomatoes. Fried chicken was delicious crispy and spicy and totally worth all the anticipation . My husband really enjoyed his mofu as well. Between us we tried the mac n cheese, pickled beets, three beans and the turnip greens ( sigh!!! Sooo good). One of the servers was very friendly and went out of her way to talk to us about the concept, dishes vegetarian friendly choices etc.  
I was concerned about parking, but there was a lot of street parking around. There is a public parking lot diagonally opposite to the restaurant. 
The ambience was great, including a beautiful mural which has been in that spot for a very long time. 
The only problem is that they call out your name when the food is ready and it is sometimes hard to heard over music and conversation. But they just opened and hopefully will get the kinks straightened out soon! 
This is going to be my go to place to bring visitors to taste the amazing food of St. Louis.

Duped again... I'm a Chicagoan and pizza is a very serious business. Now with that said a friend recommended I go to Blackthorn for "Chicago-style". First of all whoever declared this mess "Chicago-style" has clearly never been within 300 miles of Chicago. Oh wait you say St.Louis is 300 miles form Chicago then that make this just  pure blasphemy. I was just so excited and this was a disappointment. 

Ooo I like my pizza super burned oh wait you don't like your pizza burned then why the heck are you in this place? 

THe ingredients were good and I think if I'm ever tricked into going to this place again I'll order thin crust only.
Nice place while waiting for a plane.  Staff was friendly and attentive.  Had a burger. It was pretty good and reasonably priced.
Wow! Fantastic comfort food that is truly comforting. Wonderful staff that will speak to you like you're an old friend. I'll keep this one in my pocket as my go to. Amazing experience!
Great car and service. The return location is complicated to find- signs are hard to see and are far apart.

Wonderful experience. Each morning the gal who checked me in said good morning and remembered my name.  The room was clean and I had no issues.  I brought back some leftover ribs from lunch and asked the bartender if there was somewhere I could heat this up.   He took it to the kitchen where it was heated in the oven and put on a plate.  I give the staff a 2 thumbs up for courtesy!

Food tasted good just like their regular establishments, but the menu did not have all the options.  Specifically the salad.  I love the pasta house salad and this airport version only offered a small one.  Also not one person in my party had an artichoke heart.    The baked mostaccioli was great while the baked macaroni and cheese was bad.  Well probably because it was noodles in Alfredo sauce with bread crumbs, very odd and very bad.  Was not pleased with this meal compared to my normal expectation of a pasta house.

This is our go-to pizza. It's a dive and it may take an hour and a half to get the pizza, but we are so busy drinking cheap beer and g&t's and playing darts that we don't care. Call us the honey badgers of pizza. We've done carry-out here several times as well. The pizza stands alone as amazing and quite tasty (we always get the Chicago-style) but I really dig the scene, too.

The pizza was great and unlike anything I have had.  Very heavy on the cheese and the sauce was a bit on the spicy side - which I like.

Server was nice at the times she stopped to the table.  Service was good and beer selection is also good.  This is a neighborhood "dive" bar but it has a lot of charm and I would recommend to anyone who has not been here yet.

$0.40 per oz of frozen yogurt spells out alot of trouble for me this summer. This place is top-of-the-line and just what Soulard needs. Couldn't have opened at a better time.

The flavors here are changed up VERY consistently. I've been here several times now only to find new flavors each time. At least 50 different toppings are offered. Great hours (11am-11pm) and a perfect location.

The interior is neatly done in a cheesy type of manner that fits the "Island" theme of the place. Personally I wouldnt sit down and eat in here and I havent seen too many people doing so. Seems that most opt to eat outside (or take it home). 

Perfect spot to stop at if you are eating in the neighborhood and need your sweet tooth satisfied. Give it a try and it won't disappoint.

Favorite toppings offered:
Cheescake bits
Cookie dough bites
FRESHLY cut strawberries

Favorite Flavors:
Yellow Cake
Red Velvet Cake
Peanut Butter Blaster
Chocolate Milk-Shake

Arrived here on Friday around 11:15. Which was perfect because this place was slammed around 11:30 on to 12:15.
My friend and I decided that the sides really appealed to us so we were going to order 3 sides and one sandwich to split. We had the catfish sandwich. It didn't have a catfish fillet but catfish strips so it wasn't the easiest to split butt that was on us.  (When we ordered the person taking our order said shed maker sure we had a separate plate to divide up our food.  Speaking of plates, they were trays... very cool.) The catfish was breaded in a nice cornmeal crust with a little kick. I don't remwmber there being any telish on it at all. We could've gotten it spicy but I'm a wuss. It was prefect.  Our sides were macaroni and cheese, mashed butternut squash... my fave, and roasted summer squash. We each had an adult beverage.  They were good but served in a jelly jar. I liked the presentation but for the price they were really small.  The 3 stars is because we talked more to the workers than to each other.  As soon as one left our table after asking how we were doing and if we wanted our player taken another stopped by.  I appreciate you checking on us but seriously the visits were non -stop. 
All this being said I'll be back... I have got to try the Fried Green Tomatoes, the Fried chicken,  the beets and the cornbread.
I'd also like to know what the meaning is behind their name.

Oh baby. Oh baby baby baby. 

I've been wanting to try Black Thorn Pub for ages. AGES! And tonight, I finally was able to try it. 

I met a friend here around 7pm, and it was pretty empty. We grabbed some seats at the bar, and immediately ordered a 14" Chicago deep dish with pepperoni and green peppers. We were both super hungry, and I heard that the pizza takes a while to cook here (and they only have one oven, apparently?), so we got right to business. 

After our order was placed, I was able to soak in the atmosphere a bit. Black Thorn is definitely a dirty dive, but I'm cool with that. There were a few pinball machines and such. Loud (and awesome!) music was being pumped over the loudspeakers. A couple of Muse songs were in the queue, which made me happy. 

I thought the service was fine. The girl working the bar was aloof, but nice. 

It took about 30 minutes for our pizza to come out, but it was DEFINITELY worth the wait. Piping hot and so so SO cheesy. Everything about this pizza was perfect. It was cooked perfectly. It had the perfect amount of toppings. The sauce was flipping FANTASTIC. The cheese was ooey gooey. And it was filling. 

And by filling, I mean that it took me 10 minutes to eat one slice, and even though I was ravenous at the beginning of the meal, one slice was all it took to bring me to a comfortable level of fullness. ONE SLICE. And friends, I am NOT one of those "Oh, I just took a couple bites of salad and I'm full! Tee hee!" types of girls. I can pack it in. And this totally filled me up. I'm going to stop now, because this is starting to sound dirty. 

Anyway, the pizza was fucking fantastic, and it's not a matter of IF I'll come back, it's WHEN.

I have been here several times, and have always had a fantastic experience. Their hot stone massages are heavenly! Their prices are expensive, but worth it. I would come here every week if I could afford it.

There are few things that lure me out of the city limits, and the extraordinarily delicious breakfast here is one of them. The portions were a lot more than I expected. Also, don't sleep on the breakfast tamale. Wow. You can tell the ingredients are top notch and there is great care put into making each item. A great place for a casual breakfast or brunch.

In the old sweetie pies location. I love the space. It's HUGE and with plenty of seating. Everything is nicely decorated and cozy. The pulled pork was good. I kind of wanted to add some sauces. But didn't ask. The corn bread wasn't great but the cauliflower was amazing. The bread pudding was also delicious. The boudin balls were my favorite.
This months Special the Get Scrambled Calzone is incredible.  Making breakfast more exciting throughout the day.
Great fast food menu and good price options. Burgers are delicious and I like their thin crispy fries.  Not healthy but when you want something quick fast and cheap.   It's one of the better Options.

The little white woman who works this McDonalds in the morning is a real jerk. I went in there in the morning to get a cup of coffee and instead of using their cups all I wanted to do was get a refill. A guy behind the counter advised that was fine then this woman walks up Yanks the cup out of hand gives it back to me and says we don't refill cups. Instead of offering to give me a regular cup of coffee she just turned her back and walked away. I spoke to the manager later that day and he was very nice and offered a very sincere apology however that woman still works there and she was never disciplined for her conduct towards towards me. I guess you get what you pay for in McDonalds wonders why nobody is going to the restaurants any longer, they hire people who are low paid low skilled and educated workers who treat customers like they don't matter.
This happened on the Kings Highway McDonalds on South Kings Highway
Awesome breakfast and super quick! Try the pancake roll up or pancake dippers. The biscuits and gravy are also very good. Live having a restaurant like this close to home.

Black Thorn is located in the Tower Grove South neighborhood among the houses at the corner of Wyoming and Spring.  I've heard so much about this place since I moved to the city in February 2009.  We finally decided to go a few months ago to try their deep dish pizza.

We got there at 5:15pm on a Sunday evening, right after they opened at 5pm.  There were already a couple people in there.  It looked very old and a little dingy but Zack and I enjoy dive bars.  You could tell it was authentic.  If you're looking for a "hip" place to get pizza and don't mind spending more, go to Pi.

Everyone at Black Thorn orders from the bar.  When they call your name, you come up to get your pizza.  It took a little under an hour to get our Chicago Style deep dish pizza.  Since it was early on a Sunday, we didn't mind, but if you're really hungry and don't want to wait, this isn't the place to go.  However, the long wait sure builds up your appetite for the huge deep dish pizza!  Zack and I ordered the smallest pie - 10", with pepperoni, onions, and sausage.  That's only $15 which is pretty affordable for a dinner for two (plus a few drinks while you're waiting).  

The pizza was delicious!  They layer in the toppings so that in one bite you get dough, sauce, toppings, cheese, another layer of dough and then more toppings, sauce, and cheese.  We usually take a couple slices home.

I had such high hopes for this place.  You just can't get a good Chicago pizza around here.  Black Thorn has a good looking pie, cooked well, not too soupy.  Lots of toppings, and the crust is tasty BUT... that sauce???  If you actually look at it, you can see it's around 50/50 tomato and spices.  The spices are not good.  It's way too much and you can't taste anything else, which is a shame because everything else seems superior to most pizza joints.  Change that sauce to something simple and you might actually have something worth talking about.

Well, I guess it is clear from reading the other reviews that we are not alone.  And, I will say, this company clearly has no quality control from the local providers to the corporate office.  Here is the review we originally posted about the local provider ADCO United in Crystal Lake, IL followed by our updates until resolution.

10/11 - The worst experience!  We still keep thinking  we are being punked, but so far no cameras or big laughs.   The movers used our items without permission.  I actually saw one of the guys riding down the street on my husband's bike.  The same guy told us he was underpaid.  Another told us about his DUIs.  They wanted us to sign documentation noting damage of our items AFTER they loaded the truck and drove it away, making it just a bit difficult to inspect.  Our items arrived with damage as heavy items were packed with fragile pieces.  We now have broken crystal, plates, glasses, figurines, etc.  Furniture was also damaged.  Paperwork was missing and so was our queen bed, 10 ft ladder and a couple smaller items.  We did receive the bed the next day as it was delivered to the wrong place.  We are STILL waiting for them to deliver the ladder.  It's been about 2.5 months since the initial delivery (middle of July).  We were told they were too busy to bring it to us -- seriouslyl!   As for the other items and damages -- no resolution there either.  Just a lot of excuses.   They've even attempted to blame us for their mistakes.  Fortunately for us the documentation showed differently..  In speaking with our contact at ADCO today, he told me that he felt we were not waiting for anything - even after I reminded him about the repairs, ladder and claim check we are still waiting to receive.  When I asked if  he felt they deserved the money we paid,  he said he does.  " We are beyond disappointment.  We know things happen, but certainly not this frequently and then for such little effort to be put forth to correct the problems is really just adding insult to injury. This may be the best example of the worst attitude toward customers ever.

UPDATE 11/4 - We were told by UNITED corporate that they were working on our claim at the beginning of October and we'd soon see resolution.  The corporate contact seemed sympathetic and shocked by our situation. Surprise!  It's a month later and our local contact told us corporate would resolve the claim this week.  I contacted corporate and you probably can guess, we saw no resolution this week.  In fact, they will not even tell us when it will be resolved.  I even offered to help with any additional info they may need from us.  PLEASE NOTE - I strongly encourage everyone to post under the corporate office in Missouri.  They go under Unigroup.  Also, contact the Better Business Burea.  Somehow these guys have an excellent rating.  I know there were allegations of the BBB selling ratings, but I would still like to think they will not ignore all the complaints out there.

FINAL UPDATE12/21 - We finally received the majority of our claim.  After going up the food chain yet again at corporate, we finally came to a settlement.  Whatever you do, do NOT give up and keep moving up the food chain until you get to someone who is not simply in place to serve as a roadblock.. It appears they set up a system that they hope will tire people out so they do not have to take responsibility and pay for the damages they cause.  And for those who have NOT used United yet, simply don't do it!

Called with a dryer problem and they scheduled a home visit right away! The technician was extremely knowledgeable and very professional. Explained not only what was needing to be repaired but also how it had happened and how to avoid a recurrence of it in the future.  So happy I called them! Highly recommend!

Found this place after Lemmons closed and couldn't get pizza there anymore! The menu looked exactly the same so I was assuming I was going to get the same pizza. Of course I got the Chicago stlye which is just ridiculous but that's the whole point. Although similar something was different from Lemmon's pizza. The crust was a bit more doughy, there was less cheese, and possibily a little more sauce.

That being said it's still a great pizza. Takes about an hour to get but this isn't the place to come in for a quick bite. They had a good beer selection at decent prices, staff was friendly, and overall had a nice vibe. Bathrooms were disgusting though. My toilet was clogged, the door didn't lock, and looks like the place hadn't been cleaned in days. Though it did seem suiting for this place lol.

Overall was a good food, good beer, and a good time. Still miss Lemmons though :(.
Total, total dive, but wow the pizza is amazing!!!! The deep dish is out of this world (try the bacon) and the salad was decent too! Will be going back!!

My husband and I rent from
National whenever it is an option. My recent trip to St. Louis for a family emergency was made easier by the Emerald Club. I enjoy having control over the choice of vehicle. It also allows you to try different makes and models of cars you may be interested in buying.

The service started out fine for our family but wasn't great after that.   It took a very long time to get our food.   Others had sat down after us and gotten food before us.   I got my entree salad first and after a few minutes the two fish sandwiches came out.  Then 10-15 minutes after that my daughter got her pasta.   By the time she got it, she was crying, and  I had mostly finished my salad.   We had inquired a few times with our server about her dish and eventually told us the kitchen lost the ticket.  My son was told mayo would be on the side of his fish sandwich, but we had to ask for it.   Also has to ask for cheese for the pasta.     

The food was greasy in general.   I had low expectations and they met them.  The Mediterranean couscous salad had a little couscous but mostly salad greens.   It was very oily and over dressed.   The salad was supposed to have Parmesan cheese, but I couldn't find any.  Not a big surprise.   The fish sandwich was fried (ok) but the bread was extra buttered (very greasy).   

To their credit, they comped the pasta that came out late.   Unfortunately I don't know if there are any better options to eat at the airport except Starbucks, vino volo, or maybe CPK.

The deep dish pizza is amazing from this place. The sauce has a bit of kick which I appreciate, and the crust is phenomenal as well which carries a lot of weight for me with regards to pizza. I don't think the ambiance of the bar was really my taste but I won't fault them for that as it's part of its identity as an establishment. would 5/5 recommend their pizza to a friend.

Had a wonderful visit to sauce on the side this weekend. We hosted my family bridal shower in the back room and had a great experience. 

The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our group and made sure we were taken care of during our event. 

The food was very tasty as well and came out quickly. I had the "Meet me in St. Louie" and might have inhaled it it was so good. My group all had different salads and calzones and everyone really joined it. 

Thank you so much for making our experience a great one. We will definitely be coming back.

Great food but , $2.14 for a cup of water?
Really?
This is crazy
Guess I'll have to go somewhere else to get something to drink, might as well eat where I can drink water for free.

I was so happy to see this update to the old chocolate bar... great new bar and New Orleans vibe! I hesitated getting the chicken and waffle as I tend to be disappointed but it did not disappoint! It was in fact great!
our group tried the hush puppies and the red fish poor boy all were great! So glad this place is here in STL!!

I went here tonight for dinner and it was fantastic. I loved the atmosphere! The beer selection on draft was diverse and the food was great! I had the steak tacos and dip trio app! Both were delicious. I can't wait to come back.

I was impressed! This place just recently opened and the customer service was amazing! We came during mid dinner rush last night and it was packed. We sat at the bar and our bartender (labeled Bar P on receipt) was so informative and was always checking in on us no matter how busy he was.

A great local woman owned company. Fixed the standing water in my fridge and came the same day I called to diagnose the problem. Honest and upfront pricing. Couldn't have been happier with the experience.

I'm not exaggerating when i say that every single time we take food to go there they ALWAYS forget stuff, sometimes just all of our sauces even the extra we paid for, sometimes half of our food, or we will get regular soda instead of diet and have to throw it out. Not once in 6 visits has the order been correct. At first i thought it was my husband lol but when i go it's the same thing. You cannot pull away from the window before checking everything, make sure you have sauces, there are enough boxes of food to match what you ordered (even tho items in box may be incorrect) and try a sip of everyone's soda before you pull away, even if someone is honking at you. Because if you park and go inside with the order it's a bunch of side wards glances, eye rolls, and cold food for the time it takes them to discuss the matter and decide what to do and actually produce food, and fried stuff microwaved is no good, so don't bother going in for a correction, figure it out at the window. Sometimes they are crabby too, if you are ultra polite to them with please and thank you's they usually turn it around and are polite back. Their fried chicken is good, we were happy when they came to the neighborhood, they are a much welcomed establishment. But FYI you can tell the blackened chicken strips are commissary made then reheated in store, not this locations fault at all, but to other health wise that that can tastes the retail chicken preservatives like me, yea not so yum.

This is the slowest drive-thru I've ever been to. Ordered 2 sodas, at 9:45am on a Sunday. We've been in line over 15 minutes. This is ridiculous. If I hadn't already paid, I would pull out of the line.

Horrible. I called the 800 number and they gave an appointment for next Wed. Then I got a call from local mover saying they have no availability until 3 weeks late. I called the 800 number back to check what is going on. The young man seems to be very sleepy and told me "if the local mover has no availability, then there is no availability..." Sorry, you lost a business in 30 seconds although I know you don't care

Filthy cars (interior)... I had to pick up baby wipes to clean up the greasy interior.

The car needed an alignment badly ablbd the steering wheel would stick at center.

This is the second time that I had a bad experience here with poorly maintained vehicles.  The last time the car I rented had bald tires on it.

Wow, fantastic!!!! I normally order the meet me in St Louie, but the individual that took my order suggested "the fold" to accommodate my requests . It was cheaper and tasted amazing, so much so that I am sitting here eating it for a second night while I'm in town . I can't say enough about how great the service is and how fast the delivery was. My food was delivered hot, my sodas were cold, I'm happy !!!
I've become a regular customer  and look forward to coming to Clayton so I can eat here.  My only suggestion would be to open one in Indianapolis indiana so I can bring my friends !!!!!

PokeDoke was one of the highlights of my last trip to the central west end. Being from KC we always seem to be the last to jump on the new food crazes and the poke bowl is one of them. I indulged in a create your own bowl and was not disappointed! The staff was extremely helpful in choosing complimentary sauces and other toppings on top of what I had already ordered. I will definitely be returning on my next trip to St Louis!

Good food takes time should be Black Thorn's motto! Yes, the pizza takes time to cook. I usually grab a few beers and play a few games of shuffle board and the next thing you know is the best pizza in the world is ready for you! Even though the bartenders swear they are a pub first and a pizza place second they are wrong! This is the best deep dish pizza in STL or any other city in the country! I have been all over this country and in every city I try to find a pizza better than black thorn and I can't find one.... The second best thing about black thorn is that the left overs are just as good the next day!

I really enjoyed Grace Meat + Three. We came in on a Friday night, about 6:45. From the first contact through the end of the meal, the staff was very welcoming and friendly. And the food, oh boy, it was fire. 
The only thing mildly confusing is that the food isn't automatically meat and three sides. You actually get 2 sides and the 3rd would be extra. No big deal, just a little confusing based on the name and how I've seen other meat + 3 places in the south. 
I had the spicy catfish with green bean casserole and cauliflower. I also had the Excel-lent Gin Collins which was really good and refreshing. The spicy catfish was perfect - the breading was soft and stayed together nicely. They are not joking when they say spicy (you can get it not spicy, too) - I drank a lot of water! :) My husband had the turkey leg with mac & cheese and sweet potatoes. I tasted all of his food and was equally impressed. The potatoes were so yummy they could be dessert on their own.
All in all, the ambiance, the friendly staff, the quick service and delicious food made this a 5 star experience. Can't wait to come back for lunch sometime and try some more items! Really happy to have this place in the Grove which we already frequent often.

We found this wonderful place using our yelp app. We eat in Crestwood often and it was great to find something new. I had the Nest - soft poached eggs in a biscuit bowl made from scratch with cheese bacon and wonderful seasoning! I was also very pleased they offered a gluten-free bun-most restaurants have not yet caught on that you could carry gluten-free bread and still not have a gluten-free kitchen necessarily. Often people are sensitive to gluten not all are allergic to gluten.  The only downside is it's very small and most seating is communal. We'll go later after lunch the next time! Fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious!

Totally NOT the same owners and NOT the same food. The service was good, they've made improvements to the interior and expanded the menu but I honestly was disappointed in my food. The fries weren't the same, but the seasoning was! I got the chicken philly like normal but it was just really not good...tough, dry tasteless meat with too many hunks of onion and like two little green pepper pieces. I was bummed because this location always had faster service than the one on Jefferson but I'll take my familiar Pop's over this place any day.

How have is taken me this long to find this place?! I drive by all the time and finally went in after checking out other yelp reviews. Daughter loves picking out a beautifully decorated Nemo cookie. These cookie artists are fantastic! They spend time with so many cute, and yummy, details. They have fountain diet coke (a requirement in my book) and have excellent iced tea. Lately I've been sitting here with a croissant breakfast sandwich and get work done on my laptop until lunchtime. They start to get pretty busy by 11:30 and seem to do a booming lunch business. The atmosphere is quiet and friendly and comfortable. They have a darling patio too. Love that it's locally owned too!

I stayed 5 days. The location was very convenient but the property itself is lacking. My room was musty smelling with a small 70s concrete block balcony with view of the parking lot. I spent a lot of time in my room working and one day I waived off Housekeeping when they knocked on my door. The next day I personally asked Housekeeping to vacuum my room as there was debris along one wall. I don't think she knew what "debris" meant as I had to show her where I thought I spied a chunk of cat poo/kitty litter along the wall. When I returned afterward, the chunky bit remained as well as other bits that told me there was no vacuuming done... My white socks were yucky after a day working in my room. The Housekeeper the next day took care of my concerns. Really, is that too much to ask? Ugh, sticky carpeting... It was cheap though, less than $90 a night. But I think I'll go back to Home Suites.
Honestly my favorite ribs in the city. Better than pappys, bogarts, or anywhere else.

I'd give it a zero had it given the option this place is seriously messed up. My credit card was stole a few days before my scheduled reservation. Very rude hotel.. I called at first since I booked thru Orbitz to cancel my reservation since my card was stolen I had to fly to a bank branch to get a new card asap. I asked if I could cancel my reservation I had two separate reservations one was a 2 day reservation and one was a single day reservation following the 2 day reservation. They told me no my reservation if I canceled it would be charged so I said OK well one day I won't be able to make it there because I'll be in Florida trying to get a new card it'll be there the next day everything was OK I go to Florida I come back I got a check in the can't find my reservation my reservation got canceled from the hotel due to the fact I guessed of my card being stolen so I was like OK no Buddy either with Orbitz or the hotel informed me that it was canceled and even if they didn't have to and for me I didn't know so that got canceled I had a state a different hotel they said will we still see your reservation for tomorrow so we will see you tomorrow I said OK I go there the next day to check in and now I'm on the do not rent list I was banned from the hotel due to my credit card being stolen and me not being able to check in on my first original reservation. They told me I canceled too much I think maybe in a year I had to cancel another time or so just because I'm not from this town and my work schedule is spontaneous so they allowed me to get my money back for the first two days that they canceled the reservation and the last day the night manager was telling me that I would not be refunded that money but during the day the general manager agreed to refund it it's just bullshit that you can be banned from the hotel and treated so badly over somebody else feeling your card, things and weather that you can not control shouldn't take it out on u

Received a gift certificate for a head 2 toe package.  I don't usually write reviews but I thought the service was exceptional. The table with the sound and vibration just added to the experience. I'll be back!
Great price. Great service. Clean, comfortable, and updated room. The free wifi is a bonus too.

Well they knocked it out of the park again. As the warmth of Southern has begun to deteriorate Grace Meat+Three has all the personalities you miss. The food is spot on, they may have added the phrase "perfectly burnt toast" to my vocabulary.

Love this place!!! So excited poke has made its way to STL! The young gentlemen who helped me with my order was so excited and has such a wonderful spirit! As I watched more and more customers come thru, his big smile lit the room! I thank him also for his service :)
Only comment, I would love a low carb option as a base besides lettuce. I've had a poke bowl with kelp noodles that was fabulous. Just an idea if there is a market for It. 
Way to go!!!! Will be back soon!
The wings is the best sometimes the order is wrong but when I want crispy they give it to me. The workers have always been nice and I just enjoy rally's all together

I stayed here again and they have been amazing. It was really clean, comfortable beds, and the staff has been great. We booked through a third party for a discounted rate. We needed to extend our stay because of being snowed in and they booked us an extra night and matched the discounted rate. On top of that, they upgraded us to a room with 2 queens instead of 1 (which came standard with our third party booking). The hotel has a lounge and a restaurant, so being snowed in was not terrible. Awesome place. I HIGHLY recommend it.

One of the best SNS experiences I've had in a long time. They served the chili Mac with plenty of noodles, plenty of sauce and the guy at the drive thru was super happy and friendly at 6 AM on a Sunday morning!

I go to the Daily Bread usually every couple of weeks for lunch.  The food is always good.  It's along the lines of Panera Bread Co., but with more of a local feel to it.  They have plenty of sandwiches, soups, and salads to choose from.  Everything always tastes fresh.  The restaurant gets very busy during lunch time but the cashiers move the line fast and the food comes out in good time.  For people who are going for the first time, I would recommend viewing their menu online before going to the restaurant because it can be kind of overwhelming when it's busy and you go to the register without knowing what you want to order.

You will know immediately you are in for a great treat by the fact that patrons come and go constantly--this place is rarely ever "slow".  Patrick changes the menu frequently for the season and I am always enticed to try the latest menu item.  Never disappointed.  Their mountain cookies are fabulous as are all the baked goodies.

Just moved here from Chicago and have been craving good pizza! This place came highly recommended as true Chicago style. The crust was super bland and the pizza was fine but far from Chicago style. On the hunt for decent pizza here in St. Louis...
Once again, I have to share how much I love this Place!!!! Great food - Better Staff - Awesome Environment.  Everyone should try my favorite neighborhood spot ;)
Fresh food, quick, friendly staff.  Some favorite items have fallen off the menu that I wish were still available!

I've had their steak sandwich and it was great. Went back and got their rib tip sandwich and 1lb of pulled pork and both were also great. The second time I went I wanted to get the baked chicken I eyed the first time and I still got all bbq... The baked chicken and/or the smoked turkey looked like promising healthy(er) options. And it's super reasonable. The 1lb of pulled pork was $12.50. The best part are the employees; the employees are super sweet and genuine. It's my new spot for days I don't pack a lunch.

Great poke place in St. Louis - reliably fresh fish/shrimp and toppings, with the ability to do soba, rice or salad, which is a plus. Very reasonably priced. Definitely not the most amazing poke I've ever had (that was in Hawaii), but I like coming here for a quick but satisfying lunch.
Comfort food at its finest! Service was stellar ...portions were huge and the value was great! Loved the lunch special and the carrot cake! What a gem!
If you like soupy cheese on your pizza this is the place for you.  Service was slow and literally waited 15 minutes to have someone come pick up my payment. Never again.
Trey was very polite and professional, I will definitely be calling them again if I have any more trouble with appliances.

I am from Chicago, and this pizza is better than both Giridanos and Lue Malnati's. The sauce is sweet, but also has enough spice to add a little kick. I would reccomend this ad THE pizza to try if your in Saint Louis.

Do not engage. Even if you're starving you'll die just from the wait. I don't know how many time I repeated my order clearly, waited 30 minutes, and they still fucc it up every time. It's like the Whitehouse runs this place.

We (me, my wife and our 16 y.o. daughter) had a late lunch at Circle 7 yesterday.  The place was not crowded and we were seated promptly by a pleasent hostess.  

The booth was comfortable and we found the taps at every table very interesting - especially fun for those who like beer.  The interior is filled with largeflat screen TV's everywhere you look. I will admit I personally do not like this in any restaurant.  The place has a strong sports bar and restaurant vibe.  

The menu was fairly typical for this kind of a place.  My daughter ordered the Tuna Taco's which came with rice and beans and my wife and I split the Brisket Natchos.  The natchos were a 5 on a 10 point scale and the tuna a 7.  The brisket on the natchos was fatty and was not cooked for service.  The portion of chips was generous but the rest of the ingredients were skimpy.  They need to up their game - smoke the brisket or cook it rare and prep it on a flattop for service the way you would for a great philly cheese.  The tuna tacos were decent - nothing to get excited about but certainly acceptable.  We'd wished we had gone to Nacho Mama's.

The service was good and our waited was very nice.  

The bill was $28.73 before tax.

Will we return - probably not.

Would I recommend this restaurant - perhaps for someone who wants to tap their own beer watch a plethora of TV's and eat acceptable food.  Otherwise - I would suggest you try someplace else where the food and atmosphere are both better.

Excellent!!  Minimal and delicious!  Could use music in the background and the styrofoam plates are a turn-off but the food more than compensates!  Order preference:  pork, crab and shrimp.  Didn't try the chicken.

Went there in the early afternoon on a Sunday. It was so busy they ran out of a lot of the menu items. I had the classic breakfast, with two eggs, sausage, a biscuit and gravy, and two Yukon potatoes. It was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had from a restaurant.

I was hesitant to try this place given the recent unveiling of a similar restaurant that has really hit the fresh poke bowls and nachos thing out of the park. But, my friend said we should give this a chance and I am always up for something new, so off we went! I had extremely high expectations and PokeDoke exceeded them. At first, I felt some pressure to create my own poke bowl from scratch. However, given the large number of toppings allowed (and encouraged), my bowl was extremely unique and flavorful. They offer toppings such as seaweed salad and mango and boy is it good! They also have about 6 sauces to choose from and don't frown upon you choosing most of them. We were highly impressed with the fresh and very flavorful food and we will be back!

Nutshell: airy and trendy feel, rich and simple flavors, I'd recommend a stop in if you're passing through.

Rolled up on a Sunday morning and it was me, the barista, and two others.  The windows were open and the breeze was fine!  The menu is small, but that being said it seems like they do quality over quantity.  I settled on the apricot and walnut scone with a lavender latte.  The scone is chunky!  Its about the size of your fist and has huge walnuts and apricot chunks.  Paired with the blackberry (I assume) jam, its the perfect Sunday brunch item.  I was suspect of flowers in my coffee...but I'm converted!  The latte is light and has a beautifully light lavender flavor.  Everything ran about $9.  Personally that's on the upper scale for me when it comes to breakfast, but it is all tasty.  The local is really convenient, right off Chippewa behind the Hampton Village shopping center.  I'd come back.

Excellent service great staff and good food !!! The owner is very caring and attentive to he's customers which keeps us coming . I always walk away happy and a full stomach can't say enough about this place every one has to try the Chicken which is perfectly seasoned .
These good people at National provide top notch service every time I'm there.  If there is an issue they get on top of it immediately.  I'll use them any chance I get!

My first trip to Sauce on the Side was an A+ experience. Someone will say hi to you when you walk in giving you an instant feel for the friendly neighborhood atmosphere. You order at the register from a selection of about 15 different calzones and salads. The cashier was very friendly. All calzones are made fresh to order.

I ordered the Carmen. The spicy prosciutto and capicola combined with smooth ricotta and mozzarella was perfect and flavorful. The crust was the perfect combo of soft and crisp. The garlic sauce was an excellent complement, not too salty or garlicky.

I will definitely be back and intend to try a dessert calzone while I'm at it!

My heart may reside in St. Louis, but my stomach yearns for Chicago. I'm fully convinced that Black Thorn makes the best deep dish pizza in the 'Lou. 

This is one of those places that more people should know about.  Sure, everyone's been to Pi, but you haven't had deep dish 'til you've tried Black Thorn's version of it. The sauce? Spicy. The toppings? They load 'em up. Cheese? Plentiful. Get your fork and knife ready. Oh, and before I forget: it's stuffed crust too. Has the mere thought of this creation conjured up images of entering a blissful food coma? It should.

What I like about Black Thorn is that it is more of a bar that happens to serve pizza, than an Italian restaurant. No ambiance here, just grit and great food (oh, and a shuffleboard table!) So, you can certainly order carry out, or if you'd like, call up and order your pizza in advance so that it's almost ready when you and your friends arrive for some beers. They take about 30-40 mins to cook.

In closing- if you like deep dish pizza, check out Black Thorn. Their take on pizza is a lot different than Pi or your typical Giordano's/Gino's, but delicious in its own way.
We can't wait to come back to St Louis to have our favorite pizza! We miss good STL eats and especially Black Thorn Pizza!
Great service, especially for just opening and being incredibly busy! Good food, will most definitely be back to try more on the menu

This place has got a personality all its own, and it's definitely the black sheep of the family, but in a good way. As long as you don't come here with overinflated hopes about great customer service you should be in the clear, because the pizza is pretty awesome. Sure, the back room of the bar looks like an abandoned subway tunnel 200 years after the nukes fell, but so what? It's really freeing every once in a while to just let it all hang out in a place with pretty much no expectations.

Back to the issue of customer service...I've gotta say that I came in with a chip on my shoulder and my fingers crossed...mainly due to Christine's experience (yikes) and the fact that the first time I went there (which was at 1 pm on a Saturday) they were closed. What bar is freakin' CLOSED on Saturday afternoon?? Does not compute.

Anyway, once we got inside everything was coming up roses. There was a creepy middle-aged couple playing tons of Aerosmith and GnR on the jukebox, Animal Planet on the TV, and a girl with Justin Bieber's haircut behind the bar. All was right with the world.

We ordered a Chicago style pie with a whole mess of toppings and retired to the back room to occupy ourselves with Cricket and Galaga. Our pizza took about 30 or 40 minutes, announced by a bullhorn hanging from the wall. So yeah, don't come here if you're in a superbig hurry or if having your name called through a bullhorn reminds you of the police. My advice is to occupy yourself trying to hit the dartboard with behind-the-back throws while you wait.

I want to say I loved the pizza, because it really WAS good and thick with toppings, but all the cheese on top was burned all the way around the edge. =( 5 stars if the cheese isn't burned on top, that's all I'm sayin. $22 for a 12 inch deep dish with 4 toppings.

I'll be back, fingers crossed, soon.

Unfortunate, hokey name but don't let this stop you from coming here. I had the Johnny Ham Hands. An elegant, over-sized cheese puff serves as the 'bread' for ham steak, egg, and salad greens.  Crisp, tender, delicious.  I also had a side of hearty breakfast sausage. The coffee is strong and the atmosphere is energetic, fresh, and inviting. AND, they have a drive-thru!

Two of us split the chicken wings, they were very good! Not much sauce on wings, so we ordered extra sauce. Waitress brought us a small container of sauce, no problem.
I ordered the steak sandwich. The menu stated "BEST IN THE CITY", 10 ounce strip. I also emphasized, "rare". 
What I received was well done, and looked like a thin cubed steak. Wasn't very good, certainly NOT the best in the city! The bun was OK, and I'm glad I ordered the onions & mushrooms, even though they charge $.50 extra for each, they made the sandwich edible.
Waitresses were nice and friendly, but stay away from "THE BEST IN THE CITY" steak sandwich!!!

Great service, sat @ the bar where you could visit with people. I had house salad: fresh & great. 
Toasted ravioli accompanied this for lunch. Was hot & tasty. Good portions for lunch.

Plugs under bar which is a great option.

This location rarely fails to disappoint. Today I waited 15 minutes for chicken nuggets. I learned this was because three preparers couldn't see the sleeve of containers right in front of them. When I did get my order, the 40 nuggets were packaged in 10 small containers (four each).

The pizza is good, not noteworthy. But the drinks are good and the atmosphere is so cool. I've been back a few times because it's a fun, low key place to hang out and play darts/table shuffleboard tucked away in Tower Grove.

Amazing and well worth the wait! Based on mixed earlier reviews I decided to I've the place a few weeks to adjust to customer demand/ preferences etc. I got every topping (except kimchi and avocado) to taste everything. 

Pro:
- variety of topping options
- the workers took great care and made sure I got every scoop and arranged the topping beautifully 
- serving size was well worth the price 
- I was sad with every spoonful that I'll get to the end, which always ends up being a five star experience! 

Con:
- fish could be colder 
- Need bigger scoops for the fresh toppings or more variety of fresh options

We ate at the Pasta House before our flight. I had the House Salad, which had iceberg lettuce which was a little too limp, although the dressing was alright. I also had the spicy chicken club sandwich, which I really enjoyed, it came with fried chicken, bacon, lettuce, onions, tomato and a spicy tomato aioli sauce. I also had the T IPA which was decent. Overall this was pretty standard airport food.

Prices listed on website were not the price we were charged for window tinting. The price online is apparently for a different window film and they don't bring that up to you at the store unless you mention it. I wasn't pleased about this and was given a small discount for the false advertising. Other than that, they did a good job on the window tinting.

I don't get it... Everyone raves about this pizza but it's just not good. The sauce is so over spiced it taste like soap. There is WAY too much cheese. It takes forever to cook. The bartenders are really nice and I love how divey it is, but I just can't get into the pizza...

I have only tried one thing here so far, but it absolutely deserved a 5 star for what it was: a really good, memorable sandwich! Plus you get chips or fruit with your sandwich which is a nice bonus.

Friendly place, too! And the service (my order was to go) was fast.

I ordered the Sonoma Chicken Sandwich. Really solid! Everything tastes fresh and they know how to actually make a sandwich that doesn't completely fall apart when you eat it, which I can't say about most places.

Look forward to going back to try more!!

I've done the first half of my open water referral course (theory and confined), a nitrox cert, various equipment purchases, and now a regulator service with Y-Kiki. I can say that each time I've worked with them has been an absolute pleasure, and would unequivocally recommend them to anybody looking for a dive shop in the area. 

My OW referral course was excellent. Diane helped with set up the course and with my initial purchases, and she was fantastic. I took the theory and confined dives with Scott and Matt, both of whom were consummate professionals. I did my nitrox with Scott, and I've bought gear from him and Phil. All of these people were amazing, and I'd give 6 stars if I could just for the customer service this shop offers. 

The two shops (more on that below) are fully stocked with quality gear, and they can order stuff for you from several companies if they don't carry it. I haven't gone on any of their dive trips, but I signed up for their emails and it looks like they offer several to exotic locations throughout the year. They also have a couple dogs running around the west county shop. It's basically how a good small, locally owned business should run. 

Note: Since this branch is one of two and it'd be too complicated to separate out my experiences, I decided to write the same review for both.

Wow! Ultimately a true Punjabi restaurant in St Louis! I don't have to go to Chicago now! lol
Chicken Rogan Josh and Kadhai Lobster were really delicious. The Samosa also was the best I've had in some time. The menu is pretty big and am sure there are lot of great items to be discovered here. (Chicken Sharabi, is something Im curious on) 
The prices seemed very nominal
Faluda kulfi was decent
I won't give high rating to the ambience but hey, as long as I'm getting authentic Punjabi food, I swear I won't complain!!
Thanks!

Such a beautiful shop with some the most friendly staff I have encountered! I love how you can watch them create the beyond shakes! They are so delicious everything tastes so fresh! This is a family fav for sure!

Unfortunately my terminal does not have a lot of breakfast eating options, but I gave this place a shot. First impression- my server did not look happy to be here and was pretty short in talking.

I had an Omelet, the back pieces inside were whole and tasted as if they were cooked a few hours earlier and then reheated in a microwave before going on my Omelet. It was not good quality, as I see they hide ones with fat pieces inside. My other problem was that I was only served 2 ketchup packets when asked. The one redeeming quality was that the portion was a decent size, even though cheese on would cost extra.

I was going to give this place 2 stars because it's an airport restaurant for breakfast, so I did not expect much to begin with. However, after I asked my waitress for my check she left, and headed to the bar area, but stopped and chatted to the manager and another staff member there, about a workout DVD (it was pretty easy to hear I was one of two customers there). This took 3 minutes, then she got my check, and chatted with the other employees for another minute before bringing me the check.

Restaurant has street side parking. So good luck finding a spot close. 
The restaurant has very modern and cool setting. Lots of staff members. Very friendly. Told them this was our first visit. So they answered our questions about the menu. They have a different type of mix of calzones. Their a nice size, plenty big. Two people can really eat one. 
We bought drinks so we could try the different flavors. 
The calzone was alright, I just didn't like the greasy of it.

Really good sandwiches.  The bread was crazy-fresh.

I had the Tuesday special, which was turkey, ham, and bacon.  The meat was fresh-sliced, the toppings quality, and it was just a really fantastic sandwich.

The counter person was extremely polite and helpful.

I'm definitely going to be back!

Thank you Trops for not dismissing STL altogether after the last location closed. The grove is the perfect place for you to be and this location is awesome! 

I came here last Saturday with a friend and the place was jumping! Sadly because of the rain, the patio wasn't open, but even still, the place is huge with lots of seating. The variety of slushies here is great, just like the one in COMO. You can also mix the flavors to make your own boozy delight. The prices aren't bad either. The small is $5 and is definitely enough. The service by the barkeeps is also great.

One day soon I'll come back and try the Guerrilla Street Food and enjoy the patio. Can't wait!

If I want someone's dirty hands pawing through my underwear, I will ask my husband to do some gardening.

A few months ago, my husband and I had to move on very short notice, and having recently had our first baby, we had neither the time nor energy (nor sleep) to deal with the details of packing and moving our stuff.  Adding to the issue, I still own things I had back in elementary school.  I will, however, argue that the cowboy Barbie with the red chaps will come in handy someday.

We hired United Van Lines to pack and move our things to our new place in Seattle.  The two person packing team showed up 30 minutes late, and the leader immediately asked to use our bathroom.  (In San Francisco, some of the older homes have split bathrooms - toilet in one room, sink and shower in another.)  Well, the he went in and used the toilet, then came out and went straight to work TOUCHING EVERYTHING WE OWN without washing his hands in the adjacent sink room.

Eeeeeeuuuuuwwww!  Wee-wee cooties all over everything.

Later, I walked in to the bedroom while they worked and saw Mr. Toilet Hands pawing through the drawers which held my delicate under things.  He said he was "checking for heavy things".  I noticed that he did less thorough "checking" in my husband's dresser.  Again, I say... euw.

Also, things arrived broken, scratched, and generally mishandled.  Scheduling was a complete nightmare and the lead mover (different than the lead packer) was rather incompetent, repeatedly forgetting to call to update us on their progress, leading to more than one occasion in which we sat for hours waiting for them to arrive.

Two stars because some of the people were genuinely nice, and it was easy to tell those people were doing their best to give great service.  That said, I won't use them again.
If you haven't been to Grace what are you doing with your life?? Been here several times and the food is amazing. You can really tell when people like to cook and impress others with their food.

We bought things from drive tru four times, 
They ALWAYS lost something,
For example, last night I order TEN pcs wings,
It just FIVE pcs in the box!
They forget things EVERY SINGLE TIME!
We will not go there again!
I am a business traveler / do your self a favor don't eat here - I have tried it twice in 6 months and it's awful

We were there on Sunday around dinner time and everything was out except tofu. I later on read someone else's review about the same issue - if you don't go there 1st thing in the morning, sorry, we only have tofu.

I understand this is due to the concern of food refreshness, but this is the only place that does so among sooo many poke restaurants in the US I've been to! I know this is STL but this is just ridiculous. Since I don't work in the area, guess I will NEVER have chance to try their food.
Do not go here if you want quick food. It took over 18 minutes for two happy meals. Unbelievable. Inefficiency galore here. Wonder if McDonald's corporate is aware of this. Ugh.

Needed new glass for my iPhone 5. Happened to see their sign earlier in the day so decided to stop in this evening.  For about $75 less than the Apple Store charges, they replaced the glass in 12 minutes. 

That's right - 12 minutes.  

Works great.

If I could give a sixth star, I'd do it.

You know what's better than hanging at Black Thorn with a pie and a pint? The smokeless air. I know, I know. It's a pub. If they didn't serve more pizzas than beer, I'd be all over the "go ahead and smoke" rules. But they serve more food than drink. Now I can go there and actually sit and eat. I'm in dive bar heaven.

Southern food and southern hospitality done right. We were greeted at the door by Rick the owner. He Gave a run down of the menu and answered all of our questions. After telling him what we were craving and with his recommendation we went with the house made bologna sandwich and the three piece hot fried chicken with grits and collard greens. 
Both were perfect. The bologna has and egg and pimento cheese on it as well. The bologna is house made and was fabulous. The hot chicken was the left amount of heat that didn't over power great fried chicken. I am sure you can not go wrong with any of their sides but if you have never had collard greens before this is the place to try them.  I think the best surprise of this meal, is that it didn't leave us feeling over full. Do not worry about being weighed down after such a homey meal, because everything is both full of comfort but still lite. This place will have you feeling like Home while eating out! Best southern food in STL!
Wow!! Food was incredible . I had the steak sandwich and can't wait to try other menu items. Service was spot on.

I am so torn on how many stars to give this place... If it was based on just the pizza, I would give it 5. I'll start by saying that their Chicago Style is definitely not for everyone. There is a TON of cheese and the sauce has a lot of what I'm assuming is oregano (which I love) so I can see how it's not everyone's cup of tea. I personally love their pizza but it's definitely something I would only eat once in awhile because it is SO filling. Like I ate it for dinner last night and it's now lunchtime the next day and I'm still full... I wasn't even able to finish two slices after running a freaking marathon.

The reason I only gave Black Thorn 3 stars is because of the service and wait time. I've never physically eaten there but every time I've called, the person answering the phone has been pretty rude. It's gotten to the point where I dread calling the order in. And I get that the insanely long wait time is kind of Black Thorn's "thing" but cmon now... Last night we ordered at exactly 5 o'clock on the dot when they opened and still waited an hour and a half. That is INSANE. I'm assuming unless people put their orders in a day in advance, our order is one of the first they had upon opening. I literally can't conceive of one reason why it would take one pizza an hour and a half to cook... I worked at a small (but very busy) pizza place in Chicago that only had myself and two other employees working at a time and we would get deep dishes out in 40 minutes MAX. It wouldn't even take an hour and a half on Super Bowl Sunday, so I don't know what their excuse is.  When my husband went in to pick it up last night, he said that people were being told two hours and were calling to cancel their orders. Long story short: I get it, your pizza is good... But what's the hold up?!

Just went there to get some food and they were closed before their advertised time. We were in line for the drive through and they just shut down the lights. There was also a car directly in front of us that got served. I am extremely disappointed in the service I received tonight.

I honestly love this place. There is some type of frozen treat for everybody! I enjoy stopping by here to get a frozen drink. I regularly get the bomb pop. It seriously tastes like the popsicles of my childhood, but with a bit of vodka. The employee I interacted with most recently was awesome. He was extremely polite to everyone in the shop and made you feel like you were a friend dropping by.

Great casual spot for a calzone - either for a family or a casual date night.  We did not leave enough time to dine at a full service restaurant pre-Fox one night, so ran into here with our 2 teenage sons.  I love the counter service, but dine in restaurant concept, such as with Crushed Red, etc, where you can count on quick service, but can sit and enjoy yourselves in a nice restaurant atmosphere at a comfortable table.  Not quite fast food, not quite table-service sit-down restaurant, and sometimes, that is just perfect.

We were in and out in about 40 minutes, which was perfect for what we needed.  We ordered pretty basic calzones - all were good and the plates were scraped clean by all!

This is a CWE gem! I eat here at least once a week just to treat myself. I usually get a small ahi tuna bowl with white rice, spicy mayo, and whatever toppings sound good. The bubble teas and crab Rangoon are tasty too
The ribs were delicious and the environment is very enjoyable! My wife and I loved coming here for dinner and the employees were all very helpful and curtious.

I walk into this place and I feel like I am with family!!! Not only is the staff so friendly, but the food is great and never disappoints. I recommend this place to everybody, especially those that are not familiar to the St. Louis area because it is one of the best places to eat and hang out that our city has to offer. Chef Rick and his wife Elisa have truly  outdone themselves!

Best deep dish pizza in st louis. Don't believe me?... come get some. But order ahead cause it may take longer than an hour to make... and take it home unless you don't mind eating in a hole in the wall kind of place... and the owner is pretty straight to the point  so order yiur pizza and move on... we call him the Pizza Nazi, a la Seinfeld.  Not much of a chit chatter... Not a bad dude though...

This Lion's Choice has become the WORST and consistently has quality issues. Which saddens me as they used to be high quality with great service. We love Lion's Choice but are so frustrated with this location- we will finally not ever be back. They mess our order up 100% of the time, even when I try to repeatedly confirm with them. It is extremely disappointing.

Update: Were going to try the medium, but they raised their price to $10/small, $12/regular???

Update 2: Got a regular with spicy tuna. This time I actually had a lot of fish left over (and they were willing to give me a scoop of rice to help me eat it). I suspect the first time I went I was only given one of my two scoops. Regular size was enough to fill me.

Awesome to see a poke place! Would give it like a 3.5, because not enough food for the price and their fish to rice ratio was unsatisfying. I may have only received one scoop of fish though...

Environment: clean, good menu, and well-staffed so far. Choose your options at the counter style.

Size: smaller than I was expecting. $8 for a small: like a cup and a half of rice or noodles and maybe 1.5-2 tablespoons of fish. Just seeing them scoop the fish with their tiny scoop is depressing, even if you get a decent amount of fish in the end. At least the toppings were plentiful. They fill about 2/3 their bowl size, which makes it easy to stir but sad to eat. Still kinda hungry after their small; think you need to order a medium at least for $10.

Taste: yum! things taste good, nice and flavorful, and their spicy tuna had a pleasant afterburn.  Can't say anything about the freshness of the fish because only ordered spicy tuna and shrimp. They also have tofu. Base poke sauce is a sweet soy. A tad oversauced for my soba noodles but about right for the rice. 

Options: Good selection of carbs, fish, and especially toppings and sauces. Toppings include fried onions (crunch!), mango, pineapple, crab (for more meat), fish eggs (masago), seaweed salad (yum), and avocado for extra $.

Pearl milk tea: Ordered a green tea and it was brown; I think it was a generic milk tea? Decent flavor but cup was about 1/3 ice so it was gone really fast for $5. Good pearls.

This Steak 'n Shake location is the worst I've ever been to. I always try to give them a chance because it's right down the street but never will I return after this experience. Drive through time was over 30 minutes. Corporate really needs to make some changes.

Ate here today. Not sure what all the hype is about. Macaroni was dry and room temp. Collard greens were undercooked. Cornbread was dry and just ok. Really the only thing we enjoyed was the spicy chicken. Would go back for the chicken but the sides need help. Plus eating straight  off a plastic tray was a bit weird. Left a tip prior to being seated but we never received any service except when our food was dropped off?

My wife and I went here on Saturday for a late lunch. We had seen the relatively good yelp reviews and were looking forward to trying somewhere new, it seems like the city has been loosing good Asian style fare for the past decade, so I am hopeful when a new place gives it a shot.

On the upside the whole staff there was relatively friendly and attended to us right away. They have a patio and I do like to sit outside in nice weather, it did not look like they allowed smoking outside so that is an even BIGGER plus. Unfortunately, this is all I can say to their favor.

The inside appeared sparsely decorated and was not welcoming or comfortable so I was even happier that there was outdoor seating.

The menu is simple, maybe too simple? But ok and rolled with it. 

It was a build your own Pad-Thai or pho or Asian wrap. We and started with apps. I wanted Crab Rangoon and my wife ordered wantons. My CRs were cooked well, but the filling was very bland. They brought my wife what I would call "crispy noodles" covered in powdered sugar. When we asked why we received a desert, the waitress was like "oh..those are our wantons".

Uh..ok. She explained that other people had mentioned that app won-tons were "maybe a thing in St. Louis"....Yep... Look I love experimentation, but it would have helped if they had a blurb on the menu. 

I had a Pad Thai w chicken & avocado, egg, tomato, sweet pepper & broccoli. My wife had tofu, tomato, egg, spinach and snow peas. Let's just say they lapsed on the details. 

HINT: make a little cheat sheet for your waitstaff to use so they don't forget stuff. Memorizing an order may seem cool and hip, but screwing it up makes you look silly.

But to conclude, and most importantly: The food was bland and tasteless. It killed them to put a piece of snow pea on a dish? I do not want to go further as the rest of the meal was disappointing. I ate because I was hungry, but was glad to leave.

Clearly this restaurant is off to a poor start and I did not get the impression it would get better. The staff were wonderful and kind (and is the only reason I gave it an additional star) so this does not rest at their feet, this is a management and owner issue.  I do not recommend at this time and I am not willing to give it a second chance.

The other night I had a total craving for a salad and my partner, who didn't, were thrilled to see all the positive "yelps" about the Haven for many reasons, and off we went. It's exactly what I love, a friendly neighborhood place, with great food, service and prices! My partner ordered the ravioli as an appetizer for us-I recently moved here and didn't know about the toasted ravioli test! She then said the true test would be the Patty Melt; if it was good we struck pay dirt. Not only did we strike pay dirt-but there was distinct joy that the Haven uses crinkle fries! My salad was just what I wanted and our waitress was top notch. The friendly and outgoing service sealed it for us. We will definitely be back!!!!!!!! Thank you so much!
Great jj, fast service and exemplar food. Great place to go when want food in a hurry

Same experience every time I go there. Food's totally fine. Terrible wait times and people who aren't as friendly as they should be, especially considering the extended wait times....Decent food saves this rating

good eats, good coffee...and they'll cater, too...

if you like bread co., you'll like the daily bread for a change....gourmet soups, hearth-baked pizzas, salads, sandwiches including breakfast sandwiches, coffees, bagels & pastries.

usually busy at breakfast, brunch & lunch - never been there at dinner time. love the tango salad, daily double (pick a soup & sandwich). the daily bread special sandwich is r. beef, ham, salami, provel, pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pepperoncinis, & their own speical sauce on a french baguette.....yummmm!

coffee's good too. i've been to a couple of meetings here - push some tables together - works ok for that, though a bit noisy.

Great food.  Nice atmosphere.  Upscale BBQ with a twist.  Love the combo of BBQ and fried chicken.  No brainer, right?

Wish I could go once a week but I live in Cali.

New restaurant in Lafayette Square. Pretty good food experience. We shared 3 dishes, starting with the gumbo. Served nice and hot, smoky, a creaminess. Not an authentic gumbo, but good. Wished we had some authentic French bread! Next, jambalaya! Lots of rice, andouille sausage, minimal shrimp and chicken. It needed more protein and seasoning. The best dish, was the chicken and waffle. The chicken was moist, well seasoned and was drizzled with a cayenne pepper sauce. The chicken rested on a delicious waffle! Crispy. It was the winner of the 3 dishes we tried! One problem with the restaurant was the noise! We arrived early, very few tables, but very loud. The server had to bend down to discuss the menu! The noise is a big problem! And, no French bread! What's that about? If you are calling yourself Cajun/Creole, the Bread is a necessity!
Awesome! Manager is super friendly and was a great help in ordering. It's really nice that they'll split salad for you at no extra cost. Everything was super fresh and delicious.

Ever since I heard the name of this place, I have thought the menu items should be named after Bible verses to go along with "Daily Bread."  You know, like possibly the Mount Olive Bread or the Heaven and Hell salad rather than the more-common Fire and Ice.  Anyway, that's not the route they took, but the menu items are still  heavenly.  I have become addicted to the buffalo chicken flatbread, and I haven't been disappointed by anything.  I also really like their green tea, so I go against by more cost-conscious thoughts and get the big glass (and refill it!) every time.  I haven't yet tried their cookies, but they also always call out to me.

This is so far the worst National location.  I'm a National fan, but this place needs new management to get it back and running again. 

1.  It was a 20 minute wait for a National shuttle from the terminal to the lot.  We were trying to call them, but nobody was picking up.  Hertz buses came by 3 times while we waited at the curbside!!!!
2.  There were no midsize cars in the Emerald isle.  C'Mon???  What happened to the days when I can rent  something small.  There were several pickup trucks, minivans and small SUVs. Not one single normal car. The Executive Aisle had a bunch of normal cars.  
3.  it took another 10 minutes to exit the lot. It was so bad, the cars behind us were honking their horns!!
4.  The minivan we took was dirty!  Bottles of water left in the van and trash!

This has been a family favorite brunch location for years. 

Fresh ingredients, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, and delicious food! 

We have loved everything we've tried, which is most types of items on the menu. 

Also have great baked breads which we often take to go. 

Good breakfast/brunch/lunch/coffee place!

The Magic Carpet Ride is soooo delicious! I've never had another mushroom dish that I liked any better! The dough for the calzone is perfect!! The garlic butter sauce is fantastic! One of my faves in STL!!

Everything about this place just screams "home". From the type of food they sell to the ambiance and music, it's just comfortable. The food backs this up in a big way, it's straight up excellent. The Thursday night special porchetta is quite tasty, great sides, salads, and soups. I highly recommend the beets and the collard greens. 

As for dessert, the chocolate chess pie is like fudge with a pie crust, it's amazingly chocolatey and smooth, with a flaky, beautiful crust.
