No one gave a shit. Service was poor, no one was at the counter to take order, half of the people preparing food didn't have gloves on. Lots of people just standing around at the back. Food also took awhile to come out. I understand this is McDonalds, but still, this is new low.
5 for atmosphere, service and finish.  3 for food.  Not great food but really place and fun place to catch the game or casual fare.

This was a great place tucked in a residential area. The bartender seem pretty nice. The dish pizza was delicious. Topping on top of magnificent  topping. A decent take on a Chicago deep dish. Well obviously i didn't finish it so when i went to reheat it it wasn't the best.  Overall good place to enjoy pizza and drinks.

Rick continues to grace (pun intended) Saint Louis with the best southern fare around. The location is in the old sweetie pies building and they did an excellent job redoing the space to make it both gorgeous and comfortable. We tried the ribs and the sweet tea brined turkey leg which are both to die for. You absolutely have to get the mashed butternut squash, the homefries and the greens as sides. And of course the biscuits and three was incredible as well. Overall wonderful experience. We will be back many times!

My family and I ordered the fried chicken (sides: Mac n cheese and greens), half sack ribs (sides: Butter beans and sweet potatoes), and kids burger (Mac n cheese). The fried chicken and ribs were delicious. The ribs had a great smoke flavor. They were cooked perfectly. The chicken could have been more crunchy but that's my preference. The sides were okay. The best being the butter beans. The sweet potatoes were more of a purée--made it feel like it was baby food. The environment was nice and clean.
Love the fresh produce and the staff!! The salad bar is fantastic!!!  My only complaint is the older population trying to kill people on the parking lot..

This may be my new favorite restaurant in St. Louis! These soup dumplings literally melt in your mouth! We got an order of the pork, beef, and pork/crab combo and all 3 were phenomenal. I think the beef was my favorite though. We were still a little hungry after sharing between the two of us so if you're really hungry I would get 4 orders to share between 2 people.

I know this place is a big St Louis favorite, but I've been pretty unimpressed.  I've had both the deep dish and the thin crust pizzas and though I thought the thin crust was better, I thought they both were mediocre.  The biggest problem is the sauce--it tastes like tomato paste with some herbs in it.  Theres nothing special about the cheese and the crust is meh.  Its too bad because Black Thorn is so close to my house, but I won't be coming back.

Very rude service. We tried to order from the drive thru and left because the worker yelled at us. I don't usually give bad reviews, but i think people should know. I'm more than happy to elaborate. 3/8/2015
OMG my very first Poke experience. It was DELISH. the fish was fresh and the entire meal was very light and flavorful. I cant wait to go back.

Visiting from idaho I asked around for good food with a relaxed atmosphere. Grace meat + 3 did not disappoint.  

From the nice employees who met us at the counter to the very clean eating area. I highly recommend and will be back if ever in the area.

So it's not like they are cooking this up just for you; this is reheated food. Had the frittata with a side order of sausage. Tiny thin square of egg casserole with a couple of potatoes on the side. Frittata was barely warm, sausage was reheated to warm+ potatoes OK. With coffee, this was a very disappointing $16 breakfast.  All the disposable paper products are also a disappointment I don't care if you do recycle.

United Van Lines was hired to move our belongings from Iowa to Wisconsin. United packed our belongings as planned...and then subsequently moved the pick-up day numerous times. The original pick-up day was July 31 and our belongings were eventually picked up on August 18 (and delivered a few days after that), outside of our guaranteed delivery window. The delivery men that eventually arrived in Wisconsin were unprofessional and we had them leave everything in our garage as opposed to entering our house and putting the items in the appropriate rooms, like we normally would have done.

Loved this place!  A twist on the traditional pizza place, they offer a huge variety of calzones.  I had the special which was a buffalo chicken calzone.  The spicy buffalo chicken was perfectly paired with a biting blue cheese which is a must.  I could have done without the carrots in it, but it didn't get in the way.  Good place to go with a crowd as tables are easily combined.  Quite a few options to choose from, so I'll be back.

After I got rear-ended and needed a new bumper, Abra made the process as smooth as possible. There were complications with my insurance company, but Abra was fast and responsive and helped me get everything worked out. Thanks especially to Dennis who went the extra mile and even dropped off my car back at my house for me!
Amazing, quick, kind service. Portions are HUGE but inexpensive. Great place, lovely workers.

Food was less than average - if it wasn't so expensive and we had the time, we would've walked away. The Mediterranean couscous salad was a plate of greens w a small scoop of couscous plopped on top and an oil mixture (dressing) with so much lemon, that it was sour! The gyro was horrible, meat was almost frozen and pita was hard. Pasta was cold on top and by the last bite, underneath, there was some warmth. 

Beer was awesome, but for $9.50 ea, it should be. There's the one star. 

Skip it. Not worth it. Eat at your destination!

I had the "Meat Me In St Louie" and it was fantastic. Extremely generous size, both the calzone and the namesake sauce on the side. High quality ingredients.

You order at a counter, choose your own table, food is brought to you. Serve-yourself fountain drinks by Excel.
Who doesn't love lions choice? Great sandwiches. Delicious fries. We are regulars here! And have never been disappointed.
Tight space, but the food was great, and the staff was very quick and pleasant!

This location has to be understaffed. I'm not sure I have ever encountered a fast food place with a more consistently slow drive-thru. It is bad enough that I flat out will not go to this location anymore. To top things off, there are usually homeless people bugging you in line or at the entrance/exit.
Exceptional food and hospitality! Comfortable atmosphere. Enjoyed it and will return.
The five star review is because of the excellent service and hospitality here. The options are varied and the people that work here are always ready to explain menu items despite lunch time rush !

Their ingredients and sauces were delicious! A clean and cute establishment. They also have boba tea here but the teas only come in green, black, taro, and I think watermelon? 
While the poke bowl was worth every dollar, I thought $5 for a bubble tea was a little much. Some of my boba pearls were hard, and it was just an average sized cup. But if you're going for poke this is the place to go!

While wife and I go to Pi for our gourmet pizza needs, Black Thorn is our place of choice whenever we want comfort food.  If you're not used to college bars the decor will probably be a shock.  I wouldn't bring my kids to this place.  But you can't beat this place your looking for a cold beer and hot mozzarella to fill your stomach.  The chicago style takes almost 40 minutes to cook but if you love biting into a double layer of crust jammed full of gooey, warm cheese mixed with a few errant toppings, the wait is worth it.  As others have mentioned, the sauce is on the spicy side which gives the pizza a nice little kick.  If your a non-meat eater the topping selection leaves a bit to be desired, don't expect anything more exotic then olives and artichoke hearts if they have them in stock.  But in the end, even if the pizza is simple, in it's execution lies a comfort that leaves you wanting more.

Fast and easy pickup from the airport and off the lot within just a few minutes.  Was surprised at how good of a selection the Emerald Aisle had (especially given that I had arrived after 10:30pm).  Had a Black Ford Edge and absolutely no complaints whatsoever.  Next time I come back to STL, I'd rent from them without hesitation.

I'm writing this review after close to 3 years. My Organization booked through United Van Line when I was moving to Michigan to CT in 2012. Currently I'm moving from CT to AZ and while doing research almost every shipping company has negative reviews which I think is unfair if you don't give them credit when they executed the order as per your expectations. As I was packing my stuff I found the bill and thought I can share my experience.

Pickup: I told them they have to either come before 9 or after 5 but this guy calls me up at 11 when I was at work. Thank god it wasn't a busy day for me. I took one of mycolleague and went to my place. It was a towing truck. He told me that they would be collecting the cars for dispatch and dispatch from central location. I would have asked him to come to my work had I known that it was a pickup truck.

Drop off: It took  5 days before to reach CT. Since my company booked rental car for 2 weeks, I didn't care about the time frame. The driver called me the previous day and gave me a 2hr window. On staurday morning, he drove to an empty parking lot which is a block away from my hotel. It was a closed container. The driver was very polite.

Oh! Btw they charged 1000 plus. I would have been concerned about the price tag if I was the one who had to pay.

But overall the experience was okay. I would recommend them.

Decided to try this place last Friday after reading reviews and hearing from others how great the pizza is. We ordered ahead and then ended up going there to play darts while waiting for our pizza to finish cooking. Smelled amazing when I walked in so I figured everyone was right. We ordered a pepperoni & jalapeno deep dish & a little over an hour later if was ready (time frame was exactly what we expected, so that was fine). Took my first bite and was immediatley underwhelmed. They put a lot of spices right on the top, I don't like that, I prefer them mixed in my sauces.  Speaking of sauce, theirs was way too sweet for my taste, and I don't mind a sweeter sauce. What I did like about it was the pepperoni and the dough. I also loved how they stuffed the cheese right into the crust, that was delicious! Not good enough to get me to come back though, there are plenty of other delicious pizza places in the area instead!

Typical National Car Rental location - I had plenty of cars to pick from and picked one of my favorites. Fully gassed up, clean and ready to go - something that doesn't always happen!

The attendants were pretty fast and very friendly - acted like they cared I was a customer.

Not a far ride to the car rental and easy to bring your car back - though the signage could be better.

Excellent Indian buffet. Not always 100% consistent so they get a 4 instead of 5 star but usually wonderful food. Today we had a cabbage dish, several other  vegetarian, dishes such  as spinach with paneer cheese, vegetable korma, chana masala, curried eggs and dal. Other dishes were lamb biriyani, goat, butter chicken and tandoori chicken. There was naan, papdam, rice, potato pakora and a lovely carrot dessert. All this with several sauces and condiments. The quality is very good. My only disappointment is they used to serve Chai with the buffet. I miss it as it was a wonderful accompaniment. I also like that they mix it up and don't always serve the same stuff. For all you spice lovers this is the place. Not too much not too little.

I love the dumplings here!! And coming from the Bay Area California, that's high praise. Before I ate here, I generally thought Saint Louis lacked in the dim sung department. However, that's no longer the case with soup dumplings. 

The dumplings here are delicious! Granted, I only had the pork variety, so my review is limited. Nonetheless, I stand by my assertion that the soup dumplings compare to some of the best in America. With each bite, the broth comes rushing in a burst of flavor. Just writing about it makes me hungry!

What makes his review 4 stars is that STL Dumplings isn't complete. They serve their dumplings on styrophaom plates  and the venue is noisy, since it is under construction. However, that will hopefully soon improve and I look forward on giving them the 5 stars their food deserves.

I am Emerald Club so pick up and drop off was easy.  The only complaint I have is car selection.  When I got there, I saw multiple Jeep Compass's, A Fiat 500 and multiple Dodge Caravans. Other than the Fiat, there were no other cars.  Just SUV's and VANS.
The bagels here are the best I've ever eaten in my whole life. I literally dream about them.

False advertising! I travel for a living, I'm no stranger to rental cars and their fine print. Unknowingly rented with a mileage fee. The original quote included an estimate and I had put a one-way drop off St Louis to Florida, and said $0 estimated for mileage! I reviewed total estimate before booking and agreed. Never in my history of renting cars and I travel for a living, have I seen this. The other companies mileage based quotes always include an estimate for the one-way drop off mileage so that I'm fully aware, and the majority don't charge mileage anymore, worst case a one way drop off fee of $40-115. This was my third rental with National in one week and the others only charged a $40 drop fee. Why would it vary by location?

I have talked to reservations customer service managers at the drop off location, they have noted my account and I am awaiting a call back from the manager at the St. Louis location where I rented it. They advised me not to close out the account until this is resolved, so now it looks as if I have kept it several more days while I'm awaiting management's call to resolve.....

Will update this review accordingly when resolved.

This is my favorite fast casual restaurant in STL. I go so much that I've received two free bowls.

Being able to make your own poke bowl "chipotle" style is incredible. I love being able to get as many toppings as I want without an extra charge (except for avocado and kimchi). 

I believe the ingredients are seasonal because I haven't seen fried garlic and fried onion in a while(please bring these back). Go early because they run out of items towards the end of the night!

This was an excellent calzone. I got the figgy piggy the bacon was smokey with creamy cheese and hints of sweetness. The red sauce that it came with was balanced well. It was topped with quality cheese. In fact all the ingredients were really amazing. Six stars

Although this is posted very late, my wife and I wanted to comment on the service we received from United Van Lines / Suddath Relocation Systems in Deerfield Beach FL.  We moved from South Florida to Denver Colorado and it was the BEST moving experience we have ever encountered.  Our rep at Suddath was Bonnie Bottini and she was phenomenal.  We had no problems with damages, the moving truck arrived at both location when promised, the actual hauler Chris from Denver was the best.  There is not one negative thing we could say.  We would use them again without hesitation.

Patrice E and Mark R

15+ minutes for a salad and a fish sandwich with no line. This is my last time coming. I can see why it's empty at 6:30pm. I can get much better quality of food for $11 for the same amount of time rather than settling for the bottom of the barrel.

Best bang for the buck in the area! The kids meal is huge & cheap, $6 gets you basic pad Thai (you can get rice instead), egg roll or 2 crab Rangoon & 2 chicken strips...nice! The pad Thai for adults is big & you get to choose your toppings, one protein is included in the price. With the weather nice, they have 2 patio tables although ours was a bit rickety. If you are in the Hills, it's Worth the trip.

Finally made it out here with the family.

We ordered the following:
Rick's Famous Fried Chicken (Half, Not Hot) - Very tasty and juicy fried chicken. The seasoning was great and the breading thickness was just right. No complaints.
STL-Style Pork Ribs (Third) - This was my favorite for the night. Fall off the bone ribs with a raw sugar glaze. If you haven't tried this, I highly recommend it.
Cracklin Corn Bread - Not terribly impressed by the cornbread. Wasn't as moist as I expected.
Macaroni + Cheese - St. Louis has some insanely good mac n cheese, Unfortunately this wasn't one to top my list.
Grilled Carrots + Onions - My favorite side for the nice. The carrots had a great texture to them, not mushy and not too hard.
Caramelized Leek Soup - Soup had really great flavor. Definitely would get this again.

The main entrees were very good, but I felt like the sides were a hit or miss.

First off, I'll admit I'm a sucker for thick pizza and low key bars.  Black Thorn delivers on both.

Black Thorn may have topped the list as my favorite pizza in St. Louis.  Their Chicago Style is amazing - thick and doughy crust with crispy edges, gobs of gooey (non-provel) cheese, and smokey marinara sauce.  Extremely satisfying and a few slices will fill you for days.  Yes, as other reviewers have commented it may not be classic "Chicago" style with a second thin layer of crust on top - when I've had similar styles before it's been called "stuffed" pizza  -  but it's still great.  

I called my order in ahead of time pretty early on a Friday night and would recommend anyone else do the same, otherwise I'd have been waiting with nothing to eat for 75 minutes.  Wait times can be anywhere from 40  mins to 1 hr 30 mins.  Calling ahead can ensure you're not standing around waiting with no place to sit.  They do have carry out service so that's always an option.

That's another thing: the interior adds to this place's charm but also stops it from getting a better review.  Seating is very limited and there aren't really servers so when some couples sit, they'll stay seated.  I love the atmosphere the bar has, too.  A single ~30" tv, old beer cans, an old porch style overhang, and generally old decorations.  Old regulars sit at the bar yelling at the Cardinals game while an odd mix of hipsters, yuppies, and hoosiers enjoy old bar/arcade games and cheap beer.  It's just eclectic and fun. 

The outside face is completely unassuming. You can hardly tell this place serves food if you didn't read up before hand.  It's far enough off Grand to keep street parking fairly easy and groups of bar hoppers avoid it as it's off the strip.  

I'd recommend Black Thorn to people looking for a relaxing evening and some different, good pizza.  Don't go in expecting great service or the best ran restaurant and you won't be disappointed.  Rather than thinking of it as a restaurant, think of Black Thorn more as a cheap bar that happens to have a kitchen.

The "sound" and the "stone" difference is a real thing. And the ambience in the massage room is superlatively relaxing -- dark and quiet, and the scented oils were a nice touch. Angelique did a very nice job with massage.

I have been going to Y-Kiki for years at the Creve Coeur location.  I feel that it is important to patron local businesses as a small business owner myself.  The #1 reason for going to this location is knowledge.  You won't get equipment that fits this good or better fitting on the internet, patronizing local businesses.  In addition, they always have an array of trips to enjoy.

Third time here and no complaints   The food is excellent and the service is even better. Every time I have visited they are very busy but you would never know it by the quality of the food and service. The staff is so friendly from the hostess to the bartender, especially our server CharlesB  He is a rock star.  try the pork chop it is delicious , so are the nachos and wraps. Will definitely be back.
You may have to wait a while, but the pizza is well worth it. Great dive atmosphere and writing all over the walls as well as bar games to play while you wait.

First time today. Very good. Staff was incredibly nice and friendly.  However, one stinging issue that will keep me from coming back until fixed.  The bowls they use are thick plastic single use.  No real recycling option.  They could go down the street to Whole Foods and see who makes their compostable bowls they use for the food bar and try that.  That is too many plastic bowls heading to landfill.  Otherwise, excellent lunch.

I don't get it. All this fuss for this place, and I just really don't get it. I think the concept is neat, but from start to finish yesterday while here for dinner with my sister, we were totally confused. You order your calzone and drink, then seat yourself with a strange card to receive your meal from the servers, and somehow the staff knows to bring "you" the food you ordered. That was impressive.

My sister ordered The Fold (with pepperoni) and really didn't like it. Her quote was, "the best part of my meal was the Red Bull." Yikes! She really didn't like the ricotta cheese that's added to the calzones and said it messed up the texture of the dish for her. Also, neither of us liked the flavor of the marinara on the side. It tasted like some basic store-bought Ragu sauce with a few added unneccessary seasonings.

As for me, I had the Roasty Toasty and wasn't much of a fan. I should've ordered something different but it was my first time here. The pesto on the side was cold which was strange to me and I would've preferred it to be served warmer.

Based on how much people rave about this chain, I would like to come back and have a different item from the menu, but as of right now, I can't say I'm much of a fan.

First of all, I am never one to leave negative reviews; I have never felt strongly enough to leave one until now.  At this point, we are beyond frustrated and extremely disappointed in United Van Lines, and I think it's necessary for others to hear our experience before choosing a moving company.  

We used them for our recent move from Kansas to Texas and ran into problem after problem.  The first issue was that they gave us a one week window in which they would deliver our belongings, then did not deliver them until 6 days after the window closed.  Upon arrival, we had several items damaged.  

Just to name a few:
-Our washing machine is completely broken.  The knob snapped in half, and parts are loose inside of the washer itself.
-A large chunk is taken out of our antique, wooden buffet table from England.  There is also a piece completely missing on the front.  This upsets more than most since it is impossible to replace.
-A chunk of the wooden leg on our couch is missing.
-The bottom drawer of our wooden filing cabinet is completely broken and appears something got knocked through it.

Note that the people who loaded and unloaded our belongings at our homes were all wonderful and careful.  They were not employees of United Van Lines but third party moving companies.  
United told us that everything was unloaded off of the original truck and then loaded into large wooden crates before bringing them to Texas for our local company to move.  It is obvious that the United employees who loaded/reloaded our belongings were completely careless.

While we are able to make claims for these items, it is extremely frustrating and not all of the items can be replaced.  

I strongly advise you to choose another company.

Delicious food but small portions, not a bad thing.  They use paper plate/boxes to serve food which is great for environment and recycle.  Small seating area.  Order up front then sit down to get your food when called.  Quick service.
Truly a great experience. Food was amazing and the service was too. As close to a perfect brunch place as you can get.

My boyfriend had been telling me about how this was the best pizza in St. Louis. After months and months of never making it by, we finally made it in Sunday night. We got there and had a 90 minute wait for food but let me say: it was well worth the wait. That is definitely the best pizza I've had in STL! Have already recommended this place to all my co workers.

Living only a few blocks away, it was only a matter of time before I made my way to The Island Frozen Yogurt! Having previously lived by Flying Cow when I lived on SLU's campus, I had high expectations and The Island delivered.  I sampled the Pink Cupcake (personally a little bit sweet for me), the Chocolate Milkshake, & the White Chocolate Macadamia flavors and ended up getting the Madagascar Vanilla & Mint (which ended up being my favorites of the night!)  Overall, a good variety of flavors and toppings with a warm & fun décor.  I will definitely be back!

Wish I could say this gets better.  Read the "comment" from the company, claiming they've been trying to reach me.  Total crap.  I just called the 800 number they give in their comment, and it's one of those numbers where you have to go through a "survey" before you can speak with anyone.  
So, here's the deal, and it's very simple. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY.
For those that check the updates. No one ever called me to follow up. It's just the appearance that they care for a yelp review.

I'm drooling right now thinking of the left over pieces of the Chicago-style pie in my fridge from our visit to Black Thorn.

Let me say that I am not a lets-hang-out-at-a-smoky-bar kind of gal.  Black Thorn has just that smoky bar kind of atmosphere, so when we get pizza from Black Thorn, we carry out.  That being said, I cannot offer any insight to the pub experience.

I can offer insight to their pizza.  The Chicago-style pizza that Black Thorn offers is the best Chicago-style pizza I have ever had in St. Louis.  

On their pizza pie, their sauce is spicy and sweet.  They have mounds and mounds of cheese on and in the pizza.  When we order, we just tell them what we want on it and they come through.  My norm is sausage, onions, and mushrooms.  They do not skimp on the toppings.  Do not expect a puny pizza.

FYI:  Black Thorn is not Pizza Hut.  There is no "time frame" guarantee.   Normally, you get your pizza an hour after you order it.  If you order on a weekend, expect to wait two hours.  Plan accordingly.

What an incredible disappointment. Not a meat and three, for starters. A true meat and three charges you by the meat and gives you a choice of three sides included in the price. Here the sides run you an additional three dollars... each. The catfish both my partner and I ordered was not a filet but strands of unidentifiable white fish. We both ordered these not spicy and yet what we received was a mix - some strands were inedibly spicy some were not spicy at all. The cornbread was so dry - why even bother? Mashed potatoes... well, I've had better at KFC and I hate KFC. This place is in the location that was once graced by a true meat and three with soul. Oh Sweetie Pie's, how I miss you so! It's hard to sit in Grace's and not think, "cultural misappropriation." Misappropriation of southern culture, soul culture, black urban culture - take your pick. Grace's is really just an overpriced Cracker Barrel in a neighborhood where it does not belong.

Fries are addictive, but not worth getting gang jumped for. Twice i've visited this Rallys and twice arguments broke out in front of it.

Twice I also proceeded to run into my car and hope that the only thing following me to it was the smell of those insane fries. The low marks are for the area the restaurant is in, and even more so for the frequency of altercations experienced.

They may be good, but the only food I am willing to catch a bullet for is greasy fried rice. And Rallys doesn't have that.

This place was excellent! I got a make your own pad thai with beef and it was the best I've found in St. Louis so far. I'm eager to try everything else on the menu. The staff was friendly and laid back. Great experience overall.

I am not a huge fan of the rice and fish scene. Don't get me wrong, it's okay but I have never understood the passion. 

  Keeping my promise to not review within 48 hours of a visit, I have given this some thought, over the last few days.

  I stopped in the first week they opened. It was clean and the staff were nice. They were pretty well prepared and reacted pretty well to my indecision and ignorance.

  If you like the SoCal stuff, then this will be a bit different for you and maybe not as familiar but I found it to be more "Hawaiian" and therefore more authentic and not "Americanized" as much... the rice was starchy, which shows it was not over processed. The fish was very fresh. I only did lunch there (twice), so I did not see shortfalls in inventory that some of the other people have mentioned but I am thinking that since this place is new, they are still getting a feel for how quickly the types of their product move. I think I would rather eat at a fish restaurant that runs out of things, rather than seeing them try to stretch the meats out for another two or three days. 

  If I were in Kona, I might give this place a 4... you just can't beat the freshness and of course being in the Islands but the quality is excellent and I was pleasantly surprised. I might also be a little generous with my review after reading other reviews that seemed to "low-ball" their ratings over things that are not exactly specified.

  Bottom line, it is a solid 4 or 5. They are doing a great job so far and being in the middle of the continent, they are very good about keeping their fish fresh.
Love the decor. The service was exceptional. Great food and iced tea. Would definitely go back.

I had few hours before my flight and since they accepted Priority Pass and let you spend up to $28, I stopped by.

I ordered their house salad and Toasted Ravioli - 12 pcs.  The salad was ok, nothing special... since St. Louis was known for Toasted Ravioli, was looking forward to it.  It marinara sauce was excellent and the toasted ravioli was good.  I was too full on beer to finish the rest of the toasted ravioli... next time I'm in town, I'll have to visit one of their free standing restaurants in the city.

There's so much awesome sounding stuff on the menu that it's hard to pick. We ended up with the cat head biscuit, the head cheese corn dog, twice cooked wings, and Nashville hot chicken. Everything came with some pickled veggies, which were also great. Would def go again (and will need to, to try some of the other awesome-sounding stuff on the menu!)
Last night pizza from here and as usual, it does not disappoint. It I by far the best pizza in St. Louis

The Haven is definitely a local hangout.  The reviews of the food and clientele are spot on.  I came on a Friday night and found the place packed with older adults.  I had to wait 10 minutes to find a seat at the bar.  I ordered one of the Haven's open faced burgers topped with chili and a fried egg.  It was delicious.  The food is good and the beer is cold.  I understand the crowd gets younger much later in the evening.

Had a great meal at Grace Meat+Three!
Service was quick and the staff was friendly.
I had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes and corn bread; I would definitely go back for another meal as well as suggesting this place to a friend. Their seasonal Moonshine Highball drink was delicious.
Cheers!

Limited cars available for Executive members.  Many vans were 80% available.  I chose a car that was washed, but not vacuumed and gas was not full.  I was told to bring it back to the level were I picked it up.

My question was who can arbitrarily do that.  This was a customer service issue that was not handled very well.  I am the one inconvenienced, but the rental car company will win in the end.

There was only one person working to get several cars out of the lot.

There are several issues with this location, but I will choose another rental car company at this airport.  There are several pattern issues here.

I stood in 95 degree heat for 40 minutes with 30 people in front of me because they were out of cars.  Nobody was communicating or giving updates.  They had a building they could have moved the line to about 20 feet away, but instead had us stand in 95 degree temps, with shuttles continuing to drop people off and letting them figure out that they had to stand in that line.  I called customer service with hopes that someone would care. Customer service was very nice and told me the district manager would call me back. So I was surprised when the person who called me back was from the counter of the exact national car rental place that I just left and on the voicemail the person did not seem to care, still.  They told me if I had questions that I could call them back. Needless to say I didn't call back!

This place is a regular find nothing too special. They use Kenricks meats which I love. They do not have a good beer selection and the food is decent, regular bar food. The service was not very good and waited over thirty minutes for the check. I now remember why I live so close to here and only go a couple times per year.

Being from st. Louis I'm really embarrassed by Pasta House having their name with this location. The pasta house salad was lettuce, onions and olive oil. No flavor. No artichokes,  no cheese. I could not eat it. 

Pasta was fair.pasta Primavera.  Got shrimp added and they gave me 3 little ones. Travelers will not speak highly of pasta house if this is only location they try. Real bummer.

Went in for the first time on 9/28/2018 and had a great time. Something different and exciting to go and do. The staff was helpful and informative and made sure to help everyone feel comfortable. I wish they offered a 1 hour deal instead of 30 minutes or 90 minutes but that's just me being picky. Throwing hatchets at a dart board style target is fun and a good stress reliever.

Several cars with "Dead Battery" written on the window reduced the amount of available choices, and raised a concern about the quality of the available choices. However, I had no problems with the car that I picked out, the check out process, or the check in process. Easily would utilize the service again.

I LOVE this place. They always have yummy and different flavors. The toppings are fresh and they have a huge variety. The employees are all very friendly and quick to offer you several tasting cups. I love this because many places only allow one tasting, if that. This sounds silly but the spoons are super cute and add to the experience :) this is definitely my favorite frozen yogurt place in St. Louis!

I've lived here for about a month and let me tell you Roe is amazing! I moved in a week before my expected move in date yet they were still able to get all of the repairs I needed done, there's a few things we didn't notice but they are willing to shut off all of the water in the building to fix a leak! Keep in mind this building is older which means there are some "charms" such as little counter space and other superficial things people can't seem to get over. But the original crystal handles and ceilings are a dream! But this apartment takes studio living to a whole new level! SO MUCH SPACE. It's near a hospital so don't live on the street if you can't sleep through noise. But it's proximity to the 44 and 64 are unbeatable! So far I love living here and everyone is so nice! 

PS they are pet friendly and the people at "Pets in the City" are sooo nice I don't have any pets but they have dog walking services and even a groomers for all of the little fur babies! Hopefully this review helps someone choose to live here
Delicious and interesting food and excellent service! Great ambiance and the staff is great at providing their own opinions. We will definitely be coming back.
We enjoyed this lovely restaurant this morning - great food, cool atmosphere and very friendly staff. We will put this on our regular breakfast/brunch list!
Yeah so I'm at the drive through and I see a huge rat walking around the back door. I did not order nor will I ever return ... Ever

Emerald Aisle is the way to go!  Simple, fast and friendly staff.  Nice selection of cars to chose from and made week long trip enjoyable.  Only thing I can say is that the pick-up and return areas are not well marked and very confusing.  The pick-up area when dropping off a car is a small gated lot with room for about 6 cars, nowhere to turn around, etc.

My wife and I had the rare opportunity of dining out for breakfast sans the kids. The whole experience was a bit underwhelming. My wife had one of their breakfast sandwiches and I had the "Classic breakfast". The food overall was edible but not worth the "hustle" you feel having communal seating. Sadly, restaurants become "hot" by simply having a hip vibe and an interesting menu. With so many other breakfast options in the area, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

horrible! ! cold fries, cold old nuggets, and then a burnt chicken sandwich. ... all 3 of the women that were running the drive thru nasty and rude as he**, even the mgr on duty was rude.....disgusting

Quick come and go.
Staff is friendly and will get your car ready to go in just a few minutes.
The shuttle to/from the airport does not take long to arrive and the drivers are the nicest people ever.

Wow this was good!  The prime rib sandwich was fantastic from the first bite to the last. ..tender. ..moist. ..with just the right amount of horseradish sauce to keep the taste going! The smoked red cabbage side was also perfect.   Definitely recommended.  Oh..it is also very clean and friendly and service is fast!

This airport location has been a disappointment numerous times. Usually some combination of poor service and/or very slow kitchen. 

Most recent experience today was unbelievable. Waitress disappeared. Long, long, long wait for food from the kitchen. We eventually had to leave to catch a flight. Asked another waitress to please arrange our order to-go and to bring the check. That didn't happen. Finally had to bolt out of there. Waitress was no where in sight. Left money for the drinks on the table and left.

I'm done giving them chances at this airport location. Too bad the restaurant selection is so poor to start with in T2. Was hoping the Pasta House would become an improvement there, but it's not.
Exactly what St. Louis needed, my new favorite restaurant with a perfect locaton. Excellent service and excellent food, Totally recommend it!

Walked into an empty restaurant (red flag) and began looking at the menu.  Excited to try some of the street food.  Unfortunately this didn't happen.  A dude came out to greet me and immediately made me feel uncomfortable.  After he tried to flirt with me left and right I decided to leave. He pressured me to stay and continued to follow me outside and even watched me dive away!!! Totally unprofessional and I don't know if I'll come back here again. Cultural appreciation can be found through the joy of food and this behavior caused me to go somewhere else to eat.

Bread co on steroids. Plus locally owned, more variety, oh.. And better! Really a gem. Nothing exciting from the outside, it's the food that earns the 5 stars. Came on a Friday evening, not busy at all. Ordered the Walk in the Park sandwich with the Tango salad. Both fresh and delicious. Cute kid menu as well. The bakery items are delicious, though more premium-priced than the menu items. Definitely need to try this place.
If you're an Emerald Club member the process is very easy. Hop in a car and drive off to the exit. Show you DL and you're on your way. In and out in about 6 minutes.

Booked here because of cheap cost. 
Won't book again due to 3 main issues. 
1. First arrived and TV did not work for a day. 
2. They try to save money by having air conditioning that shuts itself off after a time period. 
3. Needs upgrades (ex. elevator claustrophobic, slow, and makes odd noises). 

Tolerable for a overnight stay but not as much for an extended business trip.

Good place to watch the game and have a nicer bar atmosphere. Food is typically pretty good and above average for casual bar and grill type restaurant. Three stars, however, are given solely because of the wings. Perhaps the most disappointing wings I've ever had, and I'm no stranger to wings. Sauce was ok, but the wing needed at least 2 more minutes in the fryer. Skin was limp and a few of the wings were pretty veiny. Just about anything else on the menu is good; what a shame for the poor wings!

Wayne, the bus driver, is completely rude and should just give up.

2 our of my last 3 rentals clearly had smokers for drivers and there was no effort given to getting rid of the smell.  I told the manager and he said he would get back to me....never heard a word.  It is simply nasty to drive clients around in a car that reeks of cigarettes and then face a rental manager that could care less.

The staff is horrible,  dramatic, and completely disrespectful.  Just changed to this location and never going back.  
 The staff is pathetic and when you dont have good staff/front desk there should be no business.
May favorite roast beef sandwich from a fast food chain.  Great with their horseradish and Au-Jous.  Also have a 25cent kid cone!

The repair they made did not fix the problem. Worst experience ever. Called Sears and received the correct diagnosis. Had to buy a new machine in the end. 
We were charged but stopped payment due to this company's lack of response and then combative attitude regarding the problem.
Ordered the huge birthday cake sundae. It was gorgeous and delicious. Love this place!!!

Great lunch spot in a trendy area. I went with a friend and split a calzone with a large salad and it was a solid portion for both of us. I suggest parking on a side street so you don't have to pay for parking. The staff is very nice and the food comes out relatively quickly. And it's delicious! The sauce portions are really good!
Great food great atmosphere and staff. My family eats there very frequently. Has a great family feel. Will be a customer lifelong!

This is possibly the worst meal I will ever have in my life. I haven't even finished eating and I'm hopping on Yelp to talk about how bad it is. I got simple spaghetti bolognese, and everything, absolutely EVERYTHING about it is awful. The pasta is over cooked and weirdly cut to bits so I can't get it properly on a fork. The sauce is thin, watery, flavorless, and nearly vegetarian. There is the smallest spoonful of Parmesan on here, and even it is bad. I know you should have low expectations for airport food, but sweet merciful lord this is bad. And weirdly for a pasta place in the Midwest, I'm still hungry. I just finished and want more food. How is this place even possible?! All that said, there is a very limited beer flight, the coffee stout is good, the pumpkin ale is interesting, and the double bean blonde is intriguing. So come drink some beer and have good service from nice people. But don't eat the pasta at Pasta House. Yes, the thing this place is built upon is it's weakest link.

I recently moved to the area and obviously have never heard of a Dierbergs before...so I had to do a little shopping all over town to see what items were in each store.  This is a nice choice----and I am intriqued by the cooking class space most of all and cannot wait to sign up for some fun and exciting offerings.  The store is clean, large, and has a nice selection of items that us foodies like.  Gourmet Cheeses, Healthy and Organic options., Decent looking meats....The most exciting thing I am finding is having wine, beer, and hard liquor available in the grocery store....I LOVE THIS!

I was disappointed with my Classic Breakfast. I asked for patty sausage and soft scrambled eggs. It  also came with two small skin-on potatoes and biscuits & gravy. The potatoes were delightful and the b&g were great. However, the sausage patty was burned black and it overpowered what would have been a nicely flavored house made sausage. Also, I'm not a fan of over cooked eggs. So I specifically asked for soft scrambled. They came out hard cooked and were singed to a light brown in places.  I was pressed for time so I didn't ask for anything to be remade.  I chose iced tea for my drink and it was cloudy and tasted like instant.  And it cost $2.50 which is outrageous. If I go back I will communicate my wishes stressing past experience. And if that's instant tea, get rid of it and brew up some Lipton.

Thank you PokeDoke for doing this right! The poke bowl was delicious! The fish was fresh and the toppings were plentiful! To the people who complain about the price: ummm you are in the middle of the country, how did you think sushi grade fresh fish got here? Besides, dear St Louis, please understand that you get what you pay for!
Fine home town cooking and comfort food.  Fast casual counter ordering.  Good specials and friendly service.

This was my first time at this location and I would go back here a million times over again. My fiancé and I came here for lunch and we sat on the patio. From 11-3 they have a great you pick two menu. On the menu was a Turkey BLT wrap and the minute I read that I was ALL IN! When it was time to order, the waiter notified me that the Turkey BLT wrap was no longer available as they had changed their menu but not updated he you pick two menu yet. I wasn't too upset, I just created the same wrap essentially from another on on the menu. A man, who looked like the manager, came out to another table next to us to let them know the BLT wrap could be made even though it wasn't on the menu. I didn't make a fuss, but the women next to me, jokingly said, "don't tell her that!"  He asked if I wanted him to bring me out a BLT wrap. I said not to worry about it as I already had my food. But instead the manager brought me out the wrap anyway. Zach was our server and he was so attentive and personable! This eagerness to make the customer happy was greatly appreciated. This kind of service will keep me coming back for more. Looking forward to eating here again!
Friendly staff. Excellent lattes! Cookies are amazing. Wonderful vegan lemon cookie and chocolate brownie. Salads are delicious. This place is a gem

Could use more frequent bus pick ups and drop offs and that goes for ALL RENTAL companies at STL airport, it's an absolute nightmare all the way around; National needs to ensure the cars actually get cleaned front to back. This week I had a 12 pack of cans of soda in the back of my vehicle with cans all over the place. How can ANYONE miss that?

Under construction!! Beer was good pizza is WAY to over spiced with Italian seasoning, sauce is spicy which I don't mind but cut out the Italian seasoning or oregano whichever your using, it's way too much! Cheese garlic bread was fantastic though. Kind of slow can't handle big groups but everyone was super friendly and nice!

Dave actually the construction didn't bother us always nice to see someone investing in their business. And the big crowd was us! Wasn't crowded until then and we got there at about 7:30 Saturday night with about 20 in our group and we sat down but took up most of your back room. Didn't mind the wait for the pizza for our group because of our size but the staff showed absolutely no sense of urgency. First time visit for whole group but someone heard your pizza was good. Well as a group no one thought that! everyone said the same thing. Spicy sauce isn't bad just the taste of the sprinkle on pizza seasoning is way too heavy. Almost inedible! I don't need to open my own restaurant as I like to try different things and as a group we dine out average 2-3 times a month. My 2 stars was for your pizza only but that's why we went there and in my opinion didn't like it but amazingly our whole group said exactly same thing. I hope you do well in your endeavors. I hope your regular crowd grows exponentially but also know of our group of 20 none will probably ever be back.
This is the worst car rental in the United States. Zero customer support.  Please use any other agency.

I walked in and seated myself at a high-top near the bar. Shortly a waitress came by and offered me a menu and a beer. I sipped my ice cold Shock Top while reading over the menu. 

I decided on a patty melt with fries and a small bowl of chili. The chili was good, if not quite hot enough for my taste, and topped with cheese and onions. 

The burger was huge! I barely made it through half of it. It was well seasoned, topped with grilled onions  and nicely presented on rye bread.

The atmosphere was relaxed, sports on TV's everywhere. My beer was kept full and I was well paid attention to. 

Nice place, I shall return soon.

I visited Sound Stone Massage in the midst of the Christmas season to try and relax a bit before all of the hustle and bustle of the actual Christmas Day came around.  This massage was exactly what I needed.  Jackie performed my massage in a very professional manner and I will definitely go back!  Highly enjoyed the experience and highly recommend it to others!
My customer service was amazing and did a great job on my install. They also have great sales , can't wait for the tent sale in July.  Getting more work done in july.

I have not had the pleasure of trying their pizza yet, so I will save my extra star for that.

That being said, I've really enjoyed Black Thorn - if only as a pub. Good service and a very diverse crowd. Plus, they have a solid selection of beers - both macro and micro - at affordable prices.

They accept credit cards, using Square - so it's a really nice, easy transaction process. 

I'm all in. Now to just try some of that pizza...

Yummy pizza, but order ahead or arrive before you are hungry. 
Also, if you don't want a tummy ache and you order a deep dish, ask for half the normal amount of cheese.  It's HEAVY.

Although I have to admit that the pizza is some of the best in St. Louis, I'm not so sure the wait is worth it. It takes about  1 1/2 - 2 hours to get a Chicago style pizza made. It sure is good once it's finished though! The bartenders are also always really friendly.
The Black Thorn is usually pretty full and seating can be hard to come by. My advice is to put your pizza order in as soon as you walk through the door and then try to snag a table right away after that

I couldn't tell you if the pizza was good or not because we never got served. We sat at the bar for 15 minutes without the bartenders even acknowledging we were there, regardless of attempts to get their attention. I had high hopes for black thorn because of all the great reviews of their pizza but will never return with such HORRIBLE service. As we walked out the bartender made the comment "I guess they're not happy". No sh!$ idiot!
Just a good, south city bar with good food at a good price.  I had a burger, which was very good and the fries were perfect side dish.  I'll be sure to go back and try more of the menu.

I don't know why this yelp account only mentions the pharmacy. I go to this location once in a while but one thing I don't like is some of the produce (especially onions) is old and I frequently notice I got charged wrong for something and have to go to customer service to get a refund. The prices here are high, yes the sale prices are good, they are like regular prices at other stores. I usually just walk around and pick things up that are on "sale" or search through the produce. They sometimes have good deals on a single piece of fish in the deli area. I was just in Indianapolis at a Kroger and the chicken was like 3 dollars a pound, why is fresh chicken so expensive here!! I go here if it is convenient but otherwise I would rather not.

Oh my this place is delicious. I am really picky about my fried chicken, and theirs does not disappoint--perfectly seasoned, crispy exterior with juicy chicken underneath. And the sides are amazing too!
Always smelling fresh in this bakery when you walk in with vegan options also for sweets.  The fire and ice salad is my favorite.  Portions are large and delicious.  Convenient and clean.

I appreciate the way these milkshakes look but mine didn't taste spectacular. I also ordered lemon pepper wings which I think maybe were fried too long. The cheese sauce I got with the fries was pretty good though!

The workers were kinda loud until they all went back in the kitchen and the large toy is VERY distracting and noisy.

The first guy I dealt with to remove my Viper system from my old car was great and they charged me $75, exactly what they promised.  They also told me they would charge me $75 to put it in my new car, that turned out to be wrong.  I learned this when I brought the new car in and was told $75 was the base amount just for the remote start, the door locks were more and the truck button was extra.  I don't like to be "bait and switched" but they did the work correctly.  

The job was twice what I was told during my first visit and they didn't care during the second visit.  So I will not be going back and will not recommend them to my friends.  They could have worked with me but money seemed more important that good customer relations.  What a shame!

Garbage. Rude staff. Long waits. Half of the menu isn't ever available. Breakfast starts at midnight? They're still prepping at 3am.. want dessert? Freezer is locked. I live nearby and try this location now and then, and I'm always disappointed with the service and the quality. If I was the GM or the owner, I'd be embarrassed.
People tend to love this place or hate it. I think it's the best pizza in St Louis! It's hard to compare to any other pizza, it's uniquely delicious and definitely not gourmet.

The staff at this pharmacy are rude and scatterbrained.  Three times now they have told me a one hour wait and it has always been at least 90 minutes.  I suspect they delete their messages from doctors as my doctor usually has to call them two or three times to get anything done.  "Well they just called it in 5 minutes ago", when I was standing there when the nurse called it in 2 hours earlier.

It makes me laugh that this place is listed under "nightlife"... not sure if I'd go THAT far, but I imagine they are open late.  The Haven's become a go-to close-to-home spot for decent food (nothing fancy, but a step up from bar nosh... even the salads are good, and my husband's a fan of the chili mac). We're even able to walk there, which is definitely a plus. It can get a bit smoky, since it's small and 2/3 of the place is a smoking section, but at least there is a nonsmoking section toward the back. Five beers between us, two entrees and tip for 40 bucks. Can't complain. I just really wish they had a patio, now that the weather's warmer.

I have eaten at this location several times. The service has been consistently good. The food is also good, not special but good. One item that has been not so good is the nachos. I used to get them at the Town and Country location and they were really good. Twice I have ordered the nachos and the beef brisket is like rubber. There is more sour cream than cheese and the whole thing is a cold mess. 
The bbq chicken salad is a good choice. The wings were good ( order them crispy) 
Tons of beers on draft, if you like beer it is worth the trip.

For a location in Frontenac, this place is LOW class. The owner is a rude,  crazy, ugly woman with a crap attitude towards anyone without "enough" money to meet her standards. Overheard her talking with other employees as I was having my hair styled, and was appalled at her lack of discretion and rudeness. (She was talking badly about a client coming in for a service later that day, calling her names like "cheap" "trashy" and "wanna be Real Housewife" and others I won't go into. I'm not even that nosy, she was THAT loud.)

The front desk waiting area is tiny, and crowded full of crap. The front girl was polite but aloof. More interested in texting someone apparently.

 I got a haircut here by Casey, which was highly overpriced (even though I had gotten a gift card). She seemed uninterested in what I wanted, and kept pushing styles I didn't like, and tried to convince me to add color and highlights! I just needed a haircut! Very pushy with their products. 

I asked for a tour of their "spa". Small, outdated, and didn't look particularly clean, very dingy. 

I would avoid this place like the plague.

I really don't have any in-depth review, but the deli chicken at Dierbergs (I'm sure it's a chain-wide thing and not just a Sappington location thing) is the most odd-looking and tasting thing I've ever had. The skin is completely rubbery and it has an even layer of fat underneath it. I don't know if it's the chickens they buy or the way they cook it, but it's pretty awful.

I've also tried contacting their online customer service before, and I received no response, which I found kind of silly.

While it's not a horrid place, it's definitely not the best place to shop, and I rarely, rarely do so.

La la la la LOVE this place!! There's a reason why I have to limit my Sauce on the Side urges...and that's because it's so DELICIOUS every single time I get it!!! I order the Duke almost every time but today I branched out and tried the Meet Me in St. Louie and it was BOMB.COM  My husband on the other hand couldn't change it up and went with his usual Roasty Toasty which he said is the definition of soothing lol

Dr. Fontana's eye care practice is located in the offices above the shops at Hampton Village.   He is an awesome Optometrist.  He is very thorough and knowledgeable and just the sweetest guy ever.  His front office staff are professional and courteous.  A basic exam is $100, which is a little higher than some of the discount eye centers, but they work with most insurance companies and I feel that I am in competent hands here.  Great operation.  Highly recommended!

If you're flying out of Terminal 2 you have 2 sit-down choices - Chilis and the Pasta House. I'll always pick the local place, so I had dinner here. It was okay.

On the plus side, the staff seem to be genuinely friendly which is very rare in airport restaurants! Prices (in the context of airport food) are relatively reasonable too.

I had a pizza and it was "maybe" a step above grocery store frozen pizza. I do like the very thin crunchy crust though. The staff is friendly but pretty unprofessional - they seemed to spend a lot of time chatting (loudly) about very personal things.

Pasta House is not "bad" and it's not like you have a lot of other choices in this terminal.

Nice little spot for a casual lunch.  We sat outside on the patio which was right next to  a park like setting so it gave an open feel. This place is a calzone lovers heaven. Probably the best calzone I've had. Not too much dough, but just enough to keep all the wonderful ingredients inside. 
I had the Garden (veggie lovers dream) and my boyfriend had the Cock a Doodle Noodle (Mac and cheese lovers dream). Both were served hot out of the oven and delicious. 
They also offer indoor dining if that is your preference or the weather is bad. 
If a calzone is what you're craving this is the place for you. (They do have other menu items as well)

Called ahead because we had a big order.  Get home, the order is wrong.  Head all the way back, get he missing items, and I'm not offered anything.  The employees were just mad I came back for the food.  Get home, and the chili mac, which I've had dozens of, tasted like curdled milk.  THIS is why fast foods companies are on the decline.  You're great when you make the food right.  Serving spoiled food...that's unforgivable.

Sure it's one small step away from a s&!%hole but the staff is friendly and the patrons entertaining. The important thing to remember is you're here for the pie. And that can take a while.
 
Looking like you're normal, neighborhood dive on the outside, your expectations will be met on the inside. It's dark and weathered on the inside with years of bar smoke yellowing the blinds lett you know, "we've been around the block" and it looks it. A bar that seats around 15 a table and some booths in the main room that looks into a very small kitchen (partially explanes the long wait times). The second room seats more and adds some attractions, Ms. PAC-MAN, Air Hockey and shuffleboard which unfortunately was ocupado. 

We placed out order in the proper order, beer then pizza. Mac was supper helpful in the kitchen. When quoted 45min for our two pies, she proclaimed "I'm fast. It won't be that long" and it was not. With the game room filled with all 21 and up, thank you, we grabbed stools at the bar and began chatting up the Norms. About 30 minutes later we were out the door with one Chicago and one thin together with a large salad for around $40. Not bad when you consider the amount of food in one of the ChiTown delights. Four of us finished of 1 round with another sitting in the fridge for breakfast. 

The bottom line is I liked the pizza but not enough to spend all night in the Black Thorn Pub. That's not because of it's appearance, I'm totally down with a dive but I did not get the cool, dive vibe. Maybe it's better on the weekend when it's packed to the walls. For now, I'll keep coming in, ordering out and chill'n at the bar with some suds until bell rings.

Terrible service, the place looked filthy the workers looked like they were doing snow angels in flour and the guy that took my order forgot to include an item that I literally ordered seconds before he checked me out

I used United Van Lines for a move from Philadelphia to Los Angeles.  Someone came out to look at my apartment for a quote right away.  I decided to go with a cheaper company, but when they turned out to be unreliable, I switched to United Van Lines at the last minute (9 days prior to moving) and they were very cooperative, friendly, and willing.  The movers arrived right on time and did an excellent job loading.  My delivery also arrived on time and nothing was damaged.  The reason I am giving three stars instead of a higher rating is because after the fact I was billed for a full month of storage when my moving coordinator told me the storage costs would be prorated per day.  As I only used the storage facilities for four days, it was a shock to pay for a full month, especially after already paying so much money for a cross-country move.  I would have appreciated my moving coordinator being more up front with me about these charges or better trained as she appears to be misinformed and I was the one to pay, literally, for her mistake.

Since you've hounded me to review your business,  looks like I've found some time to give my two cents. ... This off site location is poorly signed and difficult to find. Staff even agree to this issue. Allow plenty of time.

Pizza is amazing!  Im a big eater and rarely leave anything on my plate at restaurants.  But, I  have never been able to eat more than 2 pieces of a Black Thorne pie in one sitting.  Pizza is like 3 inches high stuffed with cheese.  Tangy, cheesy, greasy, saucy, amazing. 

I see alot of people have complained about the wait time...you have to know going in that its not a place you just walk in, get a pizza real quick and thats it.  Its going to take at least an hour.  They have one pizza oven and its a small little corner pub.  The best thing is to get there around 5-6 and get your order in. If you do that you can get the pizza in less than an hour.  If its after 7, you can count on about a 2 hour wait.  Either way its a fun experience and you wont be disappointed.

Really good burgers, great service, and beer taps at the tables. What else could you want?

Kids loved their food as well, and I can't pretend I didn't polish off my daughter's mini corn dogs, which were also awesome.  We'll be back!

Some of the calzones at Sauce on the Side are very good, but they have a couple that are just average.  The Carmen is extremely good and has a great flavor combo.  The Puttanesca sounds great, but the calzone we got there was so loaded with chicken that every other ingredient was overpowered.

This place saved the day for our monthly "dinner party group" of friends. Funnily enough, The Haven was our second choice of places to go, but after the THREE MONKEYS CANCELLED OUR RESERVATION, I tried the Haven.

They were gracious and accommodating, reserving the small room at the back for our group of a dozen. Service was extremely good - our server didn't have a single hiccup in our rather complicated orders. 

Food was EXCELLENT. Drinks were good. 

Price was AMAZINGLY cheap for what we got. My husband and I, between us, had 5 draft beers, and two sandwiches (he had the chili burger, I had the "stop-drop-and-roll" and our bill was only $33! We will go back, again and again.

Every member of our group was very pleased with the atmosphere (not loud, but probably because we were not in the thick of the bar area), the food, the service...

Haven, you've got a great thing here. Wish we'd found you sooner!

Circle 7 Des Peres gets a failing grade for the obscene noise level. Upon entering, I had to duck for cover as the noise level was unbearable. The 4 and 5 star reviewers on Yelp must be hard of hearing. Why the owners built a restaurant that was uninhabitable by human beings is beyond me. Prices are high, high, high for food that is just OK, OK, OK.

Love that chicken from Popeye's.  The lady in the dining room is always friendly and there to bus your table or assist you. 

When they have there 25 cent wings special  DON'T get them.  They have to be wings from the smallest birds in existence.

A total ripoff.   You get more meat on  1 breast than 12 of these wings.
Only place in terminal serving breakfast until 10:30 and they accept priority pass. That's good enough for me!

What a welcome addition to the area.  The concept and food was well done.  It's still new so the flow was still being worked out.  it is a bit cavernous may be art on the walls would bring it together.  Either way we'll be back.
Great calizone and salad.  Very impressed they delivered to our hotel for no charge!  Great food for great price!

Great fast casual breakfast! 

High quality ingredients and great service! Better than Rooster or some of the more popular breakfast spots!!!!

Holding off on this review now. My past post got the attention from the district manager. He seems to understand things were not right. I will repost after i see how things go. It could have been better if the store would have taken this approach. I hope ti give a better review in the future.

UPDATE 2/7/16

I have been sent and email from National and replied with the information they requested. 

I appreciate the fact that they have taken a second look at the issue.

I am eager to see how it progresses from here.

I did send a email to the president of National, it was read, and I have not seen a reply, nor do I actually expect one.

I highly recommend the salted honey latte with oatly milk.  Smoothest coffee I have ever had. My husband and I love to come here and work on our laptops. Cozy environment, charging outlets, natural ambiance, and great background music.

I live a 3 minute drive and an 11 minute WALK from the store.

The 1st time I ordered, the got my order wrong.
The 2nd time I ordered, it took over an hour to get to me.
The 3rd time I ordered, it took over an hour to get to me and I was given a "it should be arriving soon" when I called to ask.

JJs as a brand is great, but this specific location is garbage.

I won't be giving this location my money any longer.

Great deep dish pizza and it lives up to the hype that all of my friends were raving about! We had great service but we also sat at the bar and was there fairly early and got to know the bartender. Can't wait to go back!

The worst customer service I've ever experienced! I called for a in home quote for our move from SF to Austin in 2 months. The sales rep I spoke to told me to call back closer to the date(the earlier you book and the more flexible you are the better negotiating power you have). I told him we were looking to secure a mover by the end of this month and have 3 in home quotes booked from other companies. He then said he's not interested in my business if I am shopping around....I kid you not! If the customer service is this bad and shady from the beginning I don't want to know what it's like to actually have them move my entire home!!! Be warned!

Rick doesn't disappoint! I had the pulled pork special with collard greens and sweet potatoes as my side. If you like Southern you will like this place. I have to come back on a Friday for the duck meatloaf, or come back everyday and try every special - Saturday is prime rib! I also really liked the size of the restaurant, it's really large and they did a great job renovating the old space.

My husband and I Moved from Tacoma Washington to Michigan and had our belongings picked up June 7th from our home. We paid over $9,000 to the agreed services of Morgan Transfer (affiliated with United) and trusted their contract and customer reviews to safely and timely deliver our belongings. 

 This was our experience:

1- No communication from the Office on the day of when the movers were picking up our belongings

2- On the day prior to the last day of our delivery window, we were informed our items had not left Washington.  It took a total of 18 days to move our belongings from WA to MI.  They did reimburse us $500 for the inconvenience, which did not even cover our hotel costs or extra meal costs due to having to eat out everyday.

3- 2 checkbooks were stolen from our file cabinet during the move and two fraudulent checks were made out of my account for a total of $990.  Given the large expense to move, out of pocket hotel/food expenses, this was extremely stressful.  We called and notified Morgan Transfer of the incident, and received no follow up on the matter.  We escalated the issue to United Van Lines corporate team, but have yet to learn of any developments.

4- They lost all of our silverware, which was valued at over $400 and was a wedding gift to us from September.  We contacted Dawn 3 times about the check and silverware, and she forwarded the information to the claim department.  It's been a week and a half and still no response.  A  request was also sent in to corporate and denied because of a BS waiver that the driver has you sign when they deliver your items.  If you'd like to have the driver and movers stay on your property to check off hundreds of items and boxes (took us almost a week to unpack and to fully realize what was missing) then defiantly make that choice.  We were rushed to sign our paperwork, not properly explained the pages and were told everything was taken care of and to contain the local office with any questions or concerns that come up.  We also paid for the insurance of our items- not sure what the insurance was for since they won't actually cover anything.  Again, just another way to be taken advantage of.

I could continue on with several damaged items and other missing items (such as our bed screws- so nice to finally get your belongings after such a long wait, but still no functioning bed!).  I expected things to be damaged or things to go wrong- it's a big move. I wasn't expecting things to go wrong at this magnitude and for the company to do nothing to help out their customer, besides doing the bare minimum. 


So moral of the story, if you like to be stolen from, taken advantage of, and partner with crooks (not to mention pay an arm and a leg for a service) then book Morgan Transfer.  We've moved across the country two times before without any issues from Allied.  Can't say I'll be trusting any van lines after this experience. I know it's a lot of work, but if you can, consider doing the move yourself.  Definitely do not hire Morgan Transfer/United.


*****Update to Review******
Since posting this review on Yelp, we were contacted by United regarding this issues listed above. Shelly from customer service was very helpful and we were fully reimbursed for the missing items and were told that there was an ongoing investigation regarding the theft that was being taken seriously.  I was happy to hear this information- as I hope no one else has to go through this experience.  Being reimbursed for the missing items was also a huge relief to the financial burdens we were facing from the move.  I feel that United did address all of my concerns, which I do appreciate.   A couple of other positives to add to this review: none of our fragile wedding gifts were broken.  The packing team really did do a great job ensuring those items were securely packed.  Although we had the theft issue, the employees that we had direct contact during the move process were very friendly and professional to work with.  I know the majority of them did not steal from us, and deserve credit for their hard work and customer service.

Shout out to the daily homemade chili!!

It has just the right amount of spice and tomatoes. 

Get the half n half special for 6.95 and you don't just get a small portion with your half  sammie, you get a giant crock of it.

You should know about their chili!

One thing I noticed this last time is that I thought before I saw they had drink specials during games, but last night during the blues playoff games there were no specials. That kind of sucks because every time I'm there half of the people in there are there to watch the game, and like not just watch it but participate and get all loud with it.  Give the fans a break Haven!

We stopped by on Saturday Night after a Cardinals Game and long day of drinking. We got there at 10:45 pm and the pizza and cheese bread was still on point. With it being late we went with the thin crust instead of the deep dish. Was not disappointed, a great Pizza and cheese bread is always fantastic. 
We brought another couple that had never been there before and they were sold on the place just walking through the door. 
If you are on the fence about this place or somewhere else, you will make mistake not picking this place and this experience.

I haven't used this body shop but I've got a GEICO claim checked out by an adjuster here. The place is great, there's a very comfortable lounge with a TV and free coffee to wait in while you wait for the staff to do their thing. The staff here are polite and the place is pretty easy to find.

This is for Pasta House in the STL airport terminal 2 (SWA). 

Service was awesome. The restaurant was clean. 

Kids and Mom enjoyed the pasta. 

Pizza was good but marinara was used as opposed to pizza sauce or there was more than a normal amount of sauce. Toppings were great. 

Happy New Year 2018!

SImple, straightforward, well prepared.  A nice clean spot.  Worker was very friendly.  Dumplings were high quality.  I hope that's all you want, because that's about all you can order.  But you do get a bowl of chicken broth soup with the order.  And the dumplings are made fresh to order.  There's a lot of good flavor in them, too.
I have been here several times recently and the food has always been great. Had the cod sandwich today and it was delicious. The servers are very friendly and efficient. I could eat here everyday!

I like this place, It's a few houses down from where I moved ~ a year ago. Good standard local restaurant/bar.

My only complaint is how easily it fills.. (and stays full even with finished guests during important sports games AGH!)(If I could get a seat with less struggle, I'd opt less to just have a beer and meal at my house.)

That being said, everyone is friendly and its a nice casual place to pop in to eat at :)

Whatever you do, STAY AWAY!!!!!

If i could give this salon 0 stars, I would. I have always kept my hair short, but the last couple of years, I have grown it long. I went in to get it cut back to my usual just-shorter-than-shoulder length style. I showed the stylist multiple pictures of myself, at the length I wanted, both curly and straight. I stressed to her that I wanted to be able to wear my hair straight and curly. She assured me that she could make it look 'great.' Well, she failed. I walked out of the salon with a jaw-length A-line cut, shorter on one side. Awful, awful, awful. I walked out of the salon and immediately started crying. I went home to straighten it, hoping it would grow on me, but it just got worse. The back is SO choppy, with awful, blunt layers, and there is a whole section that is just missing.  Im honestly so embarrassed, and I can only pray that when I travel back to visit family in Utah this fall, my old stylist can find a way to make it look a little bit decent.

Yessss!!! Finally a poke place in st louis, I love Japanese food, and the more variety we get in STL the better. 

I tried the spicy tuna and ahi tuna bowl with almost everything on it with wasabi mayo and it was delicious!

My wife tried a similar bowl with spicy mayo and it was great as well.

Finally, the main challenge that we overcame was our son's aversion to asian food. He liked his bowl and is willing to come back here again.

I hope they maintain the quality of the food here and also the friendliness of the staff, it goes a long way.

The owners work here, the owners bake here, and there passion for this place shows in the food.  It is a menu that covers savory and sweet.  I always seem to want to change something in my selection and they did not mind putting things on the side.  You have know idea how nice it is to have someone listen to your order and get it right, with a smile when they are busy.  This couple thought of everything down to the compostable plates.  
I am already craving the brie, arugula and egg flavor combo.  They have a great formula here at Yolklore and I would not be surprised to see it grow fast.  Dallas perhaps?

I have used the CPR shop in Watson Plaza several times for different problems, and have yet to throw something at them they couldn't fix! The latest was my iPhone SE that decided to take a swim in the toilet and my daughter's iPhone 6 that decided to commit suicide by separating front to back! Both were fixed in good time and with great customer service and a fair price. In the past, they have fixed cracked iPhone screens and an iPad that the Apple Store said was fried and dead. That was two years ago and the iPad is still working great!
Very poor customer service at this location! Don't bother. Picklemans is right up the block go there!!

Awesome pizza!  Definitely unique compared to other Chicago Style pizza available in St. Louis.  The saucy is a bit spicy and there is a hearty amount of cheese in this pizza.  I swear each pizza weighs 10 pounds!

One thing to note, it takes about an hour or more for your pizza to be ready.  Its worth it, so just plan accordingly.  Either plan to get carry out or have a few beers before your pizza comes.


I love the dive-y corner bar vibe of this place.  Its no frills and laid back.  Awesome!
Always so good! How can Arby's stay in business in St. Louis with competition like this!?
First time to try. Flavors were excellent. We had the pork and pork/crab. To be honest I was looking for a larger dumpling but they were delicious.  Very nice people working here.

These folks just get it.  Great customer service. Expedited departure. Always a smile and how can I help you.  I dropped my ID in the bus and they took the time to call me, ask me if I needed to be sent or held in a safe.
