This place exemplifies everything that is right about our country, our people, and the culture of care we need to embrace. 

Thanks from one of your most loyal customers!

This location is always very clean & the young lady working there around 6PM today was so pleasant, cheery and friendly - she made you feel so welcome. Great variety of frozen yogurt flavors and toppings. Could change it up hundreds of ways. Hopefully, same person we had when you visit. It's sure to make you happy & satisfied.

We just had our introductory treatment on Monday, May 21. Kevin Brown was our service guy and he was AWESOME. He thoroughly explained what he was going to do and then he did it. He reported back that he found 8 (!!!!!) wasp nests around our property and a dead mouse and we discussed pest control services for our little rodent friends. We were really pleased with him. Very friendly and polite, not overbearing. 

So why the three stars?

The sales guy who visited our house to get us to schedule service was very grating - probably just an age factor. He was what you think of when you think of a typical door-to-door sales guy. Our municipal police drove by while he was talking to us (apparently, someone in our neighborhood called on him for soliciting; he had the required permits though) and the kid was bragging with to us about how he's so cool with our officers and was trying to show us that he took pictures with the officers from when he's been called on before. It was pretty immature and a waste of our time. Then, he, for whatever reason, could just NOT get my husband's very normal name spelled correctly in the email address so we could receive the documents; I think hubs spelled his name 4 times for the kid. 

Also, the time he rang was borderline inappropriate for us. We have a 1 year old and he was really cutting it close to her bed time. And, according to him, he still needed 4 more households to sign up in order to meet his quota (yes, he told us that too, and bragged that 4 more should be easy....at 7:30 in the evening....when families are settling down for family time and bed time).

The kid's lucky we were already considering pest control services and that we like a good deal. 

Anyhow. The service guy was great. And if the results are good and continue to be good, we'll keep it up - with the hopes that we never have to deal with a sales guy again.
The best deep dish pizza in this town hands down. Expensive drinks, but a small price to pay for delicious pie. Order early, there's only one oven so it can be a long wait.

I had to use Glass Doctor again today and I have no complaints. I called early in the morning and they were able to give me same-day service. They came to me, called when they were on their way and called again when they arrived. The tech was friendly and professional. 

Windshields come with a lifetime warranty against leaks and stress cracks and a 12-month guarantee against road hazard damage to your windshield. This means that if you have road hazard damage to the replaced windshield within 12 months of the replacement, they will repair or replace the glass at no charge.

Glass Doctor is two for two with me. I hope I never have to use them again, but if I do, I know who to call.
Five stars for the Chicago Style pizza! Loved it... It is a dive bar/pizza place so don't expect "fine dining". Pinball and shuffleboard deserve and extra star!

I heard great things about this place, and let me say, they are right! The food here was awesome. Calzone was big enough for my wife and daughter to split. I had the "which came first?" and would definitely recommend it.
Very impressive atmosphere and home cooking with personal spin. You will not regret coming here! Save room for dessert. It's truly delightful!

Emerald Aisle is the only way to go, simple, quick & efficient...what else do you need for a business trip?   Thank You National!  After using Budget, Thrity & Alamo....I think I have finally found my go-to Rental company.  Albeit only 1 rental in, but not a single problem or complaint.  As much as I am traveling now, I'm hoping that I will not need to change again.

Enjoyed a terrific lunch today in this spacious and nicely decorated new Tower Grove eatery. I'm a Turkey Leg and Bread Pudding  aficionado and tried both here. Both were excellent and make my Top Three lists!  My wife really  enjoyed  the BBQ Ribs and sides. Adam added to the experience with great service. We'll be back!
Visited this place after my cousin party and was amazed at how good the drinks and the food was for very low prices. Great place!!

In the middle of a cold Sunday afternoon, we stopped for a quick bite before dinner.  Not wanting too much food, we skipped the fired chicken platters (what were we thinking?!) and ordered a burger, side of mashed sweet potatoes, and the half salad+soup combo.  The burger has a white pub cheese (ooh, different) and a spicy remoulade sauce reminiscent of Big Mac sauce.  All burgers are made the same: medium to well done (no pink, just brown).  The salad I ordered was the beet salad- very fresh, wonderful cheese topping, and perfect amount of dressing.  The seasonal soup was a pumpkin soup, topped with a berry drizzle, and candied granola topping.  You would think the berry and pumpkin would clash, but they match perfectly!  The sweet potatoes were topped with a marshmallow fluff singed with the blow torch before being served.  Not too sweet, just right.

**No line at 3pm on a Sunday and the food was served within 5 minutes.

I have never been to a place like this before so I was excited to look at the menu and try it out! I stood back a while and decided on what I wanted and started ordering but the workers seemed irritated that I didn't know exactly how I wanted my bowl and I felt rushed to order. They then asked me if I wanted sesame seeds which I said yes to and they shook it once and it was empty and said sorry it's out and didn't give me any more. Kind of a let down. I probably won't go back because I felt so intimidated and they weren't inviting. Food was good though.

I had cut my own hair for about 20 years because it seemed like no matter where I went, I was getting a hair cut that I could do myself...so that's what I did.  Don't get me wrong..I'm not saying that I did a good job, but that's what I was getting from barbers.  One day I decided to go to Hair Saloon...probably because I'm a sucker for commercials.  The manager Cindi, cut my hair and did such a great job, I haven't cut my own hair since.  She always does a good job...and let's face it, I need all the help I can get.

Delicious food! Biscuits and sausage gravy are on point. Amazing bacon, sausage, eggs, potatoes! Can't go wrong with anything you get! Got my daughter pancakes and they were probably the best pancakes I've ever tasted. Will be back again!

I've never written a review while I was still in the restaurant until now...I just had a great breakfast and I can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu! Being my first visit I went with the classic breakfast...eggs, bacon toast, potatoes, coffee and orange juice. It was classic on steroids! The potatoes just a little different, the juice Is freshly squeezed, the bacon just a little thicker than usual, the strawberry jam more flavorful than most...Is it OK to eat breakfast twice because I want more now. 

Friendly staff, good prices and quick service...breakfast nirvana!
My advice would be to call in an order right when they open and pick up in an hour or so. The Chicago crust is better than the thin. Kind of expensive though. Cute place.

Best in St. Louis! Prepare for the wait, it is long, but is easy to have fun with it given the beer selections and games in the pub. It's an experience, so if you are not used to a down and dirty pub, this is not for you....but you'll miss out on the best pizza in town!
The service was great, and the food was ok.  The best part is that being a Premier Pass member gave me a free meal!  The pizza was good, and I would eat it again.

I anxiously anticipated Grace's opening in the Grove and Rick and his staff didn't disappoint. Everything was perfectly executed. We were greeted walking in the door and given menus and a chance to order a drink while we waited. Don't skip the cocktails! The mint julep was outstanding. The line moved quickly and every staff member we encountered was friendly and gracious. 

The food was everything you've come to expect from Rick. The collard greens had perfect flavor and the pickled beets had just the right amount of tartness. And the chicken! Shut the door delicious. I could seriously make myself sick by eating too much here. 

Great location! Amazing food! Wonderful service! It's a can't miss.

Sadly, my car rental from the STL location was a let down. When I got to the Emerald Aisle I had three cars to choose from which quickly became no choice because the people on the bus ran to the available cars. 

The traffic at the checkout was about 10 cars long. 

However, the drop off was easy and transportation to the airport was effortless.

This. Place. Is. Awesome!! A friend and I stumbled upon this place thanks to Yelp! And are really happy that we did. This place is perfect for indulging your ultimate sweet tooth! With their insane concoctions and great prices it's sure to be a destination during these hot summer months. The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I ordered the Banana Split shake and after waiting about 10 minutes was told that they were out of bananas but had sent someone to the store for more. Then I waited another almost 20 minutes and no one ever showed up with bananas. The nice lady behind the counter assured me they would comp my shake and give me a coupon for a free one next time I came in but that never happened. They made me the cheesecake shake I posted and I've not been back to try their other creations.

First but definitely not our last time here!!  Pot Pie was perfect on this chilly day. Beets...yum. Fried Green Tomatoes were the best I've had!!  Fried Catfish was delicious. Now I'm going to take a nap!!

I used to eat here pretty frequently, as I used to work a couple buildings over.  They're a great place to grab a quick bite on a break.  They're fast, and the food is tasty.

They introduced some salad options before I changed jobs, and I must say I really enjoyed their salads.  Other go-to items on the menu for me were the king roast beef (I'd add onions/jalapenos/other condiments at the condiment bar) and the pulled pork with slaw.

Dierberg's is not a bargain grocery store like Aldi, Save A Lot, and Shop & Save.  It can even be higher than Schnuck's on many items, but if you want an awesome selection of meat, produce, seafood, deli, and bakery items...  they are superior to the discount grocers mentioned.  And, like Schnuck's, they are a locally owned chain.    

I order sushi here regularly.  If you call the deli and ask for the sushi person, you can order ahead and it will be made fresh when you arrive.  I also like Dierberg's because they will cook your seafood for free at the seafood counter.  Schnuck's does this, as well.  But, the quality and choices are much better at Dierberg's.  I also prefer to buy produce  and organic goods at Dierberg's.  Quality all the way.  Especially at this location.  Locations vary.

The only beef I have with Dierberg's, is that they will not invest/locate in the City limits.  That to me is a slap in the face for St. Louis.  Especially since it is locally owned.

Flat out amazing.  I have eaten at Yolklore at least a dozen times.  The mushroom frittata is my go to dish and that means a lot coming from a carnivore like myself.  Of course, I do add a side of bacon, which is cooked to perfection each and every time.  Everyone that works there is very nice and sincerely concerned with everyones experience.  The baked goods are also equally amazing.  I particularly like the blueberry coffee cake.  One thing that could be improved upon is the choice of sweetener.  Would love to see some health options for my coffee......raw honey or stevia!

They were quick to serve, and receiving the car was easy as pie with a bright and accommodating representative. Returning was a little less smooth, with an unfocused counter person keeping me waiting, but my mood completely turned around with the shuttle driver. She was a retired school bus driver, pleasantly conversational, and dropped me at the Marriott Hotel (I was staying for an EARLY flight out)! Such nice service from her at the end of a long day.
Best pizza in Saint Louis. You have to go get the deep dish. However, unless you want to wait an hour or so for your pizza, call ahead. It takes a long time to get your food.

Very slow service and edible but crappy quality food.  Wait staff stand in the corner behind the bar yapping it up without a care in the world to do their job.  I think it could be because I am a PriorityPass member.  I overheard the staff talking about it and saying something about the tips.   I normally tip 20% but when it takes over an hour to eat and you have to wave down an employee to get water or even get them to take your order or clear the table, I really don't want to tip a penny, although I did leave a 10% tip because I am nice.  I even tried to get the manager to gently tell her how poor her staff were but I could not even find her.  I would NEVER eat at this place if It was not a perk lounge offered through my credit card.   NOT RECOMMENDED.

The Bradley Law Firm was very attentive to my needs. I used the Bradley Law Firm when I was involved in a motor vehicle accident. I was rear ended by an suv that left me with severe neck and back injuries. Ryan came to see me at my home during my recovery process. He was very informative and extremely polite, upbeat and positive. I never felt alone during the process. He always promptly returned my phone calls and emails. He has relationships with excellent doctors and wants you to have the best care possible. Ryan was genuine in making sure I recovered to the fullest and was compensated accordingly. I highly recommend The Bradley Law Firm.

I went through a time period where i was quite addicted to this place.  I work just down the street, which is how i discovered it.   I really like the salads, which is what i usually order.  They are really big and the ingredients are nice and fresh.  If you check this place out, be sure to get a mountain cookie.  They are rediculously amazing and huge.  FYI....it gets super busy at noon during the week.

In fast food circles, this diner style restaurant chain is one of the best and this location is better than average.  They re-did this  particular Steak 'n Shake about 10-15 years ago, but it has been at that corner since the 1950's.

Positives:
It's cheap and everything is made to order
Drive thru service is available 24 hours at this location
Table Service available, if dining inside
The BEST vanilla ice cream around and the sundaes, shakes and malts are AWESOME!
The "Steak-burger" can be greasy at times, but it is made from a combo of T-bone, sirloin, and round steaks and is NOT the grade D beef, that most fast food restaurants serve.
Chili 5-way is a heart attack waiting to happen, but oh so yummy
They have REAL breakfast with REAL eggs.
Service is better than average for fast food restaurants

Negatives: 
Hey, it's fat food (I mean fast food), what can I say.

As a touring musician, I eat breakfasts all around the country.  This tops the list - affordable, healthy, fresh Ingredients, well crafted flavors and some diverse choices.  The owner and staff were SO kind to us.  Must try: the birds nest egg?  (Called something like that) and the gooey butter pastry thing (st. Louis speciality).  These guys rock - can't recommend enough!!

I went in there for a early morning coffee. When I took the last sip of my coffee there something weird in my mouth along with the coffee. To my shock and horror I pulled out a short and curly pubic hair, complete with the follicle. 

I started to vomit in my mouth in my booth and I had to sprint to the bathroom where my coffee and breakfast tacos forcefully and uncontrollably projectile vomited out of my mouth, splattering the toilet. 

I confronted the manager who seemed ambivalent and I called the number on the back of my receipt and did nothing. So in exchange for their inaction I would like everyone to know what happened to me at this location.
I love my Steak n Shake!!  The only thing I could recommend is opening at 5 AM on the weekends.

I'm a pizza fanatic.  I have had pizza in almost every major city in America.  Most pizzas are good, but only a few are great.  Black Thorn's pizza is great.  I can say with authority that this is the best deep dish pizza I have ever had and yes, I have tried all of the Chicago places.  $18 for a large Chicago style pepperoni that can feed 3 drunk and starving twenty-somethings.  The sauce is different, but in a good way.  It is loaded with spices but is not hot-spicy.  The crust is soft with a good chew and there is no shortage of cheese.  It's just all around good pizza.  Yes, the place is a dive.  Yes, you will be eating off paper plates and probably have to bus your own table.  So what?  If you want deep dish pizza excellence, brush aside your standards or order it carry out.  The pizza takes awhile to cook, so make sure you plan for at least 30 minutes when they're not busy and up to an hour when they are.  If you haven't had Black Thorn, you are missing out.

My sister and I got the half-day package with a cleansing facial massage, full-body stone massage, hydrating body wrap and foot reflexology massage. It was fantastic! Reasonably priced, too. I highly recommend.
The calzones are delicious! Highly recommend the Costanza, Meat Me in St Louis, and Roasty Toasty!

This isn't 5star restaurant 5stars but neighborhood bar and grill 5stars. If I could give more stars, I would. We stopped in after the zoo and City Garden one day on a whim. Found them on Retail Me Not. The waitress was apologetic that they couldn't accept the coupon. She said the owner never signed up for it. Shame on RMN. Anyway, I would have paid full price every day of the week. The place is small and very quaint. Full of regular patrons from the neighborhood. I ordered a Haven Burger and my husband ordered a steak sandwich. Wow!! I mean Wow!! By far the best steak sandwich either of us have ever tasted and I am from the East Coast. The burger was amazing also. Fresh meat, cooked properly, well seasoned, and very hearty.  The service was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Our visit was perfect from beginning to end. We will be back, more than once, I am sure!

The fro-yo is scrumptious but the best thing is the new frozen alcoholic beverages. If you have ever had trops in CoMO then it is definitely worth trying the new treat that they're whipping up at The Island.

A new place that we just discovered! Great food and  very reasonable place. I enjoyed their service and food. I love their Thai tea! Also, I like their dishes because they don't use excess salt. Definately recommend this place.

It all depends on the move coordinator and driver(s) you get.  I had a proactive move coordinator this time (kept me posted on scheduling, etc.), as well as a great driver who also happened to hire good crews on both ends of my move.  Everything went like clockwork, no surprises beyond initial estimate, nothing out of place.  If you're concerned, let them know you want a good driver who hires good crews.
First time at the Kirkwood location. Nice looking place food & service was good no complaints will be back again.

Convenient but overpriced but hey, it's the airport. They managed to get my order to me in a short time between flights while the place was packed. So I give them four stars for the hustle. I had the penne broccoli pasta dish. It was hot, had enough sauce and vegetables. Just what I needed to get me through until dinner at home.

The wait is absolutely the worst. I went into this fully understanding that, so I did not let that impact my perception. I called in a pickup order and was told one hour 45 minutes. I showed up almost exactly one hour 45 minutes later. When I arrived I was told it would be 20 more minutes, so I asked for a drink and watched football. 

This is a dive bar. I appreciate that, not everyone does. Writing on the wall, dollar bills nailed to the wall and ceiling, overall messy layout, rough looking patrons, etc. There are a few TVs and some games  (Pac Man, shuffle board). I went on a Sunday evening and it was not very crowded, although traffic in and out picking up pizzas was heavy.

When 20 minutes had passed, I asked if it was ready and I was told about ten more minutes. 15 minutes later, my name was announced on the PA. I swear this pizza was upwards of ten pounds. I ate two pieces, barely, before I was stuffed. It is loaded with cheese; any more would be too much. The crust is amazing and seems house made from scratch. The toppings were loaded and fresh. The sausage had a lot of flavor. The sauce was very light, I might order it with extra sauce in the future, but had a lot of Italian herb flavor. For $30 (14 inch with unlimited toppings), this is really a lot of food. I count myself a big fan.

To say I'm obsessed with this place would be an understatement. I'm slightly ashamed to say how often I eat here but it's pretty close to once a week. I usually get the salmon and the ahi tuna with white rice, seaweed salad, crab meat and masago topped with spicy mayo + eel sauce. My boyfriend gets the tofu, and my best friend gets the chicken and shrimp. All of it's delicious. One day I'll have the guts to try the octopus.

This was my first (and probably last) time visiting a Rally's.  Service was slow (they weren't busy at the time) and it took about 5 times for the person on the register to get our order correct before putting it through.  The burger itself was good, and the chicken nugget bites were OK, however the fries were very soggy.

A classic dive bar with amazing pizza.  Get the Chicago style which is really just a normal stuffed crust pizza with a ton of toppings.  Sauce is a little spicy.  Excellent quality sausage used.  Call ahead or you'll be waiting at least an hour for the pizza.

Self serve....What more can I say. Soulard definitely needed a place like this. Great variety of flavors and toppings. Never too crowded and convenient hours of operation. Definitely going to be a summer staple.
Food was not bad...a little pricey......but they try to source all local ingredients and I like that.

Fast service when you need it. The prices are reasonable and when you are in between flights, nothing is better than immediate attention from the server. The server recommended the spaghetti bolognese with a meatball. The dinner salad had parmesan cheese, peppers and artichokes with onions.  Great airport cuisine.

If you go thru the drive thru, park and make sure you have your correct order, i got all the way home, and after paying for a 10 piece chicken mcnugget value meal, only had a 6 piece chicken mcnuggets in my bag

Waited over 90 minutes for our one 10" Pizza.  Very disappointed in the pizza.  Even more upset that I spent the entire night in the bathroom.  But if you like hipsters and dive bars this is the place.

I will never give a dentist a 5-star review, sorry. :-P But this place is pretty awesome. I've had a trouble tooth for a while and a dental hygienist made a great suggestion that has pretty much eliminated my pain. They've always been pretty friendly and I don't dread going there as much as I did other dentists in the past.

If I could give zero I would we ordered an eight piece just thighs but they still gave us a mix. My husband started eating a piece of chicken and he stopped looked at me and asked me to smell his chicken. So I did and it smelled like pee... YES! I said pee... Gross! I think it's because the chicken was bad but I'm not sure. My husband band Popeyes from the house lol.

Oh my.... just thinking about this place makes me super full.   Don't come here by yourself unless you have a fridge for leftovers.  The pizza is Chicago style at it's best, so that means patience as you wait for your wonderful pie to cook.  The Za was amazingly good, but super filling.  The place is a tiny little pub on a corner with a nice pub atmosphere with some pool tables, music and TV at the bar.  The house salad was amazingly good while you are waiting.  The beer selection isn't bad either - 3 Schlaflys on draft and 2 OFallons in bottle.  The bartender (could be part owner) was super friendly and makes you feel at home.
Fast service, love the convenience of the drive thru. Guy working the window was sweet.
I go to this place for all of my jogging-related needs. It's expensive, but everything you want is there.

Love coming to SOTS! First time eating here at the Grove area; we usually go to the one downtown. I ordered my usual - Roasty Toasty with pesto sauce. It didn't taste quite the same as the ones I get at the one in downtown sadly. The consistency of the dough was the same but the savory aspect of the filling tasted different. It could've used a touch of salt. The pesto sauce was decent but felt like it was missing... something.

Overall still love this place and will be back :)

My husband, 2-year old son, and I are in the midst of our move from Boston to Seattle. United Van Lines was contracted by my employer for our move. Our stuff was picked up on 6/6/14 in Boston but took at least 12 days (6/18/14) to leave Boston (not yet confirmed if it has left as of today, 6/18). I called multiple times starting on 6/9/14 to see if and when we had a driver assigned to our load; when told that the anticipated driver would not leave until 6/19, I asked if our load could be given to another driver. Supposedly this was offered to other drivers and declined; but, when I asked for the reasons it was declined, the customer service rep said they were not listed. When I brought up with customer service that our delivery would likely be late (latest delivery date 6/21/14), they did not seem interested in trying to address how to rectify this. They merely talked about their standard delay claims and offering us a "generous" additional $200 to pay for a bed and toys for my son. The multiple email and phone conversations we have had are empty and say nothing--there have been a lot of apologies and words but no action. I get the sense that given the standard delay claims, it is cheaper for United Van Lines to delay a shipment so that the freight is full; that is, there is little (if any) financial incentive for them to deliver on time. In speaking with their customer service representatives, I was told that there was a shortage of drivers, which is why our shipment is delayed. Although they claim that they are trying to address this situation, they seem incapable of accounting for this in their delivery estimates. My son and I are flying into Seattle on 6/21, the supposed last date of delivery. When I emailed and asked why they gave us the delivery window they did, I did not receive a reply.I have been trying to work with the company to see how we might get our load into Seattle on time, but this is not their priority.

Stay away from this moving company. I now believe every word written about United by the other 1 star reviewers because we too, have lived it. We experienced an excellent move from Maine to Florida but the move from Florida to California was an absolute disaster. First, with full knowledge of the weight of the contents as represented by their estimator, the company arranged to send us a driver who could only take part of the load on a cross country move but didn't inform us of that until he finished loading what he could into the truck. He then had to move all the items he spread out in driveway to the garage. The company then sent another truck to load the remainder of the items. That second load did not reach us until a couple weeks later. Many of the items were disassembed and parts were lost. We also incurred substantial damage to a number of items and a box was lost entirely. Since we only took the standard insurance (relying on the success of the Maine to Florida move) we got screwed big time. The coup de grace was the claims process. Here we are, one year later and still waiting for the final claims check. The first check was negated by their system for whatever reason and would have remained unaccounted for if I had not followed up. The claims person apologized and promised to send out another check overnight. Well, here we are three days later and no check. Why am I not surprised. I would not deal with this company again if my life depended on it. It baffles the mind how a CEO, who had any interest in the integrity of his company, could possible read all these one star reviews and take no corrective action. I wonder how many more 1 star reviews is considered enough for somebody to pay attention to what's going on?
The food was fine but the drive thru was so slow waited over 15 minutes to pay.    Only 3 cars in front of me that I could tell.  Less ones learned. Walk in to get any kind of service

I came in with low expectations but was really impressed by the food.  We started with a couple appetizers - loaded chips and onion petals.  The loaded chips were awesome and the onion petals really good with the dipping sauce.  I had the Haven Burger and it was loaded with cheese and cooked perfectly.  I only gave it a 4 because they had a really really limited beer selection.

Ordered at 8:00 am through the drive-thru. Pulled around to wait, not a problem.  I might note, nobody behind me or in front of me. When i got home, missing a breakfast bowl. Called the store and they told me they would remake my order since it would be cold. When I got to the store, the GENERAL MANAGER asked if I brought back the old food.REALLY??!! He gave me attitude and then came over and said, "so you were missing a bowl, so you just want a breakfast bowl?" I just looked at him and said , "whatever".Horrible customer service. It took 46 minutes to get my food and I have to put up attitude from the, GM..

Stopped in last Friday for a late lunch.  Originally intended to sample the revered burger at the Doc Haus just down the street but they had shuttered after the regular lunch hour so to The Haven.

Had been waiting to visit for around 6 years since I first saw her standing forlornly along Morganford.  Many an old timer told me I'd love it, but I knew when the time was right I'd finally get around to it.

Clean, spacious, lots of big screens, Golden Tee, Internet Jukebox, A Bud Fan clock (timeless) and even a framed "Who" album cover.  My kind of place.  There was a decent late lunch crowd so I knew we were going to enjoy.

Each day has a special, with Friday being "Fish" or on that particular day, shrimp.  

I was hungering for a good old fashioned burger and find it I did.  For $8.50 I got the Haven Burger which was 1/2 pound on a very fresh bun with 3 cheeses (cheddar/swiss/provel) and two strips of very nice bacon.  The fries were crinkle cut and piping hot.  Delicious.

My bride went with her tradtional Patty Melt and she love it as well.

Looked like about 5 beers on tap including Bud, Bud Light, Schlafly Pale, Guiness and maybe Natural Lite?

Late night bar menu includes staples like T-Ravs, Moz sticks, cheese fries.

I look forward to a pub crawl that includes the Haven on the route, but until then, I know I'll be returning for many a tasty lunches or dinners.
After party at the Holiday Inn. Despite the brand image, this place was actually pretty decent. Big room and clean.

Chandler was a great host in helping our group with tastings and final selection.
Thanks for your hospitality .  A return trip will be soon.
Executive club makes it easy....but I've never had a problem with National....nice cars...and easy check in/check out

Still in the soft opening stages 
I love private kitchen, and we've been waiting for this place to open for months, so we can eat crab roe pork soup dumplings whenever the craving hits. Ever since the owner said it's opening asap, I have been driving into the plaza whenever I'm nearby to see if it's finally happened, always ready to devour an order or two on the spot. 

And you should definitely go. But if you expect a perfect experience, give them some time. The place still smells a little like paint, the decorations are kind of sparse and they're serving you on little disposable paper plates, and everything including the credit card machine is next door so they still have to work on efficiency.

 The display case is still pretty empty with sides, and if you expect to eat a big meal for a reasonable price, you need to wait for them to work out their rhythm a bit. Otherwise, and order of 6 small soup dumplings is $8, and some come in an order of 8 for $9-12, and 2 people can easily spend $50 after tax tip to not be super full. They don't skimp on the meat, and it can get heavy quickly, but it's not exactly a complete meal without some accompaniments, which I hope will populate the case in the near future. 

I didn't care much about that and I'll def be back after everything is 100% - just had to try soup dumplings asap. They had 6 options on a piece of paper taped to the wall, but only 4 (pork chicken beef pork/crab) were available. No crab roe pork on the menu ;(

And I mean, the flavor was real good. Each meat tasted like the animal itself, and you got a nice chunk in each bao. The soupiness was inconsistent though, and that's a little unsatisfying and disappointing. Probably because in bigger scale production the soup gel isn't distributed as evenly into the filling mix? I don't know. About half of ours were as soupy and satisfying as the private kitchen crab roe pork dumplings. But again, opening kinks. 

Can't wait to see what it becomes in the future! But if you insist on going now, just beware of setting your expectations too high for the little details during what is really still soft opening stages.

A totally different experience for the average Joe. BEST PIZZA IN SAINT LOUIS. Really cheesy pizza with a nice, savory sauce that they manage to roast.  I would categorize Black Thorn as a Pizza joint, with a plus of random bar games spread around. DIY decoration (chalk signatures and quotes from your next door neighbor). It does look like a dive bar when you come in. The music selection is as underground as it gets most of the time. 

Ah, and another thing you can expect is a long wait and nonchalant servers. This is part of the deal. I keep coming back for more, and probably so will you!

Big Fail for National St. Louis location for being a grinch during the holidays.  I've been a member of National's Emerald Club for years and rent from this location every 2-3 months.  I made a reservation for the holidays and just had to make a slight change - I'm coming in 8 hours earlier - and now they are not honoring a coupon code I was granted for the initial reservation.  After calling customer service, I was re-directed to the St. Louis location where the woman told me that because of the holidays, they have raised the rates and making a change to a reservation is like starting over.  Thanks for holiday gouging St. Louis National.  I will be checking other rental options from now on.
worst service! Could not get our order right. Went in side and got not service whatsoever. Been going to this location since 1960. Will never return.

The pizza was good.  We went on a Saturday night.  When we got there around 8, the place was packed.  By 10, it was empty!  Our group had about 6 people in it.  We still had our pizza on the table with our beers just enjoying the eveing when the owner came over and started clearing out all of our stuff- taking the silverwear and plates!  The place is open until 12 or 1, but we basically got the boot at 10:30.  Normally, I'd go back for the pizza, but after that I felt totally unwelcomed there.
Staff was friendly, food was good (frittata, bacon, coffee). Would love to see more places like this in the area.

A great selection of flavors is important -- and the Island generally delivers. Not the highest quality fro-yo (sometimes a little liquid-y or icy for my taste), but let's be honest, you really pick Fro-Yo Favorites based on where you can get your favorite toppings. The Island has a plethora of options for toppings - whether you want chocolate-y, crunchy, fruity, or chewy, there's something for you.

The staff is very welcoming and encourages you to try all of the flavors to keep you coming back for more! They're very reasonably priced, and with a location right in the heart of Soulard, it's hard to say no to froyo.
By far the largest sauce location. Ski fountain drinks. The Duke is my favorite calzone. The Strawberry Fields salad rocks!

Very little options for midsize cars. It was either mini vans or compacts. I guess this is typical when you arrive on a Tuesday, most business travelers arrive Monday and then your stuck trying to get a decent. At.

Also shuttle you have to wait for each individual rental car service to pick you up at airport. It took about 15 minutes to arrive so give yourself time going back.

I wish I could give a zero. I do not know where to begin. I guess the positive is the sales associate, Scott was very nice, informative and seemed to genuinely care. Unfortuantely, there was nothing he could do about the blunder that had unfolded. We had to store our belongings for 3 months, therefore, the move out of storage to our new location was where everything went wrong. Lets start with the fact we moved during the slowest moving season and yet our load was divided into two loads. I am not sure how they thought over 9500 pounds was going to fit into 12 feet left on a truck. The agent called and told me that they were going to ship the 2nd load and have it there the same day. Then the day before arrival they informed me that they changed the plans and my second load would not arrive until over a week later (was not even given an exact date at this time and it was going to be way out of their contracted delivery window).  Since I was out of town for work at the time this meant I needed to buy another flight and rent another car to be there for the second move because if I wasnt then I was informed they would charge me over $4000/day for storage. When my first delivery came there was 21 pieces damaged, most were unrepairable. It was obviously negligence that led to this as they tried to cram as much stuff as they could in the 12 feet of the truck. As an example, they snapped a metal coffee table and a solid wood leaf to a dining table. Of course there was no way of knowing what was here and what was not since half my stuff was still to be delivered. Once the second load arrived it was also noted that two high valued items were missing and supposedly on the first load. It took 2 weeks and a lot of stress to track them down. They were delivered to the wrong people. While they were willing to compensate for the exact value of the damage (not replacement value), there was no reimbursment offered for the delay or the extra costs I had to incur to be there for the second delivery. Not only that, but the aloof attitude of "Sorry, these things happen" was extremely frustrating. When my claim was esculated to United Vanlines the customer service rep there (Diane) was downright rude. Telling me that if I thought for a minute they were going to pay for my flight and rental I was mistaken. They finally, after many weeks of frustration, agreed as a "Good Will Gesture" to add an additional $400 onto my reimbursement.  Mind you this was a very expensive, cross country move.  The attitude I was given was not acceptable. These were my possessions that I have worked hard for and the attitude was "Oh Well, it happens". I asked to know that the responsilble parties, such as the operations manager that originally okay'd my load to go onto the first truck,  were disciplined. I was told by one of their own employees that all this was avoidable, that my stuff should have never went on that first truck in the first place. How do you damage 21 pieces of furniture and it not be considered grossly negligent. United Vanlines of course is a huge company and obviously protects the individual companies so the individual customer doesnt have a chance to fight them. You are just expected to accept whatever happens and also pay in full for it. They should be ashamed to even call themselves a customer service department. They do not serve the customer they serve the big company that is untouchable.

Was very satisfied with this place! It's a great place to stop by for an afternoon snack. Personally, these fluffy little dumplings can't fill me up enough to be a meal, but they are definitely a nice snack place!

I'm in the process of moving  from Orlando to California now. United Van Lines picked up all my furniture on  December 8 with promise to deliver it strictly within 10 days. Today, after 12 days my furniture is still here in Orlando. Don't trust them!!!

On the recommendation of a coworker, I checked out The Daily Bread today for lunch.  It is a short drive from my office in Des Peres.  There was plenty of parking.  The inside of the restaurant was another story. It was packed, but this is to be expected on a weekday around noon.  Luckily, I was placing my order to go so a lack of seating didn't matter to me today.

I looked over the menu and chose The Daily Bread Special sandwich.  This sandwich features roast beef, ham, salami, provel cheese (I'm a St. Louisan, what can I say? I love it), pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pepperoncinis & DB sauce on a French baguette. I am not pepperoncinis fans so I chose to forgo those.  

Uninspired is the only word that comes to mind when I think of the food.  The sandwich reminded me too much a grocery store poor boy.  The meats, cheese, and veggies were all very plain.  The bread had a great flavor, but seemed unnecessarily chewy.  As a result, each bite felt like work.  The sauce was good and probably the best part of the sandwich.  

While I wasn't thrilled with this meal, I will likely return and try something else from the menu.  They had a good selection of salads, pizzas, and sandwiches.  So who knows, I may find something I like next time.

Having auto body work done is a pain and can be expensive. The staff at this ABRA make the process very painless; working with you and staying in contact throughout the process. They were able to arrange for a rental, too, which helped minimize any disruption.
Great selection and service! STL has a good location near the airport that is a short shuttle ride away. Emerald Isle Executive is the best.

After far too many bad experiences at the Steak 'n Shake at Hampton/40, I decided it was worth driving to this location to get my steakburger fix. What a great idea that was! Unlike the other location, this one is clean and has pleasant servers that can keep up with the demands that come along with a restaurant full of people. The food was hot and delicious and I didn't leave wanting to punch someone in the face. This is where I'll go from now on!

Had our first trip to Sauce of the Side about a month ago, so we wanted to bring our kids when they came for the holidays.  We went to a different location the last time and were hugely disappointed to find out that this particular location does not honor a uniform (military) discount like the other location did unless you are in uniform.  Being stationed over in Illinois it is highly unlikely that military member will drive over to St. Louis for an hour lunch break.  So, that did not make us happy. Insert super sad face. However, at least the food here, like the other location, is the bomb!  They have many different choices of calzones and also have the option of creating your own version.  The dough is soft and fillings are all seasoned to perfection.  They definitely know how to bring the flavor to their fare.  The combinations are really awesome and I can't wait to try another winning calzone. Also, they are huge and easily can be 2 meals for an average person!

Tried PokeDoke for 1st time last night, it was amazing, no place like it in StL.  I don't write many yelp reviews, only in extreme good or bad scenarios, and this was extreme good.
Good choice of bases (I did half greens half sobe noodles) and protein (ahi tuna excellent, octopus good, salmon average), with MANY different drizzles and flavoring options (seaweed salad excellent, crab excellent, I also sampled other yummy flavors like eel sauce, gojuguang, ginger, chili oili, kimchi)
Definitely will return and definitely recommend everyone check it out.
My first time here tonight. Fresh, different yummy. Reminded me of an Asian Subway where you pick your toppings.

While visiting family in the area, I came here a couple of times to pick up groceries. I thought the selection was decent, especially in the produce area. The cashiers were friendly enough, and offered my niece and nephew stickers on our way out the door. Not the best grocery, but it will take care of your basic needs!
Great Pizza! Cool place. If you give less than 5 stars you're an idiot.  It's just got character !!

I finally gave the "Double Decker" burger a try after declaring that The Haven Burger could not be improved upon...and I was wrong!

The Double Decker is two patties of similar weight to the Haven Burger (half-pound), but instead of broiled, the 2 patties are cooked on the griddle, delivering all the greasy goodness you'd expect in a stovetop burger.  

I now consider The Haven to be my favorite St Louis burger destination, jumping ahead of The Hilltop, Village Bar, Carl's Drive-in and Cousin Hugo's.

My lovely spouse also ventured from her favorite Patty Melt to the Friday Special...Cod Platter with 2 sides or Cod Sandwich with 1 side.  She opted for the sammy and it was gorgeous.  A sizable portion of absolutely perfectly fried cod.  Melt in your mouth delicious.

The Haven...yum!

The food is great and the staff is even better!

They make being at the airport a pleasure!
They need to serve booze in the winter time, or something! Love this place though. Always different flavors and I appreciate clean enviornments.

Love the recently remodeled Bar and Restaurant. The pizza is the same fantastic, deep dish pie they've always served. It's a great place to hang out with friends and enjoy the new atmosphere because the long wait for the pizza has not changed LOL.

This is the best deep dish pizza in STL. 

Dave, Thanks for responding! you definitely have the best deep dish pizza in St Louis but not necessarily the best overall pizza in St Louis. LOL that, and the wait, although totally worth it, is a bit long. is why I only gave it 4 stars but we will definitely keep coming back! PS I would have given you 4. 5 if Yelp would make it an option!!

So I did a funny thing a couple weeks ago. I cut off my shoulder length, chemically straightened hair really short. Like, 3-inches-all-around short. 

The plus? I revealed a mop of naturally curly hair that I LOVE. 

The downside? Well...it was pretty uneven, and there were a few straight pieces in the back that I didn't get. Did I mention I did the initial cut myself? Okay.

So I went to Frontenac Salon and Spa. They have a few stylists that specialize in cutting and styling curly hair (they specialize in the "Deva" cutting method), and after doing a lot of research, I decided to book with Jamie.

She was SUPER friendly. She told me exactly everything she was doing, exactly what products she was using and how to use them -- and she did all of this without trying to push products on me to purchase -- a huge plus. She even offered me tea while I was sitting underneath the dryer!

The salon offers a half off special on Tuesdays for new clients, so I was thrilled. My haircut, deep conditioning treatment, and style came to only $40, which seemed reasonable for the level of service I received. I would DEFINITELY go back. This place was awesome!
Great beer selection, Delicious food, clean environment and a friendly staff everything you could want and more in a restaurant!

I've been to Grace twice now, and it's clear Rick cares about his craft.  Today I had the Fried Catfish.  It was light, seasoned well, and cooked perfectly.  On the side I had the Hoppin John and the Roasted Cauliflower casserole.  Both sides were very, very good.   The service is great and the atmosphere is really fun.  The first time I went there I went all out and got the Fried Bologna sandwich.  The sandwich has pimento cheese and a fried egg on it and its fantastic.  If I'm being picky, the mac n cheese was kind of dry that day...but I'm reaching there.  Great concept, great service, fun atmosphere, great people...great food.  I'm hooked.

I've had pizza from all over the country.  None even compares to the pizza at Black Thorn!

There is nothing better than a thin crust pizza and a pitcher of Smithwick's from Black Thorn Pub!

I lived outside of St. Louis for a little over a year.  I recently moved back, and it  may have been because I missed Black Thorn pizza!

I was looking for a place to get a pregnancy massage and came across Sound Stone. They do not disappoint! Very calming environment and the staff makes you feel comfortable. Doesn't hurt that it is super close to my home! Highly recommend.

The people were very nice. The car selection, however, was embarrassing. Minivans (one of which only had front seats), a single pickup truck, something that looked like a low end Ford Fiesta, and a Dodge Charger. Could not use the Dodge Charger as I had two others with me. Both were senior citizens. My only realistic choice was to drive around a monster minivan. I have rented from National in many places but this was prolly the worst selection I had ever seen. Going Avis next time I fly to STL.

Maybe 3 1/2 stars? Stopped in for a Friday lunch while on a bike ride of the River Des Peres Greenway & Carondelet Park. I was concerned about service per recent reviews but service was prompt, friendly, and food came out quickly. Two of us shared onion petals and the steak sandwich, and it was plenty. Loved the horseradish sauce with the onions! The kitchen was kind enough to halve the steak sandwich and side of slaw, and so we were each served our half on our own individual plates - nice touch! The steak sandwich had good flavor with mushrooms and provel added, was cooked to medium as requested, but something just not right. The steak is shaped like the hoagie bun, so it feels like it's not actually a real cut of beef. Sort of like a McRib is not really ribs if you know what I mean. And the texture was kind of mushy. I could not finish it because it seemed like fake steak. Not sure how else to describe it. Atmosphere is great - feels like the south side neighborhood tavern that has not changed in many years. Another diner told of her grandfather coming here for brain sandwiches 40 or more years ago. Love that south side ambience. Everything was neat and clean, including restrooms. I would try a burger next time, but would definitely come back.

We ordered 35 Silver Box Lunches for our grade school's end-of-the-year Teacher Appreciation lunch, and everything was beautifully presented and DE-LISH!  The variety they offered was right-on.  The Daily Bread was so easy to work with.  Not a single glitch.

My favorite is the Roasty Toasty but I've like all the ones I've tried. Its nice because it is large enough to feed you two meals and they have great take away boxes. Staff is always really friendly and go the extra mile to make sure you have what you need.

After reading some of the detailed reviews of this place, I figured I'd go light.

My family and I love this place.  We don't necessarily go here every weekend, but if we're in the area in the morning, we'll hit it up.  I'm never really too bummed out by the lines, and I have never had trouble finding a table (although they are always busy).  My time in line gives me time to take in the large-ish menu, and the tables just open up.

The food is good, the pastries are great.  Sometimes they have samples spread out on tables, sometimes they don't.  The coffee is hot and full of caffeine.  When I'm there, I'm looking for a morning meal, and they surpass Panera, but aren't so fancy that I have to worry about my wallet.

It's a good fit for a nice breakfast without the commitment of a traditional restaurant.

Building has since changed management. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. In short liars and thieves. Expensive items "disappeared" during my move out without explanation. Management was not cooperative whatsoever. This place is going down and fast. Buyer beware!!

Grandson purchased his head unit here and everything was great. He then received an amp, box and sub for Christmas. It worked for a minute and he returned to figure out why. After about fifteen minutes the tech re-installed and it works fine. He found a couple of loose connections on the sub.

Great casual dining in the Grove.  Nice selection of food and decent selection of local beers.  Staff was efficient and food was outstanding.  My son and I both ordered the Meat Me In St Louis calzone.  Very good (especially when paired with a Zwickel).  We went on a Friday night and parking lot as easy and the restaurant was busy but not crowded.  We will definitely go again.

Decent poke place, nice flavors, fresh tasting, and a good mount of topping options. Was excited to try it out when they opened cause my previous and first experience had been in Australia and I didn't know it was a thing in The US. Unfortunately when my friends and I came back, they had increased their prices a bit which made the food just out of range for my budget preferences. With the new price of food being $12 for a medium bowl I would much rather get a larger proportion of food and proteins elsewhere.

No no no. This place is extremely overpriced and the food is cut up in bite sized pieces with extra small portion sizes. I ordered my four year old son an adult meal with plans to take the remaining home like usual but he ate all it. 

The food was seasoned well, but the average sized person will probably stop and get something to eat after leaving. They're charging you to pay for the decent decor.

We just hit this place for the second time last night and had a stupendous meal. Loved the turkey leg - tender and delicious. The wife loved the pork special. Cool vibe, delicious food, friendly and knowledgeable workers, and reasonable prices. Big improvement from first meal after restaurant just opened when the ribs were okay (not as good as Pappu's or vernons) and the duck meatloaf was described as too rich by my wife. They have obviously worked the kinks out. Glad to see they also added mild spice option on the fried chicken. Will definitely be back!

This is some of the best pizza I've EVER had!!! Don't think it's such a great idea to have people wait on themselves though. I understand it's a dive but throw me a bone here. The only thing good about this place is the pizza. Period. And look out for the rather rude bald guy working on Sundays. He's a real DB.

I cannot give enough stars to Dr. Fontana.  He is so adorable and nice!  I had Lasik about 3 years ago and after the initial year of checkups with TLC had to find a optometrist for yearly checkups.  I found Dr. Fontana through my insurance website and picked him since his office is right by my house.

He's probably been practicing for over 50 years and is just so grandfatherly.  He's very thorough and uses up to date (to my knowledge) equipment.  He peppers in casual personal questions throughout the exam - not in a prying, small talk way, but in a general curious to know way.  I just love him so much and he is one doctor I don't mind having to go see.

We stopped here during a layover to grab some beers and a snack.  The meatballs were good, salad was good, fried ravioli was ok, and the garlic bread was a little less than ok.  The beers were all good.  If we're in the airport again we might check this place out again, but mainly for the extremely friendly and helpful waiter we had.
Only review I've ever written. Slowest, worst, rudest fast food "restaurant" I've ever been too. They don't say, "Hi, thank you, is that all". Avoid whenever possible.

I have never been disappointed eating at the haven!! As a family favorite - I visit at least once every few weeks. Whether for a beer and a game or just dinner it's always great! My favorite is the French dip, or the steak sandwich. Today I tried the cod sandwich and it was the best I've ever had! Food is always hot too, service is always friendly. I will always be a loyal haven customer!

This is the first restaurant that I've visited in a long while that intrigued and amazed me with every bite. We sat at the bar because, on a Friday night, it was hoppin' at 7PM, and seating was limited. Still, the bar was nice, and the service friendly and accommodating!

First, a brilliantly curated wine list and carefully crafted cocktails, then onto some flavor-effusive appetizers. We had the hominy hush puppies, the dirty rice, and the greens, each one making our tastebuds sing. The hush puppies were perfectly crisp on the outside, tender and decadent on the inside. The cucumber sauce added a creamy dimension of garden freshness. The dirty rice had a tangy onion zesty-ness to it that had my fork diving in again and again. The greens accented with peppers gave them an unexpected boost.

If the apps were this incredible, we couldn't wait for the entree! Nathan, our awesome bartender/server highly recommended the fried chicken and cornbread waffles, so I ordered that. What I received was a "Dolly Cluckton"- sized breast atop a firm and flavorful cornbread waffle, with a dollop of butter, and syrup and hot sauce on the side for as little or as much dowsing as I pleased. I used about half of the small bottle of hot sauce and most of the mini ramekin of syrup. The chicken was perfection - just tender enough to be able to absorb the sauce throughout. It was so delicious, I kept eating and eating, getting through about half of the enormous breast before my stomach called "Uncle." 
This place is now at the top of my list of go-tos for 2018, and places to take StL guests!
Highest of three bids.  Technician misdiagnosed problem and was going to charge $365 for a problem that just needed an adjustment which should have been simply done for a service call charge.

The staff and location were both great. Other than that : mediocre. Nothing special. I've stayed at holiday inns before and was expecting the fountains and the indoor pools and hottubs and spas... This place had a "gym" and an outdoor pool which didn't help me in November. The room was standard, clean. The heat is motion activated so I kept waking up freezing. And there was random little things that were frustrating: I had to swipe my card three times every time for door to open, the side door didn't close you had to pull it with all your might to shut it, the elevator door closed almost beside you were in it. My wifi stopped working and I had to call their customer service department which is a teenager that answers phones with great ideas like "have you tried turning it off and on again?" But the worst part , the walls were paper thin. And there was a crying baby next door. And they were replacing Carpet above me until like 10 pm. I could even hear this person drop soap in the shower and the baby sneeze. I can never usually hear anything from other rooms. Doors opening and slamming shut all night. If you book through Priceline idk how much it is maybe it would be an okay deal if you don't want to sleep but going straight through hotel, WAY over priced.
Neat place with good and unique desserts. Could only give it 3 stars because it smells like fish or some other kind of greasy food so bad inside that we had to go outside while waiting for our food.

Yes, I know this is the dreaded fast food. But seriously, it's nothing like the processed meat products you get at other roast beef chains, or even from the deli case at the grocery store. This is your grandma's roast beef, cooked rare and sliced so super thin you can see through it if you held it up. They scoop up a handful of the heavenly stuff and plop it on a buttered bun and then covered it all with seasoned salt. 

I like it with BBQ sauce, but I know lots of people who opt for the horsy sauce or au jus. 

And where else do you have a restaurant where almost everyone orders just one sandwich...that is just meat on a bun. Yes, it's that good. 

The fries are good too. I like them with the seasoned salt or a side of cheese sauce if I'm feeling thin that day. 

And the ice cream concretes (think DQ blizzard if you aren't a STL native) are a wonderful treat. Add a drive thru or plenty of seating inside, and you've got a winner.

Wow.  The arrogance.  Who do these people think they are?  Yes, the dumplings are pretty good.  But let me warn you to be careful before going here.  I tried to call and place an order for take out.  Several calls.  Always an answering machine.  I almost did not go thinking they were closed... but no... they just do not answer their freakin phone... I order a couple of orders of dumplings at the counter and they have a no credit card policy for orders less than $25... again WTF? I pay cash.  I wait.  My dumplings arrive and I depart.  In the end, the dumplings were pretty good -- but three stars good or maybe four stars good.  Not Five stars good.  For more than a dollar per dumpling I was expecting more. Bah.

Came at 6:45 on Saturday at the store was absolutely dark. I even tried calling twice before we arrived and got an automated message saying "this number is not set up to receive phone calls." Extremely unprofessional and disappointing.
Not in the best place. Got our order wrong and the fries were not good at all. Along with that, they didn't give us out straws and ignored us as we tried to ask for them.

Reliable. Fast. Delicious. The drive through makes it really easy. 

Obviously this is just a basic sandwich place. Nothing complex but reasonable prices.

Best fast chicken place around 
Great customer service. Food is always fresh might take a extra few mins but well worth the wait and can taste the quality.

I've been twice,  first time it was pretty good we had the crab cake, greens and potatoes. Second time was very upset we tried the poboys the pork and the Red fish one, very salty and not a real poboy sandwich  barely any fish on there and pickles onions and sauce that's it!!! if you've ever had one before theirs will disappoint you. Bread was hard and the chips they gave were like crumbs and very salty everything this time just taste like a bunch of salt was used to season all their food. The greens were not like what I had the first time at all different type of greens and peppers in them. So to be honest it seemed like they were short on food and just threw something together this go round, not consistent at all!!! And also for what you get it's overpriced,,, they are making a killing over nothing

A perfect example of a horrible experience and a terrible lack Of planning. I ordered a bacon and egg sandwich with bacon egg and bread seriously for 1495 you would think they would put some mayo or lettuce or tomato or anything on it this is pathetic.

Moved from NY to SC United (which works with Mayflower and Armstrong relocation services under UNIGROUP) was the company that was hired by my hospital to move me (I am a physician). I unfortunately only mostly  cons here to report

I'll get this out of the way for now: PROs: They were polite at first. And actually very efficient in packing my things for my move while I was there to watch them (see below for further details). 

Pre Move: They were completely unorganized. I have a number of pieces of glass furniture and repeatedly told them about the sizes and number of items that I had that required crating (this means they would pack the glass items separately and more securely for the move). This was done by a 3rd party person. The 3rd party was great, but he was told I had 1 piece of glass. And had to go out and find more wood to crate only a few of my items. 

They had scheduled a time to come to pick my things up prior to me going to work. And they showed up 3 hours late. I understand that traffic and schedules change, but when I left for work (because they were late and I had to then go and leave them there), my roommate came an hour later and found them DRINKING HIS BEER WHILE MOVING MY STUFF. And their excuse was me saying before I left, if you get hot you can help yourself to drinks in the fridge, I had meant water, soda etc. I didn't realize that United, and Armstrong condoned drinking while on the job. 

When I got to SC my stuff came late. So the third party movers who were there for mounting my TV and putting together surround sound etc, they were waiting by themselves and then left. My items then came the next day. 

Everything had been broken. The boxes were smashed to bits. My dresser was barely able to stand upright. My glass desk was missing pieces. My glass dining table had a cracked base that someone had placed tape over. The estimated cost of everything to replace was around 8000 dollars. My bed had no support beams. Just some wood around it (I had to build a makeshift support for my boxspring and mattress). My bookshelf had the back smashed in because a box went through it. I had missing dining ware, no plates or silverware. 

I was furious. I made a claim, because the claim was over 5000, they bumped the claim to United. From here they sent a claims adjuster, who claimed that my dresser, which again i mention COULD NOT STAND UPRIGHT, seemed like it must have been in this condition before I moved it. I'm not sure, how he thought I would agree that I must have just moved trash down from NY, but he seemed to be trying to convince me of that. As usual they did their best to cheapen their deal, which is their job I suppose, but here was the straw that finally broke me. 

They told me I couldn't get rid of any of the broken furniture until the settlement was finished. This process then lasted 2.5 months. I came to a new city, and had to live with broken things until they gave me my settlement. My settlement did not include any of the bigger pieces of furniture, just the small things. 

When I asked if they could fix the furniture I got no response. Customer service for the company (which you will have to call multiple companies to climb the ladder until you get to Unigroups claim center is lead by a man named Vick. Vick is the guard dog. He refused to let me talk to claims agents, stating that I had to email instead. When I asked to speak to a manager, he refused to put me through instead he made me email as well. It wasn't until I found out his name and the name of his manager did I get anywhere. 

I understand that things can happen. But the complete lack of respect for my things in all phases of this really just made this whole process terrible. The lack of coordination in the beginning, the clear damage done and the refusal of responsibility, and then the inability to speak to claims agents, all these are why it seems that United has gotten such horrible ratings on line. And I seem to be just another person who is added to this list. 

Final result: I have gotten about 3000 dollars because of the items they simply lost. 0 dollars for broken furniture that they have made me keep. I will likely be in arbitration (an extended review) in order to get this sorted out, and I am anticipating that I will have to go more of a legal route (which I don't want to but its that or give up). 

I really recommend trying to find another company if you can when you move your things. It has been an awful experience.
This place is huge (the bathrooms aren't), but it's a great place for sports people.  They have simple bar foods, like burgers and wings n stuff.  And there are a ton of TVs.
From the moment we walked in it was such a great experience. Friendly people, nice atmosphere, and superb service. Would definitely recommend, and will definitely be back.

If I had paid full price I might feel ripped of, but seeing as I got a deal from Hotwire I'm fine with staying here. Over all I'm not impressed, this place could really use updating.

The room itself was clean and everything worked, but a good example of the lack of updating would be the old-school, non-HD TV.

Terrible. Staff is terrible and has screwed up my orders on multiple occasions.  The late night crew smoking right next to the pick up window. The terribly rude staff that gives me at least an average of one thing wrong per order, and the completely unapologetic reaponse when you complain. I will be conplaining to every outlet i can. Even the crappy downtown mcdonalds are better. I will be contacting someone higher up, and if i do not hear back i will keep going till someone does something.

Delicious dumplings! Simple menu and you should not go in expecting anything but soup dumpling options. I had the pork, chicken, beef, and crap/pork dumplings. The owner is very nice and she demonstrated the proper way to eat the dumplings - place it on the spoon, break the dumpling to slurp the soup and then add soy sauce, vinegar and/or chili paste and eat.

If I could rate any lower I would. Six workers are wondering around the establishment while it takes an hour for me to get my food after I was the third car in line. Only God knows what took so long, after I proceeded to the window I ordered a single steak burger with a large fry. At the window they gave me a burger and a medium fry, I asked them to correct the fry size and the manager tells me I can't get a large fry with that burger. If I wanted a large they'd have to charge me for a different burger and remake my meal. If you have common sense you will stay far away from this shithole.
this is one of my favorite schnucks to frequent. I love the salad bar. they have a large produce section. a butchers meat counter, etc....

I echo everyone's sentiments about the relaxing atmosphere and treatment.  I went all out and got a 90 minute massage from Patrick.  This place and Patrick did not disappoint!  I will recommend to my family and friends and wanted to give them a top rating on Yelp also!

Boy do I wish my husband had gone on Yelp before hiring these people.  Moved from NY to FL - truck was several days late with ridiculous excuses.  I'm watching through the window now as my husband is desperately trying to reach someone named Tammy on the phone - driver, Tomas (beware!) can't work his IPad to pull up the manifest and is threatening to leave without unloading our stuff because of HIS INCOMPETENCE.    I'm terrified that all our stuff will be hijacked or, when they finally do unload everything will be broken/damaged.  I've moved many times in my life and have NEVER experienced anything like these people.  Whatever happened to people giving a shit about their reputation or job performance?  This is a nightmare.  Can't wait to see how they weasel out of the "$100/day refund for arriving late".  They've been here for over an hour and haven't unloaded a single item.  Now the driver is just walking around and around the truck as if he can't figure out where the door is.  Wish I was recording this so I could post it.  I'm starting to think I'm the victim of some kind of practical joke. These people can't be for real!

Ok. We've been here several times now. . .trying to give them a chance at redemption.  They have a couple of issues that need to be addressed.  ONE: The fried chicken.  The first time I experienced it, must have been fresh out the skillet.  Great taste, crispy and hot.  However, each time since, I must be too late for the 'fresh' batch.  It's sad because the chicken has been horrible; tastes like it was cooked early in the day and sat in the heating pan all day.  TWO:  The Turkey Club.  Huge sandwich. . .could be good.  However, they only put a few scraps of turkey between Texas toast and a ton of garnish.  I ordered it for take-out lunch.  By the time I got to my office, I was sorely disappointed.  In all fairness, I did bring this to the attention of management who expressed their apologies and that she would look into the issue.  I haven't ordered it again yet to see if it has been corrected.

I really want this business to survive which is why I keep giving them 'second chances'.  I think they have great potential and I really want them to succeed.

Kat (the GM) provides horrible customer service.  My online order was placed over 1.5 hours ago and I have still not received my sandwich.   Naturally, I call to check the status of the order because I did receive a text notification that the amount has been taken out of my account from Jimmy Johns of $11.50.  Apparently they never received my order because there was an issue with the online website.  They suggest I contact their corporate office to resolve at $11.50 issue.  What a joke.  No compensation, no apology, horrible customer service.  I'm very disappointment with my experience here and guarantee my business will be taken elsewhere.
go early - take awhile to get your pizza but its good.  Been there about 10 times over 10 years nothing has changed.  Good beer selection.

Highly recommended ....and didn't disappoint!

We were a group of 4 & each ordering our own calzone. (1) salad was ordered to share. 

I didn't have much of an appetite but took my first bite of Meat me in St Louis. Then before I knew it, my plate was clean! This was the best damn calzone I have ever tasted! Fresh ingredients and the dough was soft with right amount of crisp. 

The salad was a small but could feed our group of 4. 

Service staff was friendly and accommodating. 

Highly recommend sauce on the side!!
The chicken was soggy and the fries were to salty. I really enjoyed by coffee though. The service was slow. I would overall say say it was an ok experience.

Loved the chips. The dip however not so much. Tasted no jalapeño.....pretty much seemed like velveeta. Now the burger, the burger was good!! Not a fan of the hoagie bun though, I like a regular hamburger bun. But the taste was great!

Let me start off by saying this was my first time eating at Black Thorn, and I can at least partially blame my poor dining experience on my confusion about their menu. But even though I ordered the wrong pizza, I still couldn't believe how bad the pizza was: it gets a solid one star. The bread to topping ratio was 9:1, and wasn't cooked through, resulting in a mushy, doughy interior. The zesty sauce couldn't make up for the bland interior, and the non-existent cheese didn't help its case. 

I read favorable reviews about the pan pizza, and assumed the Chicago and pan style were synonymous, so I ordered pan when I called in my order. I realized my mistake at the bar when I was paying, and the bartender was friendly and explained how it worked, hence the second star.  However, unless you've eaten there before and know and for some reason like their pan style pizza, DO NOT order it. 

I'm a pizza lover and appreciate all styles of pizza. However this one, not so much. I'm willing to try again and order the Chicago style pizza I'd originally hoped for. With more cheese, I could imagine the balance of zesty sauce, crust and gooey cheese to be at least palatable.

I've visited a couple times since I've moved to STL, and each time I come in with high expectations/stereotypes about Poke places. 

Unfortunately, I've been disappointed each time, maybe I should lower my standards a bit...the service and wait times are higher than other poke places... and the bubble tea is severely lacking. The dumplings are hot and taste fresh, however. The Poke is average. 

TL; DR: Come at your discretion, don't expect too much in re to bubble tea.

Just tried PokeDoke for the first time and it was awesome! I am a sushi fan and was slightly skeptical of eating it as a bowl, but the quality of the meat was good and they had tons of different toppings and sauces with it so you basically just design your own giant sushi role. They also has chicken available if you're not into sushi. Overall it was an awesome experience and I look forward to going back soon.

I ordered on postmates. Calzones were amazing and VERY FILLING. You could probably share one if you're a light eater. We got the puttanesca and the five 0. Really really good. Would definitely get again. And excited to try others!!!

I must say, the food is definitely alright as long as things don't get too busy too quickly.  The bakery does it's best.  Please don't try to order a gift card  online, it cannot be done.  Just get coffee, sandwiches, soups, or salads online.  Otherwise donotanswer!!

I really like the food here. I got the Mary bear, and I highly recommend it. It's possibly the best breakfast sandwich I've had in my life.

I kinda was expecting a sit down restaurant experience but it is not that. You order, pay, and then sit down until they deliver the food to you. They also have a drive thru. We went there when it was very, very crowded, and the seating situation felt a bit too snug. I will definitely be interested in going back, just hopefully when it is not quite as busy.

I give this company 0 stars.  I can not even begin to tell you how terrible this company is!  First I was forced to leave a hefty thousand dollar deposit that was promised to be reimbursed with in 3 days of the return of the car.  The kicker is that it has been an entire month and still no credit.  To add insult to injury National car rental customer service team is the worst!  I have spoken to several representatives and everyone has been extremely dismissive.  I have felt as if I have been in the twilight zone or been in the middle of some giant scam.  Speaking of scam, the icing in the cake is that then my credit card had to be closed due to fraudulent activity.  You do the math.  DO NOT DO BUSINESS with this company!!!!!!  I am still trying to get my money back.
This is one of the best informal and relaxing restaurants in STL. Staff great.  Food outstanding.

No big surprise here! Rick Lewis has another winner. What a great addition to the Grove. The proteins are the star of the show. I had the rib's they  might be better than my favorite from Bogarts. My boy ensures me the fried chicken is the best he has had. The new space is decorated up perfect for his style of cooking.  The Grove gets better and better. Cant wait to see what comes here next.

Stayed here for 5 days, staff was very friendly and housekeeping was very accomdating to us with extra towels and a lot of extra coffee. Really love that the bath products are bath and body works. Bed is comfortable,relatively clean, if you walk around without shoes beware of your feet turning black. Wish there were more outlets. Delicious FREE cookies made daily at the front desk. 

Elevator is slow and the carpeting throughout are dated with stains but a lot of seating one the first floor. Gym has 4 cardio machines and weights rack. Pool is nice and fast food in walking distance

I have lived in St. Louis for five years now, and for some reason I allowed myself to go that whole time without trying Black Thorn....what was I thinking?
