Called ahead for a Chicago-style carry out pizza because of the reviews warning me about the crazy lines, rude bartenders, and poor service.  I have to say, that wasn't my experience at all!  I picked up my pizza 45 minutes later from a very nice, helpful bartender and saw tons of empty booths and tables.  

Got the pizza home and....wow.  A good pizza usually has good crust, or sauce, or cheese, or toppings...this was the whole package.  Great slightly-spicy sauce, delicious sausage, TONS of cheese and great crust.  Will be sure to return!

My mom and I had a great Southern USA BBQ cuisine meal at this new, excellent restaurant in the Tower Grove neighborhood of #StLouis: 5 stars, especially for the pork ribs, friend chicken livers, tall biscuit, mashed potatoes and gravy: all site-made and fresh! Happy early #MothersDay to us!

Also, VERY clean bathrooms (ALWAYS a good sign), excellent table service. Great decor (wall hanging art was made by the female co-owner(: original, beautiful, large, collage-like sculptures made with found objects and succulents. 

NOTE: if you use the bathroom, be VERY CAREFUL opening the door to leave: that hallway is also the food-runners' aisle from the kitchen to the dining room! 

The male half of the married couple who own this new place came over to speak with us, too, so we were able to tell him how much we liked it. Since my mom is from Kentucky and has lived in St. Louis since she was 12, her opinion of Southern BBQ cuisine MATTERS! 

They offer ice, lemons, sugar and artificial sweeteners, fountain soft drinks, water, and 3 types of iced tea at a self-serve beverage center situated conveniently near but not blocking the ordering/pick-up counter.  

They get VERY busy, so highly recommend going during "non-peak" hours or expect to wait in line (which they've organized). But, the cooks, order-takers and food runners are friendly and move quickly with great efficiency, even though this IS "slow food" at its best. 

You can get the food to carry-out to home or dine-in at varied size tables, single high stools at the small counter (doubling for those waiting for carry-out, too), or outside on benches. If you dine in or outside, they give you a table marker to ID and bring your food to you.

Great, large, soft napkins and hot sauce with salt & pepper at each table. They'll bring BBQ sauce upon request, but pork ribs were great without it, too. 

Prices seemed a bit high until we realized we got enough food for two meals, each, for the cost of $41, which worked out to about $11/per meal (we tipped 10% above that, since we thought it was set up for mostly no wait service, but we were wrong: they DO have food runners, and they are VERY attentive. Next time, bigger tips!). 

So, pricing is very fair, since we got (for the total ring-up cost of $41):
--- one appetizer (enough food there for two); 
---two "mains" (one "third"--4-- and one "half"--8-- slabs of pork ribs = 12 ribs, total); 
---one VERY tall biscuit (definitely enough for 2); 
and 
---2 sides (I ate half of each for lunch and brought the rest home, since Mom didn't want any of these except to taste the mashed potatoes and gravy; she's not big on collards). .  

Only weird choice: the serving "plates" were actually metal and plastic trays of varied sizes. Food was well-presented, but it seemed odd to get such great food for "dining in" on aluminum/steel trays or plastic, cafeteria-style trays, without any plates at all. Is it supposed to be cute or do they save money on dishes or what? We didn't like that part.

Music was a bit loud (we asked them if they'd turn it down, and they did; about one notch) but fun choices ('60s-'70s USA R & B, mostly).  

Also, we aren't sure where everyone parks. We got there near 11 AM on a weekday (opening is 11 AM) and found a metered place right in front, on Tower Grove, facing North, but there are only a few spaces there. We saw no lot in back (and that was where we were, having missed in on Manchester and driven around the south side of the back lots next to it to find it) or other places for many cars. What do they do? There is an the obvious expectation of (and probably is getting to be usual for lunch or dinner) crowds! 

Very easy to get to, but we couldn't see it at first on Manchester Rd. (where its address actually is listed) because outdoor signage is lacking on that side. The restaurant is actually on the SE corner of Manchester Rd. and Tower Grove Ave.(very visible signage and benches on that side), about 1 minute's drive from the Tower Grove Ave. exit of I-64/40, very near downtown St. Louis, in the charming, up-and-coming walkable area of this neighborhood (across from Sauce). We came from West County/Creve Coeur, and it only took about 15 - 20 minutes (in non-peak traffic), door-to-door. 

HIGHLY recommended. Great website, also. THANKS, Grace Meat + Three! 

We got some paper menus for my mom's friends and WE WILL BE BACK!
Kyle, owner and brewer is awesome. Their hours are great, try their boysenberry and then their raspberry. Otherwise great, won't be disappointed. Great space as well.

The food is all around really good and same with the bubble tea! However, the menu options are kind of limited and it may be appealing to more people if things like crab, shrimp, cream cheese (like for a Philadelphia roll), fish eggs, tempura, etc were also included as choices. Other than that, this place is great.
Great Sunday chicken pot pie! Awesome idea with a fun location! Friendly staff, good food, fun southern inspired drinks, and something new to the area.

We have visited Grace twice recently, mainly for fried chicken.  Ms T orders not hot and I order the hot.  I really do like this fried chicken.  The heat is pleasant, the meat has been juicy and has proper salt.  We both order a quarter, dark and it has been very good.  

For sides we have had mixed experiences.  I have had collards both times and they are good.  As with many places I eat them, they don't chop them quite enough and you end up dragging big strings of greens out of the serving container, but they have been tender and are cooked with a little smoked meat.  They don't sweeten them much (I dislike sweet greens) but they don't use any vinegar (I prefer a splash) but they are salted lightly and I will continue to order them.  Most recently I had fried cabbage.  I'm not sure why this dish is ever called fried cabbage and that is true everywhere I order it.  It is really more sautéed.  At Grace, it was almost not cooked at all and was given an Indian flair with chickpeas and a chile sauce that was laced with cumin.  It was almost curried cabbage.  Mr D tried the creamed hominy and this was not a hit for any of us.  The hominy was tasteless, there was no cream.  Ms T had some seasonal vegetables which turned out to be mostly leeks and she is not an onion eater.

I will continue to go for fried chicken and greens.  I will just have to find another side that I like.  You certainly don't need to limit yourself to fried chicken.  It is just a small part of the menu.  Grace is a welcome replacement for the infinitely overrated Sweetie Pie's.  While dining at Grace most recently, with the D's, that subject came up and we universally agreed Sweetie Pie's was the worst food we have had in St Louis.  We are glad to have Grace as an option.

I've never eaten here but Dave's clapbacks are worth 5 stars. I'm definitely making this my next  dinner destination. Slow service noted, but the food reviews are fantastic so I'll clear my schedule to enjoy a proper pizza experience.  See ya soon!

LOVE blackthorn.  They have fantastic deep dish pizza.  It's a serious dive bar - not fancy, rips in all the booth seats, etc.  Not too many TVs.  And they won't hurry with your meal!  Sit down, enjoy a beer, and chill out until they call your name.

Congratulations!!!  You have the "BEST" pizza within a 100 mile radius!!!!!  The pizza sauce is a little spicy but not too hot.  Pretty original and not like the standard competition.   Highly recommend folks try this pizza.
First time eating there tonight. Love this place. The guy that made my bowl was pleasant. I will definitely go back! YUM!
The hostess was pleasant and seated me. The place wasn't busy. A server didn't come to the table. left after 5 minutes. If you're running a restaurant at an airport; efficiency is key.

My family and I went to the new Circle 7 location for my birthday dinner this past Monday. It has a great atmosphere that promotes celebrating friends and family, and a menu that would please the toughest critic. I was craving their "almost famous" buffalo chicken mac 'n cheese - it's seriously TO DIE FOR. When I ordered it I was bummed to hear they were out of macaroni and cheese- agh! No! I ended up ordering the buffalo chicken triple grilled cheese, and I was NOT disappointed! YUM. As I enjoyed my new favorite sandwich at Circle 7, an angel appeared from the kitchen with a birthday gift- a to-go order of buffalo chicken mac 'n cheese!!! WOW. If that's not customer service I don't know what is. I think I told about 8 people at work the next day! Folks - if you're looking for a lively, energetic place with an awesome food AND beer menu, plus outstanding customer service, Circle 7 Ranch is the only place to go.

One of the most inspired, creative places to eat in the grove. The specials are imaginative and tasty and the menu has enough variety to surprise you every time you visit. The owner and staff are all wonderful people and the service is great.

I almost feel like I'm cheating on Pi for posting a 5 star review for another deep dish pizza joint, but man was this stuff good!! To justify my infidelity, I'll just say, that Black Thorn and Pi are equally as amazing, but in different ways. 

I visited Black Thorn on Saturday night while catching up with family. Between 7 of us, 2 pizzas were plenty. The pie was big and loaded with toppings. The bread was thick, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, and the cheese was plentiful, and the sauce was perfectly seasoned with a bit of a kick. 

The atmosphere is a pretty typical dive bar, but there is a fun kitchy-ness to it with all the wall graffiti. They even have darts and shuffleboard which was a favorite among the men in the group. You order at the bar and when your food is ready, your name is called over the PA system set up in the building. Loud and obnoxious? Yes. Effective? Absolutely.   

Now, the next statement I'm going to make might have a few people gagging, but I'm not too proud to admit it:

Sometimes you just want greasy, heavy, "not good for me" pizza to satisfy the junkiest of junk food cravings. This was a winner. 

I didn't feel sick or uncomfortable afterwards, but you knew you just ate more than your day's worth of calories. 

WORTH IT!
Did not come when scheduled.  Had to reschedule, which I did not like.  However, they came early the next day and fixed the problem quickly, so overall I am happy.

I use National exclusively for one reason: Emerald Club.   With Emerald, I can choose the car with the best fit (I'm 6'6") and if I find a car where someone has smoked in it previously (I'm allergic to cigarette/pipe/cigar smoke) - I just choose another vehicle.  

The staff isn't particularly friendly, but they at least acknowledge my presence.  

With that said, the drawbacks are plenty...  1) Although I get 'points' on my Emerald loyalty card, it takes a long time to get just one free rental day, and even then there's a time limit; free days usually must be used in the same calendar year it is earned.  In other words, I can use National for every single rental  every single year for the rest of my life and still won't get more than 3 consecutive days of free rentals.  So it's not really a loyalty plan as much as it is a "what-have-you-done-for-us-lately" plan.  

2) In a region of 2.3M people -there's only ONE National location anywhere close to me.  It's 40 miles away in one of the most inaccesible locaitons near the airport - not in the airport, but across the highway.  

3) Space is a premium. If someone drops me off they have 5 parking spots to choose from and most of the time at least 3 of them are occupied.  There's an additional lot that even smaller - 3 spots just down the road.  both lots are fenced off from the main rental lot.  

4) Finding another National in other cities that I travel in the Midwest is a feat.  I've never found  National Car Rental anywhere other than in or near large international airports.  That's inconvenient for some of my trips because sometimes I will drive to a nearby city, then take the train to another city. 

However, compared to my experience with the competition - National is still the best option for me.

This bread co is okay they have great food and everything but one of the big problems is that they forgot a side of our food that we paid for and half of the time they are out of stock on their bakery items.

This is a great location to visit. They always have fresh food made for you and great service. Went last night at 1am and the service was great and they employees were upbeat and friendly. Definitely the best rally's location in metro st Louis. I'll always drive to this one over any others in the area

This is the Keeton's second location.  This place is huge and nonsmoking (although there is a nice patio out back in which you can smoke).  The food/menu is the same as the other location.  I am partial to the steak sandwich on garlic cheese read and French fries. The wings are also delicious.  Today I tried the Cajun chicken pasta, it was awesome!  Seriously I've never had a bad meal here.  Karaoke on Friday and Saturdays.  Also they have dart boards and big buck hunting if that floats your boat.  Numerous TVs and a party room for private events.

The thing I like most is the laid back atmosphere and the employees and owners are always attentive and friendly.

I should have known better seeing this place was almost empty during the noon lunch hour. The sign says please wait to be seated ... so I waited ... and waited. Finally the waitress yells at me from across the bar and points to a table. I sit down and order a water ... several minutes later the water arrives as does the waitress. I wanted a burger but was told the only way I could have a burger was cooked well done.  This is not stated on the menu. I left without eating and will not be back
I had the chicken tenders, home potatoes, mac n cheese, and and apple cobbler. Everything was good!!!!

Breakfast is a many splendored thing... Tucked away in a strip on the other side of the trail is Yolklore. You walk in and it's a nicely appointed dining area with the open kitchen off to the side. They even have a drive-thru for take out.

You order and the food comes up on the counter. There is a selection of drinks in the refrigerator and some Dubuque coffee that is 3rd wave, dubious, bitter-sour coffee. Which all the hipster kids want to explain as bright and fruity with hints of hop much like a fine wine - bullshit. This is a $10 breakfast that you essentially serve yourself.

On to the food, I chose the Nest egg in concept something different & delicious. In execution, a doughy crust baked in the familiar St. Louis 'fricassee' burnt style. It is 2 eggs baked in a biscuit-lined soufflé tin, topped with crumbled bacon, mixed greens salad on top with pickled onions and lemon zest. What could have been brilliant was only a burnt under cooked mess. Served with a side of crispy potatoes. These are baby gold potatoes boiled and then 'crisped' on a griddle while doused is season salt. These were the best part of both meals. 

My better half ordered the biscuits and gravy breakfast with country ham & seasoned scrambled eggs. The ham was good but needed a few more minutes on the griddle to give it that nice crust. The biscuits & sausage gravy was a mixed bag. The biscuit was amazing while the sausage gravy was salty & full of sage. If you are not a fan of sage don't even think of getting this. Now, I'm not sure what spices were in the eggs. While I could  see the other spices; the only one you could taste was salt. 

The staff was friendly and the chef/cook came out to say hello to everyone. That didn't make up for the meal that had more misses than hits.

EBS replaced my chimney flashing to resolve a leak, and less than 2 years later it is back.  I called in a different contractor (after reading negative reviews here) this time, and was told that not only were the roof shingles around the chimney installed incorrectly, but the chimney pan flashing--an important part of replacing flashing--was completely missing.  I emailed EBS and sent photos of the roof, but no reply.  I won't use them again.  .

This place was just okay.

When you walk in you order at the counter, and they punch it in.  They then flip the tablet towards you and you can select from presuggested tip prices, or put a custom one in and I selected 15% which I wouldn't have had I known how service was.  The food came out in a reasonable time, but you have to fill your own drink and get your own refills and when you're finished you bus your own table.  Had I known that I would have left a smaller tip.  Aside from ordering the only time me we saw or heard from anyone was when our food was dropped off.

I ordered the herb roasted beef which is supposed to come with a Laurel jus, bone marrow roasted mushrooms, and crispy leeks.  It was dry and overcooked IMO, it was slathered in BBQ sauce which is a far cry from a Laurel jus, there were no mushrooms of any kind to be found on the plate, and the crispy leeks were just burnt green onions (if you want to use green onions that's fine, there's plenty of synonyms for green onion if you wanna sound fancier, but leeks is definitely not one of them, it's an entirely different plant).

My fiancee ordered the fried chicken biscuit.  The entire plate was covered in honey and the biscuit was very dry.  Also some thought should have been put into how this was eaten.  Not exactly the kind of sandwich you can pick up and eat as the biscuit would have fallen apart and even were that not the case it would have been far too big to put in your mouth.  If it was designed to be eaten with a knife and fork that's fine, but provide the customer with something other than a butter knife otherwise it leaves people scratching their heads on howu to eat it.

We both had the macaroni and cheese which was so-so.  Not a lot of flavor built into, and the sauce wasn't terribly smooth.  It seemed as if the roux wasn't properly tempered before being added.  Also the menu said it had Gouda but neither of us could taste it.

The people were plenty friendly when they interacted with us and others.  We might consider returning but it's doubtful.

Stopped for breakfast at 8am on Sunday.  This was a disappointment.  The biscuits were horribly dry, my sons sandwich came with chili although he had asked for it to be left off, and nothing had much in the way of flavor.  Seating is limited, which meant sharing a table with strangers.  While the staff was friendly and the atmosphere was casual, we would not return.

Wow...it's hard to find words for how over the top their dishes are.  Order what you want....but the burger is a sleeper menu item, without a doubt in the top 5 burgers in the Lou.  Please  go here you won't be disappointed
It was very tasty, but the middles of our cal-zones ranged from luke warm to cold.  They need to figure out the proper cooking temperature and times, even when faced with a lunch rush.

My company uses national for our rentals all the time and this is the worst branch I've ever encountered. When you arrive there,s always a line of ppl waiting while one person is on checking in the other 3 employees stand to the side talking about football. Once I finally make it to the front the lady tells me that she can't help me and to either use the kiosk or go online. 
I've used this branch 3 times this year and 

I've yet to get in and out in less than 3 hours. I even came in 5 hours ahead of my flight knowing how slow this branch is and I'm still waiting on the teller to check me out. They keep going to the backroom saying they will take care of my rental. I've already missed my flight home.

I was sooo happy when a poke place finally opened in St. Louis. I've now eaten here at least a dozen times (because I get regular poke cravings). I'd say that overall the poke is pretty good. I usually get a regular, with a mix of brown rice and salad as a base, because they will fill 2/3 of the bowl with rice otherwise. The fish is good enough and I feel like three scoops is plenty filling. What really bothers me is that they can be really stingy with their toppings - though this seems to only be certain employees. If I'm paying $13 for my bowl, I would really appreciate a little more than a teaspoon-size serving of seaweed salad and edamame (not exaggerating). I understand they're probably trying to keep their costs own, but I would like this place so much more if they would stay consistent and slightly more generous with the toppings.

Agent let me pick and choose what date and time worked for me. I was sent emails and text notifications to keep me up to date on when the tech was coming and also what he looked like. The day of service, the tech texted me that he was on his way. He came, looked at my problem, ran a test to make sure it worked, then left. Along the way, he was extremely professional.

I cannot say enough about Grace. We held my sons first birthday party there on a Sunday for 25 people. First, the space was just right for that amount of people. Second, the service and staff were amazing, they treated our family so well and gave our son David the best first birthday we could ask for. Finally, the food...wow! We were served buffet style but it felt like the food was made with the care and attention you would use to serve an individual. It's Rick Lewis so of course the fried chicken was phenomenal. We also loved the sides (macaroni and cheese, mashed butternut squash and salad). If you are ever looking for a place for 20-25 people I would definitely recommend Grace Meat + Three.

Super cute up and coming brewery. Their selection of beers changes pretty regularly and has expanded quite a bit since they've opened. I loved their quick sour! They have a great outdoor patio with awesome fire pits. The interior is also super cool.

I  think the pizza is excellent. The Chicago Style Pizza is indeed Chicago Style, despite other reviews. It is a Chicago stuffed pizza style (with a top and bottom crust) like Giordano's in Chicago, but the sauce is less generous and is a spicier sauce than the tangy tomato sauce on a typical Chicago-style pizza. It is very good stuffed-pizza. The pizza isn't for everyone, but it is not accurate to say that it isn't a Chicago style pizza. 

I would recommend ordering your pizza in advance of your arrival due to the long cooking times, and also because you then have the option of just taking it home if there is nowhere to sit (it is a small dive bar). I think it sometimes has a soup-nazi feel to the service, as mentioned in some other reviews. They are slinging pitchers of beer and making a couple of particular kinds of pizza. You will not find anything beyond simple bar style service and you will not find Lou Malnati's pizza here, but it is an excellent diversion from the typical square-cut, thin-crust pizza in St. Louis.

This was the worst mcds I've ever been to. I'm from IL and was traveling with some hungry kids. At 8pm they had their table chairs on top tables seeming like they were closing soon. The (what looked like a 15 yo) girl who took my order was so worried about what her co-workers were taking about got my 'plain' chzbgr hm wrong then complained bc I had them to remake. The bathrooms had some sort of buzzer system that she also couldn't figure out and the bathrooms look as if I was in an abandoned bldg. I travel that way often and will drive the extra miles and time to never stop at this food nightmare again.

The front-office staff are THE BEST! So so nice and friendly. Extremely helpful. I'm always able to get in for an appointment quickly and there is very little (if any at all) wait to get in to see the doctor. Turnaround time is super fast if you're ordering a pair of glasses. Couldn't ask for a better experience at the eye doctor. Thank you all so much for the great customer service!

This place is phenomenal. Xiao Long Bao (soup dumplings) are one of the few foods I've been craving since I moved from New York City to Saint Louis 9 years ago. These were delicious and tasted just like home. The staff is super friendly and even offered to teach us the specific technique to eat them, so you don't burn your mouth. The young man behind the counter was super helpful and kind. Will frequent often.

The cook messed my order up...I asked for a 2 southwestern crispy wraps and it says it on my receipt.  I  didnt realize until i was at home that they gave me 2 grilled chicken bacon wraps. I will never go back there.
The food is good, but this is the second time they have jipped me at the drive through. They forgot the fries again! Make sure you check your order before you go.

Great restaurant! The food was awesome. My husband and I each had a wrap and the chips. Our son had the Mac n cheese. All great! We were seated right away, the staff was friendly, and we had great service from Charles! We would definitely recommend eating here to anyone looking to try something new.

Yaaaas! Crafted shakes were the bomb!!!
The pricing is out of this world!!! The treats met all of 8  individuals expectations. 

Definitely shareable! Great for any type of outing

Horrible, horrible HORRIBLE! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! 

If I could give no stars I would!

My husband got a job in Austin last year which required us to move from Kingsville. The company offered to pay for our stuff to get moved and gave us a list of movers to get some quotes.

Because we only had a short time to find an apartment we found ourselves in a situation where we would have to stay in hotel for a week until our apartment was ready for us to move in. When the woman from United came to our Kingsville apartment to give us an on site estimate we explained the situation to her. She was told that we would be leaving for Austin on the Sunday morning and our apartment would not be ready until the Friday. She was told that we would put all our belongings in one room so there would be no confusion on what to pack and our roommates would let them in whenever they were going to pack our stuff. Simple. 

The next evening we get a phone call from United telling us that they have been selected to help us move and even though we still have 4 days before we make the big trip to Austin they will be coming to collect our things the next day. When we tell them this is not possible as we still need our bed to sleep on, clothes to wear etc etc they decide to call my husbands new employer and ask if they can put us up in a hotel for a few more days. This request was denied and they were told they would have to collect our stuff AFTER we have left. 

Fast forward a week. We had made arrangements with United to meet us at our new apartment at 12.30pm, during my husbands lunch break. We we told this would be no problem. At 3.30pm the day before we move into our new apartment my husband receives a phone call at work from United to tell him they will be at the apartment at 9am. He reminds them of the arrangement we had made and is rudely told that there was no such agreement and we were to be there at 9am or we will be charged extra. After being told this I decided I would call this woman back and remind her again that we were unable to get to the apartment until before 12.30pm. Now, this woman has absolutely no idea how to talk to a client, she was extremely rude and a liar. I called her and explained the situation we were in, I can't drive and at such short notice we were unable to make alternate arrangements to meet them so early. She told me that the driver had a full schedule and if we didn't meet them at 9am we would be charged extra. I told her that this was unacceptable as this had been organized a week prior and that she would need to see what she could do and she would need to call be back as my husband could not be disturbed at his new job. By 5.30pm I had not heard from this shrew of a woman so I decided to call back. The main office was closed but I was able to get through to the warehouse where the trucks get sent from. I managed to get such a lovely man on the phone. I explained the situation to him, he checked the drivers schedule and informed me that we were the only delivery he had all day so he could come whenever we like. Interesting. All while I am speaking to this lovely man, the shrew who didn't return my calls was on the phone to my husband telling him there is nothing she can do and we better be there at 9am or else. HA!

So everything was set and we would meet the driver at 12.30. I was even given the cell phone number of the driver in case we wanted to change our plans. This guy was so helpful and put my mind at ease that we would have no more problems. Silly me. The next day about half an hour before we are due to meet the driver my husband gets a phone call, again at work after they have specifically been told not to call him there, and the driver can't get to our apartment. It turns out he has used an 18 wheeler to move a bed, a desk, a computer and some clothes and now he can't fit in the apartment complex. He needs to go back to San Antonio to reload.

He eventually returns a few hours later with a smaller truck and is really a lovely guy. He unloads quickly and after a quick bottle of water is on his way. Over the next few days I unpack and notice some of our things are missing and our computer doesn't seem to turn on anymore. We fill out a report and a few weeks later basically get told we can't prove they took or stole anything so too bad. After all the drama we just gave up. It would have been better for us to get a U-Haul and do it ourselves. 

My husband was so embarrassed by all the trouble they caused by constantly calling his new employer complaining about us and trying to change arrangements. So much for trying to make a good first impression.

So again...

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.

And if you have any delivery problems, call the warehouse, they are the only helpful ones.

First visit, tucked away on side of plaza. Limited seating and  smallish menu but they've got the basics well covered. Crowded on a Thursday at 10a, impressive. Fresh squeezed juice, savory egg sandwich, great coffee, and the best gooey butter cake I've had in a long time, not the dry yellow cakey bottom layer that's so pervasive,  great texture. Well done guys!
Super fresh fish. Great service with a smile. Shared a poke bowl with my husband for a late lunch and it hit the spot. So yummy!!! And the boba tea is great!

Yolklore really is a hidden gem on Watson. The breakfasts and baked items are amazing and creative. Can't go there and not get a biscuit. They had a coffee rubbed beef and grits special last time I went which was one of the best breakfasts I've had. The space is small so go early or get it for carry out at the drive through. They are very environmentally conscious and serve everything in recyclable containers which I appreciate.

The subcontractor was Armstrong Logistics. It has been horrible, and the horrors keep coming. First, they changed our delivery date three times. Second, the delivery date was so ridiculously delayed it resulted in an eleven day hotel stay--with two dogs. Third, we scheduled the move 4 months in advance, and they still could not get their act together. Fourth, bolts to furniture, lamps, electronics, and appliances are missing. Only 20% of these parts were actually located in the box appropriately labeled "PARTS." Fifth, the person they hired to put our items back together couldn't do it thanks to all of the missing parts. Sixth, the promise that their company would send people to hook up the large appliances they moved was incorrect. Seventh, no one told us that the company had a debris removal service. The driver who delivered our goods was the one who happened to tell us that information. Eighth, the moving crew who was supposed to help unload our items were a no-show. Ninth, many of our boxes are incorrectly labeled. Boxes that say "bedroom" actually have my living room items, or bathroom items, etc. So, it took me 4 days to find my beauty products and appliances. You can imagine how much fun I have had trying to get ready for work. This type of customer service is disgusting. Never again.

Man, there was sooooo much cheese I couldn't even finish one slice! I'm not a fan of cheese or deep dish pizzas like that, but this was good. The bartender made me a pretty ignorant Long Island ice tea. It tasted like a mixture of pure liquor and more liquor. I actually prefer a nice tasting Long Island, but if you wanna get trashed and eat thicc pizza this is the place. I can't remember how long it took the pizza to come out. Maybe 10-30 minutes. Not bad when you're intoxicated.

Best pizza in town. What makes it exceptional? A solid foundation: The tomato sauce is seasoned to perfection and the bread tastes really, really fresh--for deep dish and thin crust alike. Yes, I've had Pi and Dewey's. They do neat things with toppings but lack Black Thorn's foundation. 

Warning: Don't eat more than 2 slices of deep dish in one sitting. There's a LOT of cheese in there. 

Takeout: Call at least an hour ahead if you're ordering takeout, their tiny oven builds up a backlog of orders fast.

With several pizza places in the area, sauce on the side sticks out with their flavorful calzones. 

You order up front, then sit wherever you please. The seating is open and perfect for both groups and personal conversations. 

Food was brought out quickly- which was both good and bad. It was nice to get the food quickly, but I noticed that as I cut into my calzone it was a little lukewarm. It didn't take away from the flavor but I wish it was hot when served, even if it takes a bit longer. 

In all I would definitely recommend trying sauce on the side, but if you find your calzone is not on the warm side ask them to heat it up for you!

I have to say the staff is very nice and it is very clean. But the food not so good. The turkey sausage was very salty as were the eggs. I would not recommend the baked oatmeal. No flavor and very little baked fruit in the oatmeal, and the yogurt on top was also flavorless.
We like  to try new places but this is one we will not try again.

Amazing happy hour prices with a wide variety of beers that all have amazing taste!! The staff is extremely friendly and the location is perfect for SLU students to walk to and soon discover. Excited to see where it goes!

The ambience and seating size of this place is so comfortable. It doesn't matter whether you want indoor or outdoor seating you will have a spacious table with plenty of options. I would say the appetizers are the highlight of this restaurant as far as food. If you were dining indoors the serve yourself tap at the table is certainly a highlight!

Intriguing menu. I had the mushroom frittata- it was flavorful sand filling. My companions raved about their baked oatmeal. Fresh squeezed oj too!! Friendly staff and an owner/manager that was a gracious and helpful host. He knew how to manage AND serve the crowd. Busy place. Good coffee.

I had The Daily Bread today for lunch and it was jam packed during lunch hour. I couldn't believe me eyes! They had a large selection of soup and a lot of yummy breads sitting out, which of course I had to dive right in and pick the pumpkin loaf- that i have yet to try... But I ordered a turkey, roast beef specialty sandwich and it was only fair...but I loved how you could chose between chips, apple and or a banana for your side.  Over all it was a quick spot for lunch, especially if you are just grabbing and going, and the atmosphere was nice. I enjoyed it, just wished I would have ordered a different sandwich! :-]
Took my roommate's Black Throne virginity last night and she dubbed it our weekly catch-up/hang-out spot. So good!!

The claim damage that did not happen.  Request calls back but have no voicemail or way to be directly reached resulting in significant, unnecessary delays and being on hold.  Terribly confusing returns area and poor customer interaction on-site.

I have driven past this place and have been meaning to get breakfast. Today was the day! We went through the drivethru because of limited seating. I got the classic with bacon: the eggs were perfectly cooked (I like mine over medium). Great flavor too! The biscuit was a little plain. I used the side of gravy for dunking and was in heaven. I don't like breakfast gravy! Their bfast gravy is so meaty though..... mmmmmmm. I also enjoyed the bacon. Very thick and cooked very well -  chewy bacony goodness. I didn't like the potatoes very much. They were whole, very peppery, and one was undercooked. I dunked the cooked ones in the gravy and everything was alright.
Hubby got the fritata with tomato jelly and goat cheese. Interesting combo. I tasted and couldn't decide if i liked the jelly..... he ate all of it so I guess it wasn't a problem for him. We shared a little piece of coffee cake - yummy.

Total joke!  First appointment was a no call no show.  George called me a week later to follow up and apologize.  I thought I'd give them a second chance.  
I hired George to clean out the dryer vent in the house my wife and I just moved into.  I explained to him that we just moved in and I need the dryer ventilation in the house cleaned out.  He said no problem and I left to go to work while my wife monitored the job. 
I get a call 5 minutes later from my wife and she's in tears.  George isn't cleaning the vent in the house.  He's only cleaning the little foil tube hanging off the back of the dryer.  He is demanding his $85 and he can't clean the dryer vent in the house.  What a complete joke.  
Total Scam People!  BEWARE!

Food is not authentic. You have fewer options on a weekday buffet. Ambience is good because this is a newer restaurant. 
However, the food is cheap and the service is ok.

Great service, love the beer on tap by the table ...delicious appetizers, my favorite happy hour ...perfect spot to chill after work for a few cold ones and some appetizers after work ...our server had us to talk to their beer expert since she didn't know about a particular beer ...u just don't find that kinda service m everywhere .

Not the best thick crust pizza in St Louis. St Louis has a lot of great pizza places; the people who say otherwise are either lying or didn't get out much when they lived/visited here. Black Thorn, however, didn't live up to the hype when I went and I can't excuse the health inspector nightmare that is the inside. The carpet is so worn and dirty that when I inadvertantly spilled my glass of Guiness, it still hadn't soaked in by the time I left like 2 hours later. Ugh. Get a wet vac in that place.

Visited St. Lou for a conference in December 2018 and ate here with a large group of about 10 people. The service was great and they really worked with us as far as group size! The wait for a table and for food was not long at all and their tacos were fantastic. They also kept refilling the chips and salsa free of charge which was a plus. Server was extremely polite!

As someone who always orders to the gyoza, shumai, potstickers (you get where I'm going), I was sold when I heard a restaurant opened offering only dumplings. On my visit, I ordered the shrimp dumplings. Lovely - not to doughy, perfect amount of broth. The fast-casual setup makes for easy access to great food.

Busy lunchtime meeting.  Good was pretty fast to come out-a lot to choose from.  I had the turkey club-I could only finish half and took the rest home.  There was also a very large selection of baked goods that smelled and looked delicious...maybe next time.  I will be back.  (It was a bit noisy and crowded-so be prepared for that)

Edited 11/11/16 - 

Had to update and add a star. Yolklore has earned it for sure. Excellent food and excellent customer service. Today I had the Nest Egg, which they made w/ scrambled eggs instead of poached, since I don't like runny yolk. It was delicious! And I love their salty skin potatoes! Staff is always super friendly, too - A+++!

-----
Original Review-

Modern but inviting atmosphere with super friendly staff. Community seating for the most part, which I'm not into, so I was glad the little 2-seat table by the window was open. Also they have a drive thru - great option for hungry kids!

Their menu is straightforward and they use local, fresh ingredients. They have smoothies, cakes, and a kids menu as well. You go in, order, and they call your name when your food is ready. (Same dining concept as Fuzzy's).  We got to sample their gooey butter cake when we ordered, which was a nice surprise too.

I had the MO greens salad w/ goat cheese. Felafel was great, greens were fresh, the goat cheese really rounded it out - that's an extra but highly recommend adding it to this salad. House-made lemonade to drink - fantastic and refreshing as well. No complaints!

My husband had the traditional breakfast. He said the bacon was the best part; overall it was ok and could have used more gravy. 

Yolklore is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood. Don't bring your lunch date to dine-in, but the food is worth tasting, so drive thru and picnic instead.

The very best thing about Daily Bread is the food. they have a really extensive menu with so many things that sound good, it's hard to pick just one. Clearly the word is out because they get mobbed at lunchtime, and since they apparently make everything from scratch when it is ordered, the line is pretty long and you'll sit at your table for a good 10 minutes before they call out your name to come get your food. 

The seating area is really large, but the it feels cold to me. There are a few booths lining one side and a few bar height tables, and then just a sea of 4 seater tables in the middle of the room on a cold tile floor. They could really use something to make it feel more cozy and less like cafeteria seating. That said, at peak times every table is taken, so I recognize that they can't do anything that will mean having fewer tables. 

They do have free wifi though I don't think they have any accessible outlets and it gets so mobbed at mealtimes that I would I feel terrible hanging out and working when others are waiting for a seat. 

It also gets very loud when crowded...tile floors don't absorb any noise. 

If I could separate out my ratings, it would be 5 stars for food and 2 for everything else. But the way it stands, I don't go by very often because I just don't enjoy eating there and it's WAY too slow to consider popping in to grab carry out.

Well, it's been about 6 weeks and still waiting for that follow up call back.. that's okay. My missing items are probably in Someone's possession. After all, I've got somebody's TV stands- 2 of them actually- just sitting in my garage waiting for SOMEONE from this company to give a shit and call.

I took my partner here for her birthday along with her 2 best friends.  We were greeted upon entry by the friendly staff.  We  found the shop inviting and clean.  All the customers were friendly as well .  We ordered funnel cake, pizza and wings along with shakes for each of us.  Everything was tasty!  The shakes were Beyond tasty!  They are artfully decorated and full of sweetness!  The staff, owner and all the customers sang my partner happy birthday!  The place has a happy buzzy about it I think it feeds off of the owner Dallas.  She is one impressive women and I look forward to coming back her establishment.  Everything is reasonably priced which is a really great to see these days!  I highly recommend this place!

Holy moly, we had the worst food we have ever had at a normally very consistent high quality location. Roast beef was an extra well done salty ground up mess (think potted meat) and old cold fries. To make matters worse we had to wait in line for 5 minutes and another two at the window so you would think the good would be fresh...wrong. I should have played the lottery with the $10 I wasted on two sandwiches and one fry even if I lost I would have been better off. Guess it pbnj or frozen pizza tonight. Big FAIL tonight LC...oh I called the store, no answer but left a message let's see if anyone calls me back...

MK's has a friendly relaxed atmosphere. Their menu is simple and small but the food was tasty. Service was prompt and courteous. One thing I would recommend is obtaining their liquor license... Multiple patrons asked if they had wine or beer while we were eating our meal. They have a rather large bar that is unused and therefore makes the restaurant look a bit unfinished.

This is an interesting combination: dive bar mixed with "deep dish pizza".

Does it work? Yes if you drink enough.

Service is always fairly friendly with a bit of attitude. I can't imagine it any other way in a place like Black Thorn.

Food is OK but not amazing, though I do not recommend the pan pizza  - too much dough for my taste. The "deep dish" is not Chicago style. Chicago style goes, from bottom to top, crust, cheese, toppings, sauce. Note the lack of a crust on *top*. Black thorn puts crust on top. Not Chicago style. Some days it's better than other days - but regardless, this ain't Chicago style.

The beer is cold and tasty, and the selection is acceptable but far from amazing.

Seating is available but not excessively easy to come by, especially on the weekend.

I've never been a big fan of Chicago style pizza, so when I had several people recommend Black Thorn to me, I took some convincing. I finally was persuaded to visit about 2 years ago and I happened to be having a really bad day. We walked in, ordered at the bar, and were told pizza would be an hour. Ordered a pitcher of PBR to help kill the time and before I was finished with my first beer, my mood was improved immensely. The music selection is quirky. That particular day, every other song was a Killers song. The decor was non-existent, just marker graffiti covering everything. The beer was kind of flat. The pizza was good. So good I literally couldn't stop thinking about it until I went back days later. I'm writing this review because I hadn't been in about 6 months and finally revisited tonight now that renovations are done. I was worried when I walked in and everything looked shiny and new but the pizza was the same and the grungy charm is still there. They only have craft beer on tap now, though so we had to get our PBR in bottles. I'm reading the reviews for the first time and I see that maybe first timers need some pointers so if you're checking it out for the first time, it's not a place to go in and order carry out and wait for it. It takes a long time to make the pizza so if you're looking to just grab something and go, this isn't it. I highly recommend dining in and bringing some cards or a board game. It makes the wait enjoyable and half of the appeal of coming to Black Thorn is the experience. Seriously the best pizza and I've never had a bad time there.

Found this restaurant through Groupon. From my understand typically, lunch is buffet style and in the evening was the traditional order off the menu. My husband and I went for dinner. We were greeted at the door and taken to our table but not offered a menu. There was only one other table in the restaurant at the time but it took probably about 5mins before the server realized we needed menus and water. For appetizers, we got the samosa chat and another "street food", both recommended by the server. Dinner was goat korma, chicken korma, garlic naan, and tandoori chicken. We were both very satisfied with our dinner. Flavoring was amazing and portions was filing. The server was nice and personable. We can't wait to come back!

This rates as the best frozen yogurt place in  St. Louis. The staff is very friendly and tries to get you to try new flavors. That's because the flavors are fantastic. 

If you like sweet (think cake batter or chocolate) you will love the unique dessert flavors. If you like fruity, they have no-sugar-added options that taste like fresh fruit and other that taste like sorbet.

My favorite is the orange popsicle flavor which tastes like orange soda :-)

At $0.40 an oz, it is a good price. 

It is a clean place, with lots of seating, large cups and good toppings.
Ed did a fantastic job! Delivery was spot on and the wife and I love the new mattress. I highly recommend them to anyone.

The hotel smells like wet dog and old cigarettes. My "fresh towels" had blood spatter on them that wasn't mine. Bed frame was broken.  Key card reader never works on the first go. Highway noise in the room. Stay somewhere else...

An understated gem in south-ish city.  The staff is pleasant, then menu is quite extensive & the dishes I've tried so far have been great.  I don't remember what night I was there - but they had a chicken special that was delicious.  Bring your buds - plenty of TV's to stare at, games & cold beer!

This was a hole in the wall find of the night. I am visiting from out of town and being originally from Chicago my friends insisted we come here for some authentic pizza. It did not disappoint. We had Schlafly Unfiltered Wheat and it was a really good beer. Surprisingly light and local. The pizza was sausage and artichoke and it was phenomenal, almost as better the next day reheated for breakfast. The atmosphere was quaint and cool, filled with local patrons and writing on the walls. Highly recommend! It might take a while for your pizza, but there was ample warning and for the ambiance and enjoyment of pitchers with friends, it is worth the wait.

We decided to try a new place. Found this on Yelp. Walked in and asked to be seated. Was told sit anywhere order here. Asked for a menu and was told Menus are on the tables and on the wall. Placed our order at the counter and found a place to sit. The food was really good. The small salad was perfect and the dressing was amazing. The pizza and garlic cheese bread was great. The only disappointment was it wasn't very friendly. The cook who brought out our food was friendly.
Great bargain on a great piece of history!

I've eaten here many times, usually for lunch. The best lunch I've had here was the buffalo chicken salad and also they have a great Cobb salad. They have good coffee and a nice little bakery where you can buy individual items.

I also like them for donating so generously to my company when I have asked for donations. Local company with a great heart. I like to support them.

Fantastic and huge calzones!  I had the figgy piggy and he had the carmen.  Both were very tasty, although I don't think the red sauce is the best pairing with the figgy piggy.  The creamy garlicky sauce was perfect with the carmen.  These calzones are huge!  We came with an appetite and only ate half.  The other half heated up nicely for lunch the next day.  Look forward to trying the rest of their menu.

Not a big fan of this particular SnS. They take forever taking your order and they ruin your order almost everytime. And just one side note, if a guy named Antonio D. is working cancel your order amd run. He's imfamous for intentionally smothering burgers in mustard and sometimes spitting in food.

If you are looking for a new place to try downtown you need to try Gringo. Right away the overall atmosphere and experience is exceptional and I don't think there are any restaurants similar to it in the city.

The chips and salsa & guac are great. The Pollo Loco burrito was delicious. The jackfruit tacos are also good!

So impressed with this place. Knowledgeable staff (especially James). Got us everything we needed as a one stop shop...tint, speakers, radio, etc. Got it installed in a timely manner. The tint looks SICK. The sound solution is EXACTLY what our truck needed, not what we had in mind. 

When we picked it up, one tiny thing was overlooked and they immediately made it right. THAT is customer service. Definitely won't go to anyone else for our needs. Thanks, fellas!!!

Front desk was very personable and welcoming, did all he could to welcome us in and be accommodating. The place is decked out for the holidays and looks pretty nice. Has a security guard at night to watch the vehicles, not sure of the neighborhood, but front desk said there should not be any problems.

Room was decent, lower end fixtures and carpet but it was in good shape. Only real complaint was the hair. There was what appeared to be dog hair all over the bed spread and sheets of both beds. They do allow pets for a $25 charge, but apparently they don't use the extra $25 to clean up the bedding.
Awesome place for couples, families, or groups.  Calzones for every taste... and a heckuva beer selection.
Consistently always excellent!  I had the tango salad with the peach tea. Love this place! The baked goods are so yummy! It beats Panera hands down!

If it wasn't for an angry waitress I would give this more stars.   Last 2 times in there she treated me like I wasn't worth her time.  Slamming cups and coffee down.  Waiting as long as possible and making me ask for what I ordered.  It's a shame because I came here with my co-workers all the time.  The previous staff was awesome.  I'm not going here anymore

Went there for a third time today and ordered the same Ahi tacos I had a few weeks back, was not same product definitely had smaller chunks of Ahi that were browned with slightly red center. Was still a good taco but was not what I anticipated based on my previous visit a few weeks back when I had slices of Ahi that were red in the middle with a much better presentation and taste.

This. Place. Is. Awesome!

I have been a member since they opened and made sure to get the unlimited pass which gives me the flexibility to visit frequently (everyday if you like). The entire staff is amazing, knowledgeable and extremely warm. 

As the name indicates they have a lot of Pilates classes, Reformer is my personal favorite. However, I noticed some of my peers prefer the Barre and/or Cardio Sculpt classes they offer. I've taken all three and no matter what you will definitely get a great workout. The intensity level is up to you (level 1, 1.5 or 2). 

The classes are 7 days a week, with multiple classes each day, (including early mornings and evenings during the week, so its convenient. During the work week I prefer going in the evenings (not a morning person). The instructors are highly trained and the class size (no more than 12) allows instructors to have the freedom to provide some individual assistance and support.  

Convenient, great workout, excellent staff; I definitely recommend giving this place a visit.
The huge ice cream treat was so good I didn't check to see if they had any vegan treats. I'll check when I go back It was my birthday treat, my son and grandchildren joined me delicious......
Great place for good food!  If you're looking for a non-traditional breakfast, this place will be having you wanting more.  Awesome experience and the food was excellent!

Quiet and clean as how I want my brunch place is to be. The food was great too. The only thing I can complain is the limited menu (I think 6 items?). Otherwise, I love how they experiment with dishes!

Unique casual dining that only serves Calzones and Salads that are absolutely delicious. Get one of their specialty calzones or create your own for less than $10. Plenty of seating a free street parking if you can find it. Must try if you've never had a calzone or crazing a variation of pizza!

Decided to try Sauce On The Side, after visiting the Art In Bloom exhibit at the art museum.   The ambience was laid back and casual, with many tables.  The restaurant has you order at the counter and then choose a place to sit.  The person at the counter was very friendly and walked us through the menu, since it was our first time at the restaurant.   There is a large selection of calzones to choose from and a good selection of beers.

Amy and I decided to share the Meet Me in St. Louis calzone, since the portion are large.   Amy thought it was very good, but the provel cheese in the calzone reminded me too much of Imos.  We will be back to try another calzone in the future.
The Island has the best  Yogurt!  You should definately check this place out if you are a local or just visiting!

I went in for happy hour and was not disappointed. The people were friendly, the staff were friendly and attentive, and the food was great. Tried the dry rub wings and they were very good. The food prices are very reasonable. My only criticism would be charging me 50 cents for a side of bbque sauce with my wings and an extra $2 for a 'tall' price cocktail at happy hour. These charges are unnecessary. Nevertheless I will definitely be back and recommend the place to others.

Called in a carry out order, wait time given was accurate and staff was friendly. Sausage Chicago style pizza was delicious, as usual. Love the new renovations with some of the old charm. Next time we will sit and eat there with some cold beers!

Worst service ever, I will never go back. I am also calling their corporate on how horrible the installation and customer service was on my viper system. I am also emailing Viper about the experience as well. I was also in the market for 2 new navigation / stereo systems for my car and truck. Won't be going here ever again.

PLEASE DON"T USE THEM!!!! These people are horrible. They opened up our boxes, stole some of the contents, resealed it, and then delivered it. We filed a claim and 4 months into they said there is nothing they can do- hire a lawyer. Of course i'm not going to hire a lawyer for $500/hour and they bank on this. We found out that other people whose items were also on our truck were stolen- their wedding videos/pictures, china, etc. Very very unethical company. Please don't use them.

Can't wait to go back!!! We were a table of 4 & everyone's meal was delish. Started off with toasted ravs & deep fried provel/rice balls both served with marinara. So good! Two of us ordered the fish of the day which was salmon. Cooked to perfection drizzled with a special cream sauce. It was served with the vegetable of the day. A combination of zucchini, squash, & tomatoes. The veggies were sautéed to perfection! It looked & tasted so fresh! I want to go back just for the veggies! The hubby ordered a ribeye with garlic butter. He said it was excellent & cooked just how he ordered it, medium. The other ordered dish was the shrimp pasta scampi. My friend said it was very good but it did have a kick to it. She didn't mind the spice but it you were sensitive to spice, you might mention that when ordering. I did order 2 special $9 cocktail drinks which were okay. I wanted a mojito but they didn't have it. So I settled with a blackberry mojito. Ehhh not worth the price. I am looking forward to returning to this neighborhood gem. What a great addition to the hill. BTW it was a casual dining place. So stop on by before or after a Cardinal or Blues game.
Been here 3 times since they relocated in the grove . Each time have had friendly staff. Only thing that sucks is they don't have a huge outside sign yet to identify the building

Crown Candy Kitchen is a cute little spot right on the corner. Stepping inside will take you back to the days when you were a kid and your parents gave you 25 cents for some candy. You felt as if you had all the money in the world and with so man choices, you isn't know what to pick first. CCK takes patrons back to their innocent childhoods of fun afternoons spent in a candy shop. Candy and ice cream and malts! Oh my! CCK is the perfect spot for a little sweet treat : )

My husband and I purchased two lazy boy recliners from Janey H. at the Des Peres location.  She gave us the best customer service from when we walked in the door til the delivery of the recliners!  Very friendly, knowledgeable and let me know to watch for a sale before the delivery and she could honor that sale, which she did!  We were very very happy with our customer service and look forward to getting our furniture.  Way to go Janey!!

I have been here so many time and it's always been amazing. Well last night Friday March 4th had to be my worst dinning out experience EVER. The waitress we had for got about us. We waited to order our food for 25 mins. While another waitress walked pasted us I would saying about 15 time. Saying she will be right with you! Never in my life have I walked out before and last night night was almost my first time. It put such a bad tasted in my mouth I won't be back. Get it together!

Dr. Sherman and Brianna always take good care of me.  I had some tricky insurance items,  and they called and for the details straightened out after my insurance company gave me mis-information. They are always on time and wait isn't usually too bad.

Delish!  The Italian Salad was so good and fresh with roasted red peppers and olives being the perfect flavorful touch.  We split that and the Carmen calzone and both were excellent.  I only wish we'd eaten the calzone when it first came out so it would still have been hot.  We finished our salad and thought the calzone wasn't quite hot enough by the time we started eating it.  That's our tip: eat the calzone when they bring it out!  Yum!  So glad we tried this place!

I was extremely pleased with my experience.   I've been going to this location for a few years.  The optometrist and the technicians go above and beyond to make sure the client is satisfied. 
I will definitely be back!

Very bad service. The staff seemed confused and actually misplaced my sandwich at one point. Then, to top it off (sandwich pun), they rung me up before I had completed ordering, then told me I couldn't have avocado because it was "extra". Maybe let me finish ordering before you snatch my money then...

In summation and conclusion, this Subway is shit.
Love the service,  and the fact the revisits are free with the service contract. They have done a great job at our house. Cameron Miles, the tech, was super nice and provided great customer service.
GREAT deep dish pizza! Do yourself a favor and check it out. Laid back, comfortable atmosphere with darts and a few video games. Full bar here as well. I go for the pizza that is truly memorable...
This is a city neighborhood resturaunt and bar! It's good for game night or date night if you are doing on the budget . Great staff and good bar food with a full menu.

This place is amazing!  I've eaten here about 10 times and  I have always had great food.  The locally sourced meats are the best I've had anywhere. The coffee, the Bisquit s and gravy, the eggs, are outstanding. I honestly hesitated to post this because I am worried the place will become so popular that we'll never get to go there.  That being said, the biggest negative is the seating area being so small.  A bit more space would be nice.

The customer service at this establishment is amazing! I travel through STL fairly often and have had poor experiences at other restaurants in the STL airport. Ladonya at The Pasta House went above and beyond delivering excellent customer service. She greeted us with a welcoming hello and smile and was incredibly friendly all the while doing a great job! I have worked in customer service for over 16 years and have high expectations for excellent customer service, Ladonya exceeded my expectations and I will be back because of her great attitude, smile and overall hard work. Well done Ladonya!!!!

What a bust! The place stinks, to begin with. The pizza was AWFUL. 
Would never recommend this place, ever. Nasty

Cute, bright, decor/inside. The menu is 5 items--simple but great quality. I had the chicken and pork soup dumplings and both were great. The chicken was phenomenal though. Also had the pancake with cruller, which was a great scallion pancake with savory fried dough inside. Will come back. It's cash only if your order is under $25.
More of a quick note: They do not have different colored basketballs-only orange. Even in the kids sizes.
A great place to bring a group of friends! The place has a really cool atmosphere and the old school rock band that was playing was really awesome; the crowd loved them!

So , are you wary of seafood in a land locked state . Well worry no more . This place has vibrant colors combinations with matching bright fresh flavors. The tuna and spicy tuna bowel is what I got and highly recommend. It's like mix and match topping . From sea weed to mangoes to fried onions . It's the best thing for a warm day and hot food is just not calling to you . I'll definitely be back for more .

Do NOT, I repeat, Do NOT use this moving company. One of the guys on the crew stole my wedding ring. Nothing is sacred these days, people do not care about other people and their property. It is disgusting that a moving company would employ someone that would feel the need to go through my things and steal a personal, prized possession. It was a family heirloom and now it is gone. Find another moving company, or move your stuff yourself. You can't trust anyone these days.

Ok I'm impressed.  I was expecting mediocre fast food chain grease but not so at LC. Maybe it was because I  tried WhiteCastle last week and it made my tummy cry. The roast beef sandwich had decent flavor and the horseradish and honey mustard dips came in little containers making it feel like it was freshly made.  I was expecting those little packets you normally get which is a sign it was made a few states over and months ago. Well done LC, I think I shall be returning shortly. Next time though I will get the king size because the original was a bit small for me.
While they're seasonal - whenever they have their whipped sweet potatoes you must go! Drooling right now thinking about them. If only they would have them year round.

Great food but 
Fast late night eating
Nice to be able to find something that's convenient and healthy

Checked them out on a cold night, I liked the decor, the place had a nice ambience.  The cocktails were pretty good, but I wasn't super excited about their beers.  The appetizers - hush puppes were good, and I had the chicken and waffle entree, which was ENORMOUS.  Very tasty to boot.  A side of dirty rice was ordered, and it was incredible too.  The poor boys were also ordered at our table, and they looked quite good.  All in all I can't wait to go back and get the shrimp and grits or something, if I can pull myself away from the chicken and waffle again.

Just a good ol' neighborhood B&G -- our go-to for a casual dinner, especially when the game is on. The burgers are nothing fancy, the fries are crinkle-cut most of the time (although ONCE they subbed fantastic seasoned fries -- bring those back!), but it's simple, reliably tasty food. All the servers and bartenders are SUPER nice, and we've had some good conversations with strangers at the bar. Just a nice little place that we're really glad we found.

I went to the soft opening of Poke Doke. St. Louis has needed a standalone poke restaurant for years. Poke restaurants should have fresh tasting fish, a good array of toppings, and a reasonable price. Poke Doke satisfies this on all fronts. 

There is an array of proteins available (though I would have liked to see more options, like hamachi), including: salmon, tuna, spicy tuna, octopus, shrimp, and tofu. Unfortunately, the tuna wasn't available today. The salmon and shrimp were both fresh tasting. 

The toppings included: radishes, edamame, seaweed salad, masago, fried onions, imitation crab, and various fruits. There was also a large array of sauces (wasabi mayo, teriyaki mayo, spicy mayo, etc.).

I go to STL for biz once a month and every time I use this National car location. One time I left my prescription sunglasses in the console and they have the BEST customer service: they called me within 1 HR of submitting my online claim and offered to send them via 2 day back to me. They never disappoint; hands down the best rental car location service I have been to.

I loved this place, have frequent many times, the last three visits for lunch not a good experience my lunch partner and I ordered and the manager told us she had many to go orders and we would have to wait until all those orders are filled, what is that all about???how about you take care of the patrons in your restaurant, we waited over 45min no acknowledgement from the manager got up and left, The 2nd visit, placed order and the same drill she said they are covered up with to go orders and the wait could be about 30 minutes this is lunch time take care of your paying in house customers, this is why restaurants go out of businesses, is because of slow customer service, we also watched as 3 St Louis Policemen waited and waited never received their food order and left, someone needs to address the slow lunch service!!! situation, The 3rd visit was at lunch with some out of town guests that wanted to visit because friends said it was so good, I said nothing and went with an open mind and would give it a last try, once again the same story from the lady manager we are so busy with to go orders Your food order could take 30+minutes, if your so worried about to go orders shut down the sit in area and do to go orders only..... I am done with The Haven, Good luck with your Lady Manager and her top of the list TO GO orders, a change should be made!!

Disgusting cars! If you're lucky enough to not have to wait for one. I'm forced to rent from here regularly, and wish it wasn't so. I rent from National across the country, and this location has the filthiest cars. I'm convinced the employees who clean and service the cars are smoking in them and using them as their daily drivers. Every single car smells like cigarettes. The windows are dirty, and floors are never vacuumed. It's terrible. Go elsewhere!

Brand new restaurant right next door to Blues Museum with excellent variety of "Mexican" classics on the menu - PLUS a few new ones! I had the "machete" which is a giant quesadilla with a few more fixin's in it than your normal quesadilla - i.e. wood-fired corn and steak - very tasty but a tad dry - was much better once I put the creamy avocado "salsa" on top.  Service was excellent and food came out quickly. Had to wait just a minute to be seated since the hostess was also taking all the to-go orders, but I'm sure the staff will iron out those logistical details. Very attentive staff and nice environment - not too cramped and nice and bright.  I'll be back as soon as I'm back in town!

It's possible that living in NYC for a year has ruined pizza for me.  It was good, but nothing too special. It's a long wait for the pizza - 40 minutes to one hour. It is still a fun place to hang out with friends.

What a gem! Being a Southerner myself I'm always interested in trying "Southern" food elsewhere. This place did not disappoint. I had the Catfish with butter bean and bourbon whipped sweet potatoes. The batter on the catfish was perfect. It was crispy, had a kick of spice and held together beautifully. The butter beans accompanied the catfish well and I would definitely recommend getting them. I was hesitant on getting the sweet potatoes but glad the waitress convinced me otherwise, they were so good. Last but not least was the chocolate chess cake. If you have room for It get it! Not to mention, the staff was very nice and knowledgeable about all the food which I appreciate. I will have to come back next time I'm in STL. This is a go to spot for sure.

POSITIVES:
In my opinion, Blackthorn has the best pizza in St. Louis. I've eaten at almost every pizza joint in town, both city and county, dive and upscale, and this is the best. The sauce is what makes it. It's a spicier sauce, different from what you're used to on a pizza and it's outstanding. What I also like is that they don't skimp with the toppings. When you get bacon, you get huge chunks of bacon. Sausage...huge chunks of sausage. I think you get pretty darn good quality pizza for the price ($18 for a medium, for example).

Blackthorn also has thin, pan & Chicago-style deep dish crusts. My recommendation is to either go with the thin or the Chicago. The pan is almost too dough-y...so you might as well just eat the Chicago style deep dish at that point.

NEGATIVES:
The wait. To be clear, Blackthorn is a dive bar that happens to sell delicious pizza. They are not staffed for a quick pizza turnaround. And on the weekends, the wait can easily be 2 hours. Just know this and plan accordingly.

OTHER COMMENTS:
The bar itself, I think, is a great local neighborhood bar. It's not huge, has limited seating, but it has a charm unto itself. And the bartender has a nice mix of gruff and friendly that makes him endearing.

I used this company to redesign my website.  My contract said it would take six weeks and it took well over a year!  I then used them for other small projects which also took forever and some were never completed. Some were simple concepts they didn't understand and should have.  They also charge a rediculous amount of money for their poor service which I didn't realize until after I switched to someone else.  When I fired them, the owner Rob Timmerman became extremely contentious and threatening.  Bottom line is there are a ton of companies that can do this work efficiently and correctly for reasonable fees. Stay far away from this one!

I Rented a vehicle here to use during the Thanksgiving holiday. The overall experience was good. The office is about a ten minute ride from the airport. The shuttle drivers were friendly and helpful. The check-in was fast, the location had easy to use kiosks as well as Enterprise associates. They have separate employees who walk you your vechicle, do a pre-check of the vehicle and offer any additional insurance. You digitally sign the reader and pick-up the paper copy as you exit the property. We had reserved a mid-sized SUV but none were available. We were immediately offered a free updrade, which was nice on Enterprises part. Our associate was very friendly and helpful...we were given a Jeep Grand Cherokee Limited, a nice vehicle but dirty on the inside. I had to stop and get spray  cleaner and paper towels to clean the dash, windows and interior displays. There is one function this vehicle has that's quite annoying. It's a "start/stop" feature... when the vehicle is stopped, it cuts itself off! It then re-starts when you accelerate...wish I would have known this...would definitely use this location again...

This is one of my favorite cafe's in the St. Louis area.   The restaurant is always clean and the staff are very friendly.  During the middle of the lunch hour rush, the line can be long, but they usually serve everyone quickly.  Every time I go to the Daily Bread I want to buy one of everything on the table filled with cookies and pastries because it all looks so good.  

My favorite menu items are the fresh roasted turkey sandwich, white chicken chili, and the summer salad (seasonal item).  I usually go with the daily double so I can get two items.  The DB sauce on the turkey sandwich is excellent.  

NOTE: Leaving the plaza can be a challenge because it is right on Manchester road, which is always busy, and there are signs that obstruct the view at the exits to the parking lot.

Just got home and before the wonderful relaxed coma I'm about to slip into I had to give some props to Laura and the establishment as a whole. 
Came in for a couple massage with a friend for her birthday. I needed deep tissue and boy did she deliver. My friend had an amazing experience and she is so glad I introduced her to this amazing gem. She was all smiles and can't wait to come back.
Now my massage was great! Knowing I needed deep tissue for my back I expected her to kinda skip over the rest but nope she delivered a great full body massage (which comes with the package) before digging in. Now once she got to my back I honestly cried when she broke up some of the knots in my shoulders. I have had a migraine for over a year and once she broke it up I finally have relief. I know I'll need more work but I can't wait to go back and see her!! Amazing just amazing  
I would recommend this place to everyone and if she available go to Laura however I haven't had a bad massage therapist there and don't expect it to happen in the future!!!

I was disappointed with my Classic Breakfast. I asked for patty sausage and soft scrambled eggs. It  also came with two small skin-on potatoes and biscuits & gravy. The potatoes were delightful and the b&g were great. However, the sausage patty was burned black and it overpowered what would have been a nicely flavored house made sausage. Also, I'm not a fan of over cooked eggs. So I specifically asked for soft scrambled. They came out hard cooked and were singed to a light brown in places.  I was pressed for time so I didn't ask for anything to be remade.  I chose iced tea for my drink and it was cloudy and tasted like instant.  If I go back I will communicate my wishes stressing past experience. And if that's instant tea, get rid of it and brew up some Lipton.

This place is so cool!!! Staff is awesome and friendly. They forgot to add my husband (shake by the way that's they're fan favorite ) but we still had a great time it was my son first birthday and they brought the feature presentation to the table for him and sung happy birthday!! The cake shakes and ice cream  is the best!!!! And they sell food. It was truly awesome and I recommend the place for events or casual outing with friend kid or partner

Love, love, LOVE this place!  I ordered the chicken pot pie, which was out of this world good.  The pie toppings was perfect, not soggy, and the flavor of the chicken and vegetables was outstanding.  My sides were the beets and the cauliflower.  Both were VERY flavorful, and not your standard, run of the mill, sides.  My friend let me taste her ribs which were amAAAzing.  She had the mac and cheese and cornbread for her sides, which I thought were good, but not as good as mine.  We shared a Bloody Mary which was wonderful too, with nice toppings.  All in all, definitely a place that I'd suggest to others, and a place I want to go back to.
OH, I forgot!  The deviled eggs were some of the best I've ever had!

I'm traveling through to Phoenix I stopped at the restaurant, had biscuits and gravy that was hard and gross. After I was waiting to catch my flight and one of the girls threw a small plastic container on the floor and a condiment. She was playing with two gentlemen.  She wanted them to pick it up. The problem is they left, they all where laughing and there are a lot of elderly people trying to get around. I wasn't surprised by the food which I didn't complain about to the waitress but that took the cake. I have a picture of the plastic container and condiment. Mind you it was in the main corridor it was next to the outside check out stand. Just irritated by that behavior. I am at the St. Louis airport restaurant. Yes the gentleman came back about 5 mins later and picked it up. She asked them if they picked it up but she threw it purposely.
