Exceptional pizza! Plan to make it an evening because you will be waiting a bit for amazing food!
Clean room. Good service. Very accommodating for our dog. Right off the highway for easy access.

Nathan the bartender is a blast. Makes amazing drinks and is a good pal to talk to. We had a blast sitting that the bar on Valentine's Day. Met a lot of cool people who were fun to talk to. Nathan the bartender made custom drinks for us and entertainment us for a good four hours. Amazing guy. Recommend this place to anybody who wants to have a good time!

Great place nice environment .
Caught a late night snack with a couple family members that's night fooled me I thought I was eating ice cream the whole time was a great treat even though I don't like yogurt . You deserve every star

Aloha friends..this Cute little food truck serving all the authentic Hawaiian finger food cuisines is unique. I ordered a poke bowl with a fried egg very traditional and lobe it I got one the spicier sauces . I love the HEAT!!! Even in the heat... because boy was it hot outside. But I quickly cooled down with one of their delicious tropical soda juice things ... my only wish is that the portion was bigger but later I saw I could have ordered a bigger portion. So maybe it was me not understanding the menu who knows . Over the fish tacos and poke bowl was delicious. The plate included the macaroni salad which a few of us weren't a fan off... other wise Buzz got it down.

Been here many time. Local owners. Local produce. Locally sourced. Excellent service. Outstanding and unique combinations make up their breakfast and brunch menu.  Open kitchen allows you to watch your meal  made fresh right in front of you, with a window to their bakery in the backs keeps younger ones entertained. They provide personal service with coffee club for frequent fliers. Simply must try this place or make it a regular stop.

UVL moved us from Colorado to Texas a few years ago and we had a wonderful experience.  So, when we decided to move to Nova Scotia from Texas, we went with UVL again.  Sadly, they let us down in a BIG way BIG time!  
First, "Jack" sent only TWO packers on day one to pack a 10 room house and large garage full of decorations, etc.  I complained, so four were sent on day 2.  Still not enough.  At the end of day 4, the truck was finally "packed."  
However, no one explained that all of our items were to be unloaded then reloaded again onto a different truck in Halifax!  WHY do that with SO much stuff?  Just Dumb.  
Our contract clearly stated all goods were to be unpacked and placed on the floor at our new home.  Nope!  The driver slept in his truck while two guys unloaded boxes unsupervised.  All goods had to be transported down our road by yet another (smaller) truck.  Lack of manpower once again!  Well, after two days of unloading the huge truck, the driver took off and left behind these two guys to do all of the unpacking & putting all furniture back together.  They needed help reconstructing the log bed and I ended up getting hit in the head with a log!   The driver had not even paid the two guys prior to departing.  Obviously, the job was not completed.  We complained, so a local company had to send two guys out on Father's Day!  The company owner, 
Joe, was clearly very upset bc of this.  Needless to say, I had to unpack 72 boxes.  And, ALL of the empty boxes were left on my front porch for five  weeks before Joe's guys came to pick them up.  I had called 4 times to get the boxes hauled off; which was in the contract as well by the way.  Then, they still had left 6 boxes on my front porch which I then hauled to our recycling center.  Now, the best part.  I notified Beth of the 11 broken items two weeks ago.  No help from her.  I notified jack.  No response.  Some items were not packed properly or at all.  Just thrown onto the trucks ...THREE different trucks!!!  Three times moved with no protection!  Dining room Furniture broken,  plates no longer available broken, pictures broken. a precious gift broken, large pottery flower pots broken.  All because people do not do their jobs.  This Houston company is a joke as far as I am concerned.  Jack did not do his job.  Beth did not do her job.  Packers did not do their job.  Driver slept.  .  $21,000. And this is the service you provided Jack!  Shameful! shameful! Shameful! A score of one star is too kind.

I ordered the shrimp xiao long bao on a cold snowy day. I was rather hesitant driving there while it was snowing, but it was definitely worth it.

Flavor: The flavor was quite compatible to other dumpling restaurants I had in Seattle and San Francisco although not as complex since there is only one meat in each bao.
Ambiance: The store is nice, clean, and quiet; however, there were only two of us there, probably cause it was snowing.
Service: Great prompt service, I didn't mind the wait as I knew they were cooked to order.
Value: It was a bit more costly than I expected as the prices were comparable to Din Tai Fung (but DTF doesn't exist here)

Stopped here for the 2nd time and today I got the margarita pizza. This is fancy speciality pizza and it is really tasty!  You can tell the high quality of the ingredients because it comes out in the flavors. The sauce is nice and bold and the fresh mozzarella is great.  While this is not a traditional "circle pizza" the crust is thin and tasty and has a great crunch. 

Salads look great too. Can't wait fo go back with my wife and split a pizza AND salad!
The pre-made cobb salad was fine, but my salad and coke cost $17. Robbery.

This was my first ever massage so I went with the 'sampler' because I really didn't know what I would like or want.  The pressure was firm but not hurtful - they did tell me I could ask for more pressure (I didn't give much guidance in this area as a newbie because I didn't know what I'd like) but I thought it was just right.  It wasn't overly soft by any means, like I've read in a couple of the other reviews.  The table moved about three feet during the session so I know she was using some force!  It was perfect.  The oils and hot stones felt amazing.  The music, scents, lighting, and sound table were VERY relaxing.  I really loved the head phones and eye cover, you can really shut off the world. They also have a arm rest under the head rest so when you are on your stomach, you can put your hands in a natural comfortable position, instead of back by your sides.  I could have laid there all day!
My massage therapist was Jenn B. who came highly recommended from a friend and I second that recommendation!

This was honestly one of the best experiences that I've had in a "doctor's office." It was very clean and updated, with TVs in each treatment room. The staff was great and made me, a nervous college student, feel very comfortable. I also feel like everyone who I saw genuinely listened to me and were not rushing me. They really made sure to explain to me exactly what they believed was going on and what I was going to be treated with and I was very thankful for their thoroughness, as I was very sick and was getting worried. Test results came back very fast and I was thankful for their on-site pharmacy because I didn't have to wait any longer or stop at another pharmacy to start feeling better. Will definitely be coming back in the future!

Surprisingly good food for a sports bar--the jalapeno poppers (recommended dressing: ranch) and chicken tenders (recommended dressing: honey dijon) were tasty. The daily happy hour special is really good too; the prices outside of happy hour didn't look too bad.

The location is a little off the beaten path. You have to walk past some industrial buildings along Manchester before you find it. There is plenty of parking in the adjacent lot. Spacious interior with a patio that I didn't have the chance to check out. Maybe next time!

The two bartenders we interacted with were very friendly and attentive. There were only a few other customers when I went early on a Sunday evening, which made for a relaxing visit.

Ive been anxiously awaiting this place opening after several months. I had a few tacos a la carte during their opening week. The restaurant was extremely busy, but overall the staff kept up as well as they could. Prices are high compared to similar places. The food was great!!!

Wow! What a diamond in the rough. Completely unexpected. Ordered the fish sandwich. Fish was incredibly moist and perfectly seasoned. The batter was light and had a good crunch. What made it a fab sandwich was the bread. Kind of like a French baguette but softer. Bread had grilled marks and really the taste was hard to describe but delicious.
What made the experience awesome was this server named Jennifer. She went above and beyond to make sure I was well taken care of. Courteous, funny had a southern charm about her working in St. Louis-- go figure. Bravo to the management providing awesome high end food with a diner price!
Quick and easy ride from the airport to the shuttle stop... Just get out early for the car you want if you are an elite member... It's a race to get the car you want.
Excellent food.  The plates are oddly shaped, so the cutlery slides off of them.  But that is a small price to pay for a good cannoli.  Nice atmosphere too.

My first time here! I must say I'm not the biggest fan of Calzones but I figured we try it. Unfortunately it's just not appealing to my taste buds lol just give me a slice of pizza lol I REALLY wish they had beef options bc we don't eat pork. So maybe hamburger meatballs...turkey bacon?? A lot on the menu was pork so that cut down our options to only chicken as far as meat goes. BUT I can say the staff here were amazing! EVERYONE said hello and about 4 different people told us thanks for coming in & have a good day! Made me feel like they appreciate my business and felt like Stl Family! I love trying local restaurants and I'm glad we came in today!
This restaurant blessed my life! I You must visit this Soon! I'm coming back tomorrow!  I'm from Chicago and I'm PLEASED!

When you want a place that has a fun atmosphere with unbelievable drink prices and specials every day of the week, this is the place to go. Combine that atmosphere with some of the best southern soul food imaginable and you have a recipe for success whether you are looking for a great lunch spot, or a great place to party. The music and entertainment is on point, matched only by the friendly staff who are always available. This is a must see place for visitors and residents of the area alike to kick back, relax, and enjoy some of the best hospitality that St. Louis has to offer.

Amazing.... .Elevated flavor profile with All the sides.  Mac and cheese unbelievable.  Biscuits tender and crispy.  Apple butter was so flavorful I wanted more to take home..Tofu dish was equal to dishes I have had in Yountville and Napa.   Pecan pie was a big surprise.   Like having a glass of bourbon with your pie.  
Decor is cool and relaxed. Staff cool and clearly love what they are doing.

This place has very interesting selections and is great little sandwich restaurant to go with your friends for lunch.  The salads are huge and delicious (I don't recommend the Caesar, it was kind of bland) But it is a tad expensive and the staff was okay - not really rude but not friendly either.  Also there website is not up-to-date.  My aunt tried to order the tortilla soup special we saw on the website but they said they no longer had it.   I got the buffalo chicken sandwich and I loved it.

More exiting than Dominos, at least!

I've been here a few times and have found that their sauce is overrun with oregano and black pepper. I like it quite a bit, but it's more of an every once in a while when you have a craving for it kind of thing. I tried both of their pizza styles, and the Chicago style stuffed crust pizza is more of an homage to Chicago style deep dish than a text book replica. Which is totally fine in my book. Why not try something new?

It does take between 45 minutes to an hour to get your pizza (even if you call right when they open). However, it tastes pretty freshly made and probably took a little time to put together with all the other people's orders in front of yours.

I would definitely come back if I have a long term craving and plan ahead.

It was the witching hour and I realized I had a hankering for that most American of condiments, balsamic vinaigrette. I went to yelp to find a theme restaurant that made it a central note in all its dishes, and several days later I found myself at Circle 7 ranch. The ambience was distinctly sexual. As I munched on my fresh from the oven chocolate chip cookie I looked at some girls from the local high school. They liked the way I stared. After discussing the matter with the police I CHOSE to leave of my own volition.  Thank you for your patronage.

Found via a Yelp search while enjoying a Bloody Mary at Soulard Farmers Market, we decided to give the unknown spot a try.  Located at Lafayette and Broadway, this is a former library turned bar with a food vendor inside.  
According to their events list, they have live music on Saturday nights and karaoke on Sunday nights.  It's a huge space as you'd imagine.  Upstairs are two pool tables and shuffleboard.  The main floor has a stage, bar and the food counter.  Order at the counter and they bring it to you.
We went with the catfish sandwich which came with fried okra, and the rib tips basket with fried mushrooms.  It was all delicious and service was quick and friendly.  Apparently the catfish was a family recipe, great spices, no fishy taste.  The rib tips came thick with sauce.  Messy but worth it!
I hesitate to give someplace I've only been once 5 stars but I think this young business earned it.  They celebrate 2 months on 8/24.

I have stopped going to this Dierbergs for my usual groceries. The last few times I've bought fruit the selection has been poor, and the pieces I bought were rotten in the middle. Also, fairly certain my boyfriend got food poisoning from some bad deli meat they sold us. No bueno.

Fresh and delicious. First time trying out the place, so I got a large which was four scoops of meat/ fish items and toppings to go on top, like at subway.  It was huge so I could not finish my bowl.

The based was rice (white or brown), soba noodle, wonton chips, or salad. Then your scoops if protein, based sauce of mild, medium, or spicy, choice of cucumber or onions or both, your choices of toppings and "drizzle" your sauce garnish. 

My large was $14 but it was definitely worth the price from all I have on it.  Plus it is fresh seafood after, so you can't go stingy in fish unless you planning a day in the bathroom.

Overall, I recommend it if you are in the Central West End area.

Can't get enough of this spot, not to mention it's a half a block from the house.  They have done a fantastic job bringing this fossil back from the dead.  As a matter of fact I think i will be stopping in for a "tall frosty one" on the way home.

Good times at Black Thorn Pub on a rainy Saturday night.  We met our friends on the early side, around 6:30 pm, to find all tables filled.  Lurking for a table like vultures seemed the better alternative to driving around in the elements, so we settled in the back and ordered up some pitchers.  We heard that the pizza takes awhile to cook, so we ordered our dinner, too.

All worked according to plan, by the time our salads arrived, we had a nice booth near the dart board. Salads were basic and yummy.  Pizza arrived sometime later (we were glad to have ordered the salads).  As a Chicagoan, I'm picky about pizza.  Although Black Thorn didn't taste like anything I've had up north, it did taste good, particularly the chewy crust..


Loved the darts and shuffleboard.  "Interesting" graffiti  on the walls and in the restroom--you be the judge of that!

Don't come here in a hurry---you wait in line, you serve yourself, you get your food eventually----but it's all good.
Went there at 9:30pm food was very cold and tasted like it was sitting around all day! They should be throwing food out

The two men who cleaned my carpet did an excellent job.  They got out all the cat stains and the carpets looked wonderful and smelled great.  I will definitely call Aladdin Chem-Dry the next time I need the carpet cleaned. I've already given their name and number to my neighbor.
First time going and I must say the food and service was awesome!!! The chocolate chip cookie dessert was the bomb..

The deep dish pizza is some of the best in st. Louis. The crust has a nice golden flake and the sauce is the perfect blend of sweet and spice. Italian sausage is top notch. The actual building is a dump. I am all for a hole in the wall bar, but a place That serves food should be moderately clean. It makes you wonder how clean the kitchen is. I recommend the pizza to go.

The staff is very friendly. Located in central west end it's a fun environment to eat and play some board games with your friends. The space is similar to a subway set up and the staff are energized and friendly. The food is unique because of the combinations served as dishes. This would be a good go to place for fun.

If I could rate it lower... I know people that are coming here probably arent reading this, but if you happen to be a real person trying to find somewhere to go.. skip this place. I personally love this chain, but this is the worst I've ever been to. Mostly negative comments are going to be about an individual experience, but this is an overall... Horrible.
Most unique pizza in STL.  With an amazing sauce it hard to beat.  Only downside is the wait but order ahead by phone for smooth sailing

Really cute bfast spot in a slightly off-the-beaten track location. Came here with with my mom at her suggestion for breakfast on a Wednesday. I am gluten-free, dairy-free And plant-based and it would be nice if they had more options for eaters with dietary restrictions like myself, but the MO falafel dish was quite good. My mom got the nest which I thought was adorably presented. The compostable trays were a nice touch, and the decor was simple but crisp and cute. The whole setup reminded me a bit of Sqirl in LA, from the counter service to the thoughtfully curated and presented dishes. STL needs more breakfast options like this place!

Twisted Roots has a diverse selection of house-brewed beers appealing to a variety of beer preferences. I really appreciate the options of an 8oz and 16oz poor. I chose the former to allow me to try more beers. I enjoyed a Fashionably Late, Kingsman and one more (Proteus?). All were satisfying! I think I enjoyed the IPA-inspired one the most - I love hops. Bartender was attentive, kind and helpful.
Simple. Not an extensive menu. Soup dumplings. That's it. And they're great! We've been twice and love it.
the absolute worst mcdonalds worldwide.  the staff are complete imbeciles and management is non-existent.  avoid at all costs, you are better off staying hungry.

I'm glad I stopped by for some beer and grub. They run happy hour specials from 3-6 with $2.50 domestic pints and rails as well as buy 1 get 1 half price appetizers. 
The place was quite empty when I was there so the owner and I had a good conversation. He provided some great BBQ advice. 

I started with the DoublePlay Wings which were excellent. They serve 1 lbs of wings with either ranch or bleu cheese on the side plus several pieces of bread. The sauce had a great savory spicy flavor with cracked pepper throughout. Not a real salty, chili pepper spice, but a nice heat to it. On the wings, it wasn't overbearing, but if you try the bread and dip into the sauce, it was quite a potent heat. 

For my second appetizer, I had the stuffed jalepenos. They, too, were very tasty without being too spicy. They're known for their award winning steak sandwich and also their hamburgers.  They had some nice craft brews on draft, but unfortunately ran out of the Shlafly Special T IPA which was probably the best one. 

The place is quite new and features Keno and lottery. Karaoke on weekends. Plenty of TV's and plenty of room for groups and parties.

A solid St. Louis/small city/landlocked city 4!

I'v been brought take out from here several times without having ever stepped foot inside the store. Our first visit opening week aside, it's been pretty decent. The is several options for each step Chipotle-style, and for a small privately owned restaurant they aren't nickle&diming you for the toppings (yet). The menu is on their facbook page, though I think maybe it's not always up to date if they have new toppings... 

The fish quality is decent, probably even better than the neighboring sushi joints, and cut into big pieces. The prices are reasonable, the toppings are fresh, and even though it's not the most perfect poke bowl in the world, it is usually just what I'm looking for in a light but satisfying quick lunch. Not much more you can ask for for fish in St. Louis...

(skip the bubble tea tho)

LOVE Yolklore and so happy other people do too. Pop tarts are great! Coffee is craveable. And whatever you could be in the mood for to eat, they've got it. I love the Nest egg or Johnny Ham hands for a fancy spin on breakfast. The traditional breakfast is great too. Sometimes the potatoes are on point, other days not so much... that's really my only complaint.

1st visit. We came for the pizza. We had an excellent Chicago style pizza with the works. It took 40 minutes to prepare,  so budget your time accordingly. The bar is pretty much a dive. They have shuffleboard , pinball and other games to spend the 40 minute wait.  The pizza was perfect from crust to cheese and the toppings were abundant. We will be back.

We had the pleasure of dining at The Bellwether last night.  Love the ambiance of this place and the views of our beautiful city's skyline.  It's a chic casual "happening"  restaurant with an outdoor eating area high enough that there are no pesky mosquitoes!  We opted to sit inside but on a cool evening after sundown I'd like to sit outside here.  Every member of the staff was professional, kind and took good care of us.  

Appetizers we selected included lamb meatballs - lovely aroma and delightful flavor, a fabulous watermelon salad with feta and chili fries served with a dipping sauce that's out of this world!  

Entrees chosen were pan seared mackerel- perfectly cooked with a Mediterranean type salsa and a pork chop with a mustard glaze - spectacular!  The pork chop was accompanied by potatoes- everything was cooked perfectly.  Looking forward to another meal at The Bellwether!

One of the best for breakfast and lunch. I love the map on the wall that shows where all the patrons have come from all over the country. With such friendly service and delicious food the reputation for this place is sure to spread far and wide. Sometimes I just stop in to grab a coffee and go. Mostly though I come here for the breakfast sandwich.

Overall we enjoyed our visit to Carnivore.
Nice atmosphere, friendly efficient staff, and generally good tasting food. Salmon, salad, drinks etc.
The "happy hour" prices for appetizers is deceiving the flatbread was very good tasting but ridiculously small. We didn't expect that half price specials meant half the normal portion. At least I hope that it was half regular portion as small as it was.
The Pork steak was very disappointing by far the worst  one I've had here in the STL area. I've eaten many. While I realize pork steaks are not a premium cut of meat, I struggled to find any meat at all on this one. Purely fat and gristle. I would expect better for a place named "Carnivore." 
Glad we tried it but I'm sad to say we won't be back.
The nice atmosphere and great staff just can't overcome the prices, quantity and quality of (some) food items on the menu.

Went there last night, sat at the bar but had to get in line to order beer and pizza for the most part so DON'T EXPECT GOOD SERVICE on a weekend night.  

Chicago style pizza is mainly cheese and dough...tons of cheese.  I recommend the pan style for good, unique pizza!  Cool atmosphere- bar, games.
Rick Lewis could make a brick taste good. Every thing here is spot on and delicious. Excellent fried chicken and the best collard greens in Missouri

Overall a great place for a fun date night... the Sangria was tasty, but the Cadillac Margarita was delicious. I ordered 2 but the boyfriend helped with the second. We ordered chips and salsa but the waitress brought queso. It was all pretty good - the queso had a pico type topping, kinda smoky. I didn't eat much of it though. The salsa was tomato sauce consistency but tasted like salsa. It was perfect... I had street corn, a steak taco and a chicken taco. Both were good. The chicken taco should've been on a different shell. It was wet so the shell got a little soggy. But still very good... 

I'll definitely be stopping in for lunch because I work up the street and I need more street corn and tacos!
It's never a mistake choosing this place. Everything I've tried is delicious. Interesting flavor and food combinations. MUST try the catfish with the spicy oil. And the chili verde was amazing.

The Island is aMaZiNg!!!  The yogurt is delicious and will definitely have you coming back for more! They have a variety of flavors and toppings that are sure to please anyone's  taste buds! The employees are super NICE and FRIENDLY which just makes the "Island" experience even better! I love all the "Island-y" things scattered around the shop, adding to the 'personality' of the place! A well deserved 5 STARS from ME!!!

Had the roast beef with gravy, butter beans, green beans, and the chess cake. Brian knows his BBQ. Brooke and Taylor behind the bar made me feel like family. This is a great dinner spot and even better lunch spot. I'm beyond impressed and my belly is happy. Thanks y'all. I'll be back often
The workers are friendly, the fish is great for St. Louis,  and the bowls are a great size for the price. Plus they now do post mates, which is great
I love Emerald Club and always have a great selection of vehicles.  Cars are always in good order at this location and the staff has been great to deal with.
My company uses National exclusively. Emerald Aisle makes renting amazingly easy. Cars are always in great shape and there are no hassles.

It's 8:30am and my handyman was supposed to be at my house by 8:00am.  I just called in to the main office to see what's going on.  You tell me the guy "George" is not coming and you want to reschedule.  NO THANKS!  I needed to call you to find out you've dropped the ball on our appointment that was scheduled two weeks ago.  So unprofessional and so frustrating.  I'm going to hire someone else.  BUYER BEWARE!!!!!
Food was excellent, service was great. I think it's a bit out of the way, but definitely worth it if you are in the area. Four stars because it's pricier than most soul food restaurants.

Very unorganized, unprofessional and disrespectful staff. The quality of the apartment is also awful. Such thin walls that you can hear the person above you turning on the bathroom light. They solicit good reviews from their residents promising treats. The landscaping is really very nice...and that's mostly in part because their crews simply blow all the dirt and leaves and sludge into the fenced patios, out of site and now someone else's problem. Crooked place. They try desperately to convince you that you don't need to be present for the final inspection...when it's in your best interest and legal right to be there. Even if you set up an appointment for this final inspection there's a good chance they just wont show up and your apartment will already be being worked on. This place is a scam.
Terrible service.  JJ's is usually great with their service, they need to start over here...

We've been here four years... Most times were good, unfortunately when staff changes so does quality of service... I am not saying everything at every apartment will run smoothly. But to pay close to a thousand dollars a month and sit around with a broken dryer for over 7/8 days is ridiculous and has my home smelling. To even get someone to call me back or look at my dryer was a struggle in itself, lots of broken promises, lot's of phone calls met with no response. All just to have some one come in and "fix" it and it's still a broken dryer. Not once but twice. Not to mention they use an answering service so you would never know who you're going to talk to or if the message will get to the main office.

One of the best things about St. Louis, IMHO. I was never really into calzones until I ate the food here. 

Fatty B - like a deliciously cheesy, meaty inside out pizza with twice the flavor. The red sauce (always on the side! Haha) adds a nice little spicy kick. 

The Duke - smoky chicken and bacon nicely offset with the sweetness of corn all wrapped up in a warm, hearty pocket of seasoned dough. 

Caesar salad - surprisingly enough, I have yet to find a better Caesar salad in this town. Like for reals. 

The calzones are all huge and I usually save half for another meal the following day. You're basically getting 2 meals for $10! 

Haven't dined in at this location, but I've gotten delivery from here plenty of times. Of note, it does take 45 min to 1 hour for delivery since calzones are made fresh and have to bake. They charge a small delivery fee of about $2 that's not a tip for the driver, but the food is so delicious that it's worth it. 

Phone service has always been very professional, and we've never had a wrong order after all this time. Delivery employees are super friendly too. 

There's no greater feeling than having a nice, hot calzone fresh out of the oven delivered to your door!

Ed is the best. Great selection, convenient location. Fast delivery and a friendly place where the owner will take care of you personally. Lots of selection from value-priced beds to very high-end memory foam. We did the high-end memory foam bed and the price was much better than the big stores and delivered FAST.

It's crazy to NOT to buy a bed from "Crazy Ed."

Went here today for breakfast after it was recommended to me by a friend. I got the Nest Egg, as recommended by the friendly worker. To me, it was way too much dry pastry with not enough filling. I also found it strange that they said it came with crispy potatoes, because the potatoes were not crispy, but rather soft, undercooked and seemingly unseasoned. They serve food on paper plates, which doesn't really make sense when eating a runny egg, they should consider getting real plates.  I appreciated the fresh OJ. Don't really plan on returning.

I was very disappointed with my experience.  We rented a car from Alamo/National for 6 days, which brought the bill to over $500.  The pick up was fine, the car was fine, however, the customer service at drop off was shameful.  

I made the mistake of leaving a scarf that belonged to my grandmother, my knitting project and a reusable water bottle in the backseat, essentially items of no value to anyone but me. I know they were left there because I left them in the car for the duration of the trip and I stayed with family who checked their house.  We dropped off our car in a rush to make a lunch.  As we were driving to the airport, I realized I had forgotten the items.  This was about 2 hours after dropping off the car.  With limited time, we went back.  The woman at the National desk took my info, said they would look for it and they call me if they found it and went back to whatever she was doing before. She could not have cared less.  A man, possibly the manager or a supervisor, saw that I was upset (teary at losing my grandma's scarf) and went out to look. Another employee, assured me that items rarely "walk away".   Unfortunately, I had to leave, otherwise I would miss my flight.

The next day, I called and an employee told me to call back the next day because the person who runs the lost and found was not in.  I called back and was put on hold after asking for the lost and found person.  I spoke to someone who didn't give her name but said only "Ma'am we found the car in the dirty line after you left and checked for the items but they weren't there"  I said thank you and hung up, then asked my type A attorney cousin to please double check her immaculate guest house but no scarf or knitting.

Bottom line, someone at National/Alamo either stole my items or threw them away.  That kind of callousness to my belongings makes me certain I will look for another rental car company who will appreciate $500 worth of business better, train their front desk employees better and teach their back of house staff to not toss out or steal items. I have worked in hospitality, know it can be hard but it is common human decency to return lost and found things, rather than throw them out or steal.

REAL SOUL FOOD. Great home cooking. The rich flavor and aroma will grab you at the door. You may think your grandma is in the kitchen. This is the real deal home cooking. From neck bones, to smothered pork chops, fried chicken and fish. They have a little bit for everyone. The food is seasoned to perfection, not too salty and not too sweet. If you make it through your entrée, they have plenty of desserts. The entire staff was friendly and courteous. They made me feel like I was at home. Even the cook came out to ask me was I enjoying my meal. Some of the locals claim they provide some good competition to Sweetie Pies. You have to stop here if you live or travel through Missouri.

Airport food. Sometimes good; sometimes not.

Pasta House was an okay choice amongst a sea of ho-hum airport offerings.

First, the staff is very good.  Their good mood and friendliness was a bright spot.  At the recommendation of two of them, we ordered the meatballs, and weren't disappointed.  They were tasty without an overpowering of seasonings or ordinary pasta sauce.   Even as an appetizer, though, two of them were too many because they were that big. 

Pasta House serves local beer and the Schlafly pale ale hit the spot.  In fact, it helped wash out the taste of the toasted ravioli, which had potential, but was overcooked and dry.  The chicken noodle soup, on the other hand, was good, proving the pasta house can do pasta right under the appropriate circumstances.  This place won't win any culinary awards, but for an airport food spot, it does what it does pretty well.

If nothing else, count on the wait staff to cheer you up.

I'm a little split on my feelings of this breakfast spot. The place itself is very modern and hip. However, I'm not a huge fan of all of the community seating since it does not leave very much space for me to enjoy my food. I ordered the Billy the Kid, which is a breakfast sandwich complete with a breakfast sausage patty, fried egg, cheddar, and meat chili all piled on a ciabatta bun. However, I had to completely take everything off of my bun because it was extremely hard to take a bite out of. The chili on the sandwich may have been too much for that chewy of a bread. Eating the sausage, egg, cheddar and chili without the bun was pretty tasty. A little too pricey for my budget for what you get though. Don't think I will be going out of my way to eat here again anytime soon.

Freaky good, freaky fast. The bread is great - a sweet French roll. The chips are fantastic - I love kettle cooked chips. I LOVE LOVE LOVE how they pack on the veggies (I'm a Cali native, and I like my veggies). I had the beach club and the avocado spread was SO good - great flavor!

Finally came after checking hours with them on Facebook. FYI their phone line is still not set up. We tried the chocolate milkshake with donuts, hostess cupcake and an ice cream sandwich on top. It came with a sparkler for my bday and the staff sang to me. The shake itself was a little thick, had an unusual malt taste and was hard to eat with the wrapping paper around it.

I have a weakness for pizza places that actually create an authentic old school pizza parlor feel. Upon walking in the door of Black Thorn Pub, the smells and sights take me back to Godfather's pizza, circa 1994. Well, perhaps this would be Godfather's tattooed glasses-wearing Chicago-style brother, a little rougher around the edges with Black Sabbath on the jukebox. 

The bathroom graffiti offers sharpy-scrawled life advice littered with expired declarations of love. A never ending air hockey game punctuates the tv sports game. The door opens and we all turn to see who just showed up.

This place is awesome! They had my phone fixed in less than 10 minutes. The guys there were very friendly and knowledgeable. The prices seem much cheaper than anything I saw online. Highly recommended

So excited to try this place! I went today and it was delicious. Line was not too long, clean and inviting atmosphere. Not a whole lot of seating and parking would be a hassle. Luckily we walked from work. I got small size spicy tuna with white rice. Perfect for one meal. A little pricy but worth it. The gentleman who checked us out was really friendly. Will be back!

This is my second time coming to TDB. Smells great in here and they have an amazing variety of bakery treats not to mention a complete coffee bar for nearly whatever drink your after at a much better price than bucks. They have breakfast, lunch, and kids meals as well. They have a happy vibe and I appreciate that. All of the employees I've come in contact with are friendly. The food is good, every time I've come here my entire party has enjoyed themselves.


I would like to warn those of you thinking about coming for a lunch break treat, you might be here a while. Every time I've come in, there has been a pretty long line. BUT they keep it moving quickly and you should be up to the front.
This isn't meant for someone who has a 30 min lunch break. It's best for people who would like to enjoy their time and sit down with a friend to visit. Usually the tables are full, but they also have seating outside.

Before you make your decision, wander around he front of the line and make sure they don't have a small seasonal menu sitting out by the register that you could be missing. Happened to me both times I've been here and. I had to change my order on the spot because there were six or seven options I didn't know about! (I'm already terrible at decision making).

All in all, it's a great lunch spot for a nice date with your significant other, a friend, a roommate, or your momma. 


Note to the business:
The lines are getting a little bit excess and maybe you guys could consider expanding to another location/bigger location. Also, maybe you could find something such as NoWait, to help with the wait ones when you guys have full tables or are lined up out the door. Your staff is great and good is great, it's just accommodating the crowd that you seem to struggle with at times. First come, first serve basis will not work forever.

Worst customer service I've ever seen!! I was so blown away by the attitude of the person taking our order that I told my husband to drive off. By far the rudest staff I've ever witnessed. My husband wanted to speak to the manager, so we stayed in line, only to find out the manager was right there... talking about us with the rude employee! I will NEVER return to this location.
The Daily Bread is great!! I was in town seeing some friends and the staff was so nice and the food was so fresh and great! Highly recommend

After a day at the City Museum, my friend and I needed food. He wanted a salad, I wanted something pizza-y, and Yelp lead us here. Fantastic food. The "small" salad my friend got was much bigger than either of us expected and was full of ingredients - not just all lettuce filler. We got the garden calzone to share. I don't have a huge appetite, but are the bulk of it because it was so good. The crust was crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside, and the filling was delicious. Good beer choices, friendly service, and a casual environment with plenty of seating made this a great meal spot. I just wish I lived closer so I could try more of their offerings!
Delicious!! Thick. Saucy. Stuffed crust. I ate 1 and half pieces and was full. I also like the new vibe. Keep it coming

Everything was excellent. The hot chicken was superb, and the rub on the ribs was fantastic!
The staff was super friendly and cordial, and everyone was so nice to us. It was an overall great experience. 
I would highly recommend this place, for the price you'll get more than you can eat.

Disappointing.  Understaffed front desk, small rooms, no hot water for several hours, sink nearly clogged/slow drain, bathtub faucet wouldn't shut off, heater would cycle on for brief periods, and light rain in the morning killed the TV's satellite signal.  It's definitely below the standard for what I expect in a Holiday Inn.

Warning, this place is addictive! Friendly service and filling, affordable lunch.  Choose rice (brown or white) or noodles and top it with protein (various seafood, tofu, etc) and sushi toppings.  I could eat here every day and have a different bowl.  They also have bubble tea, one of my favourite treats.  PokeDoke is such a nice addition to the CWE.  Easy walk from WUSM and BJC.
Shelly was a very nice lady and was able to help me get my food out before my flight boarded. Food was also hot and fresh!

I wasn't super impressed with them. Not quite sure why, just a lot of little things that added up to disappointment. Everyone was nice enough, but the staff also seemed to be more about socializing amongst themselves. They seemed a little laissez faire, either that or their no pressure approach was misleadingly low key.
This was my first poke bowl and I loved it. I took the large one and I wasn't able to finish all.

Really good pizza. Be prepared to wait awhile though. I suggest calling ahead, especially if you are ordering deep dish. 

I got the deep dish and thought it was good. It wasn't Chicago style deep dish but more of a thick crust. The sauce is different then expects, different flavor but good. It's has a lot of spices in it. Overall the place was a great pizza joint and I'd love to go again.

best deep dish pizza and such a great dive bar - love this place. Sauce is not sweet at all - very peppery and pizza is just killer - It does take awhile to get your pizza (especially if you order Chicago style) but - well worth the wait and, they have a really decent music selection on their hard-drive. 

I have to admit though, I think I fell in love with this joint when I was sipping a brew and waiting patiently for my pizza at the bar and overheard the staff singing "Day Man" in the kitchen from It's Always Sunny.....good times!

Service was good, but my Shrimp and Grits left me very unsatisfied. Not a big enough portion for the price. The grits were rather bland for a southern style dish. This was my first time, and I do plan to return at least once more to try the Chicken and Waffles.
Jairon just completed treatment on our yard. He took his time to clean and prep the area then thoroughly treated the lawn, the deck and all around the house.

Came here for a happy hour. It was packed but the service was great. I couldn't stay long, so I got an order to go. It came out pretty quickly and the order was perfect when I got home (including a few specific changes to the items from the menu). Portions were big. The fries were so good! I had the veggie burger, and it was really good. My husband and kids enjoyed their meals. They have a very good kids menu. We also got the fried corn nuggets, which were good, but the sauce wasn't my favorite. I would've preferred something else. 

I definitely will be back to eat in sometime soon!

After several years out of the state, I am pleased to find out that so many NON-CHAIN restaurants have popped up in North County. A friend reviewed Ol' Henry and I trust her reviews so I decided to try it out for myself. I went on a Sunday at about 3:30 p.m. and was happy to see a short line and was quickly greeted by a staff member. I ordered baked chicken (you get one meat) with the sides of cabbage and mac and cheese. It came with a cornbread muffin. I also ordered the caramel cake. My whole order cost $16. I was shocked that it was more expensive than Sweetie Pie's and  with less meat. Nevertheless, I enjoyed everything in my plate. The mac and cheese was delicious with just the right amount of creaminess. The cabbage was fairly good. The chicken was good but nothing to write home about. The cornbread muffin was a bit too sweet for me but others might enjoy it. The caramel cake was good as well. I will be back, but only when I have the funds. It is expensive!

Talk about a weekend full of trying new places! My final meal on this lazy Sunday was at Grace Meat + Three where I ordered the turkey leg with smoked tomato bisque and mashed potatoes! I had the turkey leg dressed with gravy and it was divine! I wish I would have ordered one to go to have for lunch this week. The mashed potatoes were very good and the smoked tomato bisque was not for me. It was broth based instead of cream based, so if that's what you're into, you may enjoy! 

I had dinner with the fam and my mom ordered the ribs and loved them. The bbq sauce she used for dipping apparently had a sweet aftertaste that she liked so much she got a cup to go. For sides she got the cornbread, which was good but a little dry like other reviews have mentioned and the mac and cheese which my 12 year old brother said he wished was hot and gooey. 

I took a star off because you order at the counter and with only one group in front of us we waited a good 10 minutes to place our order. 

Overall, very nice meal and we will certainly return!

One of my fave places to eat in the Grove! They make their dough fresh every day and the calzones are always delicious and filling. My favorite is the porky fig, but all of them are great. You can't go wrong. They also offer salads and dessert calzones. Prices are very fair for the quality of food you get. The calzones are shareable for the normal appetite, so you can visit with a friend and get dinner and 2 beers for $20. 

Their service is always fantastic and quick, and everyone that works there is very friendly. From ordering to being served never takes more than 10 minutes. Their dining area is spacious and always clean. They also have a bar with local craft beers and domestics. Make sure you check out Sauce on the side, you won't be disappointed!

First time trying. Went with my mom, daughter, and brother for Sunday breakfast/brunch/lunch. Definitely worth it. Haven't been to a restaurant like this before in stl, and I'll definitely be back. I ordered a breakfast special, corned beef hash with two sunny side-up eggs. Awesome! Can't wait to go back and try their dinners!

Love the pizza, worth the long wait. Very unique sauce with coarse black pepper in it. Anyone who gripes about the food is a tool and needs to jump off the nearest cliff. The service can be cold and uninspired... Part of goin to a hole in the wall... Deal with it.... Or don't and miss out on the best deep dish you'll find in the area... Or one of the best. Enjoy. Ps, don't take your kids.

I wish you could rate it zero . Rented a car from here during the time Saint Louis was hit with snow this was the only car availed at the time. It was late I was focus on getting my destination. When I got into the car I notice a funny Oder. I thought smoke just going to leave that one open . The next morning when I inspected the car the seat were filthy and the Oder still there. I was going up for my sons graduation from basic. I picked him up for family day and had the same comment . The following day he was in his dress suit and because the seats were dirty also the rest of the car it put a stain on his dress pants. I have rented through national with my other job. When I contacted Custer service they said someone would be contacting me ... Still waiting will not rent from them again!!!
Been to two locations in STL and both were great food and fun clean location! Will go again!

As someone who doesn't normally eat frozen yogurt over traditional ice cream, I can honestly say I will be coming back to The Island whenever I have a craving for something sweet. I had a mix of chocolate milkshake and yellow cake, and topped it with fruity pebbles (which I have not been able to find at any other Frozen Yogurt place in town!) and reeses. Yum. 
The frozen yogurt did not have the low fat taste, and when I requested nutella the girl working said they would have it the next time I came in!
I would definitely recommend The Island to anyone who listens!

People were nice, but was not happy when car came with no snow brush and it snowed....enough to need the brush and scraper badly.  When I went to buy one on my own the store was sold out.  Car was also making a strange noise.  I rent very frequently, and this was my first experience with National.  I usually rent with Budget and have never had any issues.  I know it seems picky, but for what you pay for these cars, you do expect to get what you need.

Not worth it. $8 for 6 bite size pork soup dumplings. No water, you have to buy bottled water. Nothing else on the menu other than the super expensive soup dumplings. Be prepared to spend $30 for lunch here and walk out hungry. The dumplings are okay, skin is too thick. We will not return.

This place was a bit of a surprise.  We enjoyed their "famous Salad" and added grilled chicken.  The flavor of the oil and vinegar and spices  was surprisingly delicious.  The grilled chicken was moist and they provided us with a healthy amount.  The service was excellent. The server was polite and made some very good recommendations. I would be back again.
I got a calzone here for the first time today. I did takeout for lunch and ordered the Five-O. The overall flavors were really good but they skimped quite a bit on the other fillings.

During a storm in April, a tree branch crashed through my roof, along with damage into the interior (I'll go into the interior repair in another review).  EBS came out after the initial tarping job done by another company left alot to be desired.  They re-tarped my roof quickly and the rainwater stopped leaking into the house.  Later, after the insurance company determined my roof needed to be replaced, I received an estimate from them for repair which was competitive.  I have to mention that they are a preferred provider with my insurance company, State Farm.  Mike Kinsella was my contact person and his response to any issues or questions that I had was great.

Because of the volume of damage done in the area, it was about three weeks before they began working on my roof, but the tarp continued to protect the interior so no damage was done.  It didn't hurt that we are going through a drought this year, so not much rain fell during this time.  They arrived full force and worked continuously on the roof all day (they must have eaten lunch in shifts because I never heard a lull in the work going on).  I have a small house, so they were finished in one day and I have to say it looks fantastic.

They picked up any debris that fell from the roof which was appreciated since I have two dogs.  They are BBB accredited, have a super service award from Angie's list in 2010 and 2011.

I highly recommend them to anyone need roofing repairs.

Been coming here for years all of the staff is super friendly I have an account there to where you can make notes on how you like your hair cut/trimmed. This place and if there's a wait time you won't be bored like all the other waiting rooms this place has checkers mini golf and they give you complimentary drink of you choice chilled to perfection in a glass bottle FIVE STARS!

I hate to write a bad review because the place and people are very nice, but the food was very disappointing. They tried to put a hipster twist on classic recipes and it doesn't work.  Fried chicken was good, but nothing to write home about. Had mac & cheese, but it was not good. It's the first mac & cheese I met that I didn't like. It had an odd taste to it, almost sour. Definitely not anything you would find in the South. Cornbread was super dry and I couldn't finish it. Started with fried green tomatoes, which are one of my favorite things, but they were just ok. Breading is cornmeal and it does not stay on the tomatoes. The comeback sauce is not like any comeback source you will find in Mississippi. It was odd.

Dr. Vidan and his team are phenomenal!  He treated my adult daughter and me for several months following a car accident. His staff worked with the other driver's insurance and I barely had to communicate with the insurance company at all. During the treatment he moved areas of my spine that hadn't moved in years. I have soooooo much more mobility and I sleep a thousand times better than before. Now I see him about 2 times a month for upkeep and every visit makes me feel better and better. He listens to me and doesn't over do it. His staff is likely the most friendly staff of any clinical office in St. Louis! I can't say enough!  Without question do I recommend Vidan Family Chiropractic.

Filled out their form online and the agent called me back within the next day to set up a home visit to get a quote. Local (Portland, Maine) office called me up and they were hesitant to send someone out for a home visit, claiming that we were too far away from their office (we're in Milford, New Hampshire), they promised to call me back the next day. Told them that I was looking at moving at the end of August, less 2 weeks before my move I still haven't heard anything from them.

So, I love Sauce on the Side. I love the fast/casual nature of it because sometimes just don't want to have to deal with the whole rigmorale of a full service restaurant. I love that they always have a decent selection of craft beers on tap/in cans. Even more, I love that they food is really, really good!!! My calzones are always perfectly crisp on the outside and chock full of the filling, they definitely do not skimp here. Plus all the staff have always been super nice.

Sauce on the Side is definitely a fave for me at this point :)
Great food, excellent service, GREAT mocktails for non-drinkers! The friend red tomatoes are out of this world. Inventive food and a nice take on old traditional recipes.

Favorite place in St. Louis. As a southern gal, this is the best place I've been to in St. Louis for fried chicken. Breading is full flavored and sticks to the meat! All of the sides are delicious as well as the other main dishes. They always have great specials to if you're interested in off menu items. Very friendly and helpful staff as well as a cool environment for dining.

ABSOLUTE WORST!!!! Rally's should be ashamed of themselves for allowing their name to be tied to such a poorly managed location. Work in Soulard and the one on Jefferson and this one are the same distance from my work. This one is absolutely horrible - terrible customer service, FILTHY and ICE CREAM IS ALWAYS DOWN and WHY do you have two lanes if you refuse to service anyone out of the other??? Spoke to the District Manager for this location a couple years ago to complain and he offered me free ice cream...went to get it and guess what? ICE CREAM IS DOWN. Smh...couldn't do anything but laugh. Oh and the managers don't seem to mind all the random people panhandling and begging on their lot. Disgusting.

For a yummy, filling meal you won' t easily be able to create in your own kitchen, this is a great spot! The place is casual but the food is made with care and extra delicious. You'll order at the counter where the staff is friendly and willing to make substitutions or recommendations, if you ask. I had the garden calzone which was large, fresh and super flavorful! The bread is really delicious and the homemade sauce on the side is extra awesome. They bring your meal to the table and service is prompt ...my calzone was piping hot straight from the oven. The place is super clean with large storefront glass windows and plenty of seating. There are also seats for casual outdoor dining on the sidewalk, if the weather is nice. I was extremely pleased with my $10 lunch and would return here regularly if I lived in St. Louis.

I die and go to heaven every time I eat at Sauce on the Side. Everything about it is wonderful! The calzones are fabulous (you can almost taste the love)! The garlic sauce...well, what's not to like about garlic sauce? And the Caramel Apple Pie, oh Lord Jesus, how can that even be legal???!!!

But it's not just the food. The location is fun. The atmosphere is inviting. The restaurant is kept super-clean (seriously, tables and floors are clean within 8.2 seconds after someone leaves). And every single employee is nice, friendly, customer-focused, and having fun while working hard. We have brought multiple friends and visited multiple times, and have never had anything but an extremely positive experience.

We look for every excuse possible to leave our West County bubble and head to Sauce on the Side. Show at the Fox? Yep - Sauce on the Side for dinner. Heading downtown for a ballgame? Should we go to SOTS before or after? Appointment at Barnes? Let's celebrate with a calzone! Gave the dog a bath? Yessssss...Sauce on the Side it is!

Rumor has it a new Sauce on the Side will be opening in Chesterfield. While I'm looking forward to that opening, even without a SOTS in my neighborhood, it's worth the drive to visit one of the existing locations. 

Keep it up, SOTS team!
Even for airport food, this is horrible. My pizza was cold and I'm not sure that was actually cheese on there... Service was so slow and the table stank after they wiped it.
Superb brisket and fried chicken.  Great atmosphere to dine.  The owners are fantastic and staff attentive.

I don't think it's a 5-star establishment, but it is a good food and atmosphere experience,with a very friendly owner who apologizes to you for your wait. And I found the wait pretty uncomfortable, because you are standing in a very small space by the door, but there's just no room! We went pretty early, and the crowd in the door just got worse and worse. I would have left if we had gotten there and seen that jam-up. However, our first time, we thought we would stick it out and try it. PS--no parking lot, so you have to take your chances on the street. 

We were seated at a table that had air conditioning bearing down on us like a north wind, so it was a pretty uncomfortable place to sit. I had a jacket with me, and wore it through dinner. My husband did not have a jacket, so we traded places, so he had slightly less wind and I took the REALLY cold seat.

OK, to the food. I got the Friday special of "fish," which was fried cod. It was OK, but it turns out that I really don't like cod that much. I was not overly impressed. Husband had the burger, and you can't go wrong with that.

Overall, I found it OK, worth a return visit, but not my immediate new favorite. I was never comfortable, between the standing wait (good for them that people will stay, I guess) and the cold seating area (it wasn't a hot night, but even if it were, you don't want gale force winds hitting you). I wouldn't call it spacious inside--we were crammed in. 

However, lots of people appeared to be enjoying the bar. We are not drinkers, so that aspect was lost to us. You might want to give it a try, though, because it has a very happy neighforhood aura. Three-stars says "A-OK" and I just don't think it's better than that.

I was shopping in the area and since I had such a bad experience on Saturday I thought I would try again Oddly enough I had Ryan again as my server He was much friendly and listen patiently to my order He offered me the 99 cent pastry and I even had a dollar off my coffee I am pleased that I gave them a second chance

A hidden gem! The bartender (who's also the owner) is a bartending pro that's friendly to everyone customer. He'll strike up a conversation with you and is very knowledgeable about liquor. Love the space as well, and the rootop patio is relaxing.

I never thought I would be a fan of a Chicago style pizza since my heart belongs to New York style; however, Black Thorn has swayed my decision. 

The first thing you need to know about Black Thorn is that you will wait at least 45 minutes to an hour before your pizza is ready! The second thing you need to know is that the pizza is worth the wait! Black Thorn is in fact the only pizza place in the city I will order a Chicago Style pizza-it is that good. The sauce has a bit of a "kick" to it which means I usually only eat 1 piece, but the slices are so thick and filled with so many toppings it doesn't even matter because I get full from just 1 slice! 

The atmosphere is definitely as others have mentioned; kind of a "hole in the wall" restaurant, but aren't those typically the best? The service has been okay each time I've gone in for a visit. I can't complain. 

Overall, I think you have to experience this place for yourself and then let me know what you think!

First visit, and I'll be back.  I'm always looking for interesting menus and I enjoy breakfast foods though I don't eat breakfast.  So Yolklore had potential.  

I talked myself into the daily special since the regular menu will be there next time.  It was nothing fancy, beef patties over rice with brown gravy and mango topped with an egg, but it was good if you like your rice moist and clumpy.  As it happens, I do for a dish such as this and it made sense for someone familiar with mango and "stick rice" as a desert.  The patties were not overcooked and the egg over-easy.  One recommendation though, with Mango the first word in the  description, find a way to include more than 4 little cubes.  It's doubly disappointing when the ingredient that closed the deal is hard to find let alone taste.

We are Emerald Isle customers and have always been pleased with the number of cars to choose from on your lots. However,  The St. Louis airport location was the worst I have ever used. Maybe  a dozen cars at best. And the first 2 sedans we looked at smelled of cigarettes and one had a ripped drivers seat.  Fortunately, we saw a small SUV tucked away that was great! A diamond in the rough!  So it turned out well for us.

Sandie is the only real estate professional you should even consider.

Sandie helped us prepare, list and sell our house with professionalism.  Her knowledge of real estate and the St. Louis market are extremely strong and it makes the entire process go so much smoother.

There were times where we got nervous and she was always there to talk us down.  During negotiations she kept us from giving too much and saved us thousands of dollars.

She is smart, professional and pleasant to work with.  This is why we have hired her to help us sell two houses over the years and in both cases we can't imagine anyone else doing as good a job.

We can't recommend her strongly enough.

Carbon Monoxide warning!!!! Be very careful when using this company to have your carpets cleaned. I chose the method that used their truck to power the cleaning equipment. They pulled the truck up to my garage and left it running. The door to the house was left open to allow the hoses through. After about an hour, I was smelling exhaust and getting a headache. A little while later my carbon monoxide detectors went off indicating presence of carbon monoxide. It took 30 minutes of open windows and fans going to finally clear the carbon monoxide enough so that the alarms turned off. When I called the office to tell them what happened, they were rude and defensive and said that their truck wasn't the cause. I have lived in my house 10 years and the carbon monoxide detectors have never alarmed, until they left their truck running for several hours close to my garage with the door open. Be very careful. BTW the carpet cleaning results were fair.

Excellent happy hour. Good gathering place for all ages and types. Casual or fancy. Good value for the price and tasty food for the whole family. Apps or meals.  Wine beer and everything in between friendly service.

This place is AWFUL. Never again will I go to this location or ANY clarkson eyecare for that matter. They wrote the wrong perscription and want to charge ME to make up for their mistake!! I was given bad attitude by the receptionist and they are VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! Do not go here!!

With 41 reviews this place doesn't need much help from me, but wanted to put in my 2 cents and add this to my list of pizza hall of fame.  

A couple of things: 
1.) It's a dive.  Eating in is great, but don't expect UNO's or a nice family atmosphere.
2.) Even though it's a dive, it's great.  As everyone says the pizza is amazing.  Max 2 slices per person if ordering has been our experience.
3.) The staff is great once you realize that they are doing the best they can, and be sure to note that you're GOING TO WAIT on busy nights.  Just grab some more pitchers, enjoy the company you're with, and build up an appetite.  
4.) I recommend calling in for take out early, stopping in a few minutes before its done and pull up to the bar for a shot and a beer.  

Other than that, read on to others reviews of the quality of the pizza, its fantastic and comparable to Giordano's (Chicago)  in my opinion .  Be prepared to be stuffed.

This is a cool space in the Grove. They did a great job filling up the calzone and making the proportions ideal. Definitely visit this one or the downtown location over the Chesterfield location. That way you may consider this place a top food option in the St Louis area.

What a gem! The deep dish pizza is soooo good. It takes a ridiculous amount of time to come out (like 45 minutes) and I'll still give this place 5 stars because it was so good. The beer selection is great and cheap too. It's a grungy and dark place, not for every occasion but perfect for a Friday night with friends.

I had to return an online purchase here.  At about 6pm on a weeknight there was one lane open and the line was 5 deep. When I was finally the next person another lane opened and the checker made eye contact and said he could take me over at the next lane. I went over and he couldn't do my return. I had to go back to original line and wait again. One it was my turn the return was handled well.  I walked around the store after my return. They stock was thrown about and they had nothing that you can't get somewhere else.  It's unfortunate that they will all be closing in the coming months but honestly, there's not much here you can get somewhere else for less.

Is there a score lower that one?

What a horrible experience.   You sign up for their Emerald Club which gives you the option of picking any car on their lot!

Problem-----no cars!

50 people in line waiting on cars.   No manager to be found.  The poor little guy they sent out had no clue who to send up to, no manager names.   Calling the office gave you a recording!

One hour and half before getting a car.   No service what so ever.   

I called their corp and left message and guess what ?   No one cares to reply!

Poorest customer service ever!

I have a 2002 Acura MDX and one of the quarter panels of glass shattered on Saturday morning. I called Glass Dr and they were very nice and gave me a quote of $275 for the window and install fee. They said they would come fix it Monday at my house, so all was going well. 
This morning (Monday), I got a call from them saying that they were able to get the window, but it'll be $100 more than the quoted price without explanation. My father called back and left a message with the manager, who didn't call until the next day to explain the issue. 

Update (4/18): I initially left a 1 star review and was reached out to by the management of the business who explained the situation and apologized for the miscommunication. While my initial experience was less than ideal, the fact that I was contacted about how to fix the issue was a nice step and shows that the company truly cares about customer satisfaction, which is why I'm changing my review to a 3 overall.

Great lunch after St. Patrick's Day Parade


Holy Infant School has been blessed with the influence of the Sisters of Mercy, from County Meath in Ireland.
Beyond providing wonderful faith formation, the sisters also helped students and parents alike appreciate Irish Dancing.

The girls dance at school, off-site locations, and in the downtown St. Louis St. Patrick's Day Parade.

After the two-mile parade walk down Market Street, the kids are hungry.

Our daughter requested we visit Crown Candy.

This Saturday was a beautiful day; after a cold and snowy winter this was one of the first Saturdays with sun... and it was warm and no clouds... and that had the Crown Candy crowd wrapping outside the door, as is usually the case on a Saturday.

Our son was smart and recommended that we order out... and take it home... then our daughter realized we could just dine in the van and we did.

One ruben for our dancing daughter and our son and I each enjoyed a one pound of bacon BLT.
Two strawberry shakes
then
a few minutes later we were nice and filled up... and smiling

(And yes, I shared my BLT with my wonderful wife)

Inside, as we ordered, our daughter got some licorice for her brother and herself and we also picked up some chunk chocolate for Easter... the chocolate is hidden away for the rest of Lent.

The Crown Candy staff was friendly and helpful as always.

Great afternoon... and a nice food-induced nap on the drive home for me (wife driving).

Thank you, Crown Candy!
This place is so fresh and tasty! I am always stuffed when I leave because the bowls are huge. There are so many options for mix ins you can get so much variety each time you go!

If I could give zero stars I would.  Horrible experience.  They had us go on overflow and delivered our second set of stuff super late.  They never told us when it would be there no matter how many times we asked. The people that packed did a horrible job of putting what was in the boxes on the outside so we had dishes in with the kids toys and sometimes boxes were labeled office but had only kitchen stuff.  Finally, when the overflow stuff got here the movers put everything in the wrong rooms and didn't pay attention to anything in the house.

Definitely would not recommend.

Terrible customer service, and they take no responsibility or accountability for their mistakes. They sent me contacts that don't match my prescription. I can't even wear them because they make my vision blurry. I've been trying to get them to send me the correct contacts. I no longer live in the area, so I can't just walk in and talk to them about this.

When I had my eye appointment they tried to sell me on unnecessary tests.They're quick to take your money but slow to respond to actual problems--I've been trying to get this issue resolved for a month now! They never answer the phone when I call the CWE office, so I sent an email...three weeks ago. Still no response.
Save yourself the hassle and get your eyecare services elsewhere.

Great little bar and grill. If you're looking for a good local crowd, home cooked style meals and good times you should stop in ASAP. I life just down the street and stop here fairly often and I've never had a bad experience. With Shocktop on draft, I'm in heaven. Grab a couple close friends and make conversation here soon!

We had heard about L'Acadiane from several Yelpers. Upon entry we were seated promptly. The restaurant and bathrooms were very clean. 

We got a Pork Shoulder Po'boy, Jambalaya, and shared a cornbread waffle. The Po'boy was a little dry, but decent overall. The Jambalaya was good, but the portion was waaaay smaller than I had expected (as depicted below). The highlight of the meal was definitely the cornbread waffle. I had never heard of such thing but man it was delicious. 

Overall- if you're looking for a place that's quality but smaller portion size, consider it. However if you're looking to get a little fat and sassy, try somewhere else.

Food was wonderful and plentiful. Fresh orange juice is a must.  Very little seating so be prepared to wait on the weekends. Stick with the menu items as adding a la cartel items ends up being very pricey. $30 for two people!
With Dierbergs, I can trust that no matter what I purchase I know it will be of great quality. Prices are a little high but the food is well kept organized and fresh!

I really like this National location.  First I will start by saying that I am not a fan of the off airport location and on a couple of occasions in the past I have waited so long for the shuttle to show up that I had to call the desk and ask if they were coming.  I know National cannot change the off airport location situation so I can't knock on them too much for it.  

Usually the shuttle is fast and the drivers courteous.  The ride is not long.  This National in particular seems to have a good car selection, and they tend to have nice cars, and they tend to be low mileage.  The Executive Isle is a quick easy in and out as it should be. I really like renting here.
Very cool atmosphere. I got the gringo burger and soup of the day and was not disappointed! Would eat here again for sure.

This is such a cute store all around. It's really a great place to take kids or anyone else for that matter. Great selection of animals and any type of accessory you can dream of. The staff is also super nice and interactive.

I've been coming to this place for almost a decade, introduced by college friends during a drunken study session. We've since "grown up" and left the Lou for KC, but we still manage to come back to the Black at least 2-3 times a year. Their deep dish is spectacular, the sauce is unlike any other I've tried. 

Alright so yeah, you gotta wait a long ass time for your pie if you come in at 7-8pm on a Saturday night, but that's why you entertain yourself with beer and games until you are graced with its presence. Or, you take the waiting time into account and call in an hour or two ahead of when you need it, take it home, and pass out in a cheese-induced slumber. There is no table service, so when you need more of anything you have to put some work into it to get that 3rd pitcher of beer. Everyone I've ever met who works here has been polite and helpful, and I've never had an unpleasant experience. 

If you're looking for a fancy, cookie cutter, corporate Chicago style pizza and environment here, sorry but you won't find it (even though damn, you gotta wait forever at those places, too). What Black Thorn offers is much better, both in food and originality.

Also, see you guys this weekend!

*UPDATE*
Went to see you guys last night with 3 newbies, and WOW I was shocked. I think the place looks amazing! I love how it's open and airy, but still retains your original pub style. Beautiful bar, too! We waited a measly 40 minutes for a 14" deep dish, but you still can't put a timer on perfection. And it was perfect, as always. Glad my review could make your day, Dave, and you can count on us to not only bring you new customers, but to remain loyal for another 10 years!

Black Thorn makes a delicious pizza. Loaded with toppings, nice crust (albeit perhaps a little too much of it), cozy hole-in-the-wall ambiance that gets a little smoky, but that's a pub for you. Love the neighborhood feel of the place, and the bartender was very friendly. However, we arrived just a little after 6 and promptly ordered a pizza to go, and a couple beers to enjoy while we waited. Luckily they have some great dive bar games (shuffleboard? air hockey?!)... because we didn't get our pizza for about an hour. The end product was great, but by that time I was starving and tired and was wishing they had a selection of appetizers to snack on while we waited. Granted, this place is tiny, and we probably walked in shortly after several other orders had been placed. But the restaurant was relatively empty, and more than 30 minutes for a pizza seems a little egregious to me.

I'll definitely return for the Chicago Style pizza (looked SO good), but will go on a night where I plan to have several beers and play games for a while before eating. Not a very approachable establishment for the impatient!

Absolute hole in someone's wall. That being said, cheap beer, good people, and one of the top three pizzas in the entire region. No messing around - thick crust, amazing spicy sauce, and CHEESE STUFFED CRUST. Nothing else matters. Go get a pizza and enjoy the graffiti on the wall.

Awesome breakfast meeting place.  They have a nice simple menu with plenty of options. They have vegetarian, gluten-free, and traditional foods. They use local resources, including homemade pastries.  The atmosphere is casual for a larger group or intimate duo.

All I can say is WOW! I've been to a bunch of different axe throwing establishments across the country from New York to Kansas to Massachusetts-- I've become a bit obsessed with the sport and travel a bunch for work so I'm always looking for a place to throw-- and Top Notch is easily my favorite! It was packed and the energy was great (on a TUESDAY night)! Steven was an excellent coach and taught me some cool trick shots. He also managed the whole place perfectly, making sure everyone was happy and had a blast! The throwing cards and ninja stars are a brilliant touch. Forget the other places in St. Louis (believe me, they're not worth the time and effort to find in the first place).

The food was great! My husband said it was the best BLT he had ever eaten. I got the special, the Elvis French Toast which had a peanut butter cream on top. It was delicious! The only negative is there is not a lot of seating. I know that it is trendy to have the one long table that everyone sits at, but I'm not a fan. They clearly pay attention to little details. That had ice tea ice cubes for the ice tea! Such a good idea! Overall, great food and great service!

I know they don't advertise to be "fast food", but 1.5 hours to get through a basic steak burger lunch is ridiculous. The kids got their meals early which is usually nice. Except when it's 20 minutes earlier than the adults. Then I had to wait over 5 minutes at the counter before someone finally rang me out. It was a slow painful meal.
This place is my cheers. When I walk in, they yell hello and already know what I want (yeah, I go there a lot). My sandwich is usually ready to go before I'm done at the register.
I'll echo the solicitation issue. "No soliciting" signs all over the neighborhood which were ignored.

I have found such a great group of people on every trip, who are inclusive and not cliquish. The people that Val attracts to her company are fun and friendly and will make you instantly feel like you belong. Not to mention very well organized trips with great dive masters like Steve and Scotty as well as Val. They come prepared, they love to have fun, and you will highly enjoy the experience.  I've been impressed with their ability to help me buy the things I need without overselling me.
Love this place! Cute neighborhood dive bar serving some of the Best deep dish in STL. Complete with shuffle board & local drafts.

I went to this Ulta after I've been to the store in St. Peters which is way better by the way. I thought all their stores would be the same, but apparently not? I was disappointed with how the selection at this location is very slim compared to the other one.
