The girls behind the counter were too busy chatting to help me look for a product I was searching for. Finally a girl in the back of the store came to help me but she didn't seem to know where anything was? I left without buying since I was unimpressed with the store and did not have what I was looking for anyway. I'll stay at my other Ulta.

As many reviewers have already pointed out ~ if you are looking for true "authentic" Chicago style pizza, gourmet toppings, toppings that are hard to pronounce or generally sound like they don't belong on pizza, or a cooked on oak planks in a brick oven made out of rare clay, kinda pie - Black Thorn Pub is not for you.

On the other hand, if you want a delicious, deep dish pizza stuffed with basic meats & veggies, (my fav. =  artichoke & mushrooms), where you never have to order extra cheese because you might fall into a dairy induced coma, from a true neighborhood corner dive bar, then you've hit the mother-load!

Be warned, there is no service outside the bar area - order drinks & your pizza at the bar and carry them to your table/booth yourself. You will be mocked if you saunter up to the bar and ask for the waitress.  The pizza will take a long time - likely an hour, and on the weekends, longer, especially if you've ordered Chicago style.

Tips for a fabulous time if you're planning on eating in:
Call ahead & place you order, just say it's for dine-in,
Upon arrival, order drinks, like a pitcher of Hefeweizen or a Jack n Coke (please save yourself & do not order a foo foo drink)
Find a seat (I like the booths around the corner), 
Play some shuffle board, darts or Pac Man while checking out the graffiti on the walls,
Wait to hear your name called in a somewhat, Charlie Brown-esque voice & be rewarded with Black Thorn's take on Chicago style pizza, in a warm, no fuss environment.

If you don't call ahead of time, be prepared to be three sheets to the wind by the time your pizza is ready! But hey, most of the patrons are locals and can walk home, so no harm no foul!

United Van Lines is the WORST long distance moving company I have ever encountered. I moved from RI to FL at the end of June. The 18 wheeler truck showed up to my complex after being told they would NOT be able to drive with that truck and previously advising a transfer was needed. Disregarding the transfer the driver then parked at Kohls and waited to hear back from dispatch on a Sunday. We waited one hour and told the driver we would drive him to Uhaul. He rented a truck and we went home to wait. Two hours later the Uhaul comes with SOMEONE ELSES BELONGINGS. Then FIVE hours since the Uhaul debacle started we received one HALF of our belongings. Every piece of furniture was destroyed. Wood was broken, dinged, scratched, and gouged. The other half arrived two hours after that with the furniture also ruined. We had purchased insurance and they sent out Southern Transit Repair to "repair" our furniture. We now have a two-toned antique Cedar Hope Chest. And a bedroom set that is two different colors and two entirely different textures. They were kind enough to close out the claim and let us know it is fixed. It is ANYTHING but fixed. My ideal furniture is ruined on top of a $4000 move, I am not expected to replace my furniture when I purchased insurance. Jason Jarvis the claims adjuster has not been communicating and when he did he said the matter is closed.

Even though the meat looked very good, I only had a taste for sides today...primarily because I couldn't decide on just 2 sides if I'd gotten a meat. Ha! I chose the Mac n Cheese, Sweet Potatoes, Cabbage and Greens. All of it was AWESOME!!
Perfectly seasoned and prepared. I enjoyed every bite of this meal. I tasted a little meat from my family and I can say that the smothered pork chops are GREAT! I'll be back!

Just one visit since they changed it from the fried chicken place.  It does have a cool atmosphere and some pretty good food.  Maybe I'm comparing it too much to chain or buffet prices, but we were shocked how expensive this was for groups!

It wasn't large portions, espresso drinks, or even waited tables.  The very small venue didn't really have the stay for hours vibe we look for at brunch.  Very busy on the weekend without much of space.

Again, the bacon, biscuits and gravy, and food was generally very tasty.  It just seems to be missing something I can't put my finger on.  Maybe my expectations were too high from the reviews on here.

Like all the old places that are trying to get a more trendy crowd The Haven has increased their prices to the highest edge that I will pay.  The food is okay but I've experienced much better and when do Bud Light beer pitchers go for 8.50 a pop, totally crazy!  Walk down to the Hilltop and pay much less and enjoy yourself.

My friends, husband, and I really like Circle 7, however, I just wish they would add Pinot Grigio to the happy hour list.  It has stayed the same for a long, long time.  Just a suggestion from one of your fans!  Thank you!

I was very happy with the service and the car for National.  The price was high but I was glad to get a car I was happy with.  I belong to the Emerald Club so the process was easy.  I would rent from them again.  Also, the girl I turned my car into took us to the hotel which was a couple of blocks away....a really nice treat.  Thank you.

After the update, this place is freaking delicious. Prepare for a wait, but it's worth it. The pizza takes an hour to cook, but is absolutely worth it. One of the best Chicago style pizzas we've ever had.

A couple of years ago, my sister and I got some sort of gift cards with different services for Frontenac Salon in them.  We started out with facials there.  The facial was good, we were both pleased.  Not exactly the full spa-like atmosphere I would prefer when getting a facial, since the bulk of their business is the salon.

I later went back to get my hair done.  Two years later, Casey is still doing my hair, and I've been transformed into a "Curly Girl!"  She has been a wonderful teacher in showing me how to make what I used to think of as annoying "waves" turn into bouncy curls!  I now wear my hair naturally curly about half the time, and finally feel like my hair is growing and healthy!  Deva products use no sulfates or harsh chemicals and once you are rid of "lather addiction" they really are great!  Sometimes I go in and need a refresher on technique, and Casey will always go through the process with me.  

As would be expected from a salon in Frontenac, the services are definitely on the costly side.  But, I've always felt that hair is not something to cheap out on!  My husband sometimes gasps when he sees the bill...but being beautiful doesn't come free! ;)

This place is great!  Open, clean environment and great food.  Everyone can't cook collard greens but they did it right!! The turkey leg, fried chicken, and catfish are excellent.  They serve local beverages (Excel soda and Kaldi coffee).  I'm not a drinker but there is a cocktail menu.  I was skeptical when Sweetie Pie's left but they have won me over.

Being a New Yorker and him being a chi town pizza boy, both huge fans of pizza in general, we tried this place out. We are new to STL and everyone raves about this place. We ordered the Chicago style we had to wait an hour because everything was "home made" so needless to say we were hungry and excited for awesome pizza. FAIL. It was basically a huge mound of cheese and a tiny bit of crust. So we are still in search of good pizza. Suggestions welcomed!
Excellent food. Beautiful space. Staff was informative and attentive. Best catfish I've had in St. Louis. Service was suburb. We will be back, and have already recommended it to our friends!!

I had a drop down DVD player installed and my kids were super excited and we love it!!!  The screen quit working 4 months later and custom sounds switched it out with a new unit and waived the charge to ship the old one back. Super nice and very accommodating staff.

For starters, the service is impeccable, which, in my opinion, is unheard of for a new restaurant. Everyone was extremely kind and helpful. Whenever we needed something, we were helped immediately. Whenever a plate was finished or a napkin dirtied,someone would come assist us immediately. With that said, you still don't feel rushed. The food is spectacular. They have a large menu that even the pickiest of eaters can probably find something. Between my husband and I, we've had the brisket nachos, Southwest ranch rolls, el borracho burger, statler chicken plate, fried pickles, and Circle 7 Ranch wrap and all were delicious. Overall, if you're looking for a great place to eat, look no further. I will be definitely return.

The Nest Egg was Eggceptional!!!  My husband exclaimed over the Gravy Train and he never exclaims about anything.  The Gooey Butter cake was amazing.  Very nice staff, elegant dining room and the Chefs came around and asked how we liked it.  It's going to be our go-to place for breakfast.
Worst pasta I have ever had! Sloppy presentation. Took 5 minutes to get silverware. If you land in St. Louis near gate E6 keep walking.

I'm reviewing for the service mostly. We stumbled upon it as we were freezing walking down the street to an event later that night. We were so cold, we decided to go in for a drink, to warm up and wait until we needed to get going. We were greeted nicely, the bartender was quite attentive and nice and the gringo fries and chips and salsa were really good. Not sure what we were expecting since we didn't know anything about the place, but I was pleasantly surprised. If we weren't freezing, we would have never gone in but now I want to go back for dinner!

I went to this location today and asked for a number 6, no cheese. Received the sandwich and it was a salami sandwich with cheese. I took my sandwich back and said that I ordered a number 6 without cheese. The employee argued with me saying that I ordered a number 5. She eventually made a new sandwich with extra cheese. She clearly wanted to spite me and hence this recommendation.

Thank you Black Thorn for offering delicious deep dish at a reasonable price in south city. Make sure you have a few people to eat this with or you'll be eating it all week. The last pizza I got must have been 5 pounds. I wish I weighed it. But that goes to show you how much cheese they pack on this - and it's mozz of course. Sometimes toppings aren't as generous as other times, but I'm not complaining at all. Sometimes the sauce is more tangy, but it's always tangy - in a good way - though you will have to try to to see if you like it. I love it. You should expect to wait up to an hour, so it's better to-go, unless you like to drink at dive bars - which this is - which makes the fact that they have delicious pizza even better. Their sister place, Lemmons (one of the two used to be Black Thorn at Lemmon), basically has the same pizza, but in my opinion toppings are typically less generous and wait times can exceed an hour - which may explain why BT gets 4 stars overall and Lemmons gets 3.5.

We ordered paneer saag and kadhi pakoda with alu paratha . Parathas were really tasty , kadhi pakoda was ok and paneer saag was yum . Customer service is good but needs improvement . 

Ambience -7/10
Food Taste  -8/10 
Service -7/10 
Value for money - 8/10

i think it is the best chicago pizza i have had including in chicago! they broil it on top so the top layer is a little crispy. this is what i find sets them apart from others i have had. tip: they put the bare minimal sauce on the pizza and you can ask for extra sauce. you should probably get it regular the first time to know if you want extra, but it is a popular special request.

Read the negative reviews....I wished I had. I chose this company because it was recommended by my company. It started off with a small bump, "something came up, we can't keep our appointment" to another bump "we'll give you a quote on site" to another bump, we waited 3 days for a quote, to another bump, "we have no record of you in our system" to another bump "the person you need to speak to is out of the office" to another bump, "oh I have your record right here, let me put you on hold...to another bump "Press 1 if you want, press 2 if you want, press 3 if you want...then to the final bump...email with a "here's your quote, thanks." No apology, no "sorry we lied to you about the onsite quote" Not even a "hey please let us fix this and work things out." Needless to say, my furniture was never taken for a ride with United Van Lines, but I was. No thanks United Van Lines...you didn't make the cut. I'm going elsewhere.

This new asian niche place is in a strip mall off Olive in University City, it's model seems to be a trend, a limited menu with limited service offering interesting great food and modest prices. As the name suggests, they only have soup and dumplings. For the record, the soup seems to be an after thought, its a small bowl of pretty much broth but I thought it tasty although it needed some additional seasoning. You come here for the dumplings and an order is 6-8. My date and I ordered three types and it was enough food for two who do not have a huge appetite. I thought the beef actually the best and the crab and pork combo less so. The place is BYOB and only offers water and Pepsi so consider that in terms of drinks. It's not fine dining but it is an interesting place to eat and I would go back again for sure. Be aware, there is a minimum $25 for the use of credit cards.

If there is a better baked bean recipe, someone please let me know.  When you think you've tried every one, this comes along. So good!!  And the owner shared a few tips how they make it. Wish I lived closer :).

Pretty plates, but absolutely terrible food. You can immediately tell the crab was canned and the octopus was not fresh. Stick to drink specials and avoid the food if possible. 

Service was very subpar.
Great customer service...get their award winning wings...the owners are twins and both really nice guys...very clean and big establishment

Modern take on southern comfort food. The quality of the food is really good here. We ordered a prime rib special plate, fried catfish, and boudin balls to start. Boudin balls were delicious - each order comes with 6 balls. They are pork and rice balls deep fried with a side of comeback sauce. Interior is really trendy and spacious. If you're picky about seating, you've come to the right place. There are booths, round tables, tables for two, long benches for groups, and square tables. Staff is really friendly and our food came out in two minutes. The only down side is it's a bit on the pricier side. With our two plates (comes with two sides each) and the boudin balls our bill came out to $54. Overall great vibe and great food - I will be back again to try the fried chicken everyone raves about!
This place was incredible. Some of the best BBQ I've ever had. The wings, ribs, and man n cheese were fantastic. Service was awesome!
We stopped in here last week and loved it!  Decor, food, service all most enjoyable! We will return. Great concept!

I have been reading online about how bad this Steak N' Shake is, so I thought would add my recent experience.

Today at about 1pm, I pulled into the drive thru with two cars in front of me.  When it came my turn, which took about a minute, I placed an order for a #14 with a drink and bowl of chili.  I pulled forward and checked the time.  3 minutes later I had my food, all correct, and was pulling away!  The young lady at the window was pleasant and friendly.  

I was happily surprised.  Everything was exactly opposite of what everyone has been complaining about!
We had a wonderful experience. The food was incredibly flavorful and the service was amazing. It's a great new addition to the stl restaurant scene.

I read some of the reviews of this McDonald's location and have to say I am surprised at the comments.  I have been going to this location for almost 2yrs and have only one experience of a wrong order being given and they made it right as soon as I told them and did it with a smile.  I have got consistent good customer service and hot, quality food on my visits.  I caught an attitude from one female employee when I asked for my drink with no ice but that is just one unpleasant person one time.  This location also donated money from a fundraiser at the restaurant to my sons high school.  Keep up the good work at this McDonalds and take the feedback on people's reviews to be better not bitter:)  peace

Stopped in again for the steak sandwich. It really is the best in St. Louis. We love this little neighborhood bar and restaurant. The food is amazing and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. It is clean, the service is fast, the cost is reasonable and did I mention that the steak sandwich is probably the best I have had outside of Philly. Do yourself a favor and try this place.

I really liked the food here, but since it's a brewery I have to rate primarily on the beer which is not my style. The beers seem lighter and not as bold, which is good for some types but not all them.

The atmosphere is good with clean modern furniture. It has more of a beer hall feel with a bit of charm. I like that you can see over to the tanks. Parking always seems a little chaotic but I haven't gone early and left early so have had people waiting for me to leave maybe they'll pave the rest of the lot eventually. 

The burger and beignets are really good and if it were a food place that served more types of beers I'd give it more stars.   I'm sure I'll come back because overall it is a nice spot that has lots of seating. It's also nice that they include tips already in the price of everything. I'll continue trying their beers and eventually I'm sure I'll find some I like.

Really enjoyed my breakfast here with family.  The food was excellent and served quickly and clear considered the environmental impact of the serving dishes.  I had the egg "nest" and while it was somewhat awkward to eat, the flavor was great!  I really like the egg, bacon combo and will be hard pressed to try something else.  Mom had a super yummy looking egg sandwich and was very happy with it.  The coffee was also great and I am looking forward to returning and trying other tasty sounding items on the menu.  Also, the owner or manager was super nice and checked in to make sure we were happy with everything.  Overall, excellent food and service and I will be back!.

Beware, this was our first and last experience with this company.  Lint Van Lines out of Iowa City, IA gave us our original quote.  Roger was the agent and was very nice.  The quote he gave us was much less than the others.  So we went with his quote since we thought this was a reputable company and it's very expensive to move half way across the country so wanted to save a few dollars.  The movers showed up on time, were very professional and explained the process.  Once the semi left our house it was downhill.  7-23-18 was the day our possessions left our home in Cedar Rapids, IA.  Our FIRST delivery was made on 8-2-18.  We were then informed by Angie Duff (customer service for Lint) the remainder would be there the next day.  Well as she often was, confused, and incorrect with what she told us.  We finally got two crates on 8-11-18.  These crates were overpacked and looked like it was jammed in there every which way.  We have pictures along with the guys that had to unload it, they were dumbfounded with the carelessness.  We had several damaged items.  Missing 4 boxes and get no help from the customer service at United corporation or Lint Van Lines.  Hopefully this will reach the people in charge so others don't get this kind of treatment.

These guys are great. They have delectable beverages AND are awesome about keeping they neighborhood clean. 

As someone who lives in the neighborhood, I have seen their owner and employees regularly out sweeping the street of trash. The best part is that they're not just sweeping in front of their shop but are in fact sweeping everything within 250 feet of the shop or so. 

This is a great neighborhood business that I will continue to support.

Long line, not-so-friendly welcome from staff, and the ice cream was just "okay." I'm only rating this place based on the ice cream, since I did not have anything else there. Definitely not worth the long wait. I'll probably go back for the food if I'm ever in St. Louis again!

I loved the sweet potatoes in the breakfast bowl. They had a Harry Potter themed latte that was very tasty. The Turkish coffee was a first time try that was fun. We also tried the Greek cookies which I don't usually like the texture of, but this was a whole different story. We ate them more plain than with the coffee because of the delicious light glaze on top. They crumble in your mouth and are a great treat.

Store manager very friendly, professional and informative. Dropped iPhone 5S off at store for battery and power button replacements. After returning from lunch in the local area my phone was ready for pick up. A new battery has been inserted into the phone and the power button is working again without having to be replaced. I was told the battery has a lifetime warranty which is fantastic! I highly recommend this business for cell phone repair.
Last minute change of plans had us making rental reservation on our National mobile app on the shuttle from the airport! Enerald Club membership worked fabulously. Thank you National.

I wish I could give them a rating less than 0. Luckily, I did not avail their 'Service', but since I did not reply to their 'follow up calls', their representative Patrick McMahon
From some 'Cook Moving Systems' sent me a longggg ( real long) mail calling me unprofessional, heartless etc. Wish they themselves learn some mannerism and professionalism.

The drive-thru is key!! The inside was PACKED and we really didn't feel like waiting. We discovered the drive-thru on the back side of the building and got our food to-go in about 10 mins. The food was delicious, we will definitely try this place again in the future.

**UPDATE: Went back to Yolklore a few days ago and it was amazing. Wonderful service, delicious food, and great atmosphere overall. This is now one of my favorite breakfast spots!

Great candy and ice cream! The setting is 1950's very cute but this also means limited seating, but no prob we went across the street and sat at picnic tables. The Sundays are really good and really big haha, the ice cream is also great alone.

Great neighborhood bar! Their food is amazing- love their chili. Everything is homemade and the atmosphere is enjoyable with a lot of regulars. So happy I live a block away from a great neighborhood bar.

Sunday brunch.  This was our first visit to Yolklore. It's a small place with counter service. Nice selection, including pancakes, brioche French toast , frittatas, biscuits & gravy, oatmeal. We placed our order and had a seat. Iced tea made with TEA ICE CUBES!!! Everything we tried was good: French toast, bacon, eggs, sausage and biscuits & gravy. Fast service, nice staff. We will be back!

AMAZING SERVICE! STOP YOUR SEARCH right here and DIAL the number. From Ed who schedule my appointment right away, to the parts gentleman who contacted me about a slight delay in my service, to Jason the installation technician who came out and took under two hours to complete the cleanup and installation of my new drivers side window; I am beyond impressed. My window was broken into & shattered, glass everywhere, and I was so upset. Everyone at Glass Doctor handled it so professionally and put me at ease. Thank you all and keep up the amazing work. You gained a lifelong customer & I will brag about you to everyone I know!

Toasted ravioli and wings. That's all I get here, after trying pastas and pizzas. Was not impressed with the meat lovers pizza, and many different pastas. 

They have a good rotating beer selection, which is at the front of the bar. 

I usually get the check as my food comes out, since they can get really busy there. However, they really run a shop and keep an eye on you, but they just get too busy and don't get around to you. I will probably keep coming here as long as priority pass partners with them, but there are likely much better options at the airport.

Tried to hit up a piano bar for our mother's 60th birthday and it was a dud! Drove by this about an hour before close on our way to another bar and turned around. Jared got us in without a reservation or a wait and was very helpful in showing us the ropes. We had a great time! Way better than a piano bar night! And on top of it, birthday girl was gifted a T-shirt for her birthday! A great time was had by all!

My boyfriend and I have been hearing a lot about Grace Meat + Three and finally made it in to give it a try. We're both "foodies" and thoroughly enjoy trying new places. The staff was super nice. A girl with short mint hued hair rang us up, and answered all of our questions, and was just all around quirky and adorable. I ordered the special for the day which was a sandwich with some kind of lamb sausage and every bit of it was perfect. Even the bread that came from Companion Bakery was perfectly toasted. I ordered the summer squash and pesto side, and while it was simple, it was expertly prepared, fresh and delicious. My boyfriend ordered the ribs. Holy shit. We have a special term that is reserved for only the best meat snacks we've ever experienced. A term that we've only used one other time ever. MEAT CANDY. It fell off the bone, and the sugary bark was reminiscent of the torched sugar on creme brûlée, but instead of custard it was smoky tender meaty deliciousness. (Hi can i have the recipe?) We will be back. Tell your friends. Support local businesses! Keep doing what you're doing, Grace!
What a great concept.  Very interesting blend of fish rice and flavors.  Modern chipotle style for the sushi world.  Tasty fresh and delish!

We finally made it to Yolklore!  Spartan design but feels warm and welcoming. Since it was mid-morning on a Thursday we didn't have to wait to order or be seated. The woman who took our order at the counter amiably answered our questions about menu items. We helped ourselves to the self service coffee and sat at the long  table and waited for our order. Soon our Mushroom Frittata and Classic Breakfast was ready.  The Frittata has a lot going on with a generous amount of mushroom and kale inside and the toppings of greens, goat cheese and slightly spicy tomato jam. The roasted flatten new potatoes are a nice accompaniment. 
The Classic came with a generous well seasoned sausage patty and fluffy scrambled eggs. Unlike most restaurant eggs they were properly seasoned. The fluffy biscuit and gravy with plenty of sage stole the show. Try the gravy on the potato. It works. 
St Louis isn't a cheap breakfast town outside of fast food. Few deliver the value to justify the cost. Yolklore more than delivers quality breakfasts at a reasonable price. Enjoy.

I had heard about this place for years but never actually went. I am glad I went it was AMAZING. It has the atmosphere of an old style diner. Expect to wait to sit down. I recommend a Reuben and chocolate milk shake, can't go wrong there. The BLT looked amazing but I cannot have that much bacon. I will definitely return.

What to say... Sauce on the side is AMAZING!!! I had the Figgy Piggy.. Everything was evenly distributed. Every bite had everything I could hope for. The service was phenomenal. I went around 8:30. The outside was a little dark. I wish they would have patio lights. The weather would have been perfect to sit outside. There is easy Parking. It only took about 10 minuets to get our Calzones out. I was not able to finish my whole plate unfortunately because it was HUGE but thankfully the next day for lunch it was still good to eat even after being microwaved. I'll definitely be coming back for more soon!

I never give one star reviews. This is seriously the worst Steak n Shake on the planet. Prepare being in the drive through for close to 30-45 minutes for something as basic as a milkshake. Terrible wait times.

OMG.  Great comfort food at an extremely reasonable price.  The malts are super thick and there is just TOO much.  I had never heard of a Marshmallow Malt...but I had to try it.  Very nice complement to my roast beef sandwich.  Great service and atmosphere.  A little out of the way, but worth the trip.

I come to St. Louis for work and I'm so happy to have found this spot- my ultimate favorite breakfast in this city! The vibe is perfect for a brunch spot, service is great, coffee on point and the food is delicious. I'd recommend the nest egg!
Pretty solid beer list. The staff is friendly and service was fast even when they were busy. Good location and unique building. The fire pit outside is pretty awesome

Great atmosphere! Owners were great at check-in, reviewed safety rules and then showed us how to throw, but that is where our interactions ended. Our board was very chipped and worn down prior to us starting so it limited our use down to one. Not a big deal, but we only had a 30 min. experience.  The axe heads were rather dull and many, many chips. I'm not saying everything needs to be pristine as it is an axe throwing facility, but to ask the patron if they want the board changed, after they arrive-with limited time, and before they even know what they are doing seemed a little backwards. If I could rate this about 4.4 I would, but for us this definitely wasn't a 5 star rated facility.
Great pizza.  Don't think they have updates the inside since the 1970s, but that's part of what makes it great.

I've been waiting for this one to open since the spring when I was at one of their pop-ups. Place is cute and quirky and the logos and branding hint at what's going to be on your plate. It's a fresh take on classic breakfast. I got to taste their seasonal beet smoothie which was light and refreshing. The house made gooey butter cake was A-Mazing. It was sweet and dense and it will make you come back all on its own. My breakfast date and I both ordered the Gravy Train (biscuits and gravy.) The biscuits were soft but stood up to a really tasty sage sausage gravy that managed to be not too heavy on a sweltering St. Louis July day. Service is cheerful and friendly. Of course I'll be back to work my way through the rest of the menu!

I was a bit underwhelmed by this place. First off, the menu is huge so you can definitely find at least one thing that suits your taste buds. It's very similar to Panera Bread (er, St Louis Bread Co - sorry, TX gal here ;)) but better. Slightly.

All their menu items sounds so delish but I have yet to find something that will keep me coming back. It's pretty generic stuff - good, but not great. I usually get the half sandwich/salad/soup combo which is a good serving size for me. I do like that it's also a cafe so I can get my coffee fix during lunch too.

It's one of the better lunch spots in the area, so I'm sure I'll be back sometime.

While poke on the mainland is different than poke in Hawaii, the food here is really good.  My friend and I ordered different things so we could try everything!! 

Highly recommend this place. I will be back.
Finally delicious poke in St.Louis!! The poke bowls are great and there are plenty of options for everyone. Highly recommend it.

This Jimmy John's is my soul mate. I love every sandwich from here, they are seriously freaky fast. I've ordered a sandwich and had it delivered within 10 minutes. The employees are always welcoming and I eat here way more often than I should.

Very nice place, clean, quiet and fast! Arrived before my friend so had a few minutes to take in the space. Very clean inside and out, spacious seating area, was lunch crowd and actually arrived same time as a very large group arrived but once seated did not notice them or their conversations like other places that try and squeeze in tables so that was a plus. So for the most important part the food, we both got the hot chicken half order. Man those are some nice portions, big, thick, cooked golden brown on the outside, chicken was still moist and juicy on the inside. The hot breading was decent, not to much but you could feel it a bit. Overall chicken was A+, only draw back was the sides, I had the mac and cheese and grilled carrots. But would definitely go back and recommend to friends. Looking forward to trying the fish next time! Oh staff very friendly, greet you at the door and let you know about the daily specials and get you a menu while you wait to order.
The best jewelry store around!! I wouldn't dream of going anywhere else. The staff is second to none!! They are always willing to spend time to make sure you get exactly what you want!
Like any other "deep dish" pizza places, the wait is long.  Everyone said this was the best for stl.  well it's not deep dish.  I'd still take driving to chicago for better pizza over waiting here.

You have got to go to Grace. The food was great, staff was very friendly and helpful.. Since we didn't know what to order. The ribs are FABULOUS!!  We will be going back.. In the grove.. Parking lot across the street!!
I ordered a salad and they didn't even put any cheese on it. The only reason a pasta house salad is good is because of the cheese. No bread either.  Lame.

This might be the grossest place I've seen in an airport. I could see the kitchen from the bar and was so disgusted by the food and actual garbage on the floor that I couldn't order any food. Service was terrible and the house wine was $15 a glass - surprising since the price isn't listed on the menu.

I've never actually eaten in or drank at the Haven because we always get takeout but I just want to recommend their food to everyone.  The menu is pretty extensive and even has a few healthy options for those rare days when I'm trying to avoid grease.  They are almost always insanely busy but we have never had any issues with orders we've placed.  Another bonus is that you can order through LivingSocial's takeout service and do it all online!

As a former Chicago native in search of pizza since my relocation to St. Louis a few years back, I was excited going in.  Once we got home with our pizza, we realized at first this is nowhere close to Chicago style pizza but as pizza lovers we were still willing to give it a try.  To my disappointment, the sauce is like 90% oregano and just overwhelmingly bad to the point that I was scraping it off so that I could manage through a piece.  As someone who grew up on Lou's, Giordano's, Uno's, Oven Grinder, etc. this should not be allowed to bear the name "Chicago Style".  I'll stick to ordering my Lou's deep dish from Taste of Chicago through the mail.

This place was amazing! We just came here on a whim.  

$.40 an ounce this is the cheapest i have yet to find.

Flavors that were just full of flavors and deliciousness were:

Yellow Cake
Pink Cupcake
Frooty Loops (Something like that)

This is by far my second and close first froyo place in St. Louis just nudging below yogoluv.  

They have a frequent froyo card which is great :)

They do not have a ton of choices, they only have 4 froyo machines so only 8 flavors at a time, alot less than say orange leaf.  Great location, 15 minute parking outside too.  There is outdoor seating but on a hot day its like an igloo in side you will love it! TRY IT...you know you want to :) We will be coming here every saturday after visiting the farmer's market down the street.
Great new breakfast joint with crossover of lunch items. Fun vibe, very good food. Check it out. Support the new food scene in STL.

We come to Lions Choice all the time and love their food. This review is more specifically for the Des Peres location. We were just in, right before closing, and the gentlemen working couldn't have been nicer. Best service I've ever had at a fast food restaurant. Just wanted to give them a shout out!

My wife and I decided to try Yolklore after she had read a good review of the restaurant.  We arrived around 8:30 a.m. The place, while busy, had enough seats available.  In regards to the seating, there are perhaps 4 small tabletops, 1 large communal style table that seats around 20, and a long bar style seating area for around 10 persons.  We were able to procure a small table for the two of us.  

My wife ordered our dishes: the Johnny Ham Hands and the large size option for the Gravy Train dish.  The smaller size for the Gravy Train would have been enough, as we only ate half of the dish.  Both dishes were okay, nothing special that would warrant our return to the restaurant, since there are closer options to where we live.  However if you live close by or are in the area, then the restaurant is a fine choice for breakfast.

I love using the Emerald Aisle with the ability to chose my own car to rent.   Although I do find that lately there hasn't been a wide variety of car types at this location as in the past.  None the less, we were happy with our choice.  The car was clean and comfortable.  I selected our car, after sitting in a few others, and drove to the exit where I was quickly checked out.  The return experience was even easier.  Because of the ease of using Emerald Aisle, we frequently rent from National.  However, if they offered more one way rentals, we would even do more!
Neat little place in stl. Best sandwich I've ever had.  I ordered the turkey blt and it was fantastic.

Visiting from FL for the holiday and was looking for something local in a neighborhood with some culture and this was recommended. Has the prime rib sandwich on special with a side of the buttered beans and it was fantastic. The space is nice and open and the decor is ok. Has some local beers on tap and bigger selection in bottle/can. Staff super friendly. Others had the fried chicken and the burger which they enjoyed as well

Neat brewery. Smells new still and staff was polite and helpful. The have 3 of their own beers on draft, I liked 2 of them. Board and card games are available to play also which is cool. Normal craft beer pricing also, so $4-$7 range. Not very busy, probably because of how new it is. I'd return.

A great spot. Within walking distance of all of Midtown St. Louis' attractions; very close to Grand Center and the Pulitzer and Contemporary Art Museum. Development of the nearby City Foundry shopping and eating hub, and Forest Park Parkway, is something to watch, and will be a boon to the area. The Central West End seems to be developing further east too, connecting Midtown to the CWE. CLoL is in the heart of an area that's booming, and this is loft living at its best--the Lofts are beautiful and competitively priced. Very stress-free living.
Such great food!! I also love the huge beer list that they have!

My partner and I were ready to loathe this bar that was once the home of Woodies. We walked up the steps and were immediately greeted by one of the owners. He explained his vision for the bars future and invited us to go in and take a look around. Not much has changed. It's still a beautiful bar and music venue. Gorgeous dark wood and plenty of space to hang out. No drag but there's live music some nights. The friendly bartender told us the drink specials and we ended up sticking around for a couple of hours. Great service all night. Try the pickle shots. Yummy. Next time we'll try the food they all raved about. So although my old fave bar is gone I look forward to coming back to The Archive. See you soon!

Where has this place been all my life?  The fried chicken is absolutely amazing -- the best in STL in my opinion.  I had the hot and spicy...and loved it.  BUT if you have an aversion to spicy food, try the regular because the spicy is really, really spicy.  Yum!  The mashed potatoes and gravy were heavenly and the cornbread was big, buttery and delightful.  The squash had a pleasant seasoning and was delicious. The place has a nice atmosphere and a full bar.

Wow, this was my first time here and I don't know what's taken me so long.  It's fantastic.  From one fried chicken lover to another, be sure to check out the new king of STL!

I really want this place to make it. I want to go back soon and hope to give it more stars, because if the owner reads this (and other reviews) and makes some simple adjustments, there is nothing holding this place back from having a line out the door.

First things first:
-  The soup dumplings are fantastic.  
-  The owner is delightful and helpful to those unfamiliar to soup dumplings.
-  The simple "do one thing and do it great" menu is bold and awesome

What could make it better:
-  Get some airflow in there.  It's hot and the air is stale.
-  Turn on some sort of background/ambient music
-  Serve some fountain drinks or something besides bottles of water

Making New Years resolutions, that involve living a healthier lifestyle sometimes forces you to shop at stores that normally are not on your store radar.  That was the case with this Sports Authority and I must say they impressed me. 

We were on a mission to find "manly" yoga socks and were not having much luck. 
When we entered the store, I immediately was impressed with its size. I had never seen a SA this big. I guess size does matter, because we not only found what we needed, but received good customer service as well. 

Wanting a sport type sock, we walked over to the shoe department thinking they would be there.  In addition to the socks, we also were considering the Vibram Five Finger shoes. Unfortunately they did not carry the Five Finger shoes, but the sales associate was still very helpful. When we asked about the yoga socks, he told us they'd be in the yoga department. The what? Yoga has it's own department? That's impressive alone. 

What made him a stellar retail associate for me was the fact that he walked us over to the "yoga" department instead of doing the typical retail trick of pointing and saying "over there".  He assisted us in finding the socks and then excused himself to return to his own department.  We found a "manly" two shades of Grey sock that is going to  work just fine for the beginning yoga class. 

The one detail that kept them from getting a 4 star rating is their pricing. The yoga sock was the same brand we found earlier at Whole Foods selling for $9.99 and on sale for 20% off, was selling here for $11.99. Damn it, why did WF only have the girly pink socks in stock. 

The cashier girl was friendly & witty making the experience of paying more money then I would have at Whole Foods pleasant.

The best BLT ever!!  Shake is huge and very delicious!  I am not from the area and did not know the area I was driving in.  Wow!  Not an area I would drive in again.  Thanks for all the great reviews and getting me to go there.  All the food was great...the area...not so much!!
This place was just horrible!!! Nothing good to say about it . The service was horrible the food was horrible super greasy with no flavor.. was worse then Taco Bell !!!

You know, I don't know who you are when you get so big I can't find you listed. All I know is I live in Volusia County Florida and I contacted United Van Lines and some dumb F---- named Charles A. a "Sales Consultant" who was too lazy to call me back or email me. He is probably some alcoholic or something. Meanwhile, I am waiting for an estimate from a corporation I think is reputatable and I never hear back from anybody after numerous attempts. Forget it. You can bite me.

Came to St. Louis for the weekend and had reservations at the Bellwether. It certainly didn't disappoint. Bobby took excellent care of us and the food was amazing. The ginger dumplings were exceptional. Great atmosphere and service!

This place is bright, airy, and the staff is very friendly and professional. I had a great experience here and don't plan on going anywhere else for my eye care. Brittany and Brianna (don't know if she spells her name this way) were knowledgeable and actually helped pick my contact lens color. The optometrist helped also and was very patient with me as I went through my lens training. Yes...I recently decided to wear contacts and even though it was intimidating at first...the staff was encouraging and supportive.

Great food, but horrible customer service and will never come back. The people who work here have the worst attitude and are unhelpful. As one of the many restaurants near the hospital you are likely to get better service and same quality food elsewhere. Not worth the trouble!

I've been wanting to try them for a while now and am glad that I did. The only knock on them is they are a bit on the pricey side, but the food is delicious and you get a healthy amount. I got the Swinger sandwich: breakfast sausage patty, fried egg, chili, cheddar cheese on a ciabatta bun, with a black coffee & side of fruit. My son got (6) Big Dippers, with fruit cup, side of bacon ($3/2 pcs), milk. We also got an Orange Dream smoothie. All told it was $30, like I said a bit pricey but lots of food. Plus the staff is very friendly too! I will be back very soon

St Louis has a ton of beer options and this is one of the better ones.  The atmosphere is great and is perfect for families.  It's always amazing how many families are here.  The beer is delicious and the food is incredible.  The burger and fries and addicting.

Surprisingly good. Very casual with no table service but the food was very good, plenty of variety to choose from and priced well. A bit hidden from the busy streets but nice place for breakfast. A plus is that they have a drive through.

The signature Nest Egg did not disappoint. My son had the Billy the Kid and it was a hearty breakfast sandwich. We finished with a salted caramel brownie that was amazing. This place is putting a fresh spin on breakfast. The service was great and the staff seemed happy to be there.

Tonight I was tailgated by one of your drivers. I was on highway 170 around 8:15pm. I was going 70+ miles in the fast lane, passing people. Your driver rode my ass for a good while, even after I tapped my brakes to let them know to back off. Then they flashed their lights at me multiple times. I was doing over 70 and passing people. There was NO reason for that reckless driving. If someone in front of me slowed or slammed on their brakes your flatbed tow truck would have crushed me and left me with severe injuries, or death. I got over and let them pass when it was safe for me to do so. However, this happened again as the both of us exited on to highway 40. I was in the fast lane, again going in excess of 70, and passed your driver. They then got behind me and rode my ass, and flashed their lights. They tried to pass me but there were cars in the center lane, unfortunately, leaving them no option but to follow me. This sort of driving of a large truck is reckless and potentially harmful. Please advise whomever that they need to be more responsible on our roadways.

Great lunch menu and even better baked goods.
The service is really great here.  The coffee is roasted fresh (you can see their roaster working behind the counter).  Just a really great all around neighborhood bakery and lunch shop.

Grace is a more than a restaurant it's a place you go to eat and feel like home. The food is what you would imagine from your childhood but better. Everything has so much flavor, and richness I couldn't stop eating! If you're looking for a place to take the family or just stop in for lunch this is the place it's accessible for all, they have this cool sign that says "If you're able share a table". I think places in stl really need more commuter seating to bring us all together like this. I have extremely high hopes for Grace and the name they will leave in the Grove!

Yeah, this place is awesome. The pizza from the wood-burning oven is so damn good every time. I'm pretty sure I've tried every option over the past few years, but the one with kale is my fav. Alex, the owner, also makes really delicious bread. I got some for my family for xmas last year and it was a big hit!

The shop really is a hidden gem -- nothing too fancy, but really cool for a casual date, especially since there's a bar next door. Plus, your boo will think you know all the secret spots in the city! Go support a local business and eat some kickass pizza!

A must if you're in St. Louis.  The sandwiches are ridiculously big and so are their milkshakes.  The service is a little iffy and the bathroom is gross, but it's worth it.  The seating is also limited, so I would recommend not going during peak hours.  The sundae with pecans and hot fudge is outstanding.  I'm not even a ice cream lover but boy was this good.  Always wanted to try their BLT but never got the nerve.  Now that we live in FL, I regret not getting it :)  The Reuben is good, though!  As a salad lover, I cannot recommend their salads... obviously it isn't their specialty :)

The food here is actually really good! And that's not just by bar food standards. It is appropriately priced considering the size of the portions and the deliciousness. The service is really bad, but they do offer takeout orders if you don't want to deal with that. It's never been crowded any time I've ever been in, so it's a nice quiet spot to hang out if you're wanting to spend some time inside eating. So in a nutshell - service = bad, food = GOOD! I recommend giving it a shot.

United Van lines MCollister group was fantastic 
Starting with Mark Friedman who came to assess and walked me thru  entire process 
He stayed involved all the way thru delivery 
Further Dianna Stolz was excellent working packing and loading days as well as delivery days 
The packers were efficient but took time to make dr ure everything was properly packed 
The driver also was quick and efficient taking the time to carefully place hoods in house

I had their deep dish Chicago style pizza and it was amazing! We ordered it ahead of time because friends had warned us that it takes a long time to cook, there was a two hour wait but it wasn't a big deal since we planned for it...also SO worth it! The pizza tasted great, it was huge (I could only handle 1 piece ha!) When we went to pick it up the whole place looked awesome, I wish we would've just stayed and hung out there so we will definitely plan on that next time.

A $275 auxilary cable install (due to miswiring) resulted in complete battery drainage and damage to hands free unit. Ended up costing me additional $434 from dealership to repair. Custom Sound refuses to accept responsiblity. If it prevents you from making the same mistake, It was money well spent! Work was completed at Fairview Heights, IL location.

I use National all the time when I travel for work and I'm a fan in general.  This particular National exceeded my expectations on my return because I was staying at a hotel right down the street before an early morning flight and instead of taking the shuttle back to the airport to get the hotel shuttle, one of the National employees dropped me off!

Really great atmosphere, and good pizza.
Order at the counter, seat yourself, and enjoy the crazy gooey pizza!

I must tell you that the milkshakes here are to die for! It's been a few weeks and in my mind I still can taste the chocolate banana malt that I had. With every sip there were chunks of banana coming through the straw it was amazing!
I have a five shake challenge here and if you ever watched man versus food you would know that there was an epic failure! They also have chocolate and candy but the hard candy and gummy candies are not made in house. The guy told me that the chocolate was.
It's a cute little place very kitcsh it was very clean. It's just an older building.
Was given coconut creme chocolates instead of marshmallow. Took forever to get service. Food wasn't great. Malts were good.
The atmosphere is nice and service was great very friendly.  Loved the food. Will definitely be going back.

So I realize that the poke I've had on the West Coast and in Hawaii will never be on par with what's available in St. Louis but I think this place generally gets it right and I'm happy it's here. I've generally had pretty quick and efficient service and particularly at lunch time they seem well equipped to handle the CWE/BJC/SLCH/Wash U crowds. The small bowl with two proteins is a ton of food and I feel satisfied with it alone. The proteins I've sampled have all been fine. They also have good side elements for the proteins including mango, edamame, and seaweed salad that have always been spot on. I also think they do a nice job with their sauces. If you ask for spicy mayo though note that sometimes they can be quite generous with it so if you think you might want a little less then ask - they certainly can accommodate "just a little." Definitely a new favorite lunch option for me when I feel like wandering into the neighborhood and still want something reasonably quick.

Went there this afternoon on this very cold winter day. Got to warm up with some very good sour beers and some board games. The bartender was very friendly and helpful to us. We loved it and will definitely be back!

We are no strangers to Circle 7 Ranch, but we moved out of town a few years ago and are only able to make it in once in a while. Tonight was our first visit to the new(ish) Des Peres location. We loved the heat lamp outside that made for a comfortable wait. The hostess, whose name we didn't catch, greeted us with a smile and was very friendly. When our table was ready, it was already set with the high chair we requested and menus. Matt D. started us off with brisket nachos, which never disappoint. Our server, Chris L., greeted us shortly after we sat down and returned promptly with our drinks. He was very personable, gave us a couple of recommendations from the menu, and we never had to wait for a drink refill. We ordered the Buddy's BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad, the El Borracho Burger, and the children's grilled cheese. The kitchen times were quick and our food was on the table just as we finished our meal. Our food was exactly as we ordered, fresh, and absolutely worth the drive from Columbia, MO. We'll be back! :)

Tried Yolklore for the first time today. The environment gives a feel of cleanliness without losing a warmth and sense of welcome. The menu has a great range of options without being overwhelming. And the food was very good. Everything cooked perfect! I will gladly return often for an amazing breakfast. Everyone should try

I absolutely recommend Body Gears Physical Therapy St. Louis with all of my heart and soul. 
JOANNE MACZA and her team have truly, literally, made me a better person. They not only helped me become pain free and put me back together, they also gave me the knowledge, skills and tools I need to help keep myself pain free, strengthen my body, and should I injure myself in the future, how to put myself back together. 
The human body will wreck itself trying to fix itself. After two kids and a slipped-disc back surgery, I had diastasis recti and a continual sore lower back.  I would dread going to bed every night because I knew in the morning when I woke up my lower back muscles would be in so much pain. Some mornings I was not even able to bend over to touch my toes, but on my own pants, or sit on the floor to tie my shoes. After being an athlete all through high school and college, I knew this was not how the body was supposed to be, and not how my core nor my back should behave. I knew something was wrong with my core. I did not accept the idea that "this is how it is after two kids". TAKE THE TIME TO PUT YOURSELF BACK TOGETHER. 
Joanne not only helped me work to heal my diastasis recti and teach me isometric core exercises to continually keep my core strong for life, but also worked with me to release scar tissue from my back, and retrain my body to use the proper muscles for movement instead of the "work around" my body had created when my abs didn't work. My back muscles were doing all the work for my abs. She then retrained me how to sit, stand, walk, get out of bed, pick up my children, and finally how to hold myself and stay strong during workouts so I don't repeat any of these injuries again. 
Joanne and her team have literally given me my life back, and also given my husband his wife back, and my boys their mother back. For that I will be forever thankful. 
During my visits to physical therapy, I have watched Joanne teach a ballet dancer how to dance better, a baseball pitcher how to throw a ball better, a weight lifter how to lift better, and then me, how to do daily life things better. I'm convinced there is nothing Joanne doesn't know. She listens to what injuries you have, and then backtracks through your whole body to find the reason for the pain, and not just cure what hurts. She is concerned with making your body the best machine it can be, and how it can work in the most proper form. 
I highly recommend you go visit Joanne for anything that bothers you. She is a fantastic human being and great at her job, and honestly wants to help make you better.

Excellent carpet cleaning!!!  Arrived on time, was able to go to work while they did their work!  Carpets ended up cleaner than expected.  And the house smells FANTASTIC when I came home.  Highly recommended.  They were even able to clean a highly valued Persian rug that we don't trust with just anybody.

One of my favorite all time places to pick up carry out.
I've only dined in a few times because I feel that the service is a bit slow, which is probably why the food is always hot and prepared very well. I just live in a fast paced world, so don't let that deter you from going.
Their fried pickles are super delicious, and I always get their buffalo chicken salad. It's a very generous portion of chicken which has been perfectly moist every time. The consistency is 100%.
I've tried their meatballs as well and they are also a nugget of meaty love. 
Highly recommend this place. It's clean, the staff is friendly and good is GREAT! If you're in a hurry, call it in and pick it up. Totally worth trying out.

I have never been one to say, "I absolutely cannot go to ____ Supermarket" until I visited the Schnucks at Spoede and Olive.  
 
The variety of different types of product are virtually non existent.  The produce selection looks as if it has been sitting in a non-climate controlled environment.  It seems that I can never find anything here!

The store conditions seem very outdated and dirty.  It looks as though they haven't remodeled since the late 1980s.  Floor is yellowed.  Lighting is dim.  They don't even have a self check out.  Many times I have found myself running in to get one or two items, and I have to stand in line for 15-20 minutes until I am subjected to communicating with the front end staff.  

The associates that are working on the front lines have CONSISTENTLY demonstrated the following on every visit: No greeting, no pleasant demeanor (unless they are chatting with the bagger).  I have been proactive in asking.  "Hi there.  How are you?"  and I have been met with blank stares, monosyllabic responses, and "I am here."

I would like to think that I live in a nice neighborhood and would in turn have a nice grocery store to shop at.  This is not the case.  I will either drive two minutes further to Dierbergs or to the Schnucks on the Chesterfield border.  I will not be returning to this establishment any time soon.

After a long day of traveling, we were met by a very nice host who suggested which calzones to try. They are seriously the best, and this is from a very picky eater. The crust wasn't too thick and the ingredients were all fresh. Plus, who doesn't LOVE melted cheese? The salad was just as delicious. Never had mint in salad before. Nice touch!

Not sure why such bad reviews. For a airport restaurant this place is awesome. Good microbrew beer. Good friendly service. Food is great for the price which is very reasonable. With my priority pass I get $28 credit. I like this place and have no complaints. Better than most airport restaurants by far.

The Haven is located on Morganford between Loughborough and Holly Hills in South City. Long gone are the days of brain sandwiches at this south side watering hole. The dilapidated Haven has been around the Holly Hills neighborhood for a long time.  It recently closed down, was sold, redone, and has reopened under new ownership.  It is now a hopping new spot for south-side locals. 

The new owners have done a great job gutting the old place and giving the new one a clean, cozy feel. It's a tad small and smoky, but they offer flat panel TVs galor, video games, cheap drinks and a decent full bar/restaurant menu (under $10). 

I had the Cannelloni lunch special, which was good. My friend had the burger and thought it was delish. If you're looking for a low key drink in a clean, safe neighborhood bar.... give the Haven a try.

Note: more soda fountain and diner than candy shop. Somehow I was of the impression there were going to be yards of homemade floss, hand-pulled saltwater taffy, cases of chocolates, that sort of thing. (I think I saw pictures somewhere?) Candy counter was very much secondary to food service. Crowded and a little difficult to navigate. That said -- the food must be good. There was a line out the door when we first drove by. We were coming exclusively for candy, though, and left without.

I love this place.  Its kind of like going back in time.  The food is amazing.  A pound of bacon on a BLT!!  I like it because there are not televisions and music blaring everywhere.  Its like the diners of the 50s . If your in St. Louis you must go there at least once.

My friend and I arrived early so we could chat before the lunch rush.  I had a grilled ham and cheese.  You can be assured that no matter what you order, you will not be disappointed with the portion size.  The ham and cheese were perfectly melted, the bread was expertly grilled. Our waitress was there whenever she was supposed to be and she didn't miss a beat.  No time for dessert today.  I have a single area of unhappiness.  I am a Coke drinker, and it is Coke no Pepsi.  I saw the lunch line forming and closed our conversation.  The people in the line deserved their time in a St. Louis treasure.

Hand-Dipped confections, Man-sized sandwiches & a chocolate malt that'll make you cry for Mama!

Set aside some time so you can take in the whole experience. Grab your favorite Gal & your best Bud. Take 'em down to Crown Candy for a soda-pop & a good ole' fashioned American sandwich, top it off real ice cream sundae or a float, see what it was like when life wasn't in such a hurry to pass you by.

They don't make 'em like this no more. There's a line out the door for a reason, stop the car & go in.

Clean efficient McD, newly renovated but in a rough part of downtown near the St Joseph Shrine. 

Easy in and out, can order at the automated kiosk and have dedicated staff to keep the dining room clean. 

Also there is a 30 minute limit to how long you can be here, and no outside food may be consumed on the premises to discourage free wi-fi squatters. 

Bathrooms are locked so you must be buzzed in by staff, and on the day that we visited, one of the windows was boarded up because it had been shot out. 

So this is clearly an inner-city McD with some areal challenges, but for what it is, we think this McD deserves 

5 stars

Coming from Seattle, it is great to have a quality Poke place in STL. There are tons of great options and the drizzles are a unique touch. Prices are reasonable and the fish is fresh and tastes fantastic! Overall, would definitely recommend this place for great Poke in STL!

I love Chicago style deep dish pizza, I've been on a mission to find the ultimate Chicago crust outside of Chicagoland.  On this weeks list, Black Thorn Pub.  Truly a dive bar by definition.

As soon as they opened at 5pm, I was on the phone calling to place my carryout order.  At first, I kept receiving a busy signal and wasn't sure if I had the right number.  But try try again, my persistent paid off when my call was finally answered...I guess there were a lot of carryout orders being called in when I was trying to call mine in too.  I placed my order for a large deep dish ultimate veggie (hold the artichoke hearts).  

It would take about an hour.  I arrived 55 minutes later to find out, it'll be another 20 minutes of waiting.  Normally I wouldn't mind the wait, but I was missing the Super Bowl.  All I wanted was a good deep dish pizza, a beer and to sit with my two little pups curled next to me in the comfort of my own home watching the greatest game of the season.  

While I waited, I took the time to note not only how much of dive bar this place really was but how unclean it was too.  There was a good layer of dust behind the bar amongst the clutter of knick knacks, junk and bottles of booze.  A glimpse of the kitchen area wasn't any better, the floor and counters could all use a good wipe down.  There was only one table of 6 seated for dinner during the time I was there and a handful of carryout orders that came and went. 

I was so excited to get that pizza home.  I opened the box and was a little surprised, it didn't look very DEEP to me...a little over 1" high.  For all that baking time, the crust wasn't much more than a thick crust by my hubby's standards.  There was a ton of cheese, at least 1/4" thick.  A little more than a Wisconsin Cheesehead like me would care for.  The crust was very soft and cheesy all the way to the end.  But cheese aside, the flavors were good and the sauce had a little kick to it.

Glad I tried it, but not my favorite.  IMHO...too long of a wait, not the cleanest establishments, overly cheesy, crust lacked pizazz and they seem to lack pizza consistency...I wish I would have gotten that 3" deep dish I read about.  But don't take my word for it, it's worth a try.

Guys. For real.  Possibly the best fried chicken that I have ever had.  And I have had a lot of fried chicken.  Don't judge.  It was coated in a perfectly seasoned and crispy skin while still maintaining an amazingly moist and juicy inside.  I'm drooling just thinking about it.

On the side I chose macaroni and cheese and green bean casserole.  I have never been to a restaurant that has carried green bean casserole, and it did not disappoint.

The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  2 problems that are not worth taking off stars for. 1) The line to order could be better organized with some simple roping.  2) The $8 biscuit appetizer was served with extremely small biscuits.  About 3 bites each.  For $8 I was expecting a little more.

I will absolutely be recommending this place to EVERYONE I know.

This place is better than Froyo! It's cheaper and the flavors are better. There's a great selection between Yellow Cake, Root Beer Float, Choco Mocha Frappe, Vanilla Bean and many more. I would get the Red Velvet Cake first. It's awesome!
This is hands down the best fried chicken in STL. One of my favorite restaurant in STL. I would give 6 stars if possible.

Great new Neighborhood bar. Adam the owner/head brewer was extremely nice. It's the kind of place that you can go have a beer at after work. Or spend a casual evening. 
They have a "roots" line that is a more traditional brewing style and a "twisted" line that is their spin on brewing styles. 
The beers are Cheap! 20Oz pours for $5!!

I had the Irish Flu, Kingsmen and Hey Joe. All of them fantastic. My wife who is not much of a beer drinker enjoyed the beers too. We only had appetizers for food and it was great. 
Will definitely revisit. All brews done on site and it's a very laid back atmosphere! 

Definitely a place mid town needed!!

Went today & atmosphere is good. Disappointed in the food though. Mac & cheese was very dry, cornbread was almost burnt, chicken was ok but it was also dry. Ordered a bloody mary & took forever to get, was halfway finished eating before it came.  The other two people in my party felt the same. Maybe the kitchen was having a bad day, but I probably won't go back.

I order from this place all the time on doordash. My go to order is spicy tuna on a bed of white rice topped with edamame, imitation crab, fried onions, cucumbers, white onion, soy sauce and spicy mayo. The bowl is refreshing and literally always hits the spot. I've only ever gone in one time because I was in the immediate area, and the girls behind the counter were less than enthused to have a customer. However, the Poké is still delicious and I will continue to order from PokéDoke anytime I'm craving it (AKA every single week)

This place introduced me to Poke and I love it now. When we went, the worker was very generous with the amount so a regular was very filling. He was also very positive and upbeat and explained everything to us in an entertaining way.

Rayshaun D. Baskin, Sr. Lead sales Agent was handling Alamo, and Enterprise the night we arrived. Another woman at the counter was really giving him a hard time while we waited in line. He handled her professionally, took care of us. Learned he was pulling a double shift, he had to a cat with anxiety problems that he was worried about and it was going on midnight yet his politeness and professionalism were on point. What an adorable, perfect human being he is! We just adored him! It's been about a month but I never forgot this young man. I believe we were there on September 12,  2018. We  arrived from Phoenix on a delayed flight to visit family in the St. Louis area and we were so tired. But he put smiles on our faces and I pray he is blessed for the precious person that he is.

Looks like things have not gotten much better since the last review here. In the past, I have gotten pretty good burgers and fries. That's when they are busy. No line of cars? Best to stop elsewhere. Last night, 7:30pm got a quarter pounder and medium fries. People can tell if fast food has been sitting out and this burger and fries were not freshly cooked. Seems this is normal for them to cook in advance, but who really knows how long it sits there? Pretty much the same where ever you go. You don't and it's a crap shoot every visit. The one fry I tasted (I always try one before I leave) flopped over when I held it up. I asked the window person how long have these fries been sitting out? No direct answer but offered a new one if I waited. I left.

i recently lost my job and was (thankfully) able to find work out of state.  Although a "lease-is-a-lease" (legally), Saum/Hutcheson management did everything they could to rent my apartment as soon as possible and minimize my legal obligations to finish out the lease.  They did not have to do this, but they did.  

I also just have to address some of the negative reviews I have seen posted.
1: "Things went "missing" during my move."  Well, you're in the city.  The Big City...Saint Louis! You need to keep an eye on your stuff.  if you leave things sitting around, unobserved, while loading in and out of the building...guess what?  Sometimes bad people take rhem.  This is NOT the fault of the apartment management.

2: "Plumbing problems...Crud, hair, urine, semen (??WTF??) backed up into my tub."
 Okay....I won't even delve into how that person performed the detailed forensic analysis to determine the individual constituents of the "crud" that backed up into their tub.  
But, this can happen in apts, especially high rise buildings.
The Saum/Hutcheson are beautiful, historic buildings.  Old buildings have issues on occasion.  It happens.... but maintenance has always responded promptly to any issues, plumbing ir otherwise.
ALSO: Old buildings in the city use window unit air conditioners.  Just a fact of life...everywhere.  And if you let it run when its cold outside, you destroy the compressor.  My unit went bad, and it was replaced without question.  Why?  BECAUSE I DID NOT RUN IT WHEN IT WAS COLD OUTSIDE!!

Plumbing: My (two) plumbing issues (kitchen sink and bathtub) were handled immediately, professionally, and had rapid responses at very late calls in the early morning hours.  

Make no mistake....apartment life in a high rise building built in the early 20th century requires a certain amount of understanding on the tenants part.  But I have witnessed management replacing hundreds of feet of vertical piping....tearing out and patching plaster walls in multiple units, at what must have been considerable (necessary) expense...and FIXING the problem!  Just to resolve my kitchen sink backing up.  I was grateful and impressed.

So.. .if you want a plain, crackerbox, beige, boring apt with a dishwasher, garbage disposal,  a postage stamp "patio" and sliding glass door...look elsewhere.

But if you want to live in a building with history, character, a staff that truly cares and wants to help fix any issues....on SOUTH BROADWAY!!!  With window views of the Arch, close to everything cool in STL, in Tower Grove Park, spending breezy summer evenungs with your friend just looking out your window at the city, way up in the sky....then this is a place to consider.
(I miss it already....)

Cars are always dirty and today is no exception.  Someone left a jacket and books in the car, and the cleaning crew jsut left them there for me I guess.  Dirty windshields and water spotted rear view mirrors round out the package.
Maybe they need a new car wash or some new towels???

Went back on Saturday to reaffirm my love for their burgers.

If possible, everything was better.  Delicious Haven Burger with 3 cheeses and 2 nice strips of bacon was as juicy and full-flavored as ever.  The bun was fresh, the fries were crisp and the pickle spear had a nice snap.  All for under $10.

Mama had the Patty Melt which had a generous amount of swirly rye bread.  Her only complaint was that she had a lot of bread left over, but the doggy box solved that.

We walked out the door with 2 meals and 2 drinks for under $25 before tax.  

Simply one of the cleanest, well-staffed and friendly neighborhood bars in south city.  The delicious food just ups their game.

Be back soon!

This has been one of my favorite spots for lunch for the past 2 years. I love the food at Daily Bread - it's all made fresh, and the portions are generous. My favorites are the seasonal salads, and Autumn Crunch, as well as their clam chowder - yum! I also enjoy the ginger peach iced tea, the blueberry pie, and chocolate chip cookies :)

The Daily Bread is very popular, and therefore gets crowded at lunch time. Your best bet is to go early, or do what I do and call your order in for carryout. Prices are a little higher than Bread Co., however, carryout portions are worth the price, versus the micro packaging Bread Co has adopted for their drive thru orders. 

I also want to commend this restaurant on their commitment to customer service. Salad dressing was left out of my order and the manager went above and beyond to make sure that I was happy with my food. Thank you very much Daily Bread - you have a loyal customer in me!

This food was AMAZING!! My partner and I got the lump crab cake... super good quality and great flavor. The jambalaya was also incredible! The winner though, was the chicken & cornbread waffle. The waffle was incredible and the chicken and as HUGE and perfect and it was all covered in their house hot sauce, which has a nice heat... not too spicy. 
My ONLY complaint is that it's still too dark in the back area. The music was really fitting for their vibe, but we would've enjoyed our food more if we could see it (and each other) a little bit better. ;) The food is what we went for, though, and seriously zero complaints about that!

A nostalgic ice cream parlour/candy store/sandwich joint.  Certainly quaint and charming for sure.  We arrived on a weekday afternoon during the lunch rush and the first and really only major strike for me in the experience was the line of people congregated in the entrance.  With no host you basically have to hover over a table like a vulture.  They could have used a host, or some benches because it looked like a big clusterf*** in the entrance.

Once we got sat the service was prompt and the food was good.  Turkey sandwich with provolone and bacon (added that to it otherwise it would have been plain I guess) was good, and the to-go milkshake I ordered was excellent... not the very best ever but definitely a treat.

I went with a group of six on a Saturday night and we were seated right away for our reservation. We happened to dine during restaurant week, so half of our table did their special menu and the rest ordered off the normal menu. Everyone was impressed with their meals and raving! The biggest hits were the chicken limon and the filet with blue cheese butter. Our waitress Ashley was personable and attentive! Will definitely return when we come back to St Louis!

This is the worst McDonald's in the city. The service is terrible and the food is worse. The drive thru seems to take double the amount of time and they still don't get your order right. I've never received hot fries from this place. Do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else.
Wow. We were not disappointed. Cone, sundae, malt, all excellent. Great atmosphere, great service. We had a blast.

Went for dinner.   We had arancini for appetizer.   So good !   Rice was cooked just right.  Loved the cheese in the middle.  Tasty red sauce.  Chicken breast for an entree.  Caper sauce was seasoned just right.  So good.  Service was great as well.  We will return.

When a new restaurant opens, I typically wait a couple of months to try it out to give them time to make adjustments, but my husband and I were just too excited for iNDO. I recommend reservations because this is not a huge space and can fill up quickly. Although we had a server, the front of the house seems to work as team and everyone we encountered was friendly and knowledgeable. They all seem to be passionate about the food and drinks they are serving which always makes service better. The nigiri was like butter, cabbage salad was refreshing, lamb ribs were tender, and the crab rice was delicious and provided us with a fun table side presentation. This place has a great vibe and we had such a fun dining experience. It's hard to believe they have been open for such a short time. The prices are high, but so is the quality. We can't wait to go back!

I just don't get what this place is about. The people who work here are disgusting and treat their customers like trash.  The restaurant is filthy and I would hate to think what condition the kitchen is in.  The ice cream is watery tasting and the flavors taste fake and inexpensive. Do yourself a favor and go to Bailey's Range downtown. Their ice cream is much better and their flavors are of much higher quality.  And their waitstaff isn't crude and scary to look at.
Have never had a problem here over 8 years of renting cars from this location. Always the fastest of the chains to get out and back in. Very convenient and always great service.

I was in town on business and came here for dinner. I had a very good "build your own" calzone. The ingredients were fresh and tasty.

Nice selection of craft beers at happy hour prices. The cashier that took my order was knowledgeable, helpful and friendly.

Awesome stop during a quick trip through St Louis. Friendly staff who guided us through how to throw, they provided tips on how to do so effectively and even provided some cool ninja stars and metal playing cards to throw as well.
