Clean, fun environment, and a great stress reliever. Fun solo or with a group of friends and office mates.
The technician was very professional and informative. He did everything as was discussed in the plan. I would recommend this service to others.

The space is okay. The pizza is okay. But honestly the owner Dave's bad review clapbacks deserve  5-stars. This man's responses are lit.... in the most crazy way possible. I mean honestly this man should have his own Reddit account for these responses. Are you having a slow day? Then read one of his comebacks to a one star or two star review. I have abs now, you've heard it here first... the most effective ab workout of 2018, reading Dave's clapbacks. Congratulations sir.
Great example of what southern cuisine should be like. Just like momma would of cooked. Well worth the drive from the county.

Wow. So many customer service missteps. 3:00 on Sat., almost no customers yet left waiting to place an order while 3 people walk by register. 1 of 4 orders correct, in error by both register manager and food preparers. Nothing offered to make it up.

You need to make this visit anytime you're in STL. And if you skip it, you might consider punching yourself because you didn't make the trip. Amazing beer, amazing food, amazing service, super cool atmosphere. Burgerrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrs. Brewwwwwws. A 10! A 10!

This is some of the best pork steak I've ever had. T-ravs and bruschetta are mouthwatering as well. The wait was not too long on a Friday night, and the waitresses were very nice. I can't wait to eat leftovers.
It would be a better environment if people left there kids at home. Really great having 2-5 year old kids running around a brewery.

Pretty good Chicago style pizza. Takes about an hour to cook one of these pies so keep that in mind when coming here. Cool little dive bar though and they have air hockey, shuffleboard, Ms Pac-Man/Galaga, and pinball to play while you wait. Friendly bar staff as well.

While I don't eat fast food often I do occasionally get a craving for terrible but tasty fries. I have also taken ppl here late night after a night at the bars. 

They are not friendly, are always out of something we are ordering, stop serving night food at random times, and only accept cash at some unknown time of day. Shady shady...
Great Place!! Great Food!! I thoroughly enjoyed the food here. It was delicious. The service was quick and they were very nice!!

Sauce on the Side is one of the best things that has happened to St. Louis.  I love these warm, cheesy, melty, gooey folded golden calzones.  The portions are right on, the flavors are right on, the left overs are almost better than the first bite!  

The salads at Sauce on the Side are strong enough to stand on their own.  If Calzones are not your thing, stop in for a salad.  Fresh, flavorful, filling...you will not be sorry.   I like both the Smokehouse Salad and the Strawberry Field Salad.

I highly suggest the Figgy Piggy.  This an amazing flavor combination of Salty and Sweet.    Monthly Specials peak peoples interest.  The Grove location of Sauce on the Side is nice and roomy.  I love the windows looking out onto Manchester Road.   The staff is very helpful and friendly.

Started off strong... I will say if you have any plans on going to this place be prepared to wait. It is the type of place where you have families with kids but also people who just want to sit and drink. So the turnover of tables can be slow. They have a huge menu and an amazing bar selection. Everything I have ever tried is fantastic. 
We got a bar seat while we waited about 45 minutes. I got a text saying our table was ready, walk to the front and they had texted the wrong person. We were told we were next and even though we were we had to wait another 15.
 Our booth was lovely, over sized with plenty of space. The only problem is we requested a high chair and this booth would not accommodate but we made it work. Our waiter was great, got all of our drinks and orders very quickly and was great with our 8month. We waited a longer than average time for our food to came out. Our entries were great, but all of our fries were cold or under cook.
This place is still a place we will go back to, but they have some need to get through some growing pains.

OK-customer service, but then annoying to deal with when you spend $1600 on a repair but your car is still unusable because "it wasn't leaking when in shop." It's fine though! I got $56 back! :-) 

Out of shop my car worked for one day. Then stalled on me twice while driving. I brought it back and it was another $1200 maybe $900? To fix the problem. I would have just bought a new car if the repairs were more than $2000 initially. I did not have the financial capability to accommodate any price over $2000. I tried to make the $1600 work though because my car is very useful for my line of work. After pulling some strings I was able to cough up the money. 

Mind you, to repair the car any further it was at least $600-900 more because the coolant can was damaged. But I wish I knew this prior to driving it. Again, it didn't work after a full day of use. But all fluids were checked. I couldn't pay for this again nor could I go without a car for much longer. I ended up bringing the car to car max and trading it in. Again a car is very useful in my line of work so I needed it ASAP. I didn't have a car for about three days while it was in their shop and it really set me back. I called initially to ask for compensation considering how much money I had dropped on the repair. Mike had told me he could tow the car to the shop and try and fix the problem. All I would pay for was the part. The part USED, was apparently $600. I would not pay that money on a 2007 Toyota Prius. Nor would I have the capability to be without a car again. I declined. I asked for a $400 refund Mike said he would call back, never did. Two weeks pass and I drove there again asking to speak to the owner, Mike. He was at lunch. I came back again two hours later, still at lunch. His employee relayed the information and Mike called me back that night right after they closed. (I'm glad they're busy!) :-) Mike was short and demeaning, understandable. I look young and oblivious to the world. It's easy to act like I'm the person in the wrong. And apologized for taking so long to get back to me. He mentioned his lawyer would allow for a good faith agreement. Sure. They gave me the option to either get their auto repair service maintenance thing for a year OR $56 for the initial diagnosis. I'm not planning on living in STL for much longer so I opted for the $56. 

I understand the work put into my car but I expected some compensation. Not $56 worth of compensation, but it's okay! It's some money back. 

All in all, I would not recommend them to anyone. I always believed that a diagnosis meant FULL diagnosis. But Mike told me countless of times, "I can't predict the future." Because I guess you're supposed to be able to predict the future rather than addressing the problem before it surfaced in the future. Maybe I was just one of the unlucky ones but you're free to give them a try. I ended up getting a new car, one star for a great oil change though!

I can't even begin with how impressed I am with these guys. I have eaten here so many times and I have yet to be tired of their food. Their grilled chicken has jumped its way to my number one favorite food on the planet! Their fries could easily top any other fry at any other restaurant. Their modiga flatbread is to die for. Every single thing on their menu is phenomenal. I didn't think it could get any better....UNTIL THEY STARTED BRUNCH!!!!! Their brunch is HANDS DOWN the best brunch in St. Louis. If you're a pancake lover, you're about to worship their fluffy cakes with a dollop of their house butter! I could go on and on about how amazing this restaurant is, but my mouth is watering. Check it out if you want amazing food with amazing service!

We went for the first time this past Friday night. We knew it would be busy, but wanted to check it out anyway. We walked in, and were immediately treated by a friendly hostess, who informed us it was an hour wait. We went to the bar, which was very full, but you wouldn't know it from the bartenders' behaviors. They spotted us instantly and asked what we wanted. There were at least two bartenders who were extremely attentive to everyone in the area. We never had to wait for a drink. Our table was ready in 45 minutes and we were greated by a energetic waitress. She had to be so busy, but acted like we were her only table. She was knowledgeable and her service was fantastic. I know why this restaurant is so busy...the customer service is top notch! Not to mention the food was phenomenal as well. Can't wait to go back!

Very nice place. The food was great and served in a friendly atmosphere. It's very clean and trendy located in "The Grove" part of St Louis. I had the smoked meatloaf which was very tasty. The only thing stopping me from giving 5 stars was the food was a bit slow to arrive at the table. But, I would absolutely go back and recommend this place.

Everyone was nice but it took more than 2 hours just for an influenza test. Even checked in online an hour ahead of time. That's a long time to wait, especially when you have an appointment. Will likely not be back.

Loved getting to check out the newer Grove location. It's super huge and spacious!  Too bad it was nearly empty between 5 and 6pm on a Thursday too?!?  
Super impressed with the server that immediately ordered a "redo" of a pepperoni and sausage fold that she inspected and deemed unsatisfactory.  I'm impressed with the quality control! Makes me love the place even more!
The Smokehouse salad continues to be my favorite. I highly recommend!!!

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY - ESPECIALLY FOR CAR TRANSPORTS. I wish I could give zero stars. I spoke to a guy named LEROY WILLIAMS and he was the WORST. Lied to me about everything. We scheduled my car pick-up on Sunday and then gave me the number of the guy in charge of transportation. The guy named Mike didn't call me until 4 days later just to tell me that they only pick up from 8-5 M-F (when LeRoy also told me that they are accommodating to after work hours). Everything he said was wrong. I'm still in disbelief with how badly this whole situation became all because of an idiot who cannot do their job.

I am here about every other week and have been since opening. I'm so glad Goodscents came to South County! The sandwiches are always fresh, store is always clean and staff has been great. I at times bring my 2 year old with me who likes to "help," the workers are always friendly with her and don't mind when she hands them her chips or money.

First time at CCK so I had to get the Heart Stopping BLT and it definitely lived up to the hype. Half the sandwich and I was stuffed! Grabbed a chocolate shake to round it out. Awesome environment, like going back in time. Such a StL gem!
I love this place! The best salmon I've had in Missouri. For being located in the Midwest, the fish is really fresh and delicious! This is the place that I crave food from often.
Delicious food, great service- like eating in a "real" restaurant instead of an airport.

Circle 7 is a staple in my rotation of places I go to monthly. Their menu changes with specials so there's always something new to try. I love their selections of chicken and wraps but their buffalo chicken grilled cheese is great. 

Their patio is awesome and great to watch a sporting event, year-round. Inside, they have beer taps at some of the booths which is awesome. 

The service is always great and their menu has something for everyone. I recommend trying one of the Circle 7 collaboration beers. 

There is usually a nice wait but you can grab a beer and be patient, it is worth the wait!
Good beer. Good service. I'll definitely be here at least once a week to participate in their happy hour or siren specials!
This place is so cute. Food was delicious, great atmosphere, food was quick, service was friendly. A tad pricey for two people for 30$ but worth it for fresh squeezed orange juice

Good old fashioned fun!
Grilled cheese was just like my mom used to make, and was definately a welcome bit of comfort food. It was eclipsed later by the GIGANTIC sundae, with perfectly rich ice cream, chocolate syrup and marshmallow. 
Will definately be my first stop next time I'm back in St. Louis!

Garbage! Nothing about this establishment is fresh even though they reside outside the security gates walking distance from baggage claim. You would think that a place that bills it self fresh scratch food would at least try to come close to it? Absolutely not.

I ordered the lasagna al forno; i got a small square of it probably worth $4 with tax. Yet the lasagna cost me $13.99 with a piece of small butter bread. 

Save your money let this business go out of business.
Holy Oregano! The pizza was very good and cheesy, but up the sauce a little and tone down the oregano. $1.75 PBR which is good. I enjoyed however, I enjoyed.

I just went here for lunch for the first, and as my buddy and i both agreed, the last time. We call it a one-and-done.

The dumplings here are okay. The extremely limited menu here doesn't scream sophistication as it would at other establishments in the same vein, but rather just constricted and similar choices. The three dumplings we had may as well have all been the same, as the flavors are not different enough to differentiate whether you're eating beef, pork, or seafood for that matter.

The food came out quickly and ordering was quick and simple. The prices are out of control expensive though, as another Yelper points out in these reviews the $8 and $12 price points for six small dumplings is kind of egregious. We split three bamboo steam baskets of dumplings including pork / seafood / beef, for a total of 18 dumplings. Sounds like a lot, but it isn't. They're very small, bite size and unfortunately the menu is so limited you don't really have an option to order any sides (they bring a very small cup of tofu-broth soup out before the food though), not that we could really afford to anyhow, it was $34 ($17 each) for this and we both left feeling hungry. For $34 one can probably do better in the quantity department at nearly any other establishment within 0.5 mile.

There are no drink fountains, which would not be a criticism except that you cannot just get a glass of water, you're forced to buy it if you care for a beverage. You can purchase Sam's Club brand bottled water for $1 among a few other soft drinks. Also in the drink cooler were what looked like jars of rice? As well as a couple of other items i could not identify, nor if they were to go w/ the meal or just side items to take and go. Your option for dining utensils are chop sticks, naturally, and styrofoam plates. This is terrible for the environment and for $34 i want to eat on ceramic. This isn't a taco-truck, this is a sit-down establishment and it just doesn't jive with the food or strike a balance regarding what this restaurant is seemingly trying to achieve. To use a credit card one must have a bill of no less than $25, this is a major business-first, customer-second inconvenience, on the other hand you'll have no problem hitting that dollar mark since the prices are so high, as i mentioned. 

There is no music playing, and it's an otherwise sterile, echo-filled hallway that bounces every conversation in the room directly towards your ears. It was difficult to converse without raising our voices, which is odd for such a small place.

I think this restaurant has a lot of potential, and honestly a few tweaks would make it a go-to lunch spot. It feels half-done, and again not putting the customer first at nearly all levels makes it difficult to want to come back.

We stopped here on a whim. My husband has been searching for a good calzone. We were riding pass, he spotted them and we turned around. I'm so glad we did. Kathleen was our first impression and just an AWESOME person. Though my calzone was ok. The really impressive part of our visit was the service. It was absolutely commendable all around. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because my calzone was cold and rather than make me a fresh one they warmed the same one. All in all it was a pleasant experience that I will definitely have again.

We had been out the night before and someone mentioned pizza from Black Thorn and we knew we had to to have some. We ordered a large deep dish with just about every meat you can put on a pizza and an order of cheesy bread to go. 

I've heard of this place from several friends and had been dying to give it a try and it was well worth the wait. This might just be the best pizza I've had in St Louis, and I think I've had some pretty good pizza. 

I stopped in, grabbed the pizza and headed back home to enjoy this monster in the comfort of my own home. I was truly impressed, the large pizza felt like it weighed 10lbs. Ok, that might be a bit of an exaggeration, but not much. I could not wait to get home and dig in. 

Fast forward about 20 minutes and we were tearing into this thing, but we didn't do a whole lot of damage to it. Everyone was stuffed after just one piece. It had peperoni, bacon, sausage and a few other meats I think, and was loaded with cheese. 

It tasted almost as good for breakfast the next day and was just as filling. This place is less than two miles from home and I can't believe it's taken us a year to visit. It will definitely not take us another year to return, and next time we might dine in to get the full Black Thorn experience!

My husband and I were in on a Saturday night. When we got there 4 tables were seated, ours being the 5th. There were two waitresses. We ordered our drinks and they were brought to us promptly. I ordered the fried rice with vegetables, my husband ordered the spicy steak. We also ordered spring rolls as an appetizer.

A table that was sat after us had multiple apps brought out long before ours came out. The spring rolls came out as the same time as my fried rice. My husbands dinner was no where to be found. About 10 minutes later his dinner came out of the kitchen. It looked great, but it was emitting a bad smell. The taste was decent but the smell won. He could not finish his meal. The fried rice was great, the vegetables very fresh. 

We were very patient at our table. I've worked in the industry and am familiar with serving multiple tables and the stress that can occur. However, I asked for a re-fill on my drink, she said OK and took my cup. She then became busy and my drink was never returned. It was filled but just sitting on the bar area. My husband got up to get it for me. 

Unfortunately, our experience was not great and we will not be returning. We really love to support small business but this is one we can not get behind.
BLT TO DIE FOR!!!  The simplicity of their food will keep u coming back. I won't even mention the ice cream. 2 scoops coffee ice cream with caramel and those roasted pecans......Heaven!

My cousin and I were looking for something to do as the sign up for the poker tournament was already full. We were pretty bummed, but we were determined not waste the night. We threw around a few ideas, and then I remembered that I had saw an axe throwing place down the street. I've heard of these opening up and starting to become popular, but honestly I wasn't sure really how fun it would be. We decided to give Top Notch a shot.

We walked in around 6:30pm on a Saturday night and were able to secure a spot for the both of us. Here are a few things that would be helpful for a first timers.
- Two options for sessions, $20 for 30 min and $35 for 90 min
- Walk-ins are welcome, but you can also make a reservation online
- You can bring your own food in, they do not have food
- You can bring your own drinks (alcoholic or non-alcoholic), they do have non-alcoholic drinks for sale
- There is a convenience store you can buy food and drinks at around the corner

With this being my cousin and my first time, we went with the 90 min session which I would highly recommend if it is your first time. It gave us a good chance to get used to the axes, play around with throwing cards and stars. Ben, the Axe Master, gave us a quick tutorial and safety guidelines. I appreciated that the explanations were short and sweet and allowed us to get to the throwing quickly!

My cousin and I each got our own lanes and quickly got the hang of it. I don't know what it is about axe throwing, but we were having an absolute blast just throwing the axes at the target. We didn't even need games, I love just hearing the sound of an axe hitting and sticking to the board. 

There are games though. The Axe Master will go through games about 30 mins into the session and then hand you throwing cards and stars in about another 30 mins. I appreciated the gradual introduction of new items. This allowed us to get comfortable without feeling overwhelmed.

90 mins of constant axe throwing is quite a bit. My arm was hurting by the end of it, maybe because I'm getting old. I still had an amazing time though. I'm glad we didn't make it to the poker tournament, because it led to Top Notch!

The Axe Master did a great job checking in with us and encouraging us throughout the whole session. I had a blast! I've already scheduled my next visit with 5 of my visiting college friends!

Nice new restaurant on Washington Ave, with a nice twist on some  Mexican cuisine. Went with a co-worker for lunch, so we decided to try this place out. We were able to be seat right away at lunch time. Our server greeted us pretty quickly and took our drink order. I had just water and my co-worker order tea.  If you want a straw you  will have to ask for one, and be aware that they have paper straws (better for the environment). Unfortunately we had to remind our waiter to bring the glass of tea, however we didn't receive it until after our lunch arrived. I also had to ask for clean utensils, both my fork and knife had dried food on it. Once brought to the waiters attention they addressed it quickly and were apologetic.

We ordered the chips and salsa. The chips are made in house and served hot. The salsa was not a juicy/liquid salsa, it was more of a think red thick salsa. Both were really good.

We had the Machete Pollo, it was kinda like a quesadilla but a little different. In the description it said it had fundido cheese, however you couldn't tell. Flavor wise, it had a really good flavor, and nice little kick to it. Wish there was a little more of the corn. The corn was amazing. Overall be both enjoyed the Machete Pollo.

We also had a Gringo Taco & Al Carbon taco. The gringo taco was very flavor full, the chipotle crema was very good on this.The al carbon was on point. Super delicious, had a great kick, the steak was cooked perfectly. 

I will be going back, there were a few additional items on the menu that sounded tasty. Overall we had a good experience given the few bumps in the road we experienced.
This is the best pizza in town and also the best Chicago style pizza I've ever had. The pizza is so unique and flavorful. Highly recommended!

I've been wanting to try Grace Meat + Three for a while and had the pleasure of checking this place out this past Thursday for a late lunch. I arrived around 1:30 pm and had no waiting and no struggle to find a place to sit. The young lady at the counter who took my order and explained the specials to me was delightful! She was really friendly, welcoming, and outgoing. After placing your order, you are handed a table card to put on the table of your choosing. They're "so St. Louis" by featuring famous St. Louis neighborhood landmarks. Mine was Sacred Heart in Florissant.

I ordered the half slab of BBQ ribs with a side of mac-n-cheese and greens, with sweet tea. I thought that based on the name, the entrees came with three sides, but that must no longer be the case as I as informed that all entrees come with your choice of two sides.

My food arrived to my table really quick, and the person who brought my food to me was also very friendly. The food was really good! My ribs were meaty, had good flavor, and were really tender. The greens were also really good, however the mac-n-cheese isn't baked and wasn't the best ever, but also wasn't bad.

The dining room is very nice and spacious with both communal tables and private tables and booths. You fill your drinks yourself, and leave your trash on the tables as the employees will clear the mess after you're finished eating. The music played a range of nice vintage tunes including Motown to set the tone of the traditional menu fare.

All in all, I really liked GM+T. The good food, friendly staff, and nice atmosphere make for a great restaurant. Be aware though, your meal will not be the cheapest. My total came to about $22 after tax. Still worth it though.

Hmmmm. Their corp strategy shows if youre eating at the bar. Smoothie machines churning primary cored mystery mix. 

Kitchen had a 45 min wait(convention in town) and had to ask the booze barbie  to bring my chips and queso (yellow not white, fail #2) Usually this is the first thing at the table. No?

Hard pas on this place unless you really need to get food

This was our first time coming to Gringo - as it recently opened this month. Really great location on Washington Ave. The decor inside the restaurant was the cutest. Really light and airy feel. There were some families and young people there. Our waitress was great (forgot her name) and the food was good. I got some tacos (chicken, beef, and fish) all were good except the fish one. They were street tacos size. We also got the classic queso and chips. Not terrible but didn't wow us. My fiance got the pollo loco burrito and like it. The gringo fries are great too! Overall great experience! We'll be back!!

It's hard to find a restaurant in STL that really makes you say yum.  More often than not, it's all just ho-hum.  

Loved the breaded fried catfish, the chicken pot pie + sides of sweet potatoes, baked cauliflower and corn bread. 

My family and I will definitely be back (soon).

I have been to Rockwell Beer a couple of times now. It's like if a pretty smart kid erected a building with brightly colored shipping containers and cinderblocks instead of legos and then filled it with beer. When you sit in the bar area you can see the tanks and the pallets of product. If you're my age you can't help but think of Bob and Doug running around Elsinore Brewery! The first time I was here for beer and the second time for lunch. I have heard about the Brasserie burgers at the BrassWell counter and of course I wanted to try them. I ordered a double burger which comes with onions, American cheese, pickles, and dijonaise and the Shoestring Fries. This and a beer was $19 and Rockwell Beer is a no gratuity establishment in case you were wondering. It took about 10 minutes for my buzzer to go off that my burger was ready. I picked it up and got a cup of ketchup for the fries. It took a beautiful photo, didn't it? So there's really nothing to say except go get this burger. It's absolutely delicious. It's thick, beefy, and not overcooked. The cheese is smooth and melty. The bun is perfect. The shoestring fries are crispy and perfectly salted. The ketchup is Heinz. Yum. The beer is nice but I'll be back for those burgers.

a spot that's pretty close to me and pretty good!! Have had soup dumplings across the nation and these are comparable to ones I've had in New York! 

Their menu is literally just soup dumplings so a good snack before a full course meal - or could definitely have a few plates of these for a full meal! I believe they had 4-5 options of when I visited and such a fan of the pork and crab & pork soup dumplings. 

Very large inside and definitely enough seating for large groups. They do only take cash for any orders under $25. So be prepared to bring cash or splurge on a couple different soup dumpling options if you're paying with card!

Overall - great soup dumplings and was surprised to find a great option here in STL. real tasty and come with all of the sauces and dips as well such as the red vinegar.
Fun taps at tables. Good fried pickles. Other than that is super average. Service is average. Food is average.  Kind of place people in the suburbs gravitate toward.

This is a fast casual breakfast joint. Every thing comes in economic friendly disposable dishes. The egg basket I got was really good but most importantly it was very creative. The sausage choice they use is very tasty. The smashed golden potatoes are a great way to show diversity as a alternative to potatoes for breakfast! Overall clean environment. Seeing the kitchen while you eat is a blessing!!!!

My experience with National reinforced the idea that I really need to stick with Enterprise to be happy. Yes, I know Enterprise, National and Alamo are part of the same company (Parents, children, siblings, I don't know. Just something related), but there's a world of difference among them.

I'll say that the National agent at the counter in Lambert Airport was absolutely wonderful. Quick, affable, flattering ("Girl, are you a model?"), and a musician to boot. He did the "It is not. It is NOT!" thing when he saw on my driver's license that my birthday was the following day, and he enthusiastically wished me a happy one. He was fabulous in every way.

That's where the fun ended. Some differences:

* The Enterprise shuttle driver helped everyone with their bags, even my measly single backpack. The National driver just waited for people to board.
* The Enterprise shuttle driver offered bottles of water. National offered nothing.
* The Enterprise shuttle driver welcomed everyone, and no "special classes" were alluded to. The National Driver gave preferential treatment to the Emerald class, whatever that is, and he gave them more direction than us non-Emerald class people.
* Emerald people were dropped off in a special lot with special assistants milling about. Because I was non-Emerald, I was dropped off in a lot and told find the car size that I ordered in a certain section.

More headaches:
* Naturally, I couldn't find my car's section and I was confused if I needed to check in at all before just taking a car. I walked inside, was told I didn't need to check in, and someone pointed (from wayyyyy behind the counter) in the general direction of the cars I could take. Yes, "take." Keys were in the ignition.
* I asked about a walkthrough, and the counter person told me to note any imperfections and tell the lady at the booth on the way out. I had nothing to note imperfections on. Luckily, I chose a car with nothing wrong.
* The signage for exiting the lot was bad, and I didn't see arrows on the ground.
* The woman in the booth was extremely fast and didn't ask if anything appeared to be wrong with the car.
* When I returned the car, the inspection was super-fast and, in my opinion, not very thourough.
* I told an attendant that instead of taking the shuttle back to the airport/Metrolink, I'd wait for a friend (Hi, Christine F.!) to pick me up. The National attendants told me to tell her to come in through the main entrance on the main road, not the car return entrance. I told her that, but she called me in a confused panic because there really was no entrance. After 10 minutes, we finally realized that the attendants really meant that Christine could come into a pea-sized parking lot with four spaces for visitors' cars. I had to walk across a long lot to her; she couldn't drive over and get me. I'd hate to think about someone less able-bodied trying to make their way to a friend's car.

I got a great deal on Priceline, but I think I'll just suck it up and pay the extra $10/day to use Enterprise from now on, since they actually give a crap about their customers. Seriously. Lesson learned.

Both desk agents were extremely helpful in the middle of the night with many waiting customers. I love National's Emerald Aisle! And the fact that we are able to reserve car seats so we don't have to bring them with us is also very helpful!

I went here for dinner with my wife based on a recommendation from a friend.

The food was absolutely delicious and the cocktails are out of this world.

The only hiccup was a catfish entree that was a little undercooked, but the staff went above and beyond to make it right. They comped our dinner as well as another round of drinks. I was very impressed by their concern for our experience despite what was a minor issue all things considered.

Definitely recommend this place. Great atmosphere and excellent food.

We ordered a fish sandwich and a turkey bacon melt. Both were excellent. I would order these again. We saw the BLT sandwiches, which were larger than we wanted, but they looked good. 
We also ordered a chocolate shake, which was enough for both of us.

The drive- through is possibly ran by Helen Keller. 
If you don't have anything else to do with your time, this is your restaurant.

After watching the St. Louis episode of "Man Vs Food" a few too many times, I at long last made my journey over to Crown Candy on a Saturday afternoon to see what the fuss was all about. Not surprisingly, there was a huge line when I got there, so I knew it was going to be pretty amazing.

Bandmates and I decided we didn't want to wait, so we actually just walked in, and discovered there was an entirely separate area for carry out orders! The one downfall of Crown Candy is the limited seating, so we were perfectly content to get our orders without having to wait in line, and eat back at home. Keep that in mind if you do not want to wait 40+ mins to dine in.

I wanted the full experience, so I went with their famous BLT, and a chocolate milkshake. Let me just say this: the BLT lives up to its reputation (think it was voted one of the best in the country?) 
You will get so much bacon stuffed between two pieces of bread that you just might get the meat sweats trying to finish it. The milkshake is really rich as well. Try theirs, and then try one from any other restaurant, and you'll never see milkshakes the same way again. Definitely a perfect ten, in my book.

Here's hoping Crown Candy can someday get a second location!

I don't usually like having unsolicited service people come to my door, but they were working next door, plus I knew I needed pest control service, so it all came together.  Good price, all my questions answered.  They set up my appt for later that same day, which was great.  Zach P was the technician.  Thorough and polite.  So far, I am very pleased.
Not a fancy place, but their calzones are great. They have tons of calzones types. Nice lounge music. They have different kinds of beer.

Love this great addition to the Hill neighborhood. Not too stuffy, or overpriced, and the Modiga flatbread is a must have. We stopped in again for happy hour drinks and just to sit in the bar, it was a perfect plan. Will be back again.

Stopped by on a Friday evening and although it's not a huge space, it somehow feels spacious. Staff is super friendly, beer is tasty, and the food is phenomenal. I do wish they had some additional seating. Or at least a dedicated dining area. 

Overall a great experience, we'll be back!

I had the cookies and cream shake. Prices are very reasonable! The shake cups have frosting and cookies (or whatever topping comes on your shake) "glued" on the outside. So if the shake didn't satisfy your sweet tooth, the outside of the cup sure will!!!

Born and raised in Stl, and crown candy is one of the most overrated places in the city. Some flavors are impressive like the black walnut, but the malts are bland and watery. Above all, the waitstaff is deplorable and completely ruins any potential atmosphere the place would have.

Had the introductory treatment and they were very thorough and friendly. Our service member Tim Jacobs was very friendly and helpful! They also have great prices and deals. Thanks for the great job Tim Jacobs!

Grand opening weekend was March 2-4.  We visited Friday night and got to experience the first day excitement.  The place was packed, but there were open tables.  When it gets warmer, they have a huge patio and lots of picnic tables.  There is parking for a food truck, so I imagine this will be a popular place to be.

There are currently 2 beers on tap that they brew.  Obviously looking to expand.  They had several other beers on tap, including a cider.  The beer was fine, nothing spectacular.  The location, high ceilings, stash of board games by the front door, and friendly staff make this place special.

I am a huge fan of Sauce on the Side but if Sunday night had been my first time there, I probably would not be going back. We called in a to go order and I do realize that it was placed about an hour before closing, but that does not make it okay to serve a poor product. When we returned home and opened the boxes, both calzones were very burnt, to the point of being black on the ends, and had abnormally large holes on the top. If it were me, I would not have let these be served to a customer. This makes me hesitant to return during off hours.

This restaurant is the epitome of charm. Grace is a quaint corner restaurant with a welcoming environment. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with such kindness and a warm atmosphere. The food was delivered very quickly and was incredible. We were first greeted by Cory, who was incredibly kind and personable. Our server, Brooke, was very knowledgeable and attentive. The sweet tea was DELICIOUS, the rack of ribs was seasoned to perfection and the moon pie was out of this world. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!

We have used movers over a dozen times the last 15 years. This experience has been THE WORST. To top it all off after 4 months of going back and forth on our claim, the claims person said they would have our check to us for over $2,000. Now 3 months have gone by since that day and I've called, emailed, contacted headquarters. The operator tells me he claims dept is so busy it's typical I don't hear anything back from anyone. Michael Davis is the claims person. You should not have to pay for your move until everything is settled. Ridiculous. The packers just threw everything in boxes, literally just dumped drawers out into boxes. I could have done that myself. They ruined our $6,000 table and then offered $900 for it when we had replacement value Insurnace. It seemed what ever could be damaged was. I will NEVER use them again.

I don't expect much from an airport restaurant, but I do expect relatively quick service. Especially when I'm just ordering an appetizer. Apathetic lunch staff, slow busing of tables, and no sense of expediency. 30 minutes after ordering I walked out. Decided I needed to catch a plane more than I needed to eat.

One of the best, if not THE best, breakfast/brunch restaurants in St. Louis. Great service, friendly atmosphere, creative menu, and delicious dessert options. My wife and I will be lifelong customers. Absolutely love this place!

Visited on a Saturday morning with my Dad and bf. We tried the Johnny ham hands, nest egg, and classic breakfast. Also some fresh oj and a pop tart. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the overall aesthetic felt bright and inviting. Someone who looked like a manager was walking around checking on guests--super courteous. Food was served fast and made to order on a hot grill open to view from seating. We all really enjoyed our meals -- the nest egg belongs in a fancy restaurant, it was as tasty and unique as the preparation was visually appealing. Those potatoes, damn they were good! Great bacon. Oj was fresh and a good compliment. 

Happy to see a little place like this in the neighborhood and wishing it all the luck and success.

I learned about Velofix when they posted a Thursday night ride. The first thing I learned was how to put air in my new tires and off we went. Franseco discussed bicycle rules in the road. 
I needed a lock and lights for my bike.Franseco helped me select the right ones. No going stopping at a store just get off my bike, purchase what I need and I was ready to ride again. This is the way to go.

The pizza better be good here. I didn't have any but will be back to try it due to the positive reviews. 

But this place is gross. And the wait staff was curt and rude. I know, sometimes that can be charming in a Carla from Cheers kind of way. But it wasn't like that. The drinks were fine, and the games were fun, but when I do get Black Thorn, I will get takeout.

This location started out strong and then took a nose dive. For the first few months it was great service and great food. The worst part was waiting in the long lines to order. Well, the lines are gone, the service is gone and the food quality is just average. We have pretty much stopped going here.

I was so sad about Yolklore. I've heard the best things via reviews and local St. Louisans but I was so disappointed. When I think "yolk" I think runny, indulgent, breakfasty/brunchy. I didn't find any of this here. It was quite a ways from the city which I didn't expect at all and it wasn't a sit down and order type of place but rather order at the counter or drive through. 

I got the nest egg. The description makes it look like it's to die for. It was much less than this. I wanted the ratio of filling to bread to be much heavier on the filling side and it was probably 80/20 with the bread taking over completely. I took only a few bites before just having bread left. It said three eggs and I find that very hard to believe. I was also extremely bummed about the potatoes. They took a small potato, seasoned it and smashed it on the grill for a few minutes. They weren't crispy and the inside was totally bland. Not to mention they only give you two. 

Not worth the prices and really just not very pleasing. Some of the other options would probably be better, but if the nest egg was any indication of what the menu says versus what is reality, I'm not confident.

Do not hire this company if you want to receive your goods in a timely manner.  We waited 25 DAYS past the last promised date in the delivery window.  We moved cross country and had to make due with the basics we brought on the plane with us for almost a month. They kept calling us and moving the date farther away. For a company with such a big name they were 
woefully inefficient!  Very frustrating dealing with this company.
Love the pizza. Best in town. You'll wait a bit for your pizza, but it's totally worth. Call ahead to cut down on lead time if you're in a hurry.

The Daily Bread is in my TOP 3 of favorite lunch places in St. Louis. Honestly...
It's like what Bread Co. should be. Everything is made with care and extremely fresh.  The soups do not all taste the same. Each one is flavorful and original.  I have eaten here too many times to count but I did get to stop by for lunch today. I had the Daily Double with chicken and wild rice soup and the buffalo chicken flatbread sandwich.  Their flatbread is most likely a freshly made pizza crust. It has just the right amount of chew.  The buffalo chicken has a slight kick but nothing too major which works perfectly with the gorgonzola cheese and caramelized onions. Did I mention the ranch on the side? I don't even eat ranch anywhere else but here it just works. My second favorite item would be the fire and ice salad which is the same buffalo chicken in a salad.  Their bread and bakery items are always good as well. Anyone want to meet for lunch?

A step above normal restaurant food served on a tray with get your own drinks (except alcohol).  The layout is very nice & clean.  Soda is from Excel so I could get Ski after choosing 1 of three teas available.

$14 spicy catfish with 2 sides (choose red beets pickled with onion & smoked red cabbage) was my meal.  With soda somehow I went to over $18 with tax... IDK.

Catfish was well cooked and placed on white bread.  Added unnecessary hot sauce & ate the last bites of catfish as a sandwich with bread.

Red beets were made more interesting with onion and was a good sized side.

Smoked red cabbage was nice surprise flavor with descent crunch even though I assumed it was cooked.

I want to go back for the fried chicken or turkey leg like other friends rave about.
The veggie torta was highly disappointing as was the guacamole and salsa. Their refried beans are made with lard. They were out of something we ordered, too.

I like off-site car rental locations for one reason.  The cars are outside and you can get a good look at what you are getting.  In St. Louis, the Emerald Aisle was almost cleaned out.  All the people on our shuttle bus were hard working business road warriors and scrambled to get the good cars.  We asked if we could take one from the Executive Aisle instead.  We got a beautiful granite black Malibu LTZ.  We drove this car 1,000 miles and it got great gas mileage.

Check out quick.  Return, super easy.  The shuttle back to the airport was a yawner.  The only thing that kept them was 5 stars was the dirty hand print on the inside roof of the car that I had to look at our entire trip.  Stuff happens.  We still love National.

1/12/19 - First time at this quaint corner brunch restaurant. Open kitchen with a community style table in the center of the room and additional tables/bar top around that. 

Main focus of the restaurant is breakfast and lunch items. Based off the previous reviews, the Nest Egg and Pancake Rollup seemed to be the most popular.

The Nest Egg is a hollowed out biscuit shell with two eggs, bacon, cheese, greens, and pickled onions. It was a tough decision on how to attack it, but the knife and fork route seemed safest. As soon as the knife sliced through the egg white, the yolk exploded on to the tray and it turned into a giant mess. So time to grab the biscuit pieces and scoop as much fillings as possible. Not exactly what I envisioned but it turned out okay. The biscuit seemed a little dry but it helped to absorb the egg yolk. 3.5/5

The Pancake Rollup consisted of two scrambled eggs, turkey chorizo, cheddar cheese, pickled jalapeños, fire roasted salsa, and a lime crema. The cheese, chorizo, and jalapeños were the perfect blend of spice with the lime crema to cool it down. My only comment would be more filling and less crepe. Other than that, it was amazing. 4.5/5

Everyone in the restaurant was very cheerful even though it was in the middle of a snow storm.

Menu Items: 4/5
Food Quality: 4/5
Service: 4.5/5
Atmosphere: 3.75/5
Overall: 4.25/5

A St. Louis landmark this is a good place to go for nostalgia sake. They have a BLT that has about a pound of bacon on it..(REALLY!) that you could use to commit cardiac suicide. The old ice cream shoppe environment is pleasant and the service is friendly. The shakes and malts are amazing and they bring you enough to really fill the glass twice. That could be a meal in itself.
 There is usually a wait, so not really someplace to go if you are in a rush. 
There is a candy store area also that offers plenty of options for gifts or stocking up for treats to take home.

Took my husband today for a birthday lunch--he loved it. Wings and spinach salad were great and all of the sports themed wall hangings and of course the tv screens--my husband and I had a great lunch with great service--thank you Alec P.
This Exceeded expectations.  I would definitely go back.  The fact that it is BYOB is a huge plus too.

Last night was terrible at The Haven. Ordered a Frisco melt with Mac and Cheese. The Frisco melt had a very thin small over done  burger that did not fit the Texas toast it was on and the Mac and cheese was from a box of kraft. Been going there for years and last two times were bad. Will not be going back.
Unique decor and the best fried chicken I have ever had. They are always busy, but keep things moving right along. We will definitely be back!
If you're looking for something to represent St. Louis, Arch apparel is it! So many different things to represent the Lou. Worth every penny, love love love!

Wanted a simple quick take out.  Saturday, 8/21/18: Arrived at 4:15 pm. and placed our order of 3 burgers and 3 orders of fries. Paid for it and seated ourselves at counter to wait for our food. While we were waiting one person came up and said they had paid for their meal but were still waiting 20minutes for shakes. Another person came in that had gone through the drive thru. His complaint was food was thrown in bag and came unwrapped and got all mixed up. Food was a mess. We watched the food prep person pack a bag, push it to drive thru then pull it back unpack it and repack. She was also making fries and would forget to pack them.   I said that looked like our food she just repacked and sent through drive thru. It was now 4:45 and no food was being prepared. Tried to get attention of anyone behind counter. Manager was hassled and not a happy person. She  never  smiled and blamed every thing that was going wrong on everyone else. One server came up and wanted his tips. Now you need to understand that there were two servers and threes tables with guests. So they were not busy inside, but drive thru was busy. After 45 minutes I finally got the manager who said our food was gone and they would make a new order. We declined because we had to be some place in 5 minutes. Got our money refunded and left hungry. Will never go back there again. Stay away.
I stopped in for lunch and tried three different tacos. All three had great flavor and the service was great during a busy lunchtime. Will go back.

We had a great first experience here yesterday as we visited for story and craft time with my 16 month old. The cafe is cozy and charming and had a little coloring table and basket of kids' books. The employees were very polite and friendly as well. We will be back!

Sports Authority has the basics: 

Most importantly there's usually a $10 check-in offer.

Decent stock of running shoes i.e. Brooks, Asics, Mizuno 
Equipment such as benches, cardio machines, weights, camping gear
Accessories: gloves, socks, running caps, running belts, watches, water bottles and bubble gum

Customer service is a solid 3; nothing spectacular.

This Brentwood location has a parking garage; different but not necessary.

Late-night downtown fast food choices are not great so I swing through this drive-thru about every other month for a quick snack.

IMHO, the problem is the area not with the employees.  It is very close to bars, the arena & stadium.   I have seen the employees dealing stuff & I have just driven away.  The big warning is if they say the fryer or computer is down... Yeah, I leave.  This is not the location I demand my rights to freedom fries.

Cheap quick sandwiches with the vegetables cooler & the meat warmer tells me logically at least it wasn't sitting underneath the heat lamp... So OK.

Fries are breaded & seasoned but I usually don't get because the breading seems to retain the grease.

With the new $4 meal they added funnel cake to a sandwich small fry and drink.  At a glance that sounded like a bargain quick snack before work.

Funnel cake was saturated with grease along with the fries...

Now I sit with a heavy food comma & decided to write a review vs jump into work.

Third time we've been here, but now they are officially open.  Was surprised they don't accept tips, but kudos to them for making all employees salaried.  

Burgers are top notch.  Staff was super friendly and accommodating.  Will be looking forward to their future brews.

Another business trip, but this place was recommended by a colleague. The service and ambiance was great. They actually have beer taps at the tables which are really cool. I had the burger and it was cooked to perfection . The cooked veggies were equally delicious. I will have to come back during my next business trip and explore more of the menu. Loved it !

Disgusting.  If I could give this zero stars, I would.  You probably like this if you're from St. Louis and haven't had east coast pizza.

Every time I complained that I haven't had good pizza here, I was told to try this place.  We called on a Saturday night and were told to come get it in two hours.  I knew the drill; someone explained to me that it takes forever but is so worth it!  No.  We brought it home and it looked decent enough.  But I prefer a sweet, chunkier sauce and this was spicy and the crust was burnt.  Ugh.  Double ugh.  I wouldn't even wait two hours for a meal I really loved, much less a disgusting one like this.  Still if I was given the choice of this or Imo's, I'd probably pick this crap.

Do NOT do the Urine Extraction- it DOES NOT work.  And they charge you basically double the regular cleaning.    I used a black light after it had had dried (took DAYS) and all the stains were STILL there.     The owner credited $80 out of a $556 bill (for $1000 sq ft, stairs and an 8x10 rug) and sent the guys back the next week and they did a truck extraction cleaning (steam cleaning I guess), which was nice, but after it finally dried, not only were most of the urine stains still there, but there is a residual odor (still!) in the carpet.    Also, I noticed the dog sniffing an area, so I did the sniff test (eww) on at least one urine spot and I could smell urine.      (my carpet is only 3 years old and my dog weighs 4 pounds)     I'm going with the traditional Steam Cleaning next time.

We hopped in here after hanging out with family at the bar down the street--the Hilltop. We wanted a tasty late night dinner at a bar and grill, and that's exactly what we got. 

My husband ordered the French dip, and he surprisingly discovered the meat to be tender and not chewy or fatty like a lot of other places. My burger hit the spot, and the crinkle fries won me over. He didn't regret ordering the chips. 

Since that night, we've been back about three or four times. We've sat at the bar all of those times, except for one. 

I've decided that the Haven's food might just well be worth stomaching the often loud conversations of misogynistic men at and around the bar. My husband refers to it as the "broha retirement home." 

This couldn't be more true as many of the patrons consist of uber Alpha-male wannabe types who like to shoot their mouths off while watching various sports on the TV and objectifying and degrading women to either maintain this image or even worse, to unwind and unleash their true selves while downing beers. If I can overlook all that for a cod sandwich, that speaks volumes.

My son ordered spaghetti bolognese that could be more accurately called spaghetti ala catsup. Bad to mediocre. For a restaurant that holds itself out to be Italian, this was a disappointment. Did not enhance the airport dining experience

I LOVE STEAK 'N SHAKE RESTAURANTS! They are team players here and make mostly everything from sauces to of course the yummy shakes! ;) Good Eats, Fast Service @ Cheap Prices. + If the order is not right they are more than happy to make it right! They must be doing something right, for the business it turns daily. Give it a try and a "like"
(*Always tip your server 18% standard tip on the total bill before discounts/coupons. They only make $3.63hr + tips & pay taxes on tips)

Old timey preserved soda fountain. A museum w sweet malts. I had the fresh banana Johnny rabbit malt. Excellent handmade malts. Very fun. Only gripe is instead of an old timey player piano pumping out Dixieland there was a shelf unit playing Unbelievable by EMF.

Very good experience. The people at the desk were very friendly. The physician was friendly. I was in and out pretty fast. Also, I'm currently without insurance and the total visit cost was really inexpensive! I'll definitely come back if I need urgent care again in the future.

Dude. DUDE.

I checked this place out after seeing Steph's glowing review on it. I needed to chill out the night before taking my nursing licensure boards.

I read all the thorough descriptions on the website and also decided on the La Stone ThermoTherapy. I was able to make my appointment online, which was very convenient, and didn't have any trouble getting a slot for that night.

The place in Crestwood Mall is very relaxing right as you go in. I filled out their paperwork and then had about a five minute wait as I perused their coffeetable books.

Jackie was also my massage therapist. She sat down with me and asked my reasons for coming in today (apparently her top three clients are nurses, doctors, and police officers...not surprising!) and explained everything from the beginning of what to expect. She was very patient and kind.

The massage engaged all my senses - the room was dimmed with candlelight (but I did have an eyemask on during the actual massage), I had headphones on playing relaxing music, she used aromatherapy...the table I was on vibrated with the music, which I knew about going in and I was afraid it would be distracting, but it wasn't. And Jackie worked her magic with hot stones and her hands literally from head to toe.

Like Steph said, it was a true 60 minutes. Also, you can do the massage in your underwear or completely naked, it's up to you. She doesn't try to sway you one way or the other, but I went totally nude because I have no shame. =] And I think I got the most out of it that way. But if you are shy, she is okay with that.

The massage was fantastic. Sublime. I did not want to get off that table. I felt like jello afterwards.

I called my mom on the way home and told her I felt high. I guess that's a good massage! And I passed my boards the next day! Success! :)

Plaza Health has always provided friendly and timely service and they've been there when I've had a couple dental "emergencies". The dentists and staff are knowledgeable, professional and sympathetic. I've been through a couple of root canals with can very very scary but they got me through it. I would recommend Plaza Health to anyone looking for great dental care in the St. Louis area.
We held my 9 yr olds birthday party here and it was great! The staff was so friendly & helpful ! All the kids had a blast and did not want to leave!

One of the worst experiences I've had in a long time and the only reason they get two stars is because I know they tried.  Service was pretty friendly and I've been told by a good friend the pizza is excellent but it appeared someone didn't come in that night.  Every open table was messy, the table behind me were letting their kids throw darts all over the floor and the deep dish pizza was totally burnt, and I am not exaggerating.  I can't imagine why they let that leave their hands.  I was pretty hungry so I did eat two pieces but the bottom was black, the top was burnt and was just not good at all.  But again, they clearly were overwhelmed.  I would go back if with my friend but otherwise I seem to be that 1 in a thousand customer that even the best places have something go wrong.  No one is perfect and my visit proves that.

The place itself looks great! Very clean and friendly staff! You order your food first, pay, then find a seat! 20$ for bottomless mimosas and they give you a baby food jar?! Come on!!! The champagne is cheap and orange juice is too....at least give me a pitcher! 
Fried chicken is delicious! Crispy, spicy and flavorful! Let's talk about these sides. Absolute trash! Collard greens had no flavor and weren't even chopped! I should have pieces of meat, garlic and onion: flavor!!!! Green beans...same! No flavor! Literally just over cooked green beans and water! Mac and cheese was so dry...it was like eating a cracker! And last but definitely not least: the horrible cornbread. How dense can you make the cornbread?! Cornbread should be fluffy and light! You can make it sweet or spicy. It's so versatile! I'm so disappointed and won't be back! But I highly recommend the cooks go down south to learn how to make soul food! Or at least go into someone's granny's kitchen! Put some love in your cooking!

We had a very favorable experience with the folks at Bohrens Moving and Storage. We were moving from NJ to SC with alot of electronics and music items. We were impressed by the initial meeting with Bob Ferrare, which was very informative. The packers were amazing. This was further confirmed when we unpacked and could see how carefully they wrapped and packed everthing.  The loaders were excellent taking great care not to damage anything. The  movers (managed by Mike Longfield) were extremely hard-working. All went smoothly. Thanks to the entire crew.

I have never been disappointed when coming here. The staff is awesome, amazing people who strive to satisfy every guest. There is always something new on the menu that is equally delicious as it is healthy. The food is proof of how much time & effort has gone into making this place what it is. I recommend ANY smoothie, any food, anytime. It blows my mind this place is also a drive thru! This is the only brunch spot I recommend. Yolklore rocks!! Give it a try, you'll be hooked.

This place will turn 100 in 2013, now, that's amazing!

We decided to check out Crown Candy Kitchen around 9PM on a Friday night-they close at 10. Even though it was pretty empty, it was nice to just soak it all in for what it's worth.

Other yelpers recommended the malts & shakes, so of course, that's what we got. Some were tempted to try the 5 malt challenge, but decided that maybe they should come better prepared next time-i.e., starve themselves prior, think of strategies, etc. 

Don't be fooled by the empty shake glasses that they bring while the malts/shakes are being prepared. The real thing actually fills up your glass THREE TIMES!

The flavors are really rich and true to it's name, you definitely won't go wrong with any of them. I got a vanilla shake, while the others got chocolate with a banana shake, strawberry shake, & butterscotch malt. On the menu they have chocolate as the favorite flavor, & I'd have to agree! Must get chocolate next time.

I'll definitely be back to try their food & watch my friends gorge themselves for the 5 malt challenge. You're more than welcome to join!

Ate here tonight for the first time.  After finding many meals on the menu that sounded appetizing, I was excited to try their Sweet Bourbon Salmon.  I LOVE salmon and often choose it as an entrée.  It was totally disappointing though.  For a $16 entrée I was expecting something much more.  The salmon was SUPER dry and not much flavor, so I had to pair each bite with a scoop of mashed potatoes.  While the potatoes didn't look great (they looked like they had sat around for a while) they had a decent taste at least.  The grilled veggies were just how I like them (overdone and soggy) but I know not everyone would be happy with veggies of that texture. 

The patio seating was nice and I enjoyed the atmosphere.  The waiters and waitresses we encountered were all very helpful and nice.  

I had high hopes for this place, but I don't think I'll be back any time soon.

Good store better than going to a Walmart that treats their people like crap .  I do not work there but a family member does at a different store.   I worked there over 20 years ago .  Great salad bar and nice people .  But local !!!!
Not caring about customer service is there specialty. If you like terrible attitudes and slow service then this is the place for you.
Best pizza in St. Louis, and great dive pub.  Shuffle puck is awesome!

After a few unsuccessful tries to get into here due to some huge waits and extremely hot weather, I finally got a chance to try Crown Candy Kitchen a few weeks ago. It immediately feels like stepping into another era in North St. Louis. Old fashion diner and milkshake place? Sign me up! I had the turkey club with chips (tasted like Ruffles). Sandwich was good but next time I'm getting the BLT. I saw a few other folks get it and there was a truckload of bacon on there! Best part of course, the chocolate malt. You have to get a shake of some type in here.

This place is definitely NOT for the health conscious folks. I've heard so much about Crown Candy Kitchen that I was dying to try the famous St.Louis eatery. First the neighborhood may seem a little rough but make sure that doesn't scare you off--because the shakes are amazing.
Before trying Crown Candy Kitchen I shamefully  thought all shakes were all equally made. But I was I proven wrong. 
I had the chocolate banana shake and holy cow-- love at first taste?! Everyone who visits/lives in the St. Louis area has to try Crown Candy Kitchen shakes at least once! :)  Crown Candy Kitchen definitely lived up to its hype.
Simple and purely delicious. I daydreamed of these for weeks after I first tried them. The pork soup dumpling is a MUST!

This was the last stop on a long family road trip.   We did the DSM-KC-STL triangle before heading back to the Chicago area.    It's a Holiday Inn.   It appeared to be updated recently with new linens, wallpaper, but the smell of smoke lingered in some areas of the hotel.  The exterior is an old stucco which was not very appealing and it's not exactly cheap.  What it is - a place to sleep with free wifi close to the Zoo.  The staff is generally friendly and willing to help out with recommendations.

The food was fantastic, however we sat in the bar to avoid a 1 hr wait for a table. The old saying " you can pick your nose but you can't pick your neighbor " held true tonight. We were next to a table of four drunks that were as loud as they were inappropriate.  Sadly these were not young kids they were near my age ( mid 50's). We ate quickly and paid quickly as we were not enjoying ourselves. As we were leaving one of them tried to get smart with me. My advice to the management is to monitor you bar area, if I'm spending $100 bucks on dinner I don't appreciate four drunk people ruining my evening.

I love this place and keep coming back!
Have had my third fried baloney sandwich which I proclaim as the best in the world.
The brined turkey leg is really good and the fried catfish is very nice!
I like greens and they are my go to side.
Bread pudding is way above average!

I guess you can tell that since I drive in from Chesterfield and it's sometimes hard to find parking that I keep coming back cause the food is special and the people are great.
Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

After enjoying a delicious meal at Mosaic, a friend and I decided to cap off the evening with a malt from Crown Candy.  This was my first visit to this clean little store in the middle of a somewhat sketchy neighborhood.  I had been looking forward to visiting this place for a while since I had seen the Man V Food episode where Adam failed the malt challenge (5 malts in 30 minutes).

We both ordered cherry malts.  For $4.50, they give you a 24 oz styrofoam cup full of super thick cherry ice cream nirvana.  It was so thick that it was initially impossible to suck it up the straw until it melted a bit more.  They offer a $1 option to make it extra thick but I can't imagine why anyone would need it thicker.  Both of us thought that the malts were outstanding.

The service was great and they were very friendly.  We were the last customers to enter the restaurant just before closing.  We were warmly greeted when we entered and they expressed their gratitude when we left.  Crown Candy really lives to their fine reputation.   I am looking forward to my next trip to St Louis so that I can visit Crown Candy again and sample their BLT which my St Louis friends have raved about.

This was my first time having food from here and I was not impressed. I had the street corn which was burnt and a steak burrito. Lucky for me I decided to cut open the burrito because there was a hair in it. I called and the manager Cat was very nice and understanding and offered to replace the meal or refund. She said one of the general managers would call us back the next day but we still haven't heard from anyone. I'll call back in a short while but Cat was nice.

Wow. I don't expect a lot of of airport restaurants, but this was abhorrent. 

Our waiter seemed harried and distracted. He took a long time to seat us, didn't return for our drink orders (another server did that), took a very long time to bring us our food (it was cold by arrival), and never brought us our check. The other server did that as well. He also took off during the meal, just shouting out that he would be back to the other workers. My pasta was cold and my husband's sandwich was burned to black and inedible, but we had no one to tell. We tried to tip the other server on duty-she was fabulous-but she refused. This guy needs to be retrained and fast, before someone misses a flight because of him.

Went at 1230 on a Friday, very crowded although the line was short and efficient. I had the double cheeseburger and collard greens. A very nice atmosphere where you order the food first and then they bring it out to you. They have Excel soda products which were very good, good choices of food and salads. The collard greens were good, hamburger tasty although about average. There are mostly fried foods in this restaurant. I would recommend a trip to Grace Meat and Three!

Great tasting food with a unique menu. Some things, like the Mary BEAR I had, contained Ingredients most would not think to combine. Lots of healthy options, including gluten free.  They even fetched my some soy milk for a nondairy creamer option. If you choose fruit as the side, Most meals are fairly light. Only downside might be the price,  it I'd rather have great tasting healthier food like this and not be absolutely stuffed like at the typical chain restaurants.

This place is the best at getting your order right! 
    When I'm picking up burgers it's always tricky because I can't eat onions and wifey doesn't like american cheese...so one burger no onions, and the other no cheese. 
    Most fast food places mess this up about half the time. 
    This place always gets it right. 
     And they are so nice and friendly! I drive farther to come to this Rally's!

Tried this place for a quick lunch, and I really enjoyed it! I popped in on a Tuesday, just after they opened. It wasn't very busy, so I was served promptly. The staff was friendly, helpful and walked me through everything. I ordered three scoops (one salmon and two ahi tuna) with rice and many of the various toppings. Topped it all off with eel sauce,  spicy mayo and sesame seeds. It was very fresh, yummy and filling. Might go with the two scoops next time, as this was more than enough food. Definitely will be back!

I never write reviews, but I'm so mind blown that I feel the need to. I was interested to try this place considering it is black-owned and I had never heard of it before. However, I will never step foot in this place ever again due to the poor customer service. I went there on a Sunday night with my boyfriend and his parents who were in town. There were only about 3 couples dining and a few people at the bar, however, we were never greeted until we asked the bartender if anyone was going to seat us. A guy finally comes from the back and asks if we have a reservation -- which we did not. He pauses and says he'll be right back. Then he comes back with the lady who was behind the bar and another guy. The lady states that due to the amount of reservations and what they had available in the kitchen, they would not be able to serve us. We asked if their website says you HAVE to make a reservation to dine, which is a no. Unfortunately for them, we were coming to try everything out because we have a large party reservation for March. Hard pass due to this experience. Weird part is that the excuse literally made no sense -- making it seeem like they ask people with reservations what they plan to eat so they can have it available in the kitchen??? I would've respected their poor excuse more if they would have just told us what wasn't available in the kitchen. Sounds to me like they're either lazy or have lack of resources. Either way, I won't be going back.

Great atmosphere and old time feel. This place will transport you to a different time. The chocolate ice cream isn't great, you could taste the coco powder, but the Oreo ice cream was dense, creamy and delicious. It's great on a hot summer day, just beware of the weekends. We went at 5:30 hoping to miss the rush but they were totally backed up and it was over an hour wait for a shake. Will be back.

Pretty good as far as airport food goes. The good is decent, not great, but by far the friendliest staff in the airport. Beats the pants off Chili's and the fast food fare down the terminal. Also has great beer, some good seasonal choices and drink deals (beer and a shot for $12). Space is a little crammed, but being an airport eatery, it's to be expected. Best choice in terminal 2 for food. Also serves a good breakfast.

I enjoyed my visit to sauce in the side. If you like those fast casual spots that have a variety of made to order options that fit everyone, this is the place for you. The price is about $10-$15 depending on what you get. I had a longer than usual wait, however the cook came out of the back and explained my wait and was very kind and upfront about it, so I couldn't complain. The calzone was hot and fresh and had an ample amount of fillings for the price so I felt the pricing was fair. I love the fact they have different dipping sauces, because most places only have marinara or maybe a meat sauce but sauce on the side lived up to its name with plenty of sauces you could choose on the side! The staff was nice and attentive! I would go back again in a heartbeat!
We came here after work one night and have since ordered to go. I had the Magic Carpet Ride and split Beets Me salad. It was so good!!! Will definitely be coming back!

Dr. Sherman and the rest of the team do an awesome job of running a welcoming, friendly,  professional eye care office. From the moment I walked in to the moment I left. I felt safe, secure and valued.

Food is average - not spectacular as the prices would suggest - service is not very good at all.   A female manager came to our table and asked how things were but seemed relatively uninterested in our answer.... she talked to a server poorly in our presence.  Host staff seems very frazzled in busy times.  T&C location was NEVER like this....
We love this place. Fast service (we always do take out), great vegetarian options, and delicious queso. The place is also so nice and the people who run it are so friendly. Highly recommend!
Very decent handmade soup dumplings. Not quite Din Tai Fung quality and uniformity, but deliciously imperfect nonetheless.

Trips to Crown Candy are rare for me, as our hours don't always match up. So when a friend invited me along for a candy-buying ride, I cajoled him into lunch as well.  I usually get the Heart Stopper, but I like to mix it up. The chili tamale is delicious (if a bit on the salty side) and Paul's egg salad sandwich must have contained at least a half dozen eggs. Portions are huge, so if you want any frozen treat, save half for later. Don't skip the ice cream, and make it a Newport (topped with pecans a whipped cream) as often as possible !

Three stars, not because it's bad...its pasta comfort food that you could easily duplicate at home in your kitchen. Come here to get decent tasting food, good beer, and great service. I ordered the cheesy garlic bread and the baked mostaccioli. Fast, hot and fresh, with nice portion sizes...just bland. I was here at 630 pm on a Thursday, and the place was absolutely crushed with customers, but my server Jim was amazingly friendly and attentive.

I knew this was going to be proper deep dish pizza (an actual pie, rather than just extra thick crust) when I read about the wait times in other reviews. So that actually encouraged me to come to this restaurant. Get a salad while you wait. One large salad was enough for me and my friend to share. I didn't actually notice the duration of the wait, and the pizza was pretty killer. My pizza didn't have a layer of sauce over the top, which personally I'm fine with, but if you're a Chicago style purist you might want to specifically ask for that specifically. They have a large patio, but chairs were just piled up on the edge. This was my first visit, so I'm not sure if patio season is simply over for them or what.

I needed a new bed really badly.  My mattress was the same one I had purchased right out of college!!!  (And I won't tell you how long ago that was.;)  I walked into this place not really sure about what I wanted and all I can recall from my purchase at a big box place years ago was that I felt like I was working with a used car salesman.  LOVED this place.  No pressure tactics at all, extremely knowledgeable, and happy to let my "pretend" nap on every single mattress on the floor. I left there with a new bed, pillows(GET THE FOAM PILLOWS----HEAVEN!), mattress protector and box springs for a great price.  I am sleeping like a baby and wholeheartedly endorse this place.

Excellent Classic breakfast. Sausage gravy nicely seasoned with just a hint of sage. Egg cooked medium to perfection. Nice crunch to the biscuit. My favorite bacon maker. Can't wait to try rest of menu.

I really wanted to come away from my visit loving this place, but found myself feeling more 'meh' than anything else.  There wasn't any single thing I could point to and say, "this is bad".  It was more like death by a thousand cuts.  
First of all, I was annoyed that the name is a lie.  It isn't meat + 3, it's meat + 2.  Sure you can get an extra side, but it isn't standard like the name suggests.  Is this a quibble?  Yes it is, but it set the mood for the rest of my experience.  
I had the biscuits appetizer, chicken, mac and cheese, home fried potatoes, and the apple cobbler.  The biscuits were tough, like the dough had been over worked, and the topping potions on the small side for the amount biscuits served.  The flavors for the jam and pimento cheese were good, but the whipped lard tasted like spoiled mayo with a bad mouth feel.  It's subjective, I know, other people might love it, but me - not so much.  The chicken was as good as I expected, crisp, moist and well seasoned.  I can't tell a difference in what he served at Southern.  The mac and cheese had the same issues as the dish had at Southern, too dry and not enough cheese flavor.  The bread crumb topping just made things worse.  The home fries were on the verge of being over done, but were otherwise tasty.  The apple cobbler was over sweet and not very cobbler-like (it came across more like a Dutch Apple pie, which if the sweetness had been balanced wouldn't be a bad thing).  Overall the meal was between okay and good, but for the prices charged I expected a whole lot more.
From a presentation standpoint, the whole experience is a fail.  Outside of a BBQ place, I'm pretty much done with being served on cafeteria trays with paper containers.  It cheapens the whole experience.  
The dining room is nice, but they need to do something to baffle the sound in the room.  The echo and noise level was so bad I had trouble hearing the servers when they brought my meal.     
Overall I can't muster a lot of excitement about going back.  It was good, but I expected a lot more.  While that's partially my fault, I can't help but feel disappointed.

Usually love this place (food is better than beer) but today our food took over 70 minutes and it sounded like an overrun daycare inside the brewery.
