Props to the kitchen crew though - it was only 2 people and they were simply overrun by a poor system and angry customers. We will just go to Brasserie for the burger from here on out.

My husband and I order Indian from all over St. Louis on a weekly basis.  Our favorites include House of India, Flavor of India, Saffron, Bombay, and Anis Hyderabad.  We were excited to try something new tonight.  We order chicken 65, samosa chaat, and malai tikka.  The malai chicken was raw and we couldn't chew it.  There was no way around it; it was completely inedible.  We love chicken from the tandoor and there was no way this was cooked in a tandoor let alone cooked properly.  Something was definitely off.  We called the owner and he apologized and offered a replacement dish- chicken tikka masala.  This chicken was cooked but full of gristle.  Upon cutting into it, the inside looked spongey and gray.  We truly couldn't believe it.  Our rice was hard and dry and most likely leftover from their lunch buffet.  The only saving grace was the samosa chaat which was delicious and a hard dish to find at our regular spots.  However, after biting into that so called chicken, we can't imagine ever coming back.  I'm pretty sure this was a health code violation in every way.

This Steak 'n Shake is always sooooooo slow I waited 45 mins in drive through for a cola !! This is ridiculous . Also the workers always have an attitude for no reason and they take their time dinning in or drive-through always takes forever they are so rude and don't even care . DO NOT GO THERE !!

I had dinner at Gringo in October 2018 and enjoyed my meal.  The restaurant is located next door to the Embassy Suites hotel.  It has an open air jibe, the decor is industry meets the sea meets the jungle.

The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  It has a cool bar scene.

I have two complaints; the first is they charge for chips and salsa.  No respectable Mexican restaurant would break international Federale law by calling themselves a Mexican restaurant and then charging for this basic food item.

I had the taco salad with a side of rice and beans.  The food was all very good. The portion size was perfect, not too small or large.  The quality was very fresh.  My second complaint is they gave me very little dressing, when I asked for more I was not told I would be charged .75 cents.

Both the chips and charge for the dressing was not a big deal, but if the restaurant would stop the nickle and dime game they would have got 5 stars from me and probably more customers. 

Overall a really good restaurant, I would eat here again next time I'm in the area.

United Van Lines and their local partners: Armstrong Relocation Company, Suddath Relocation Systems of Milwaukee and Merchants Transfer & Warehouse in Little Rock were wonderful. I've moved all over the country and never have I had such great teams working for me. I had a full pack and unpack service. They went above and beyond for a personal request and nailed it. I'd hire them any day. My sales person was Karen R Boulton in Little Rock AR and she was not only professional and knowledgeable, but was a ton of fun and great at her job. Thanks everyone
Top notch. Haven't had legit soup dumplings around since I've been to Boston or NYC. The lady at the counter is very sweet. Do not pass up!!
I get carryout a lot from the Haven and it's consistently delicious. The service is good. The food doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. It's just good bar food done well.

United Van Lines- I accepted a partial settlement for much less than the minimum acceptable despite the fact I paid for the highest level of insurance which happened to be the most expensive. Your company refused to reimburse me for the lost doors to my grandfather clock and my tv remote controls although your own personnel reported the losses. Unfortunately, I was tired of calling and emailing your company for many months without receiving prompt  responses from your company and without anyone trying to settle in good faith. 

BTW -no one from United ever returned my calls or emails. It's interesting that you choose to respond here.

I think it's bad to say that it's taken me a week to make it to Grace Meat + Three, but I finally made it. Everything Rick Lewis has done in Saint Louis has been great and it's finally time he has his own place. When you arrive you are greeted by a smiling face and are told about the specials. It was a little after 11am and the line was already almost out the door. 

You place your order at the counter and they bring the food to you. The service is so quick, almost by the time you find a place to sit, your order is ready. Today I started with an order of the fried green tomatoes. They had a cornmeal crust and were crispy. They are perfect way to start the meal. For my entree, I ordered the sweet tea turkey leg with Mac and cheese, and corn bread. I expected a decent size leg but when it came out, it was almost as big as the tray. The turkey leg was juicy and delicious. The mac and cheese was creamy and had a crunch top. The corn bread is what you want in cornbread, a crispy outside and fluffy inside. Everything was absolutely wonderful and I think I found my new go to place!

I grew up with Schnucks as our go-to grocer out in West County.  The staff is always friendly and welcoming and ready to help you.

They have great WOW Wednesday deals and Drive By deals on Friday that spark my interest.  They also have great deals that you can pair coupons with and make it an even better deal.

Way to go Schnucks!

Great review by Mandie.  Just want to add that it is pet friendly.  If your pooch is well-behaved, bring him/her along and enjoy a sidewalk dining experience with waterbowl for the pooch provided.

Banana and Chocolate with Reese's Peanutbutter sprinkles...YES!

The name explains it all. Two stars for effort 

I honestly feel like I'd have had a more flavorful meal at chipotle  

The ingredients were fresh and the food was hot. The service is good, but the food is not - except the guacamole!

I can't believe this is the first time I'm writing a review.  This has always been our favorite pizza joint in St. Louis and is our go-to place when ordering for guests who come to town. 

My husband and I actually met at Blackthorn 9 years ago - a night I'll never forget.  We now have a family which never would have happened if it weren't for our chance meeting that evening!  

Thanks for EVERYTHING! :)

Rally's menu is definitely a step above most fast food. Their wings are delicious and made with Frank's hot sauce (the best!) so obviously that's a huge draw. They serve delicious garlic parmesan fries and put a few mozzarella sticks in there as well. Crazy good food is their motto and it's true - it's all actually flavored and seasoned instead of your more basic one dimensional overly salty fast food you would find most other places.

Pricey for what you get. Bland food, small drinks, and a very awkward experience from start to finish. By the end of the meal we just wanted to leave. I am not a picky person by any means and I was genuinely disappointed in the entire dining experience at Gringo. Their chips and salsa are good though, but it was not free like most other Mexican restaurants.

I attended the opening night at The Bellwether and it was a fantastic experience. The new owners did a gorgeous renovation of the space and it is one of the coolest looking restaurants in St. Louis. I had the ginger dumplings as my appetizer and they were delicious and packed with flavor. I especially like the fact that their pasta is homemade. For dinner my wife had the filet and I had the short rib ragout. Both dishes were amazing. The filet was a showstopper. One of the finest steaks I have ever tasted. The homemade pasta with the short rib ragout was also incredible. They also have an impressive bar menu of handcrafted cocktails and a great dessert menu as well. The carrot cake ice cream was terrific! I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.
We started with slow service and the were out of regular margarita.  The margarita we did order and the burrito were great!  We are used to free chips and salsa they did have but with a charge.

Visited this past Friday after work for dinner with my BFF. This was my second visit and far better than my first during their first week. Service was great, food was awesome, and prices were reasonable. RC, I'll definitely be back to try new dishes!! And those chips - y'all might consider selling them by the bag to take home!

The only negative this time was the SA cleaning the table behind us was spraying the cleaning fluid from far above the table instead of onto the cloth - had we been any closer we would also have been sprayed.

My plane arrived late, the weather was miserable and I was fit to be tied. Needless to say, I was hoping for a pleasant experience with my car rental. I was pleased to find the entire crew at National that evening already knew my woes and made my rental experience enjoyable and without pain. Have a corporate account through National and have been  using the company for nearly two years. The St. Louis team and my last experience with them made me a National fan for life. Thank you, National.
Good food.  Good service most of the time.  Would like them to stay open later for social gatherings.
